The **Supreme Dao/Way of the Most High and Mystic Treasure**,
Humbly **gazing upon the Great Mercy**,
And **piercing the vast compassion**,
That **universal grace** may descend.

Your humble disciple hears that all **things under Heaven** are insufficient to **exchange with the divine**,
Yet **cultivating sincerity within the heart** can **respond to Heaven and Earth**.
How much more so for the **teachings of the Primordial Mystic**,
Which are all **paths of purity and clarity**!
If **the three karmas and six roots** of **offenses remain unchecked**,
How could one **pure in body and twofold in spirit** attain this?

At the **commencement of this strict fast**, we **first dispel dusty thoughts**.
May this **propagation and exposition** bring forth **illuminated virtue**.

Humbly, we reflect that your disciple **Certain** and the **ritual master**,
Since the **vast eons** and until this life,
Have **deep-rooted karmas** and **tenfold sins** as heavy obstacles.
Though we possess **wondrous and tranquil essence**,
We are **bewildered by passions**;
Though we hold **clear and luminous faculties**,
We are **obscured by worldly attachments**.

...

For **lust and hatred** are rampant, yet our **nature** stands as lofty as **lofty bamboo**;
Our **hearing and seeing** are dull, yet our **wisdom** is as blind as the deaf.

We cannot **guard our outer form**,
Yet suffer **many afflictions of the body**;
We cannot **restrain our speech**,
Yet commit **many transgressions of the tongue**.

Where the **mind** reaches, **desire** follows;
With **accumulated deeds**, we forge **endless sins**.

Now, facing the **Supreme Reality** and **repenting in earnest**,
We **cultivate the wondrous Dao** with **sincere practice**.

All **actions arise from the six roots**,
Each **particle of dust** is **delusion itself**;
Who among us does not bear **suffering in the body**?
Each **worldly thing** obscures the **True Nature**.

Thus, at this **sacred altar**,
We **banish all malevolent obstacles** in their entirety.

With **mind** purified and **inner contemplation** unimpeded,
Our **nature** remains **void and pristine**, and **external phenomena** no longer ensnare us.

All **flattery and deceit** are **severed**,
Every **greed and malice** is **cleansed away**.

Past **karmic deeds** shall never again lead us to **fall into ruin**;
Future **new afflictions** shall not be **cast into the abyss**.

May we **preserve our body** and **avoid all sins**,
Never **pursue worldly gain** while **forgetting the True Way**.

Humbly, we pray that all **sages** may **perceive clearly**,
That the **August Spirit** extends **far-reaching illumination**,
So that the **jewels of the Peach Blossom Spring** may **wash and purify** all hearts,
And the **sweet dew of the Dao’s radiance** may **cleanse away** every stain.

May the **root of crimes** be **extinguished**,
And the **luminous wisdom-nature** attain **perfect clarity**;
May our **devotion to goodness** be **steadfast and sincere**,
And we **await the blessings** of the **descending grace**.

With **calamity sunk to the nine depths**,

Your servants **bow in reverence** and offer **gratitude** to the **Supreme and Natural Three Treasures**.

We **thrice chant and thrice prostrate** in homage,
**Reaffirming the sacred law’s position**.

We, the ministers, follow the prescribed rites and laws,

We humbly pray to the **Supreme Three Venerables**,
The **Ten Directions’ Holy Assembly**,
The **Playground of the Mystic Middle**’s Grand Master,
The **Responsive True Spirits**—

The **Three Pure Ones, Most Holy**,

The **praise is chanted in the hall**.

Exit the hall,

From the **Elevated Platform** to the **Lowly Dust**, from the **Unfolding of the Cosmic Scroll** to the **Tossing of the Mustard Seed’s Calamity**,
He **looks back** upon the **myriad myriads**, lamenting the **fleeting life** of the **Jin Dynasty’s insects**;
He **gazes down** upon the **nine dusts**, sighing for the **Han Palace’s ants**.

I, **your humble servant**, reflect upon my **lowly station**,
My **fate severed** from the **Celestial Path**—
Thus, I **rely upon** the **received teachings** and **rituals**,
And **diligently** explore the **subtle depths** of my **sincere supplications**.

Now, I, **your humble disciple**, [name],
**Hold the sacred talisman** and **seal the Dao/Way’s court**,
Hoping that **benevolent Heaven** may **observe below**,
And **perceive my slightest virtue** amidst the **dust of the world**.

I **humbly pray** that the **Nine Pure Ones, Most Holy**,
From the **Palace of the Curved and Secret**,
And the **Ten Extremes’ Primordial Sovereign**,
From the **Celestial Chariot of the Flying Void**,
With **hundreds of millions of Heavenly Servants** trailing behind,

**Hurl flames ten thousand li**, calling forth **Yang** while summoning **Yin**;
**Turn incense in three cycles**, ascending from **sun** to **moon**.

To the **furthest East**, they **roam in scorching waters**,

To the **South**, they **construct the Vermilion Peak’s Palace**,
In the **Center**, they **encircle the Yellow Congealing’s Hall**,
To the **North**, they **reach the Night City’s Gate**,
Below, they **exhaust the Chilly Spring’s depths**.

It is said that **Lu** is **called the Teacher of the Dao/Way**,

From the **extension of the True Ones** and their **secret attendance**.

The **Primordial Sovereign’s** **divine command**—
Who **dares not** **revere it**?
I **bow my heart** in **sincere supplication**,
And **look up** to the **cloud-borne arrival**.

I, **your humble disciple**, [name],

We **kneel and prostrate**, **twice bowing**, to **welcome the Sacred Procession**.

The **Celestial Chariot** arrives and **halts**,

After the **morning worship** is **completed**,

The **officiants** **present incense**,

The **metal chimes** are struck,

With **all ranks** present, I, **your humble disciple**, [name],
Alongside the **gathered platform officials**,

To the **Three Pure Ones, Most Holy**, the **Treasure Realm’s True Spirits**.

Indeed,
The **Primordial Scene** is **universally spread**—

Since **life and death** are **distant realms**,

「Now I humbly seek to **resolve the karmic debts of my mortal form**,

I have **heard that in ancient times, during the延康 era (Yán-Kāng)**,

**when the Great Polarity was first established (肇判太极)**,

The One generates the Two, and the Two generates the Three;
Earth follows Heaven, and Heaven follows the Dao.

Above, the stars and constellations are arrayed;
Below, the mountains and rivers are arranged.

The Three Pure Ones are the most exalted of all saints,
The Four Palaces receive the duties of myriad spirits.

Beyond the dim and obscure, within the vague and indistinct,
Some form palaces from mist,
Others build halls from gathered clouds.

The assembled immortals stand in ranks,
Paying homage to the august Sovereign of the Great Effulgence;
The myriad phenomena revolve in harmony,
Bowing in reverence to the Purple Enceinte Emperor.

Even unto the Great Thousandfold Sand Realm,
The Boundless Divine Realm,
Palaces bear names of springs and curves,
Mountains bear names of Luo and Teng.

Officials govern over Heaven, Earth, and Water,
Departments are divided into left, right, and center.

The Thirty-Six Tribunals, the Twenty-Four Prisons,
Dim as the tortoise peaks, vast as the peng sea.
The whale stirs waves and spews clouds and thunder,
The sea-serpent exhales mist and forms pavilions and halls.

The Golden Platforms and Jade Observatories
Lie beyond the Weak Waters, boundless in extent;
The Serpent Chambers and Dragon Palaces
Guard the deep abyss, unfathomable in depth.

The saints of the Yang Interval,
The enshrined and honored deities,
If they can indeed be summoned by the Great Ritual,
Or transformed to diligently serve,
The Yellow Emperor established their names,
And the Hundred Things revered the Earthly Sovereign,
Ranked across the Nine Regions.

Even unto the enfeoffments of prefectures and counties,
The city gods and their guardians,
For the sake of the state,
There are ancestral altars,
Recorded in the sacrificial canons,
In accordance with the laws of the sage kings.

Thus, the Great Void is clear and bright,
The constellations shine resplendent,
Lanterns intermingle with orchid and cassia lights,
Incense curls from sandalwood censers.

I humbly pray for the cranes and phoenixes to harness,
Their ranks descending from the distant heavens;
For the wind-horses and cloud-chariots to pass in procession,
Descending in majesty upon the mortal realm.

The humble臣 and the officials of the Ritual Bureau of代, in solemn obeisance and twice-bowed reverence, now present their respects and invite the Sacred Procession.

Let the ranks of the Two Classes of Saints descend.
The Three Realms’ multitude of True Ones, arrayed upon the *jiào* feast, extend their prostrations and earnest petitions, humbly awaiting the radiant descent.

May they each align in the ranks of the Celestial Host,
And together, with reverent deference, welcome the Imperial Procession.

Descend, O Emperor, upon the Cloud-Carriage.
When the Crane-Carriage arrives and halts,
And the Phoenix-Carriage takes its place before the court,
The *jiào* feast’s assembled True Ones shall observe the ritual as in a grand audience.

Having completed the morning rites,
We request ascent to the *jiào* feast’s table,
Where the Ritual Officials shall offer incense,
And arrange the first prostrations and libations of wine.

Let the *zhì* bell be struck,
Scatter the flowers,
And perform the music.

With the officials of all ranks and the humble臣某, in earnest sincerity, we now address:
The Three Pure Ones, Most Sacred,
And the Precious Realm’s numinous spirits.

We have heard that the Idle Lotus Platform is the dwelling of the Most High;
And the Great Floating Earth is where the Celestial Lord expounds the Dharma in its time.

Moved by the inclination of a single nation’s heart,
And the summoning of the Ten Directions to their seat.

First ascending the Lion’s Peak,
Then entering the Precious Pearl’s midst,
They guide the multitude of beings,
And unfold the wondrous Dao.

At its beginning, in one passage,
The deaf and the ailing are all cured;
At its end, in ten repetitions,
Even withered bones are reborn as whole.

The Four *qì* resound and clarify,
Illuminating all spirits across the cosmos;
The Five Colors flourish in abundance,
Enhancing the Celestial retinue in the void.

From then on, the True Doctrine flourishes and spreads,
Its profound teachings disseminated far and wide—
Above, to dispel calamities,
Below, to deliver the people.

Without the Two Luminaries, there would be no brightness;
Without the Two Principles, no order would stand.
None but the True Persons can fully know it,
Only the highest sages can practice it with might.

When the Most High descended in the Zhou’s early years,
And the Celestial Master arose in the Han dynasty,
They transmitted the method of presenting petitions and offerings,
And demonstrated the rituals of establishing *zhāi* feasts and *jiào* ceremonies—
Illuminated as if inscribed in crimson and gold,
Shining forth like the sun and moon.

Yet we, the humble臣, feel shame
To be reckoned among the Celestial Host;
Our hearts are like scattered reeds, unable to grasp the Mystic Pass,
And our eyes, like withered stalks, cannot peer into the Sacred Domain.

We hold the Yellow and Purple, yet know not the flow of the Seven Elixirs;
We emerge from the Blue and enter the Black, yet comprehend not the inhalation and exhalation of the Two *qì*.

Though our understanding of the True Way is dim,
Our foremost intent is to benefit the world.
Thus, the *jiào* master某, though bound in the mortal realm,
Turns his heart to the Ultimate Dao,
And with his entire clan offers solemn prayers,
Twice-bowed in reverence, to welcome the True Ones.

We humbly reflect upon the lofty celestial signs,
Where responses echo like the reverberations of a bell;
And the sincere yearnings of the common heart,
Where supplications and averting of misfortune find no greater efficacy than in pure devotion.

Thus, though millet and barley lack fragrance,
It is the white hemp that may be offered in devotion.

The sincerity and earnestness of our petitions
Are fully expressed in these words.
With reverence before the lofty True Ones,
We solemnly declare them as follows:

**Proclamation of Words:**
As the words attest, our devotion is sincere and profound.
Whatever is proclaimed and inscribed shall surely be answered in kind.

I have heard that the Three Bright Ones illuminate,
And the Five Classics unfold—
These are called the Heavenly Roots,
And thus they preserve the eons of the cosmos.

The Primordial Thread unfurls through all ten directions;
The Vital *qi* of the *Fan* pervades and gives rise to all things.

When first the myriad creatures emerged,
And the dark *yin* nurtured the common folk—
To govern blessings and calamities,
The stars and constellations shift in their courses;
To manifest responses and omens,
The thunder and lightning strike with wrath.

Only the Sovereign Emperor of Heaven
Rules supreme over all living beings;
The boundless Heaven above
Truly enfolds and watches over the earth below.

Thus, there exist methods of purification and expiation,
To serve as rites of *jiào* and thanksgiving.

The *jiào* master某, humbly reflecting,
Knows his nature is inherently flawed and borrowed,
Born into this mortal realm,
Yet blessed by the enlightened governance of the Sage Emperor,
And steeped in the refined customs of the Central Kingdom.

Greed, hatred, and delusion—
How could he escape transgression?
Body, speech, and mind—
How could he be without fault?

「From the countless ages past until this very life,
Some have served their lords yet lacked true loyalty,
Others have tended their parents yet failed in filial piety—
Abandoning kindness and thrift.

Some have violated the teachings of the Three Treasures,
Committing theft and lewdness;
Others have transgressed the Nine True Precepts,
Holding affection for monks while harboring deceit,
Curving their words to flatter,
Pointing to Heaven and Earth to swear oaths,
Invoking deities to curse and damn.

In trade and exchange, they seek only self-gain to harm others;
In actions and conduct, they act contrary to the True and betray the Dao.

Below, they chase fleeing beasts;
Above, they shoot winged fowl—
Wanton slaughter in the space between blade and board,
Unrestrained revelry at the feast of cups and dishes.

Thus, their misdeeds sink deeper than the Stygian Sea,
Their sins accumulate higher than mountains—
The Three Corpses [三尸] chant in the vault above,
The Five Emperors [五帝] speak in the netherworld below.

The Master of Life seizes their fate,
For their deeds are unkind and their calamities remain.

The Way of Heaven brings disaster and affliction,
Yet they gain no merit through prayer.

Now, in repentance and remorse,
They earnestly wish to purge all sins.

They rely on the boundless grace of the Supreme,
And humbly beg for forgiveness of countless lives’ transgressions.

From this day forward, may they never forget the resolve to amend;
For future deeds, may they find the path to true renewal.

The *jiào* master and officials, with utmost fervor,
Prostrate themselves in reverence, offering incense and libations.

We, the *jiào* master and officials, with sincere devotion,
Address the Three Pure Ones [三清] and the Celestial Saints [上圣],
The True Spirits of the Precious Realm [宝界真灵].

We hear that the Great Dao is formless,
Yet boldly named as *Dao*.
All things return to it yet it claims no ownership;
The common folk employ it yet cannot fathom its source.

At the wilds of Shāngchéng [襄城],
Even the Seven Saints are lost;
Within the walls of Jùguó [束郭],
The Nine Years’ Great Mystery [九年大妙] is heard.

The method of *Fùmò* [副墨] began with the Lu recitation [洛诵],
The depths of *Xuānmíng* [玄冥] were drawn from Shānmíng [参寥].

To seek the fish, one must not forget the basket;
To exhaust the meaning, one must first establish the symbol.

Then it is known that color is not color,
And the Mystic Vision [玄览] reveals without blemish;
That emptiness is not emptiness,
And the Void Chamber [虚室] gives birth to whiteness.

To perfect one’s nature begins with daily self-abnegation,
To restore one’s life ends with non-action.

Entering the Gate of Profound Mysteries [众妙门],
Free from all nets of doubt.

Thirty-six divisions,
Over five thousand teachings—
Some transmitted among mortals,
Others hidden in the heavens.

Those who revere and honor them receive blessings,
Those who slight or neglect them invite calamity.

The *jiào* master reflects on his humble, fleeting life,
Like grass and insects, frail and insignificant—
Gazing upward to the lofty vault [高穹],
Turning toward the Verdant Netherworld [碧落] in sincere devotion.

Like the otter offering fish to its gods,
He hopes for the virtue of response and communion;
Like the sunflower turning to the sun,
He seeks only to bend in prayerful reverence.

Thus, he recites the scriptures of the Three Caverns [三洞],
And sustains the incense and flames for two or three hours.

The revolving *Xuánjī* [璇玑] aligns the heavens,
The resonant *Línláng* [琳琅] awakens all divine spirits.

With this most solemn offering,
He seeks the unending blessings of the Dao.

Above, he purges the Nine Solar Calamities [阳九之数],
Below, he expiates the One Hundred and Six Earthly Disasters [百六之灾].

Long life and peace for the aged,
Serenity within and without.

He records the names in the Celestial Register [丹台],
And petitions the True Master of Fate [真君] to extend our years upon the Jade Tablets [青简].

May we live eternally, gazing far,
Day by day growing richer, month by month prospering—
Enjoying the fullness of the Five Auspicious Blessings [五福],
And attaining a hundred years of enduring peace.

There must be lasting fortune,
In perfect accord with the *Yì* [《易》];
All inauspiciousness must be dispelled,
Conforming to the words of the Daoist Scriptures [仙经].

We, the *jiào* master and officials, with utmost supplication,
Prostrate ourselves in reverence, offering incense and libations.

With music played,
We, the humble officials and the assembled *jiào* attendants,
With sincere devotion,
Address the Supreme and Formless Sage [虚无至圣],
The True Spirits of the Three Realms [三界群真],
Humbly awaiting their vast compassion,
And their penetrating, enlightened discernment.

We hear that the Great Dao is profound and vast,
And to seek it is no simple task.

True grace is distant and unfathomable,
And to attain it is most difficult.

Yet, how much more so when we dare to hope for private favor,
Without doubt deserving the merit of expiation.

How much more so when we offer our feeble prayers,
And rely on sincerity of speech!

With earnest intent and reverent devotion,
May our words soak into the Sacred Hearing [圣聪],
And our pleas reach the True Listening [真听].

The *jiào* master, though unworthy of life’s blessing,
Seeks only what is good.

He fears the errors of the Three Karmic Actions [三业],
And the taint upon the records of the Celestial Bureaucracy [列曹].

The stars and omens converge,
And the calamitous numbers are upon us.

If not for the secret prayers of purification and expiation,
How could we hope for mercy and pardon?

We follow the prescribed rites and formulas,
And solemnly list our petitions—
Bathing our bodies and minds in ritual purity,
With utmost sincerity, we present our prayers,
Hoping to ascend to the Primordial Pole [元极],
And forever align with the common will.

We beseech thee, for the *jiào* master,
To purge celestial disasters,
To scatter earthly calamities—
Freeing him from all misfortune within this year,
From the four seasons’ months,
From the movements of the Five Stars [五星],
From the four pillars’ punishments [四柱相刑],
From every inauspicious fate.

May his years of life be long and distant,
Like the eternal pines and cypress;
May his calamities be stilled and never arise,
Like the fragrant orchids and sweetgrass.

May music be played.」

「The noble lineage shines with splendor,
And descendants flourish in prosperity—
Bringing harmony and peace to the realm,
Enjoying the pure and virtuous breezes of the age.

The Three Lights [三光] radiate brightly in the vault of heaven,
And the Nine Crops [九稼] grow abundantly upon the earth below.

Border beacons cease their warnings,
And the distant wilderness returns to the Way [仁].

Mountains and rivers display auspicious omens,
And the numinous and divine [神明] gather blessings in concert.

The Three Realms [三涂] and Six Paths [六趣] alike rest in their hidden prisons no more.
All living, growing, flying, and submerged beings
Are equally nurtured and sustained.

The Celestial Officials [天司] and the Earthly Bureaus [地府],
The lunar attendants [月职幽僚] and the mountain streams [岳渎山川],
The divine and sacred [神明] now order their ranks—
Promoting the Dao/Way’s winds [道风] and aiding transformation,
Dispelling malevolent *qi* [邪沴] to bring peace to the people.

May the sovereign wish that heaven and earth follow their proper rhythms,
And the four seasons thus be perfected;
May yin and yang be in harmony,
And all things flourish accordingly.

The gentle wind and the rain of the *kǎn* [坎] hexagram
Shall always bring deep and ample nourishment to the fields;
The droughts of *xùn* [旱魃] and water demons [水妖]
Shall never encroach upon the allotted domains.

Malevolent ghosts [鬼邪] shall perish in brilliance,
And epidemics [时疫] dare not spread their influence;
The divine shall guard the gates,
And strange portents naturally subside and be quelled.

Beneath the vast heavens and across the boundless earth,
A domain of longevity and springtime prosperity.

With utmost reverence and humility,
Your subjects bow twice and present this offering.

Music shall be played.
The sacred titles shall be invoked again in solemn recitation.»

The officials of all ranks, including the undersigned subject [某], together with the officers and assembly at the altar, with utmost sincerity and reverence, humbly petition the Most Venerable Nine Sovereigns of the Great Luo, the Ten-Directional Most Holy Ones, the Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits, and all True Essences.

We have heard that the highest reaches ascend to the Round Luo, while the lowest extend to the Four Quarters. The boundless ranks of saints and the positioned True Immortals—some preside over the Golden Gates and Jade Palaces, others govern the Tartarus, the Tai Mountains, or the rivers and seas, while some oversee the altars and shrines. When they descend, they float upon the void and arrive; when they depart, they move without trace. Ten thousand steeds move in unison, escorting the natural array of ceremonial attendants; the Nine Phoenixes harmonize their cries, borne aloft by wind and cloud in swift passage.

We, your subjects, gaze upward in awe as Your celestial chariots ascend the Azure Expanse. Though our hearts yearn to follow, we kneel in reverence to bid You farewell.

At the sound of the *zhì* [知磬] gong, we chant the Sacred Hymns in Your honor. The Grand Lecture begins, and we focus our spirit to burn incense. The incense officials, the messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attendant spirit officials—may they now cause this altar of our ritual offering to spontaneously generate the Golden Elixir and Jade-Green Pills, the hundred spirits of mushrooms and herbs, as the multitudes of True Ones gather before this incense brazier.

May we pray that the Ten-Directional Immortal Boys and Jade Maidens attend to the fragrant vapors, conveying our sincere petition of old directly to the Most High, Boundless, Supreme Dao; the Three Pure Ones, Most Holy; and before the Jade Emperor, Sovereign of the Golden Gates of the Celestial Vault.

With the Perfect Flower of the Heavenly Worthy completed, music shall be played.

The spirits are sent forth, the offerings are transformed, and all is returned to its source. The rites are concluded. Thus ends *The Complete Ritual Codes of the Dao Gate, Volume Nine*.
Thus begins *The Complete Ritual Codes of the Dao Gate, Volume Ten*.

**Master Guangcheng of Mr. Du Guangting’s Compiled and Edited *Ritual of the Numinous Treasure, Great Unity, for Invoking Rain***

This ritual does not involve the Nine Sovereigns.
For all who take faith, only the *Jade Palace* is to be invoked.

The **Twelve Divisions of the Dao Field** are to be arranged according to the diagram of the rear altar, allowing only the finest **Twelve Divisions of superior-grade paper and writing implements**. Civil officials and commoners are not permitted to ascend the platform or participate.

This ritual is highly efficacious—**twelve seats** shall be established, and none may be slighted or made carelessly.

Incense of **Descending Truth** (降真香), **Mao** (茆香), **Cedar** (沉香), **Dragon’s Spittle** (龙涎香), and **Pure Sandalwood** (清木香) is to be used; **Sandalwood** (檀香) is forbidden, as it obstructs the Celestial Precepts. Violators shall be deprived of merit.

**Ritual Observance at Night**
The ritual proceedings ascend the platform as prescribed.
The **Grand Master** (都讲) leads the assembly, while each disciple pays homage to the **Preceptor** (师) in accordance with the Dao.

The **High Functionary** (高功) proclaims the **Spiritual Guards’ Mantras** (灵咒).
**Qingyang** (青阳) radiates in its void, its brilliance returning to the **Divine** (灵).
The **Spiritual Tiger** (神虎) repels malevolence, while the **Flying Celestial** (飞天) tolls its bells.
**Delusion is shattered, trials extinguished**, and **ten thousand demons bound in form**.
The **Nine Mysteries** (九微) return to the Dao, and the **Eight Powers** (八威) subdue the **Essence** (精).
The **Thousand True Ones** (千真) verify the records, and the **Three Elements** (三元) disperse the **Pure** (清).

The **Left Whistler** (左啸) of the **Central Yellow** (中黄), the **Right Strategist** (右策) of the **Six Ding** (六丁),
**seven rotations and eight harmonizations** (七转八合), circling the **Celestial Scriptures** (天经).
The **Holy Transformation** (圣化) stands majestic, and the **Great Dao** (大道) is set in motion.
The **Auspicious Clouds** (庆云) flow and spread, converging with the **Bright Landscape** (合景) of the **Yellow Court** (黄庭),
**uniting in harmony with the Dao’s True Essence** (和与道合真).

The **Grand Master** (都讲) leads the assembly, and the **Law Drum** (法鼓) is struck **twenty-four times** (二十四通).
The **High Functionary** (高功) ignites the furnace.

Invoked are the **Supreme Three Heavens** (三天), **Primordial Origin of the Three Essences** (玄元始三炁),
**The Most High Lord Lao** (太上老君),
who summons forth from my body the **Thirty-Five Officials of the Three and Five** (三五功曹), **Left and Right Attendants** (左右官使者), **Left and Right Incense-Bearers** (左右捧香), **Postal Dragons and Mounted Officials** (驿龙骑吏), **Golden Boy Incense-Keepers** (侍香金童), and **Jade Maiden Flower-Dispersers** (传言散花玉女)—**thirty-six each** (各三十六人出).

Those summoned must be attired in solemn robes.
The **local land and soil spirits** (此间土地正神) are to be invoked and closed.

I, **disciple of such-and-such state/county** (某州某),
**humble and sincere**, petition for my realm:
Since the arrival of **spring** (阳春), the **sweet dew** (膏雨) has long been withheld.
The **long clouds of summer** (夏云) have lingered, and the **gentle rain** (甘雨) is delayed.
The **autumn clouds** (秋云) of **commercial harvest** (商秋) have gathered, yet the **auspicious rain** (嘉雨) remains absent.

I now request, with my **Preceptor and all ritual officials** (临坛官众等),
to establish the **Dao Field of the Numinous Treasure, Great Unity, for Invoking Rain** (灵宝太一祈雨道场)
and to **dispel and scatter** (罢散) the **Twelve Divisions of the ritual** (设醮一十二分).
I pray that the **True Essence** (真造) descends and the **Divine** (真) examines my humble sincerity,
bestowing **sweet dew** (甘泽) as **mist** (雾), fulfilling the **people’s thirst** (黎元之涸望).

My **sincere and earnest petitions** (诸诚恳) are fully recorded in the **Blue Scriptures** (青词).
I wish to receive the **Most High’s True Essence of the Ten Directions** (十方正真生炁),
flowing into my body, so that my **sincere supplications** (所启之诚)
may swiftly reach the **Supreme Court of Purple Mystery and Jade Palace** (上清紫微碧玉宫),
the **Great Unity Emperor of the Celestial Vault** (太一大天帝),
the **Left Celestial Dragon** (左仙龙王) and **Right Celestial Dragon** (右仙龙王) within the **Jade Palace’s Inner Precincts** (紫微碧玉宫内院),
the **True Official of Great Unity** (太一真官天顺君),
the **Numinous Master of Great Unity’s Pure Stream** (太一清灵宝川真人),
the **Eastern Peak Emperor of Heavenly Equality and Human Benevolence** (东岳天齐仁圣帝),
the **Manifest King of the River’s Auspicious Response and Overwhelming Might** (江渎昭灵孚应威烈广源王),
the **First Attendant of the Inner Precincts** (内院直事一使者),
the **Second Attendant of the Inner Precincts** (内院直事二使者),
the **Third Attendant of the Inner Precincts** (内院直事三使者),
the **Day Official of the Five Directions** (日直功曹),
the **local land spirit** (当所土地),
the **Three Realms’ responsive deities** (三界应感),
and **all mighty and numinous powers** (一切威灵).

I have heard that the **Five Directions’ Cloud Seals** (五方云篆) are the **first safeguards for peace in the family and the state** (保家宁国之先);
and that the **Three Caverns’ Illuminated Precepts** (三洞明科) are the **essential means for saving beings and securing the people** (济物安民之要).

The **humans and heavens** rely upon them, both ancient and modern follow in their footsteps.
Above, they regulate the **celestial hosts’** (列宿) celestial movements and below, they respond to the **pleas of all living beings** (群生之沥祷).
Now, as the **current moment and place** (当境) approach, the rains have **failed to arrive on schedule** (愆期), and the crops are **near withering** (就槁).
The people’s distress is **deeper than ravines and valleys** (深於沟壑), yet no **harvesting success** (功) is achieved in the **fields** (田畴).
In awe of the **Supreme Dao’s** (上帝) benevolence toward life, and unable to bear the sight of the people **facing death** (就死),
I humbly submit this **sincere petition** (纡诚恳),
hoping to receive **special grace** (殊休).

May the **Heavenly Dao** (道恩) grant its **merciful favor** (善贷) and **inspect and respond** (天鉴顺临).
When **clouds rise and *qi* ascends** (云升气上), may it command the **spirits of mountains and marshes** (山泽之灵);
When the **armor of the earth is split** (甲拆勾萌), may it **bestow the nourishment of rivers and streams** (沐浴江河之润).

All who hold **sincere devotion** (恳悃),
dare not fail to **report this to the heavens** (上闻).
With **fasting resolve** (斋意) and **heartfelt words** (心词), I solemnly declare them for **proclamation and supplication** (宣奏).

**Proclamation:**
I request the **attendants** (官) to ascend and offer incense (上香).
Once the **petition’s meaning is fully declared** (词意具宣), the **fasting sincerity** (斋诚) will surely be **rewarded** (必享).

I have heard that the **Dragon’s** (龙) flight and **soaring** (飞跃) are **unbounded in their transformations** (运变化之无方);
Yet all things have **beginning and end** (始终), and **life’s creation depends on conditions** (生成之有待).
After **entreaties to Heaven have been poured out** (吁天之沥恳),
I shall **await the appointed day to welcome its blessings** (指日以迎休).

With today’s ascent to the platform and invocation of the Dao,
I pray that the assembled **Dharma-masters** (法众) perform this second offering of incense (运兹二捻上香),
and that this incense smoke,
may ascend the void directly to the **Upper Purity Palace of Purple Darkness and Jade Clarity** (上清紫微碧玉宫),
to **venerate** (供养) the **Great Unity Emperor of Heaven** (太一大天帝) and the **High Worthies** (合坐高真).
We submit our bodies, our **spiritual essences** (神), and our **command** (命) to the Great Dao,
and with this offering of incense, dedicate its **meritorious virtue** (功德)
to **purify and solemnize** (净严) this public hall (公宇),
to **lay out** (敷设) the ritual platform (坛场),
and to **solemnly venerate** (祇奉) the High Worthies,
**proclaiming and expounding** (宣扬) their **esoteric teachings** (秘典).
We hope to **stir the pure and luminous discernment** (清明之鉴),
to **subtly dispel** (潜消) the **excessive drought** (亢旱之灾).

May the **benevolent clouds** (慈云) arise,
and shower the **abundant rain** (大霈) of **nourishing dew** (之泽).

---

May this **auspicious harvest** (嘉谷) be fulfilled,
and let the land become one of **prosperity and abundance** (富庶之秋).

Now, we burn this incense,
and **solemnly vow to return to** (皈依) the **Way’s** (師尊) **Great Sage, the Most Perfect High Worthies** (大聖眾至真之德).
After attaining the **Dao** (得道之後),
we **ascend to the formless realm** (升入無形),
and **harmonize with the Dao’s** (和與道) **Most Perfect Truth** (合真).

We have heard that the **Five Phases** (五行) **interact in cycles** (相沙),
and thus **flood and drought** (兹水旱) become **calamities** (之災).
All things flow in their natural course (萬物流行),
and thus **flourishing and decay** (乃榮枯) have their **fixed measures** (之有數).
Now, the **sweet rains** (甘雨) are delayed,
and the **threat of famine** (將害豐年) looms.

Unless we **exhaustively express** (殚) **pure sincerity** (蠲洁之誠),
how could we **hope to receive** (曷冀) the **blessings of nourishment** (沾濡之澤)?

With this **ascension to the ritual platform** (升坛行道),
we **solemnly beseech the assembly of High Worthies** (請法眾等) to **carry this third offering of incense** (運兹三捻上香).
May this incense smoke **soar directly upward** (腾空径上),
reaching the **Upper Purity Palace of Purple Darkness and Jade Clarity** (上清紫微碧玉宫),
to **venerate** (供养) the **Great Unity Emperor of Heaven** (太一大天帝)
and the **gathered High Worthies** (阖坐高真).

We submit our bodies, our **spiritual essences** (神), and our **command** (命) to the Great Dao,
and with this offering of incense’s **meritorious virtue** (功德),
we **devoutly dedicate** (奉為) to **reverently honor the sacred spirits** (某夤奉真靈),
and **pray for benevolent response** (請求惠應).

May the **stars’ light return to illuminate** (星光回照),
and the **Dao’s** (道) **Most Perfect Benevolence** (癊興慈) **arise anew**.
We **solemnly command** (勑彼) the **hundred deities** (百神),
to **aid in the sacred duty of bestowing life** (助舉施生之職).
Let it rain **prodigiously for three days** (沛然三日),
and may we **witness the fulfillment of our prayers** (願觀沾足之期).

Now, we burn this incense,
and **solemnly vow to return to** (皈依) the **Way’s** (師尊) **Great Sage, the Most Perfect High Worthies** (大聖眾至真之德).
After attaining the **Dao** (得道之後),
we **ascend to the formless realm** (升入無形).
**Repentance** (唱方), **confession** (忏方).

We have heard that the **Most Perfect High Worthies, Great Sage** (至真大聖),
**need benevolent blessings** (需惠澤) to **save people** (以濟人).
The **Most High Primordial Lord** (無極元尊),
**fans auspicious winds** (扇祥風) to **nourish all things** (而育物).
Thus, in **ten cycles of transformation** (十回演化),
and **nine gradations of instruction** (九等垂科),
they **open the vast Dao-gate** (開廣大之法門),
and **pour the sweet nectar of compassion** (酒慈悲之甘露),
**showing forgiveness of sins** (示之宥罪),
and **granting the plea for mercy** (許以求哀).

Now, we **reverently construct this Dao-field** (某肅建道場),
and **devoutly bring our faith and trust** (虔赍法信).
We **return to the command of the Upper Purity Palace of Purple Darkness and Jade Clarity** (皈命上清紫微碧玉宫),
the **Great Unity Emperor of Heaven** (太一大天帝),
and the **gathered High Worthies** (阖坐高真).

We **humbly pray** (伏願) that upon hearing our voices,
they **respond in compassion** (寻声赴感, 应念垂慈).
The **officials and commoners alike** (官吏云, 士民云) **confess**:
*"Officials have accumulated offenses and guilt* (吏积愆尤).
*The people indulge in excess and licentiousness* (俗有奢淫).*
We beg for **slight leniency** (乞少寬) in **Your wrathful punishment** (於威怒).
*The people suffer from famine and hunger* (民罹饥馑),
and we **hope for final deliverance** (冀終格) in **abundant harvest** (於豐登).*

May the **merits of fasting** (斋功) **pervade the boundless** (廣被於無邊),
and the **rain of the Dao’s teachings** (法雨) **nourish all beings** (溥沾於一切).
After attaining the **Dao** (得道之後),
we **ascend to the formless realm** (升入無形),
and **harmonize with the Dao’s Most Perfect Truth** (和與道合真).

**Knowing the ritual bell** (知磬舉),
we **offer three salutations** (三启),
and **three obeisances** (三礼).
We **reiterate the sacred rank** (重称法位).

We, the **devout officials of all ranks** (具位臣某等),
**sincerely unite in prayer** (谨同诚上启),
and **reverently address** (上启):
the **Upper Purity Palace of Purple Darkness and Jade Clarity** (上清紫微碧玉宫),
the **Great Unity Emperor of Heaven** (太一大天帝),
and the **gathered High Worthies** (阖坐高真).

We have heard that when **the heavens suffer drought** (上天亢旱),
we **behold the radiant return of the Milky Way** (瞻云汉之昭回).
When **the earth below is scorched and parched** (下土焦熬),
we **lament the exhaustion of the water sources** (叹水源之枯竭).
No sign of **the crane’s auspicious call** (不見鶉鳴之候),
only the **worries of wolves and tigers** (但懷狼顧之憂).
We **devoutly command the celestial adepts** (虔命羽流洁严),
and **reverently offer precious rites** (公宇珍供演揚奧典)
to **hope for special blessings** (冀沐殊休),
for **the Dao’s virtue has not yet returned** (邈天德之未回).
We **awaken in fear** (惕危衷) and **increase our dread** (而增惧).

Now, we **further solemnize the Dao-assembly** (再严法会),
and **reverently construct the ritual platform** (肃建坛场).
We **look upward to the hundred spirits** (仰百靈) for **their descending inspection** (降鑑之恩),
and **wait for the response of a single thought** (俟一念潜通之应).
Then, **above, the Heavenly Emperor’s benevolent blessings** (上明天帝大慈之澤) will be granted,
and **below, our devout prayers** (下副臣等請祷之誠) will be answered.
We **reverently report this** (谨启以闻).

**Knowing the ritual bell** (知磬舉),
we **offer twelve wishes** (十二願).
The **grand recitation begins** (都讲举),
and we **focus our spirits while burning incense** (存神烧香).

The **Incense Officials, the Messengers** (香官使者),
the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** (左右龙虎君),
and the **attendant spirits of incense** (侍香诸灵官),
should **cause this Dao-field** (當令臣道場之所) to
**naturally produce golden elixir and verdant jade** (自然生金液丹碧),
**mushrooms and herbs of myriad blessings** (芝英百靈),
and **gathered High Worthies** (眾真交會) at this **incense burner** (在此香火炉前).
We **pray that the High Worthies descend with blessings** (上願高真降福),
and that **all under heaven receive Your grace** (率土蒙恩).
The **ten directions’ immortal children and jade maidens** (十方仙童玉女),
**attend and escort the incense smoke** (接侍香烟),
and **transmit and proclaim our sincere prayers** (传奏向来所启之诚)
to the **Upper Purity Palace of Purple Darkness and Jade Clarity** (上清紫微碧玉宫),
and the **Great Unity Emperor of Heaven’s Presence** (太一大天帝御前).

**Knowing the ritual bell** (知磬舉),
we **recite the *Xiaoxue* (小学) Immortal Praises** (仙赞).

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Standards Collection, Volume Ten** (道門科範大全集卷之十) **ends.**
**The Complete Daoist Ritual Standards Collection, Volume Eleven** (道門科範大全集卷之十一) **begins.**

**The *Lingbao Taiyi Rain-Prayer Ritual*
Compiled and Edited by Master Guangting Du**

**Ritual Setup and Daoist Ceremony**
The ritual platform is established as prescribed.
The Grand Master leads the assembly, and all disciples pay homage in accordance with the Dao.

The common folk lament the calamity of drought,
And the **magistrates and prefects** [*郡守、令尹*] are burdened with anxious concern.
We strictly adhere to the **Sacred Scriptures** [*宝箓*],
And solemnly invoke the **Pure Field** [*清场*].

Praying that the **Ten Days** [*十日*] may align in harmony,
And that **auspicious dew** [*嘉泽*] may descend in abundance;
So that the **Three Springs** [*三春*] may be fully nourished,
And that the fields of the people may be universally moistened.

In **summer**, dark clouds bind in **active suspension** [*活套*],
So that the **Three Crops** [*三农*] may be fully nourished,
And that the **highest plants** [*亢苗*] may be universally refreshed;
In **autumn**, dark clouds bind in **active suspension**,
So that the **Nine Harvests** [*九秋*] may be fully nourished,
And that all may rejoice in a bountiful year.

Praying for snow,
That the **Six Celestial Outpourings** [*六出*] may send the **flying snowflakes** [*飞霙*],
And that **auspicious moisture** [*嘉润*] may descend in abundance;
So that the **Three Ascents** [*三登*] may harmonize in omens,
And that we may preemptively celebrate a year of prosperity.

All beings, whether **sentient** or **insentient** [*动植*],
Are entirely indebted to the **Transformative Power** [*造化*] for their creation and sustenance.

Disasters sink into the **Nine Earths** [*九地*],
Fortunes rise from the **Ten Directions** [*十方*].

We, your subjects, with **sincere hearts** [*志心*],
Bow in **reverent homage** [*稽首*],
And offer **gratitude** [*礼谢*] to the **Supreme Celestial Treasures** [*无上虚皇至真三宝*].

**Chanting the Three Invocations** [*吟三启*],
**Declaring the True Text** [*宣真文*],
With **three rites** [*三礼*] **raised**,
And **proclaiming the Law’s rank** [*称法位*].

We, your subjects of **all ranks** [*具位*], including the **Altar Officials** [*合坛官众*] and myself,
With **unified sincerity** [*同诚*],
Respectfully submit our petitions to:
The **Supreme Great Three Pure Ones** [*大罗无上三清*],
The **Supreme Jade Emperor of the Highest Heaven** [*太上昊天玉皇*],
The **Nine Grades of Highest Virtue** [*九品高真*],
The **Ten Directions of Supreme Sages** [*十方上圣*],
All **Heavens and Earths** [*诸天诸地*],
The **True Scriptures and True Masters** [*真经真师*],
The **Perfect Celestial Symbol** [*圆穹上象*],
The **Heavenly Treasury of Spirits** [*天府列真*],
The **Earthly Abodes and Mountain Shrines** [*厚地洞宫、岳渎主宰*],
The **Emperor of the Eastern Tree** [*扶桑大帝*],
The **Divine Lord of the Bright Valley** [*旸谷神君*],
The **Dragon King of the Abyssal Depths** [*洞渊龙王*],
The **Water Emperor of the Nine Rivers** [*九江水帝*],
The **Twelve River Sources** [*十二河源*],
Those who **stir clouds and bring rain**, **Thunderers and Wind Lords** [*兴云致雨、雷电风伯*],
The **spirits of all temples** [*诸庙神祇*],
The **City Deities and Community Lords** [*城隍社令*],
The **Three Realms** in response,
All **True Spirits**.

We have heard that:
The **Round Celestial** [*圆清*] dwells in **Purity** [*宅粹*],
And the **Square Earthly** [*方厚*] stores **Essence** [*储精*];
All are governed by the **spirits**,
And the **Transformative Power** holds the **total authority** [*总权衡*].

Though there may be **auspicious or inauspicious** [*吉凶*] **categories** [*有类*],
Fortunes and calamities are **never partial** [*无私*].

Thus, the **Divine Mandates** [*冲科*] preserve the **rites of petition** [*请祷之文*],
And the **True Teachings** [*真教*] elucidate the **patterns of expiation** [*襘禳之范*],
Attaining **sincerity** in worship,
And **responsive harmony** in sensation.

Now, for the present realm,
We humbly submit that **sweet rains and auspicious snow** have failed to arrive on time,
And that the **Sun Prince’s** excess is a **precious concern** [*珍*],
Not to be lightly dismissed.
With **fasting devotion** [*斋庄*] fully observed,
We look upward to the **Highest Virtue**,
And downward to the **Red Scriptures** [*丹款*].

Humbly praying,
That the **prolonged darkness** [*重阴*] may follow its proper course,
And that **abundant dews** [*霈泽*] may arrive in due season,
So that the **crops and grains** may flourish and be plentiful,
And that the **people and soldiers** may attain **prosperity and ease** [*康乐*].

We, your subjects, have long followed the **Master’s instructions** [*师训*],
And early donned the **True Talismans** [*真符*].
All incense petitions are logically beyond reproach,
Yet, when we receive the **Divine Edicts** [*词旨*],
How dare we not report them,
And solemnly present our **Altar words and vows** [*启坛词诚*] **for proclamation** [*宣奏*]?

**Proclaiming the Petition** [*宣词*].

As per the **Divine Edicts**,
With **utmost devotion** fully observed,
We now **propagate the Transformation** [*宣化*] to **follow the currents** [*承流*],
Thus **lengthening the lives** of the people and **aiding the world** [*长民辅世*].

Should any **single thing** lose its **proper place** [*有失其所*],
Then how could our **great fears** [*大惧*] find rest?
We fear that **punishments may be unjust**,
And that the people may rise in **grievance and lamentation** [*怨嗟*].

Or should the **Four Cardinal Directions** [*抚宇*] be disordered,
And **affairs** become **troubled and chaotic** [*乖方*],
With **accumulated guilt and regret** [*烦扰积悔*],
The longer this persists,
The more the **proper sequence of time** [*时序*] may be delayed.

Thus, we purify the **Sacred Field** [*灵场*] with incense,
And **reverently consult** the **Sacred Texts** [*稽参宝典*],
With **pious introspection** [*虔省躬*],
And **humble self-blame** [*引咎*],
Praying that **fortunes** may be turned and **blessings** bestowed upon the people.

We look upward to the **Highest Virtue of the Three Realms** [*三境高真*],
And the **Supreme Sages of the Nine Heavens** [*九天上圣*],
Begging forgiveness for our past actions,
And permission to **renew ourselves** [*自新*],
Adjusting and rectifying **Yin** and **Yang**,
Balancing the **celestial decrees** [*律令*]—
So that the **good fields** [*良畴*] may be nourished,
And that the **many crops** may grow in harmony,
That the **prefectures and counties** may be secure,
And that the **people and soldiers** may attain **prosperity and ease**.

We, your subjects, **reverently follow** the **fasting laws** [*斋法*],
And **diligently report** our petitions at every opportunity.
Hoping that our **sincere intentions** may be **responsively harmonized**,
And that the **auspicious blessings** [*庬休*] may swiftly arrive,
That our **shadows** may follow and **echoes** may respond,
And that our **wishes** may be fulfilled and **rites completed**.

At **dawn’s first light** [*明旦*],
With **pious sincerity** [*虔诚*] and **lawful conduct** [*依法行道*],
We continue to report our petitions.

**Issuing our Vows** [*发愿*].

**Raising the rites** [*举*],
And **concentrating our spirits** [*存神*] while burning incense.
The **Highest Functionary** [*高功*] restores the **incense brazier**.

The **Incense Officials and Messengers** [*香官使者*],
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Officials** [*左右龙虎君*],
And the **attendant spirits of incense** [*侍香诸灵官*],
Shall now command that,
Wherever we have previously **invoked the altar** and **performed the rites** [*启坛行科*],
There will naturally arise **golden elixir and azure jade** [*金液丹碧*],
**Mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits** [*芝英百灵*],
And **all spirits** will gather in assembly,
At this **incense brazier** before us.

Now, we pray that the **Ten Directions’ celestial youths and jade maidens** [*十方仙童玉女*],
May **attend** the **fragrant vapors** [*兰烟*],
And **transmit** our **previously offered sincerity** [*所启之诚*],
Swiftly reaching the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Boundless** [*至真无极大道*] **and the Highest Heaven’s Golden Gates, Jade Emperor** [*昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝御前*].

「Know the **ritual of striking the stone chime** [*磬举*] **and begin the invocation**,
**Exit the hall** and **chant the hymns** [*出堂颂*].
**Proceed to the threshold** and **guide** to the **Six-Panel Hall** [*引至六幕堂*].

**Morning rites** [*清旦行道*]
**Ritual proceedings commence** [*法事升坛如式*].

**The Master of Ceremonies** [*都讲举*] **invokes the assembly**,
**Each pays homage to the Teacher** [*各礼师存念如法*] **according to the prescribed manner**.

**The High Functionary** [*高功*] **declares the sacred protective spells** [*宣卫灵咒*].

The **Kan Palace** [*乾宫*] **conceals the hidden sage** [*隐圣*],
The **Dao’s origin is nameless** [*道本无名*].
The **Kan Symbol** [*坎符*] **bears the virtue of water** [*水德*],
**Flowing humility** [*流谦*] **and **draining evil** [*恶盈*] **are its essence**.

The **Gen Corner** [*艮隅*] **establishes stability** [*定止*],
**Transformation arises in majestic splendor** [*化立峥嵘*].

The **Zhen Direction** [*震方*] **gives rise to the **Sacred Symbol** [*起象*],
**All things draw life from its bounty** [*万汇资生*].

The **Xun Center** [*巽中*] **stirs the winds** [*风动*],
**All beings prosper under its nurturing** [*群物仰成*].

The **Li Radiance** [*离明*] **establishes its position** [*设位*],
**Illuminating the vital essence of the sun** [*焕赫阳精*].

The **Kun Residence** [*坤居*] **embodies profound virtue** [*厚德*],
**Abundant cultivation brings universal honor** [*茂育皆荣*].

The **Dui Metal** [*兑金*] **restrains its brilliance** [*戢耀*],
**Serpentine grace unfurls in purity** [*蜿蜓素呈*].

The **Azure Waves** [*碧波*] **spread vast and boundless** [*漶漫*],
