The radiance of the sun and moon shines forth on all sides,
The thunderous roar of winds and peals resounds with solemn awe.
In harmony with the four seasons, the symbols of change are aligned,
And the hundred virtues descend, bestowing blessings and auspicious signs.

Only through virtue does one draw near,
And sincerity alone is the path to grace.

Now, certain officials humbly submit:
For the disorder of yin and yang, for winds and rains,
For rain and snow that fail in their proper times,
Lest they harm the fields and bring sorrow to the people,
We reflect upon our own lack of virtue and fear the calamities
That may befall those who disregard the sacred.

Thus, we dare to offer earnest prayers and devout supplications,
Hoping for favorable responses and to receive the boundless blessings of the Dao.
We request the assembly of all present to join in this initial offering of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend high into the heavens,
To honor the Ten Directions’ Supreme Dao/Way Treasure, the Celestial Sovereign.

With reverence, we dedicate our bodies, our spirits, and our lives,
Prostrating ourselves to the earth,
That through this incense offering’s merit,
We may bless the current Emperor, the august Sovereign.

Humbly we pray:
May the celestial favor be everlasting,
And the sacred calendar flourish in prosperity.
May the foundation of His rule endure for ten thousand years,
And His noble lineage thrive through a hundred generations.
May the five winds and ten rains never fail,
Bringing perfect harmony to all.
May the four quarters and myriad lands together receive
The enlightening transformation of His grace.

Now, we offer incense again,
And humbly rely upon the Supreme Virtue of the Dao/Way Treasure,
The Great Sage of All-Pervading Truth.
After attaining the Dao, may we preserve the heavens’ eternal existence,
And align ourselves with the Dao’s true essence.

With this incense offering’s merit,
We pray for the protection and tranquility of the prefectural magistrate
And extend it to all his subordinates.

Humbly we pray:
May the wondrous Dao/Way solidify in its blessings,
And the most exalted deities aid in virtue.
May gentle winds stretch far and wide,
And the banners of the celestial realm rest in solemn order—
A sign of the utmost benevolence.
May sweet rains fall in due season,
And every hundred miles resound with praise of the harmonizing Dao,
As though the music of the *qing* [1] were heard.

May officials be united in harmony,
And the people’s afflictions all be lifted—
No disasters from yin and yang’s disorder,
And abundant harvests for the farmer’s hopeful prayers.

Now, we offer incense once more,
And humbly rely upon the Supreme Virtue of the Celestial Sage,
The Great Sage of All-Pervading Truth.
After attaining the Dao, may we preserve the heavens’ eternal existence,
And align ourselves with the Dao’s true essence.

With this incense offering’s merit,
We pray for the protection and blessings of these people,
And extend them to all within our borders.

Humbly we pray:
May the imperial radiance descend like a torch,
And the Dao’s yin [2] embrace all with its grace.
May all within the realm bow in obedience,
And the three calamities [3] be extirpated from every village.
May the rains and snows be ever timely,
And the seals of the land suffer no injury from drought or flood.
May the grains abound in harvest,
And every household rejoice with the blessings of filled granaries.

Now, we offer incense once more,
And humbly rely upon the Supreme Virtue of the Celestial Sage,
The Great Sage of All-Pervading Truth.
After attaining the Dao, may we preserve the heavens’ eternal existence,
And align ourselves with the Dao’s true essence.

We chant the directions,
We repent the directions,
We command the demons.

We raise our voices in supplication for rain.
The Dao unites with the primal *qi*,
And yin and yang nurture all beings.
The people below have committed many transgressions.
The Supreme Dao bestows the decree of punishment.
With earnest hearts and diligent morning repentance,
We sincerely regret our sins and seek forgiveness in the unseen.

May it be granted to shower rain and snow,
And to moisten all that is without feeling.

We bow three times.
We again solemnly proclaim the sacred titles.

The undersigned officials, along with the assembled congregation,
With sincere hearts, jointly petition:
The Supreme Great Three Celestial Deities of the Great Dao,
The Most High Heavenly Jade Emperor, the Celestial Sovereign,
The Nine Grades of High Perfection,
The Ten Directions’ Supreme Sages,
All Celestial Deities and Celestial Lords,
The True Scriptures and True Masters,
The Round Dome’s lofty symbols,
The arrayed constellations and stars,
The boundless earth and cavernous palaces,
The sovereigns of mountains and marshes,
The Water Realm’s deep abysses,
The summoners of clouds and bestowers of rain,
The City Deities and all mighty spirits.

We hear that the Round Dome’s mysteries are profound and silent,
And the divine transformations hidden in speechless grace.
The Great Dao is vast and unfathomable,
And its primal functions operate beyond mortal control.

The shifting of yin and yang in contraction and expansion,
The subtle movements of heaven and earth—
When pestilential *qi* invades according to season,
Then drought arises without fail.

There are no reverent rites to uphold,
Nor sincere petitions to extend.
Yet with utmost sincerity, the celestial grace descends in splendor,
And with profound devotion, the divine responds in mercy.

Now, we—your humble servants—
Humbly confess our long neglect of sweet rains,
Lest fertile fields be harmed,
Lest the year’s harvest be imperiled.
No auspicious dew has fallen,
And we, bound by duty to this land and its people,
Have vainly sought relief in prayer,
Ever trembling in fear and self-reproach.

Perhaps there are officials who fail to heed imperial decrees,
Or judges who err in meting out justice—
These accumulated transgressions
Have brought no peace.

Thus, we purify the jade altar,
Adorn it with sacred offerings,
And humbly bow in repentance,
Hoping to turn misfortune into blessing.

We pray to the lofty immortals of the jade palace,
To the supreme sages of the celestial capital,
To the true sovereigns of the ten directions,
To the mighty spirits of the three realms—
May they awaken their divine hearts,
Extend their mercy below,
Drive away the dark void of the abyss,
And command the cloud-bearers to harness the wind.

Let abundant sweet dew descend,
Let misty nourishment permeate the land.
Let heavenly rain pour forth,
Let blessed moisture drench the earth.
Across the vast thousand-li expanse,
May hidden plagues be dispelled;
Through every field of the ten thousand homes,
May all reap the hope of bountiful harvest.

Above, we honor the Heavenly Venerable’s boundless compassion,
Below, we align with our servants’ earnest supplications—
Thus, we humbly present this petition.

*(The ritual is now complete.)*
Twelve wishes are fulfilled.
The high priest restores the incense burner.
The incense officers and messengers,
The Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
And the attendant spirit officials—
At the place where we formerly ascended the altar at dawn to practice the Dao,
Gold-liquid elixir and jade-green herbs shall spontaneously arise,
With mushrooms and hundred-spirits’ blessings,
As the assembled immortals gather before this incense burner.

May the celestial boys and girls of the ten directions
Attend to the fragrant mists,
And swiftly convey our humble petitions
Directly to the Supreme Dao of the Boundless Primordial,
To the Three Pure Ones of Highest Holiness,
To the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Court.

*(The ritual bell is struck, and the hymn is chanted.)*
Exit the hall, and lead to the Six-Curtain Pavilion.

*End of Volume Thirteen of the Complete Ritual Standards of the Dao Gate.*
*Volume Fourteen of the Complete Ritual Standards of the Dao Gate.*

**Ritual for Invoking Rain and Snow**
*Compiled and Edited by Master Guangting Du*

**Midday Dao Practice**

The ritual platform is ascended as prescribed.
The Master of Ceremonies leads the assembly, and all pay homage to the Teacher in accordance with the Dao.

The High Functionary proclaims the *Wei Ling* incantation.
The Vermilion Spirit and Crimson Flame ignite—
Flames and winds surge in crimson radiance,
The Red Wheel turns with unyielding force,
Heaven’s light bursts in eight directions.
The威威包罗 spreads, transforming the ten thousand realms.
Molten gold cascades, dispelling all demonic traces.
Evil is vanquished, the Dao’s primal virtue shines forth.
Golden talismans summon and command—
Striding on clouds, wielding dragons.
Hymns of joy resound, petals scatter through the void.
Divine transformations unfold—
The Four Quarters prosper in harmony.
Beneath the Sovereign’s gaze, none dare disrespect,
As harmony aligns with the True Dao.

*The law-drum is struck twenty-four times.*

The High Functionary ignites the furnace.
The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Originator of the Three Qi,
The Most High Dao Lord,
The Most High Laozi,
summon forth from within our bodies the Three Five Functionaries,
Left and Right Officials and Messengers,
Left and Right Incense-Bearers,
Dragon-Mounted Couriers,
Golden Boys Attending Incense,
Flower-Scattering Nymphs,
Thirty-six Direct-Symbol Officials,
Thirty-six Day-Incense Officials—
All emerge in resplendent attire,
Crowns and ribbons trailing,
Unlocking the Mystic Platform’s earthly and territorial deities.

At this midday Dao practice,
I humbly present my sincerest petition,
My deepest devotion already recorded in the heavens.
May the Most High Dao’s ten-directional True Qi,
The Sacred Treasure’s luminous radiance,
Descend into our bodies,
That my earnest plea may swiftly reach
The Most High Boundless Dao,
The Three Pure Ones of Highest Holiness,
The Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Court.

*The law-drum is struck, and the rank is proclaimed.*

We, the officials of this assembly—
With utmost sincerity—
Humbly petition:
The Primordial Heavenly Venerable of Natural Emptiness,
The Most High Dao Lord of the Boundless Dao,
The Most High Laozi,
The Emperor of Supreme Virtue of the Undifferentiated,
The Most High Sovereign of Heaven-Opening, Talisman-Bearing, History-Encompassing, Truth-Containing,
The Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Court,
The Purple Forbidden Emperor,
The Great Emperor of the Northern Dipper,
The Great Emperor of the Northern Celestial Pole,
The Sacred Ancestor of Highest Dao,
The Nine-Heaven Life-Preserving Sovereign of Destiny,
The Earthly Sovereign of the Yellow Soil,
The Great Saintly Empress of the Primordial Heaven,
The True Lord of Five Blessings and Ten Gods—Great One,
The Thirty-Two Heavenly Sovereigns,
The Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Masters of the Mystic Middle,
The Palaces of Eastern Clarity, Southern Polarity, Western Spirit, Northern Truth,
The Celestial Capital, Jade Gate, Golden Threshold, Seven Treasures, Jade Terrace, Purple Forbidden,
The Most High Dao Lord of the Sacred Treasure’s True Clarity,
The Supreme Chancellor, Supreme Prime Minister,
The Supreme Protector, Supreme Tutor,
The Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors,
The Eleven Great Luminaries,
The Seven Elements of the Northern Dipper,
The Twenty-Eight Constellations,
The Nine Palaces and Ten Precincts of the Great One,
The Four Celestial Worthies of the Northern Pole,
The Great Emperor of the Vermilion Phoenix,
The God-King of the Yang Valley,
The Dragon-King of the Cavernous Abyss,
The Ten Caverns and Five Sacred Peaks,
The Nine Rivers and Water Emperors,
The Eight Seas’ Dragon-Kings,
The Three Rivers and Four Great Waterways,
The Five Lakes and Seven Marshes,
The streams, valleys, and sources—
The Five-Directional Rain-Bringing Dragon-Kings,
The Masters of Wind, Cloud, Thunder, and Lightning,
The Sovereigns of Yin and Yang,
The territorial and boundary deities,
The city gods and community officials,
All responsive beings of the Three Realms,
Every divine spirit.

We have heard:
Though heaven’s burden may seem vast,
The common folk’s suffering is unbearable.

The Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors,
The Eleven Great Luminaries of the Celestial Worthies,
The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper,
The Twenty-Eight Constellations,
The Nine Palaces and Ten Precincts of the Supreme One,
The Five-Directional Rain-Bringing Dragon-Kings,
The Masters of Wind, Cloud, Thunder, and Lightning,
The Sovereigns of Yin and Yang,
The territorial and boundary deities,
The city gods and community officials,
All responsive beings of the Three Realms,
Every divine spirit.

We have heard:
Though the Dao/Way precedes the heavens and earth,
It subtly governs the interplay of Yin and Yang.
By the virtue/power of the responsive beings, communication is certain,
For sincere words are never without effect.

Now, on this occasion of the **threefold Dao/Way** (三时行道),
We seek the fulfillment of the **habitual and transformative** (习坎) merit.
And with the **six reins guiding the wheel** (六辔驰轮),
We have already reached the **heavenly ascent** (重离) station.
Not merely to honor the sacred rites,
But to invoke the **illustrious virtue/power** (明德),
We offer the **secret scriptures** (秘箓) with utmost solemnity,
And pray for the **enduring blessings of the sacred diagram** (宝图).

At this **noon court session** (午朝),
Ascending the altar to perform the Dao/Way (行道),
We request the assembly of the **Law** (法) to take this first pinch of incense,
Wishing that this incense smoke may soar through the sky,
Ascending to the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure, Heavenly Venerable** (无上道宝天尊).
We submit our bodies, our spirits, and our lives,
Prostrating our heads to the earth,
With this merit of the first pinch of incense,
We pray for the blessings upon the **current Emperor** (皇帝陛下).
May the sun and stars shine brightly,
And the tortoise and tripod (龟鼎) remain in harmony,
So that the **praise may echo eternally at Mount Song** (嵩高),
And the **auspicious longevity may match the Dipper’s Pole** (斗极).

May the **heavenly rains** (雨旸) be constant,
And all under heaven share in the **harmonious unity** (凝和).
May there be no warfare,
And all lands reach **peaceful tranquility** (康靖).

Now, this incense is burned,
As we submit to the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure, Great Sage, and Venerable Assembly of the Most Authentic** (道尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao/Way,
May we forever preserve the heavens and long endure,
In harmony with the **authentic Dao/Way** (道合真).

At this **noon court session** (午朝),
Ascending the altar to perform the Dao/Way (行道),
We request the assembly of the **Law** (法) to take this second pinch of incense,
Wishing that this incense smoke may soar through the sky,
Ascending to the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure, Heavenly Venerable** (无上经宝天尊).
We submit our bodies, our spirits, and our lives,
Prostrating our heads to the earth,
With this merit of the second pinch of incense,
We pray for blessings upon the **prefectures and their officials** (郡宰) and their **subordinates** (属僚).
May the **government halls** (棠砌) be orderly and the **courts** (柳庭) be simple in disputes,
So that the **virtue of benevolence** (仁风) may spread across the **thousand-li** (千里),
And the **blessings of kindness** (惠泽) may reach the **four classes of people** (四民).
May the **heavenly mandate** (奉天) be eternally steadfast,
And the **reports to the state** (报国) be ever more prosperous in fortune.

May the **Five Phases** (五行) be in harmony,
And the **six qi** (六气) be balanced,
So that the **rains and winds** (雨风) never stray from their proper measures,
And the **harvests** (禾稼) bring abundant joy.

Now, this incense is burned,
As we submit to the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure, Great Sage, and Venerable Assembly of the Most Authentic** (师尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao/Way,
May we forever preserve the heavens and long endure,
In harmony with the **authentic Dao/Way** (道合真).

We chant the **Four Directions** (方),
We repent the **Four Directions** (忏方),
We command the **demons** (魔).

The **Incantation for Rain** (祈雨颂).

The **Supreme Dao/Way** (至道) encompasses the **original qi** (元气),
And the **divine** (神) nurtures all beings within **Yin and Yang** (两仪).
The common folk have committed many transgressions,
And the **Heavenly Sovereign** (上帝) has brought down punishments.
With utmost earnestness, we perform the **morning rituals** (朝礼),
And with sincere hearts, we repent our sins in the **dark abyss** (杳冥).
May the **Heavenly Sovereign** (上帝) graciously descend rain and snow,
To nourish all beings, even the **sentientless** (无情).
Three prostrations (三礼).
We repeatedly affirm the **Law’s station** (法位).

The **officers of the altar** (合坛官众) and I, the **modest subject** (具位臣某),
Together with sincere hearts, humbly present this petition,
To the **Venerable of the Three Void Realms** (虚无三境至尊),
And to the **auspicious assembly of the Dao/Way Ritual Feast** (醮筵列圣).
We respectfully hope for the **great compassion** (洪慈),
And for the **penetrating and illuminating response** (洞回昭鉴).

We have heard:
The Dao/Way precedes the **Five Celestial Sovereigns** (五太),
And its **pervasive influence** (弥纶) knows no bounds.
The **divine** (神) exists beyond **Yin and Yang** (两仪),
And its **manifestations and measures** (运量) are limitless.

The calamities and blessings each have their inherent origins,
Yet their auspicious and inauspicious effects respond swiftly, like echoes and shadows.
Therefore, the rites of *Róng* (honoring rain) were recorded in the *Classics of Rites* by the ancients;
The texts of fasting and *jiào* (ritual expiation) were established by the Sage Emperors in the canonical statutes.
For the efficacy lies in proper response—
Not merely in empty words.

We, the humble subjects, though unworthy of the sacred halls,
And though we presume to follow the teachings of the Dao,
Now follow the sacred treasures,
And solemnly establish this hallowed ground.

Now, we, the lowly petitioners, lie prostrate in distress over the extreme drought,
As the people’s hopes wither.
With sincere words and faithful offerings,
We personally confess our transgressions and pray for mercy.

We humbly hope that the **Venerable of the Purple Extremity** (紫极高真),
The **Celestial Bureaucrats of the Pure Capital** (清都列象),
The **Caverns of the Penetrating Peaks** (洞天),
The **Sacred Precincts of the Mountains and Waters** (岳渎),
And the **Blessed Lands of Tranquility** (福地靖庐),
All the exalted deities of boundless benevolence,
And the sovereigns who govern **Yin and Yang**—
Whose reach extends to the furthest depths,
Whose responses are swift to every plea—
May command the hidden dragons of the seas to rise,
And disperse the fragrant *qi* of mountains and rivers.

May the clouds move and the rain descend,
Nurturing the three agricultural cycles with their life-giving moisture;
May the spring planting and autumn harvests flourish,
So that all grains may grow in harmony and abundance.

May the four classes of people live in peace,
And may prosperity extend a thousand *li* in every direction.
May all living beings be sheltered beneath the **Great Compassionate Cover** (覆容),
And may nothing escape the **Transformative Nurturing** (化育).
Above, we honor the **Exalted Great Compassion** (尊大慈),
Below, we fulfill our subjects’ devout prayers.

We respectfully present this petition.

**The Twelve Vows are raised.**
**The Invocation of the Spirit and the Burning of Incense begin.**
The **High Functionary** restores the altar fire.

The **Incense Officials and Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the Attendant Spirit Officials**—
Let them now command that the place where the humble subject previously knelt at the **Noon Court** (午朝) and ascended the altar to perform the Dao,
Shall naturally produce **golden elixir and emerald-green jade** (金液丹碧),
And **mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits** (芝英百灵).
Let the **Celestial Worthies** gather here before this incense burner.

Now, we pray that the **Celestial Youth and Jade Maidens of the Ten Directions**,
Attended by **orchid and musk** (兰喱),
May swiftly convey the humble subject’s sincere petition
Directly to the **Supreme Dao of the Boundless and Limitless Great Reality** (至真无极大道),
To the **Three Pure Ones, the Most Sacred** (三清上圣),
And to the **Heavenly Sovereign, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Court** (昊天玉皇上帝) before the Celestial Throne.

**The gong is struck, and the hymn is chanted.**
**Exiting the hall, leading to the Six-Curtain Pavilion.**

「The Daoist Canon of Rituals and Regulations: A Comprehensive Collection, Volume Fourteen *concluded*
Volume Fifteen: *Master Guangcheng Du Guangting’s Revised Edition*
**Ritual for Invoking Rain and Snow**

*Performing the Dao in the Evening Court as prescribed.*

**The gong is struck, and the incantations are recited in accordance with the ritual.**
**The Master of Ceremonies (高功) announces the sacred talismans.**

The Five Stars shine resplendent, auspicious **qi** ascends in flight.
**Yuan Shi** gathers the **shen** (神), as Heaven and Earth revolve in harmony.
The Jade Talismans and Sacred Nodes (玉符宝节) resound with whispered commands.
Hurl flames and display might—wickedness and malevolence shall not remain.
Ten thousand demons are subdued, their chaotic forms dispersed.
Monstrous beings and evil forces are crushed, as the **Dao qi** circulates universally.
Divine light illuminates the night, dispelling all shadows.
Ten thousand spirits descend in ranks, their blessings riding the winds.

Grass grows in abundance, beneficence spreads across the land,
In perfect accord with the **Dao** and its true essence.

**The gong is struck, and the ritual drum is sounded forty-eight times.**
**The Master of Ceremonies (高功) ignites the incense burner.**

Now summoned are the **Supreme Three Heavens and the Primordial Yuan Shi’s Three Qi** (无上三天玄元始三炁),
**The Most High Dao Lord** (太上道君),
**The Most High Lao Lord** (太上老君),
And the **Thirty-Six Officials of the Five Agents** (三五功曹) within our bodies,
The left and right **Celestial Officials and Messengers** (左右官使者),
The left and right **Incense Bearers** (左右捧香),
The **Dragon-Courier Attendants** (驿龙骑吏),
The **Golden Boys Attending Incense** (侍香金童),
The **Jade Maidens of the Spoken Word and Scattered Flowers** (传言散花玉女),
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** (五帝直符),
The **Direct-Day Incense Officials** (直日香官)—each thirty-six in number—now appear.

**The assembled deities don their splendid attire, their crowns and sashes adorned with trailing ribbons.**
**The talismans of the Mysterious Dao and the Celestial Emperors are invoked,**
And the **True Officials and Land Deities** (真官正神) of this locality are summoned.

Now, the humble subject performs the **Dao** in the Evening Court,
Ascends the altar, and sincerely presents this petition—
**With utmost devotion and sincerity, already recorded and heard.**
We pray that the **Most High Dao Qi of the Ten Directions** (十方至真道炁),
The **Sacred Auspicious Light of the Mysterious Treasure** (灵宝瑞光),
May descend and flow into our bodies,
So that the humble subject’s sincere petition
May swiftly reach the **Supreme Dao of the Boundless and Limitless Great Reality** (至真无极大道),
The **Three Pure Ones, the Most Sacred** (三清上圣),
And the **Heavenly Sovereign, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Court** (昊天玉皇上帝) before the Celestial Throne.

**The ritual positions are invoked.**
**The humble subject [name], together with the assembled altar officials,**
**Solemnly offers this sincere petition to the following deities:**

The **Emperor of the Void-Natural Primordial Heaven** (虚无自然元始天尊),
The **Lord of the Boundless Dao** (无极大道太上道君),
**The Most High Lao Lord** (太上老君),
The **Emperor of the Mixed Primordial Supreme Virtue** (混元上德皇帝),
The **Heavenly Sovereign, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Court, Who Holds the Talisman and Governs the Cosmic Cycle in His True Form** (开天执符御历含真体道昊天玉皇上帝),
The **Great Emperor of the Purple Cluster** (紫微天皇大帝),
The **Great Emperor of the Central Heaven and Northern Pole** (中天北极大帝),
The **Highest Ancestor, Most Sacred Daoist** (圣祖上灵高道),
The **Great Emperor Who Preserves Life and Governs Fate in the Ninth Heaven** (九天司命保生大帝),
**The Earthly Sovereign, Great Land Deity** (后土皇地祇),
The **Primordial Heavenly Great Sage Mother** (元天大圣后),
The **True Lord of the Five Blessings and Ten Spirits** (五福十神太一真君),
The **Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors** (三十二天帝君),
The **Thirty-Six Divisions of Sacred Scriptures, Great Master of the Mysterious Middle Law** (三十六部尊经玄中大法师),
The **Upper Palaces of the Eastern Flower, Southern Pole, Western Spirit, Northern Truth, Daoist Capital, Jade Metropolis, Golden Gates, Seven Treasures, Jade Terrace, and Purple Cluster** (东华、南极、西灵、北真、仙都、玉京、金阙、七宝、瑶台、紫微上宫),
The **Lord of the Mysterious Treasure, Supreme Dao of Clarity and Truth** (灵宝至真明皇道君),
The **Supreme Chancellor and Prime Minister** (上相上宰),
The **Supreme Guardian and Preceptor** (上保上傅),
The **Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors** (三皇五帝),
The **Eleven Great Luminaries** (十一大曜星君),
The **Seven Primordial Stars of the Northern Dipper** (北斗七元星君),
The **Twenty-Eight Constellations** (二十八宿星君),
The **Nine Palaces and Ten Refined Ones, Lord of the Supreme One** (九宫十精太一君),
The **Four Sacred Deities of the Northern Pole** (北极四圣真君),
The **Great Emperor of the Supporting Mulberry** (扶桑大帝),
The **Divine King of the Yang Valley** (旸谷神王),
The **Dragon King of the Deep Abyss** (洞渊龙王),
The **Ten Caves and Five Sacred Peaks** (十洞五岳),
The **Nine Rivers and Water Emperors** (九江水帝),
The **Eight Seas and Dragon Kings** (八海龙王),
The **Three Rivers and Four Marshes, Five Lakes and Seven Swamps, Valley Streams and Source Springs** (三河四渎、五湖七泽、溪谷川源),
The **Five Directional Dragon Kings Who Bring Rain** (五方行雨龙王),
The **Masters of Wind, Cloud, Thunder, and Lightning, and of Yin and Yang** (风云雷电、阴阳主宰),
The **Deities of All Local Temples and Shrines** (府界县境、诸庙神祇),
The **City Deities and Community Orders** (城隍社令),
And the **Responsive Deities of the Three Realms, All Spirits** (三界应感、一切神灵).

The humble subject hears that the **Heavenly Classics and Earthly Compasses**
**Encompass all transformations without partiality;**
That **Yin** is severe and **Yang** is relaxed,
**In the orderly operation of the Five Agents.** (运五行之有序)

The divine **Way’s** mysterious power is naturally established,
Manifesting through the harmonization of extraordinary **qi**.

All things follow their proper course,
And time adheres to the grand order.

Now, the humble subject, having received the imperial decree,
Comes to assume the district’s talisman,
Seeking to govern with benevolence and moderation,
To serve loyally and diligently for the sake of the land.

When the **Yang** sun rages unchecked,
Sweet dews and auspicious snows are delayed—
Fearful of failing in governance,
Lest calamities befall us in turn.

The humble subject reflects that all teachings possess genuine **dharma**,
And earnestly practices the cultivation of self-examination and repentance,
Ever since dawn, humbly praying for blessings and expiation.

On the day of our solemn vows,
We offer sincere pledges in faith;
All who partake in the ritual abstinence
Strive to purify their hearts.

Moreover, with utmost sincerity,
How dare we neglect to report?
Thus, we present our earnest words,
Respectfully submitting them for Your consideration.

**Propagating the Words.**

According to the stated petition,
We humbly implore with utmost sincerity.

The humble subject hears that the **Way’s** doctrine of the **Hun Yuan** (混元) encompasses all beings in its transformation;
That the **Emperor of Primordial Beginnings** (太始之尊) governs and regulates all spirits.

The mysteries are unfathomable,
Yet the responses are subtle.

Still, the sincerity of our incense offerings
Ascends to the **Tian** (千) realms of the **Fu Yao** (覆焘);
And the fragrant vapors of our ritual
Dare not be neglected in Your reverence.

With abundant blessings and extraordinary merit,
We exalt Your profound wisdom.

At this evening assembly,
Ascending the altar to perform the **Way’s** rites,
We request the gathered **Way’s** masters to take the first pinch of incense,
That this incense smoke may rise to the heavens,
Offering to the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure of the Ten Directions** (十方无上道宝天尊).

The humble subjects prostrate themselves—
Body, spirit, and life—
Devoting the merit of this incense offering
To bless the present emperor, the august sovereign.

May Your grand vision shine ever brighter,
And Your sacred years endure like mountains.
May You guide the **One Qi** (一气) to settle in harmony,
And align with the Four Seasons in perfect order.

Gentle winds and abundant rains
Shall flourish in the Year of Great Plenty;
The moon and stars shall shine without fail,
In accordance with the Primordial Calendar.

The Nine Encirclements shall be pacified,
And all nations prosper in unity.

Now, as we burn this incense,
We seek refuge in the **Virtue/Power** of the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure** (众至真之德).

After attaining the **Way**,
May we preserve eternal life,
And harmonize with the **Way’s** true essence.

At this evening assembly,
Ascending the altar to perform the **Way’s** rites,
We request the gathered **Way’s** masters to take the second pinch of incense,
That this incense smoke may rise to the heavens,
Offering to the **Supreme Scripture Treasure of the Ten Directions** (十方无上经宝天尊).

The humble subjects prostrate themselves—
Body, spirit, and life—
Devoting the merit of this incense offering
To bless the district magistrate,
And extend to all officials under him.

May Heaven’s blessings be upon Your prosperity,
And the spirits bring peace to the fields and valleys.
May You uphold the virtues of diligence, frugality, and integrity,
And promote the spirit of moderation and benevolence.

Rains may fall as we travel,
Washing away drought in a thousand miles;
Flowers may bloom throughout the county,
Bringing joy and comfort to all people.

Now, as we burn this incense,
We seek refuge in the **Virtue/Power** of the **Supreme Scripture Treasure** (众至真之德).

After attaining the **Way**,
May we eternally preserve life,
And harmonize with the **Way’s** true essence.

At this evening assembly,
Ascending the altar to perform the **Way’s** rites,
We request the gathered **Way’s** masters to take the third pinch of incense,
That this incense smoke may rise to the heavens,
Offering to the **Supreme Teacher Treasure of the Ten Directions** (十方无上师宝天尊).

The humble subjects prostrate themselves—
Body, spirit, and life—
Devoting the merit of this incense offering
To bless the common people,
And extend to all within the district.

May the realm and its people be tranquil and at peace,
And the wells and neighborhoods secure and harmonious.
May pestilence vanish from the clustered roofs,
And bandits be barred from the hundred gates.

Silkworms may yield twice their harvest,
And the imperial taxes be fulfilled without loss;
The five grains may always flourish,
And the granaries overflow with joy.

Now, as we burn this incense,
We seek refuge in the **Virtue/Power** of the **Supreme Teacher Treasure** (众至真之德).

After attaining the **Way**,
May we eternally preserve life,
And harmonize with the **Way’s** true essence.

**Invoke the Four Directions, Confess the Four Directions, Command the Demons.**
**Prayer for Rain.**

The **Way** contains the **Yuan Qi** (元气),
And **Yin** and **Yang** nurture all beings.

The common people commit many transgressions,
And the **Supreme Heavenly Deity** (上帝) imposes punishments.

With utmost sincerity and morning repentance,
We humbly seek forgiveness for our hidden sins.

May You now grant rain and snow,
Nourishing all beings without exception.

**Three Prostrations.**
**Reaffirm the Daoist Titles.**

The humble subjects of the various ranks,
Together with the assembled officials,
Now humbly present a unified petition to the **Most Revered of the Three Realms, the Supreme Deities of the Ten Directions** (虚无三境至尊、十方醮筵列圣).

The humble subject hears that all beings arise from the **Miao Dao** (妙道),
And that all divine governance is regulated by the **Supreme Spirit** (上灵).

Through the ritual of purification and expiation,
The deepest mysteries are communicated.

Now, as the **Yang** sun grows fierce,
Sweet rains and auspicious snows are long delayed—
We fear the calamity of drought,
And the disappointment of failed harvests.

With utmost reverence and devotion,
Our prayers have yet to reach the **High and Illuminated** (高明);
In dread and humility,
We dare not cease in our supplications.

Rather than face repeated offenses,
We seek to offer sincere, unyielding devotion,
Hoping Your boundless mercy may return,
And Your compassionate heart recognize our earnestness.

May You grant rains as the moon wanes,
Nourishing the three agricultural cycles;
May the clouds not linger until evening,
Spreading dews throughout the entire district.

The year’s labors shall bear fruit,
And the land’s blessings be boundless.
All within the realm shall be blessed,
And all living beings share in Your sacred protection.

Above, we honor the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure’s** benevolent grace,
And below, we fulfill our subjects’ prayers with sincerity.

**Raise the Twelve Vows.**
**Raise the Incense and Burn with Devotion.**

Shall now command the humble subject to the place of this evening’s assembly,
Where incense and altar rites are performed—
That golden nectar and emerald dew,

Receive the fragrant vapors,
And swiftly transmit the humble subject’s sincere petition
Directly to the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Ultimate Mystery, the Three Pure Ones, and the Jade Emperor of Heaven** (至真无极大道、三清上圣、昊天玉皇上帝御前).

**Know the Strike of the Chime Stone, Exit the Hall to Chant.**

Exit the door,
And lead to the **Six-Curtained Hall** (六幕堂).

**Ritual of the *Lingbao* Petition for Rain and Snow**
*Compiled and Edited by Master Guangting Du*
*Three-Day Sitting Repentance Rite*
*With Daily Repentance Rites Appended*

The humble disciples, with sincere devotion, take refuge in the **East Azure, West Subtle, South Vermilion, North Dark**—the **Four Cardinal Directions and the Six Extremes, the Ten Directions of the Ultimate Mystery**—before the **Supreme *Lingbao* Celestial Venerable**, the **Great Emperor of the Mulberry Tree**, the **Divine Lord of the Sunlit Valley**, the **Dragon King of the Abyssal Depths**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Rivers**, the **Divine Lords of the Twelve River Sources and Four Great Waterways**, and the **Celestial Spirits of Cloud-Conjuring and Rain-Bringing**, along with all others.

Having completed the rites, we humbly repent with sincerity.

The disciples have heard that the **Great Pivot is formless**, yet universally nurtures all living beings; the **True Sovereign speaks not**, yet brings all things to perfect fruition. When the sequence of **Yin and Yang** falters, the timing of **wind and rain** may be delayed. Thus, when petitioning, one must align with **refined sincerity and response**.

Now, it is respectfully reported that in **such-and-such prefecture, county, or district**, the **sun’s heat is excessive**, and **auspicious rain has not yet fallen**; **auspicious snow has not yet descended**. In accordance with the **Three Caverns’ urgent rites**, we seek **auspicious pardon through supplication**; invoking the **Nine Pure Ones’ swift command**, we humbly offer **devout reverence**. Though our hearts are pure and our intentions sincere, the **heavenly response remains unfulfilled**. Thus, we now **convene at dawn, midday, and dusk**, exhausting our **sincere devotion**.

The disciples, with sincere hearts, take refuge in **body, spirit, and command** before the **Ten Directions of the Ultimate Mystery**, the **Supreme *Lingbao* Celestial Venerable**, the **Great Emperor of the Mulberry Tree**, the **Divine Lord of the Sunlit Valley**, the **Dragon King of the Abyssal Depths**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Rivers**, the **Divine Lords of the Twelve River Sources and Four Great Waterways**, the **Celestial Spirits of Cloud-Conjuring and Rain-Bringing**, and all **Water Palace Spirits**.

We humbly pray that the **Celestial Pole may store blessings**, the **Jade Capital descend its gaze**, and that **oily clouds arise in the Six Extremes**, **abundant dew descend upon the Nine Regions**, **auspicious snow fall from the Nine Heavens**, **fertile fields be richly watered**, **vegetation receive ample moisture**, and that **all grains may yield a bountiful harvest**, **the people be freed from hunger’s distress**, and **all sentient beings** may **share in the Dao’s shelter**, attaining **eternal life** and **harmony with the True Way**.

---
**Daily Morning Repentance Rite for the Perfected**

**Announce the invocation, then chant the hall’s praise.**
**Sing the rites to the Ten Directions.**

Having completed the rites, each kneels long in repentance.

The disciples, with sincere hearts, take refuge in **body, spirit, and command** before the **Ten Directions of the Ultimate Mystery**, the **Supreme *Lingbao* Celestial Venerable**.

We humbly pray that the **Mystic Origin’s teachings** may be **eternally upheld in stillness and tranquility**; that the **Celestial Pole** may **receive sincerity**, for **only the pure may ascend**. May we **first communicate with the Supreme Sage**, **purify ourselves of all faults**, and **follow the sacred canons**, granting **repentance’s acceptance**.

Now, the **Emperor’s benevolent heart** encompasses all things; his **filial virtue** aligns with Heaven. He **transforms the winds of Great Peace**, standing **unmatched in virtue**, fearing **the faults of all under Heaven**, ever **blaming himself in speech**, regarding **the four seas as his home**, and **blaming himself in governance**. Though he **dreads omissions**, he **hopes for universal pardon**.

May **thoughts, words, and intentions** all **return to the Marvelous Dao**; may **spirit, *qi*, and form** **eternally preserve life**. Down to the **lowest of beings**, all may **attain great blessings**.

The disciples **bow in gratitude** to the **Supreme Triple Jewel of Perfection**.

---
**The Complete Ritual Precepts of the Daoist Tradition, Volume Sixteen concluded.**

**The Ritual of the Lingbao Petition for Rain and Snow**
*Compiled and Edited by Master Guangtong Du*

**Ritual Procedure:**
The assembly is convened as prescribed. All participants pay homage to the Master in accordance with the ritual.

The High Priest proclaims the **Sacred Protective Incantations**. The Five Stars shine resplendent across the five directions:
- **Water Star** repels calamity,
- **Wood Virtue** brings prosperity,
- **Mars** dissipates misfortune,
- **Jupiter** wards off war,
- **Venus** secures stability for the family and state.

Their names are inscribed upon the **Jade Tablets**, their characters recorded in the **Imperial Archives**. They ride the winds, scattering their radiance through the boundless heavens, moving unseen in darkness, feasting in the ten directions. Five clouds gather as canopies, summoning gods and harnessing the winds. All spirits are commanded—**the Celestial Guardians unite in harmony with the Dao and the True**.

The assembly sounds the **Law Drum twenty-four times**. The High Priest ignites the furnace.

**Invocation of the Supreme Three Heavens:**
The **Primordial Three Qi of the Highest Heavenly Beginning**, the **Supreme Dao Lord**, the **Supreme Venerable Lord Lao**, are called forth from within our bodies—**the Three Five Officials**, the **Left and Right Attendants**, the **Perfumed Dragon Riders**, the **Youths Who Bear Incense**, the **Maidens Who Scatter Flowers**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols**, and the **Day-Officials of Incense**, each thirty-six in number, now emerge.

The assembled bear **solemn attire and resplendent robes**, their headgear adorned with trailing ribbons. The **Mysterious Altars of Land and Domain Spirits** are opened.

We, the humble petitioners, now establish this **Ritual Assembly**, sincerely declaring our intentions. Our earnest prayers have been recorded and heard. May the **Supreme Ten-Directional Dao-Qi of the Most High** descend in **Lingbao’s Auspicious Light**, entering our bodies, that our sincerity may swiftly reach the **Supreme Boundless Dao**, the **Three Pure Ones of Highest Sanctity**, the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign**, before the **Heavenly Sovereign’s Throne**.

**Invocation of Titles:**
We, **Subject of Rank [X]**, together with the assembled officials of the Ritual Hall, humbly and sincerely petition:

- **Primordial Heavenly Venerable of Natural Spontaneity,**
- **Supreme Dao Lord of the Boundless Way,**
- **Supreme Venerable Lord Lao,**
- **Emperor of Supreme Virtue of the Mixed Primordial,**
- **Supreme Sovereign of Heaven-Opening, Symbol-Bearer, History-Holding, True-Body Daoist, Celestial Jade Emperor,**
- **Purple Cloud Celestial Emperor,**
- **Midheaven North Pole Great Emperor,**
- **Holy Ancestor, Highest Daoist,**
- **Nine-Heaven Life-Preserving Sovereign of Destiny,**
- **Empress of the Earthly Sovereign,**
- **Great Saintly Empress of the Primordial Heaven,**
- **True Lord of the Five Blessings and Ten Gods,**
- **Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors,**
- **Thirty-Six Departments of Sacred Scriptures, Supreme Master of the Mysterious Middle,**
- **Eastern Hua, Southern Extremity, Western Spirit, Northern Truth, Celestial Capital, Jade Metropolis, Golden Gate, Seven Treasures, Jade Terrace, Purple Cloud Upper Palace,**
- **Supreme Dao Lord of Lingbao’s Most True and Illuminated Way,**
- **Supreme Minister, Supreme Chancellor, Supreme Protector, Supreme Tutor,**
- **The Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors,**
- **Eleven Great Luminaries,**
- **Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper,**
- **Twenty-Eight Constellations,**
- **Nine Palaces and Ten Precincts of the Supreme One,**
- **Four Celestial Worthies of the North Pole,**
- **Great Emperor of the Fuxi Tree,**
- **Divine King of Yang Valley,**
- **Dragon King of the Abyssal Caverns,**
- **Ten Caverns, Five Sacred Peaks,**
- **Nine Rivers and Water Emperors,**
- **Eight Seas and Dragon Kings,**
- **Three Rivers and Four Great Waterways, Five Lakes and Seven Marshes, Streams, Valleys, and Sources,**
- **Five-Directional Rain-Bringing Dragon Kings,**
- **Masters of Wind, Cloud, Thunder, and Lightning,**
- **Sovereigns of Yin and Yang,**
- **Spirits of Prefectures, Counties, and Temples,**
- **City Deities and Community Lords,**
- **All responsive beings of the Three Realms,**
- **Every divine spirit.**

We have heard that the **Supreme Dao precedes Heaven**, that **Highest Worthies establish teachings**, naming all phenomena and nurturing all life. Our **sincere words** have been offered with reverence—may the **Great Work** now descend in **manifest response**.

---

Now, the undersigned, having received the imperial mandate and served as a regional governor, strives to govern with frugality and love for the people, offering loyal devotion to the state. Yet, with calamities of drought and floods afflicting the land, and blessings of rain and moisture not yet bestowed, we have earnestly prayed to the lofty heavens, hoping to attain divine response. May the sacred texts be unveiled, and the subtle truths recited; may the ritual offerings be presented with fragrant devotion.

We humbly welcome the celestial procession, reverently contemplating the layered spirits. May the **Tiger-Standard and Dragon-Flag** briefly emerge from the primordial chaos, and the **cloud-chariot and crane-drawn carriage** momentarily descend to the sacred precincts. May the divine favor be manifest in its trustworthiness, and this humble ritual acknowledged—so that we may be blessed with auspicious fortune and the people universally protected.

We, the undersigned, with utmost reverence, implore the **Supreme Sovereign of the Three Realms**, the **Assembled Saints of the Three Worlds**, all hoping for boundless compassion and the illumination of divine insight.

We have heard that the **Great Ultimate encompasses the Three**, dividing the **Two Principles** in the realm of indistinctness; that the **light and pure obtain the One**, manifesting the **illuminated patterns**. Grasping the **Celestial Globe**, it governs the **Five Phases**; stirring the **winds and thunder**, it harmonizes the **Four Seasons**. It shapes all things and nurtures life—though the **True Method** bestows upon creation, yet the **common truth** knows the afflictions of **Yin and Yang**.

Now, the undersigned, having long delayed the **Great Nourishment**, risk harming the flourishing life. With solemn vigilance and laboring concern, we have followed the ancient rituals of incense and prayer, sincerely seeking divine protection. May the **clouds of rain** descend abundantly, and the **snow-clouds** melt universally. With strict rites fulfilled and fragrant offerings presented, we pray for celestial favor to answer, ensuring prosperity for the people.

We, the undersigned, having received the sacred teachings and participated in the ritual, now proclaim the **sincere words of the invocation**.

As the words are proclaimed, they are deeply sincere. We look upward to the **Supreme Sovereign of the Three Realms**, the **Nine Pure Ones**, the **Illustrious Celestial Worthies of the Purple Extremity**, and the **Unrestrained Immortals of the Red Terrace**, whose radiant light descends and whose divine grace is imbibed.

May the **celestial movements align**, the **heavenly torches burn evenly**, and **Yin and Yang harmonize** while the winds and rains follow their course. May auspicious blessings arrive and malevolent influences cease. May the **thousand-li territories** forever enjoy peaceful years, and the **ten-thousand households** dwell in secure harmony. May all **creatures and plants** flourish in their growth.

We, the undersigned, with utmost sincerity, bow twice and present incense, offering wine for the **secondary tribute**. Music is played.

We now, with solemn sincerity, address the **True Saints of the Five Sacred Peaks**, the **Divine Spirits of the Four Great Waterways**, the **Spirits of Auspicious Lands**, the **Masters of Named Mountains**, who summon clouds and bring rain, and all **mighty divine beings**.

We humbly acknowledge that your **vast and profound virtues** are revered across the land, whether dwelling in **cavernous palaces** or ascending as **celestial constellations**. You regulate the **winds and clouds**, distribute the **rain and dew**, and silently assist the **enlightened ruler’s governance**, aiding in the **sovereign’s administration**. All living beings universally receive your blessings.

Now, the undersigned, as the responsible governor, faces the misfortune of delayed rains and prolonged drought. With earnest prayers, we seek divine response. The ritual platform is constructed, and the solemn rites completed; the fragrant offerings are presented with strict propriety. May the **masters of Yin and Yang**, the **gentle spirits of the peaks and waterways**, the **celestial officials of the Cavernous Heavens and Purple Bureaus**, and the **saints of auspicious lands and named mountains**—all in their **true and gracious forms**—descend to aid the people.

May your protection ensure peace and security, may the **fields and villages** always thrive with moisture, and the **granaries** forever overflow with abundance. Even the slightest of **plants and creatures** shall benefit from your blessings.

We, the undersigned, with deepest reverence, offer wine for the **final tribute**. Music is played.

We now, with solemn sincerity, address the **Great Emperor of the Eastern Tree (Exalted Sun)**, the **Divine Sovereign of the Bright Valley**, the **Dragon King of the Abyssal Cavern**, the **Water Emperor of the Nine Rivers**, the **Source Kings of the Four Great Waterways**, the **Rulers of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, Twelve River Sources, Streams, Valleys, and the Underworld Sovereigns**—who summon clouds and bring rain, and the **mighty spirits of the Water Realm**.

Your **encompassing heavens and girdling earth** ever shine with the virtue of nourishing below. Your **profound and boundless depths** are unfathomable, your **vast and limitless expanse** endless. Though you dwell in **immortal retreat**, your **benevolent influence** is ever clear. You govern the **rising and falling of all things**, uniting **blessings and calamities** under Heaven’s will. Your responses are swift, your insights penetrate all obscurities.

Now, the undersigned, with the **heavens’ blessings delayed**, feels urgent alarm. Our **sincere supplications** seek divine resonance. With **pure fasting and offerings** presented in solemn devotion, and the **ritual rites conducted with strict reverence**, may the **Four Seas’ Sacred Ones**, the **Spirits of the Hundred Valleys**, all **scaled and sheltered beings**, and the **deep mysteries of the Dragon Palaces**—temporarily leaving the **Pearl Gates**—descend to the **True Hall**.

May you partake in these humble offerings, behold our sincere prayers, and **support the vault of heaven**, universally blessing the people. May the **seasons align**, the **Five Phases harmonize**, and the **clouds bring rain**, nourishing all things without limit. May the **farmer’s toil be rewarded**, and the **lands enjoy abundant relief**.

We, the undersigned, with repeated and earnest supplication, in **awe and fear**, kneel twice and present incense. **Sacrificial libations** are poured. **Sacred hymns** are chanted, and the **ritual petitions** proclaimed.

We now, with solemn sincerity, address the **Supreme Sovereign of the Three Pure Ones**, the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**, the **Nine-Ranked High Worthies**, the **Ten-Directional Supreme Saints**, all **Heavenly Deities and Emperors**, the **True Scriptures and True Masters**, the **Circumambient Celestial Hosts**, the **Sea and Mountain Dragon Gods**, the **Responsive Beings of the Three Realms**, and all **True Spirits**.

Now, the **ritual rites are complete**, the **fasting sincerity has reached its peak**, the **celestial music has ceased**, and the **immortal teachings have concluded**. The **mundane world hums with activity**, yet the **celestial chariot lingers**; the **cloudy heavens are distant**, and the **immortal abode is about to return**. May **a hundred blessings** be extended to the **abundant year**, and **three harvests** secured in the **annual cycle**.

The humble servant, along with the **officiating priests** and all others, is deeply moved by longing and the urgency of seeking grace, and thus offers this **supreme petition** with utmost reverence and trepidation. Bowing and kowtowing twice, we humbly address the **Celestial Chariot**.

We **perform the ritual** (举) to chant the **Hymn of the Departing Spirit** (送神颂).
We **perform the ritual** (举) to maintain the **Spirit’s Presence** (存神) and burn incense.

The **High Master** re-ignites the **altar furnace**. The **incense officials and messengers**, the **Dragon-Tiger Generals** of left and right, and all the **attendant Spirit Officials**, should now command that the humble servant’s previous **sacrificial site** spontaneously produce **Golden Elixir and Azure Jade** (金液丹碧), **herbal essences and myriad sacred beings** (芝英百灵), whereupon the **multitude of True Ones** will gather and convene at this very **incense and fire altar**.

We pray that the **Ten-Directional Celestial Youths and Jade Maidens** may attend to the **fragrant mist**, swiftly conveying the humble servant’s **earnest supplications** as previously offered, to the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Boundless and Limitless True Sovereign** (俓御至真无极大道), the **Three Pure Ones of Highest Sanctity**, and before the **Celestial Sovereign Emperor of the Jade Vault** (昊天玉皇上帝御前).

We **know the strike of the ritual bell** (知磬举), and **chant the hymn** as we exit the hall (出堂颂).
We **step outside the door** (出户) and **lead the procession** to the **Six-Curtained Hall** (六幕堂).

**Compendium of Daoist Ritual Precepts, Volume Seventeen** concludes.
**Compendium of Daoist Ritual Precepts, Volume Eighteen**—compiled and revised by **Master Guangting Du** of the **Broad and Complete School** (广成先生杜光庭删定)—
**Ritual for Invoking Rain and Snow from the *Lingbao* Canon** (灵宝祈求雨雪拜章仪)
**Evening Ritual of the Dao/Way** (夕景行道).

The ritual ascends the altar as prescribed.
The **ritual bell is struck**, and each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Daoist precepts.

The **High Functionary** proclaims the **Sacred Lingbao Incantations**.
The **Five Stars** shine forth, illuminating the **Five Directions**.
The **Water Star** repels calamity, and the **Wood Virtue** brings prosperity.
The **Uranus** dissipates misfortune, and the **Jupiter** wards off war.
The **Mars** steadies, and the **Four Celestial Guardians** bring blessings to the family and state.
Their names are inscribed upon **Jade Tablets**, and their records kept in the **Imperial Archives**.
They ride the **gales**, scattering their radiance, soaring through the **Supreme Void**.
They move unseen yet traverse the **Ten Directions**.
The **Five Clouds** float as canopies, summoning deities and harnessing the winds.
They command the **Ten Thousand Spirits**, standing guard in the **Celestial Patrols**, harmonizing with the **Dao/Way** and attaining **True Unity**.

The **Sacred Daoist Drum** is struck **twenty-four times**.

The **High Functionary** ignites the **Sacrificial Furnace**.
The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Originating Qi**, the **Highest Dao/Way Lord**, the **Highest Venerable Lord Lao**, summon forth from within our bodies the **Three Five Officials of Merit**, the **Left and Right Attendants**, the **Incense-Bearing Officials**, the **Dragon-Courier Messengers**, the **Golden Boy Attendants**, the **Flower-Scattering Jade Girls**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols**, and the **Direct Day Incense Officials**—each numbering **thirty-six**—to emerge.

Those who emerge are clad in **solemn ceremonial attire**, their **headdresses and sashes adorned with trailing ribbons**, opening the **Mysterious Altar’s Land and Domain Spirits**, and the **Regional Deities**.

Now, as I establish this altar and practice the Dao/Way, I sincerely offer my **devoted intentions**.
My **earnest supplications** have already been recorded and heard.
I pray that the **Supreme Dao/Way’s Ten Directions’ True Qi** and the **Sacred Lingbao Auspicious Light** descend, flowing into our bodies, so that my **sincere petitions** may swiftly reach the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Boundless and Limitless True Sovereign**, the **Three Pure Ones of Highest Sanctity**, and before the **Celestial Sovereign Emperor of the Jade Vault**.

I request the **proclamation of the ritual rank**.

**I, [Name], of such-and-such rank**, together with the **assembled officials of the altar**, sincerely and unitedly address:

The **Primordial Heavenly Venerable of Natural Emptiness**, the **Supreme Dao/Way Lord of the Boundless**, the **Highest Venerable Lord Lao**, the **Mingyuan Emperor of Supreme Virtue**, the **Highest Sovereign Who Opens Heaven, Holds the Symbols, Governs the Calendar, and Embraces the True Body of the Dao**—the **Celestial Sovereign Emperor of the Jade Vault**—
The **Celestial Emperor of the Purple Forbidden Enclosure**, the **Great Emperor of the Northern Heaven’s Pole**, the **Holy Ancestor of Highest Dao**, the **Heavenly Venerable Emperor Who Preserves Life and Governs Destiny in the Nine Heavens**, the **Earthly Sovereign Who Emulates Heaven’s Laws and Possesses Great Virtue**—the **Great Earthly Sovereign**—
The **Primordial Heavenly Holy Empress**, the **True Lord of the Five Blessings and Ten Deities**, the **Thirty-Three Heavenly Emperors**, the **Emperors of the Eastern Clarity, Southern Polarity, Western Spirit, Northern Truth, Daoist Metropolis, Jade Capital, Seven Treasures, and Jade Terrace**, the **Lingbao Emperor and Illuminated Dao/Way Lord**, the **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Masters of the Mysterious Middle Dao**—
The **Supreme Chancellor, Supreme Prime Minister, Supreme Protector, and Supreme Tutor**—
The **Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors**, the **Eleven Great Luminaries of the Stars**, the **Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water**, the **Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper**, the **Twenty-Eight Constellations**, the **Nine Palaces and Ten Celestial Precincts’ True Lord of the Supreme One**, the **Four Celestial Guardians of the Northern Pole**, the **Great Emperor of the Eastern Expanse**, the **Divine Lord of the Yang Valley**, the **Dragon Kings of the Cavernous Abyss**, the **Ten Caverns and Five Sacred Peaks**, the **Nine Rivers’ Water Emperors**, the **Eight Sea Dragon Kings**, the **Three Rivers, Four Seas, Five Lakes, Seven Marshes, Streams, Valleys, and Sources**, the **Named Mountains and Cavernous Palaces**, the **Peaceful Lodges and Auspicious Terrains**, the **Five Directional Rain-Dispensing Dragon Kings**, the **Wind Lord and Rain Master, Thunderer and Lightning Mother, and the Cloud-and-Mist Officers**—
The **Prefectures, Counties, and Local Temple Deities**—
The **Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits**, and **all True Essences**.

I have heard that **serene stillness and subtlety** are called **Dao/Way**;
That **yin and yang’s expansion and contraction** originate from **Heaven**.

Only Heaven can thus bless the people below,
Only the Dao/Way can thus nourish all things.

When the seasons are out of order and the land suffers drought,
And the people are in distress, withered and parched,
We purify the grand halls and hang the sacred banners.
We invoke the true formulas of the Three Caverns,
And summon the true essences of the Nine Purity.
We await the true blessings of the Mysterious,
Hoping to harmonize with the responsive **spirits/qi**,
To thank the Clouds for their luminous **virtue/power** and beseech the **Essence of the Dao**,
Swiftly to harmonize with the responsive **spirits/qi**.

Now, having completed our supplications,
We present this tablet in reverence and declare our merits.
We, the disciples, submit our bodies, our **spirits/qi**, and our lives
To the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Boundless Extreme**,
And to the **Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits**.

May you graciously look down upon us,
And ascend to the presence of the **Boundless Extreme Dao/Way**.
We chant,
And pay homage to the Ten Directions.

We have heard that the **high and luminous** respond,
Though it be said without sound;
That the **vast and encompassing** bestow private blessings,
Which are clearly manifest and not in vain.

Indeed, the **Dao/Way’s** profound and subtle teachings
Are embodied in the **exorcism and purification** rites of the **Three Caverns**.
Let the blessings first be granted,
For the **Essence of the Dao** is pure and reaches its peak.
May calamities be dispelled,
And yin and yang restored to harmony.

In years when flames scorched the earth,
Or times when famine struck the people,
If we sincerely pray with devotion,
We must receive the **Essence of the Dao’s** blessings.

Now, for this region,
As the **qi** is disordered and the seasons are amiss,
The **Rain-Dispensing Dragon Kings** fail to act.
We humbly revere the **Mysterious Essence**,
And sincerely offer our prayers to the **Highest Dao/Way**,
Hoping that the **Supreme Sage**** will take pity on us,
And shower abundant grace to nourish all equally.

We pray to the **Thunder and Cloud Spirits**:
May auspicious colors rise in the sky,
And all fields be thoroughly moistened.

We thank the **Rain Cloud Spirits**:
May the **Supreme Sage**’s grace take pity on us,
And shower abundant blessings to nourish all equally.

We thank the **Thunder Cloud Spirits**:
May the **Supreme Sage**’s grace descend,
And bring **auspicious rain** to thoroughly moisten.

Let the blessings touch all within this realm,
And the **virtue/power** of the Dao extend to all beings.

We disciples, though unworthy,
Have partaken in the **Dao/Way’s** fragrant offerings
And fulfilled the **Dao/Way’s** grand rituals.
Yet we still fear that our words may be misguided,
Or that our recitations may falter and be forgotten,
Accumulating these sins beyond measure,
And inviting the dreaded retribution from the **Netherworld**.

Daring to offer our own bodies as atonement,
We beg for mercy and forgiveness,
To pardon our past transgressions,
And to attain the great blessings of the Dao.

May our petitions be measured and harmonious,
With yin and yang expanding and contracting in due time,
Answering the sincere devotion of the prefectures and counties,
And bringing joyful livelihood to the black-haired masses.
May misfortune sink to the Nine **Netherworlds**,
And blessings reach the Ten Directions.

We kneel and pay homage in thanks to the **Supreme Dao/Way’s** Three Treasures.
(*Dao/Way* Door **Rituals and Regulations Comprehensive Collection**, Volume Eighteen, Volume Nineteen)

**The Ritual of the Dao/Way’s File-Changing and Fortune-Beseeching Assembly**
*Compiled and Revised by Master Guangting Du, with the Filial Offering Chapter of the Wenchang Star*

**Ritual Procedure for Ascending the Platform and Conducting the Dao/Way:**

When the ritual is properly elevated, the Grand Master presides, and all pay homage to the Teacher in accordance with the Dao/Way’s precepts.

The High Functionary proclaims the Sacred Protective Incantations.
Five luminaries shine resplendent in their cardinal quarters—
Mercury repels calamity, Wood’s virtue brings prosperity,
Mars dissipates misfortune, Jupiter wards off war,
The Constellation Star steadies the four directions, benefiting family and state.
Our names are inscribed upon jade tablets, our words recorded in the Celestial Archives.
Riding the gale, we scatter our radiance, soaring through the boundless void,
Entering and exiting the Netherworld, feasting in the Ten Directions.
Five clouds float as canopies, summoning spirits and harnessing winds,
Commanding ten thousand spirits, guarding the Celestial Sage,
In perfect harmony with the Dao/Way’s True Essence.

The Law-Drum is struck twenty-four times.
The High Functionary ignites the furnace.

**Invocation of the Three Treasures of the Supreme Dao/Way:**
The Most High Three Celestial Primordials of the Three *Qi* of the Supreme Void-Natural Primordial Origin,
The Most High Dao/Way Lord,
The Most High Laozi,
are summoned to extract from our bodies the Thirty-Five Officials of the Three Five,
Left and Right Attendants, Incense-Bearers, Dragon-Courier Scribes,
Incense-Serving Golden Boys, Flower-Dispersing Jade Girls,
The Five Imperial Direct Symbols, the Direct-Day Incense Officials—
thirty-six each—
who emerge in resplendent attire, adorned with flowing sashes and trailing ribbons,
opening the Dao/Way’s Pure Platform and the territorial spirits of the domain.

Tonight, in solemn stillness, we ascend the platform to conduct the Dao/Way,
and humbly present our sincerest intentions—
our deepest aspirations already recorded and heard.
We pray that the Most High Ten-Directional True Dao/Way’s *Qi* and Sacred Treasure-Light descend,
flowing into our bodies,
so that our petitions may swiftly reach the Supreme, Boundless Dao/Way of the Most High,
the Three Pure Ones of Highest Holiness,
the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign.

**Invocation of Titles and Ranks:**
We, the lowly officials of the rank [blank] and those assembled at the platform,
sincerely unite in supplication to:
The Most High Primordial Heavenly Venerable of Void-Natural Spontaneity,
then to the Nine Sovereigns of the Nine Heavens,
the Thirty-Six Great Heavenly Emperors,
the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors,
all Heavenly Emperors,
the Star Lords of the Purple Enclosure and the Celestial Wall,
the Five Emperors,
the Three Primordial True Ones,
the Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Masters of the Mystic Middle,
the Eleven Great Luminaries,
the Star Lords of the Northern Dipper and Southern Pole,
the Twenty-Eight Constellations,
the Eastern Star of Literature and Art,
the Seven Stars of Virtuous Worthies,
the Twelve Palace Spirit Lords,
the Wenchang Star Lord,
the Three Platform Star Lords,
the Star Lord of Advancing Merit,
the Star Lord of the Minor Multitude,
the Round Celestial Star Host True Lord,
the Supreme Clarity’s Wenchang True Person of the Southern Vermilion,
the Nine *Qi* Wenchang Palace Celestial Officials of the Most High,
the Star-Fight True Lord of Life-Giving,
the Nine-Heaven Elder of Qingcheng Mountain,
the Nine-Heaven Life-Directing True Lord of the Hidden Peaks,
the Nine-Heaven Investigating Envoys of Lushan,
the Five Sacred Emperors of the Five Peaks,
the Four Great Waters’ Source Kings,
the Officials of Filial Piety and Merit,
the True Lords of Examining and Recording,
the King of Martial Valor, Loyal Aid, and Broad Relief,
the Officials of Filial Piety, Merit, and Examination Records,
the Moral Resonance of the Dao/Way,
and all True Spirits.

We now burn incense, offering these merits
for the ancestral temples of our lineage,
the emperors and kings,
the territorial and ancestral spirits,
the masters of scriptures and transmigration,
the recluse scholars dwelling in mountains and forests,
our fellow students in the Dao/Way,
the ritual officials of this assembly,
our myriad ancestors, parents, teachers, and kin,
all people of the world, winged and crawling beings,
and all sentient life—
now burning incense, we repent and devote body, spirit, and fate
to the Most High Ten-Directional Sacred Treasure of Natural True Boundless Dao/Way.

We humbly beseech pardon for all past and present transgressions,
for the karmic debts of life and death,
for repeated offenses now spared,
freeing us from the Three Evils, Five Paths, Ten Sufferings, Eight Hardships, and Nine Calamities.
May our minds grow luminous, our actions forever aligned with the Dao/Way.
Our petitions, when answered, shall ascend before the Most High True Boundless Dao/Way.

**Recitation of the Square and Repentance Square:**
We, the ritual officials and assembly, with sincere hearts,
devote body, spirit, and fate to the Ten-Directional Boundless Dao/Way,
the Most High Sacred Treasure Heavenly Venerable.
Through this established platform and incense-burning repentance,
we hear that the Dao/Way follows nature—
innately free of wisdom or folly;
yet through attachment to things, distinctions of sage and common arise.
If one dares to amend faults without hesitation,
what obstacle remains to entering the Dao/Way?

We, the ritual officials of this assembly,
from our earliest lives to this day,
though endowed with lofty wisdom, have been obscured by things;
though possessing the subtle body, have been clouded by desires.
Our true nature cannot be preserved, our senses are ever disturbed—
evil accumulates, virtue wanes.
We have not sincerely served our parents,
our conduct lacks resolve,
our clear minds are muddled in response to the world,
our desires run wild, our emotions unchecked.
We have justified wrongs, concealed faults,
pursued gain at the expense of righteousness,
with stingy conduct betraying our teachers,
with narrow views slandering the True Wind.
Our intentions have been deceitful, our paths hidden.
We have concealed others’ virtues and magnified their faults,
shielded our own flaws while boasting of our strengths,
insulted the True Spirits, scorned our superiors,
humiliated others to seek victory,
flaunted our wills, wielded unjust authority,
and amassed the sins of the Three Karmas, the Six Roots.
Some are recorded in the Three Officials, Nine Departments;
others inscribed in the Five Emperors, Four Ministries.

Now, invoking the Sacred Treasure’s Ritual of the Dao/Way,
we establish our Pure Hall as a temporary abode,
facing the assembled saints to repent and atone,
and cultivate the Mystic Dao/Way with utmost devotion.

We humbly pray that the saints extend their mercy,
that boundless grace encompass all,
erasing past transgressions, severing future karmic fruit,
purifying our bodies and restoring our untainted nature,
awakening the hearts of all beings,
reverently upholding the Three Treasures’ dignity—
that our petitions may be answered,
that the ritualists’ supplications shall be granted,
that blessings extend to all living things,
and that grace permeates the Netherworld.

We kneel and pay homage three times to the Supreme True Three Treasures.

**Translation:**

We once again proclaim our sacred rank.
Your humble servants, [Name] and others, with utmost sincerity, now humbly petition:

To the **Dongzhen Natural Yuan Shi Tianzun** (Lord of Primordial Natural Perfection),
To the **Dongxuan Great Dao Yucheng Daojun** (Lord of Mysterious Dao in Jade Canopy),
To the **Dongshen Great Dao Hunyuan Laojun** (Lord of Mysterious Dao in Primordial Unity),
To the **Hao Tian Yuhuang Dadi** (Celestial Jade Emperor of the Supreme Dao),
To the **Nanji Tianhuang Dadi** (Southern Pole Celestial Sovereign Emperor),
To the **Beiji Zimwei Dadi** (Northern Pole Purple Micro Emperor),
To the **Hou Tu Huangdi Qi** (Empress of the Earth),
To all **Illustrious Sovereign Dao Lords**,
To the **Seven-Bend Mountain Official of Fate**,
To the **Zhi Gong Ju Zhenjun** (Lord of True Offerings),
And to all **Worthy and Spiritually Mighty Ones** who oversee the **Guizi** (Spiritual Register) and attendants—

We have heard that the **Mysterious Dao** is nameless, yet vast as the origin of Heaven and Earth;
Though called **"Great,"** it encompasses all things in their natural course.
As its origin, it flows eternally without end;
As its fulfillment, it nurtures all things to their true nature.
The Emperor’s Dao is subtle and mysterious,
The Divine manifests the power of creation,
Bathing in the Emperor’s molding and refining,
And aided by the Illuminated Spirits’ guidance.
Thus, the Two Principles possess ungoverned virtue,
And the Illuminated Spirits establish their creative function.

We, the ritual officers, though born of the Emperor’s creation
And nurtured by the Spirits’ transformation,
Though our coarse nature is ground and refined,
And our mediocre essence is chiseled—
With reverence, we follow the Grand Architect’s will,
And invite the Spirits’ blessings to guide us.
We have long prepared the ritual hall,
And now humbly address the Highest Worthies,
Assuming the role of Daoist ritual officers,
Offering our sincere hearts’ devotion.

How could we dare not report this with utmost sincerity?
With hearts pure and true, we now solemnly declare our petition.

**Proclamation of Words:**
The words are examined with clarity, and our sincerity is evident.
As we focus our thoughts upon the Sacred Altar,
Our hidden communion reaches the True Realm.
The incense’s fragrance ascends to the distant heart,
And the celestial processions draw near in misty splendor.
The jewel-throned seats are arrayed in purity,
And sacred lotuses bloom in the numinous domain.

May the **Three Pure Ones of Supreme Holiness**,
The **Ten Directions of Highest Worthiness**,
The **Great Master of Mysterious Law**,
And the **Illuminated Treasure of Perfect Truth**
Look down with compassion,
And graciously respond with manifest signs.
Command the **Inspectors of the Divine Office**,
The **Guardian Spirits of Scripture**,
The **Local True Officials**,
And the **City Deities and Community Lords**
To unite in harmony and virtue,
To guard and purify the ritual grounds,
To cleanse both within and without,
And to dispel all malevolent forces.

Thus may we, your servants, attain stillness of **qi** and concentration of spirit,
So that our thoughts, once aroused, may swiftly ascend,
Our petitions reach the heights,
And our ritual merits be perfectly fulfilled.

With deepest awe and fear, we kneel and bow twice,
Humbly submitting this petition.

**Raising the Twelve Vows.**
**Raising the Offering of Spirit and Incense.**
**The High Functionary relights the incense burner.**

O **Incense Officials, Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and Attendant Spirit Officials of Incense**—
Let it be decreed that at the places where we have previously practiced in quiet nights,
Golden elixirs and emerald jade shall spontaneously arise,
With mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits,
As the assembled Worthies gather before this incense burner.

May the **Ten Directions’ Celestial Youth and Jade Maidens**
Attend the fragrant banquet,
And swiftly convey our earlier sincere petitions
To the **Supreme Dao of Boundless Extremes, the Three Pure Ones of Supreme Holiness, and the Celestial Jade Emperor’s Presence.**

**Know the gong’s strike; exit to chant the Praise.**
**Exit the door, leading to the Six-Curtained Hall.**

To the **Supreme Dao of Boundless Extremes, the Three Pure Ones of Supreme Holiness, and the Celestial Jade Emperor’s Presence.**

The **Grand Master** proclaims the **Sacred Incantations of the Spirit Officials**.
**Qingyang** shines with empty brilliance, illuminating the sun and returning the spirits.
The **Divine Tiger** repels malevolence, while the **Flying Celestial** tolls the bells.
The **Wicked are crushed, and the evil are exterminated**; all demons are bound in form.
The **Nine Mysteries** return the Dao, and the **Eight Wonders** subdue the vital essence.
The **Thousand Worthies** inspect the records, and the **Three Elements** dispel the turbid.

The **Left and Right** exhort the **Central Yellow** and command the **Six Ding**.
The **Seven Rotations and Eight Harmonies** revolve through the **Celestial Scriptures**.
The **Holy Transformations** stand majestic; the **Great Dao** rises in action.
The **Auspicious Clouds** flow and spread, uniting with **Huangting** in harmony with the **True Dao**.

The **Grand Master** strikes the **Law Drum** twenty-four times.
The **High Functionary** relights the incense burner.

The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin of the Three Essences**—
**Taishang Daojun**, **Taishang Laojun**—
Summon forth from our bodies the **Three Five Spirit Officials**,
The **Left and Right Officials and Messengers**, the **Left and Right Incense Bearers**,
The **Dragon Couriers and Cavalry Officials**, the **Golden Youth Attendants of Incense**,
The **Jade Maidens of Spoken Petitions and Scattered Flowers**,
