Each **thirty-six** in number, to emerge.

Those who emerge must wear **solemn and resplendent attire**,
With **crowns and sashes trailing their ribbons**,
And open the **Mysterious Daoist Gate for the Land and Domain Spirits**.

Now, in this **Morning of Clarity**,
As we ascend the platform to practice the Dao,
We humbly present our **entreaties from the heart**,
Our **sincere and earnest devotions**,
Already recorded and heard by the **True Dao of the Ten Directions**,
And pray that the **Supreme Dao’s Essence of the Three Pure Ones**,
The **Sacred Treasure of Auspicious Light**,
May descend and flow into our bodies,
So that our **earnest petitions** may swiftly reach
The **Supreme Dao of Boundless Extremes, the Three Pure Ones of Supreme Holiness, and the Celestial Jade Emperor’s Presence**.

We request the **invocation of the Law Positions**.

With the **Grand Master and all assembled officials**,
We humbly present our **sincere entreaties**,
To the **Supreme Heavenly Worthy of Natural Emptiness and Primordial Origin**,
The **Sacred Treasure of Auspicious Dawn**,
The **Worthy of the Dao and Its Virtue**,
The **Celestial Jade Emperor of Supreme Holiness**,
The **Great Emperor of the Southern Pole**,
The **Great Emperor of the Northern Pole**,
The **Earthly Sovereign of the Imperial Soil**,
The **Holy Mother of the Primordial Worthy**,
The **Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors**,
The **Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors**,
All **Heavenly Emperors**,
The **Five Emperors**,
The **Three Elements of Supreme Worthies**,
The **Thirty-Six Departments of the Primordial Middle Sacred Law Masters**,
The **Eleven Great Illustrious Stars**,
The **Northern Dipper and Southern Celestial Stars**,
The **Twenty-Eight Constellations**,
The **Eastern Star of Literary Brilliance**,
The **Seven Stars of Virtuous Excellence**,
The **Twelve Palace Spirit Worthies**,
The **Literary Success Star**,
The **Three Platform Stars**,
The **Star of Advancing Virtue**,
The **Star of Minor Celestial Worthies**,
The **Star of the Rounded Vault**,
The **Supreme Pure Primordial Southern Star of Literary Brilliance**,
The **Supreme Nine Qi Literary Brilliance Palace**,
The **Star of the Nine Heavens and the Dipper**,
The **Nine-Heaven Elder of Qingcheng Mountain**,
The **Nine-Heaven Life Officer of Qianshan Mountain**,
The **Nine-Heaven Messenger of Lushan Mountain**,
The **Five Sacred Imperial Peaks**,
The **Four Celestial Rivers and Their Kings**,
The **Officers of Auspicious Offerings**,
The **Worthy of Examining and Selecting Officials**,
The **King of Martial Brilliance and Auspicious Aid**,
The **Officials of Auspicious Offerings and Record-Keeping**,
The **Divine Response of Virtue and Dao**,
And **all true spirits**.

We have heard that **you shape and perfect all things**; who can fathom the **pages of the Dao’s Virtue**?
That **you oversee all beings**; how can one discuss the **governance of the unseen realms**?

The distinctions of noble and humble ranks,
Which bind the scholar’s rise and fall,
Establishing the hundred officials—ancient and modern call this the **Heavenly Art**,
Setting forth the Five Sacrificial Garments—sages attribute this to **Heaven’s Mandate**.

Thus, to harmonize all undertakings with due propriety,
To govern the myriad people with just administration,
To uphold the **Dao’s Virtue** as sovereign authority,
To assist and guide the governance of the unseen realms.

Your humble servant, **Official of the Daoic Ritual**, reflecting upon my own mediocrity,
Yet equally blessed by the **Transformative Nurturing**,
Studying the **Confucian Way** to cultivate myself,
Hoping for advancement through scholarly merit,
With sincere devotion and respectful intent,
I now erect this **Sacred Altar**,
At the very beginning of our rites,
As the first act of **Communing with the True**.

Now the night-watch has ended, the morning light ascends.
The **Celestial Path** is clear and bright—all behold the **subtle essence** of drifting mists;
The **Incense Altar** stands serene—together we gaze upon the **refined and solemn** presence.
With **feathered insignia** and **cranes’ grace**, the **scholar’s cap** stands erect like a **wild goose**,
Bearing aloft the **Divine Model**, reverently addressing the **True Spirits**,
Hoping through my **sincere and earnest longing** to fulfill my **earnest petitions**.

Your servant, **Certain**, dwelling in the **Daoic Realm**, entrusting myself to the **Mysterious Stages**,
Revealing the **tilted piety** of this turbid age,
Guiding the **Great Benevolence** to spread far and wide.
Moreover, presenting these **respectful words**, how dare I not submit them above?

With a heart sincere, I now **declare my petition**.

**Examine closely these words**, and **see clearly my true intent**—
The **Most August Sage** deigns to hear within the **dim and distant**,
While the **common mortal** exhausts their nature in the **fleeting and illusory**.

Since the **unseen realms** have now been contacted,
It is fitting that my **earnest prayers** be granted in harmony.
Perhaps this humble form may receive the **showering blessings**,
To continue offering **fragrant incense**, humbly presenting **devoted reverence**.

Your servant has heard:
There exists a **Primordial Unity**, first before Heaven and Earth;
Its name does not fade, eternally manifest through ancient and modern times.
Those who attest to it call it **Saint** or **Divine**,
Those who ponder it observe its **wonder** and **boundaries**.

It encompasses the **Vast Daoic Qi**—who can discuss its **Root Source**?
Only through **clarity**, **tranquility**, and **spiritual purity**,
Does its **harmonious unity** prevail;
All **capacities**, **actions**, and **guardianships**,
In essence, return to the same **principle**.

The **flow of the Dao** depends upon
The **enlightenment of the individual**.

At this pure and clear dawn,
Ascending the altar to perform the Dao,
We invite the assembly of law to kindle the first incense strand,
Praying that this fragrant smoke may ascend to the heavens,
Offering devotion to the **Natural Primordial Lord of the Perfected Caverns**,
The **Jade Throne Lord of the Mysterious Dao**,
The **Lord of the Great Dao, the Venerable Old Lord of the Mixed Unity**,
The **Celestial Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heaven**,
And all the **Illustrious Dao Lords**.

With body, spirit, and life surrendered,
We prostrate ourselves in reverence,
And with this incense strand’s merit,
We bless the current emperor.

May his blessings be as boundless as Heaven,
His virtue ever renewed like the sun,
His merit saving all living beings,
His grace extending to all plants and creatures,
So that all tribes within and without submit to **Ren**,
And all nations embrace the **harmonizing Dao**.
May the wind of **Mixed Unity’s purity** spread,
And the **Great Dao’s harmonious transformation** flourish,
With the virtuous ascending to office,
And the wicked vanishing into obscurity.

Now, through this incense offering,
We take refuge in the **Great Saintly Perfected Ones’ supreme virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
We preserve Heaven’s eternal life,
And align with the **True and Perfect Way**.

We have heard:
The **Thirty-Six Divisions of Mysterious Speech** transcend the mundane and establish the Dao;
The **Infinite Billions of Victorious Treatises** transcend desire and reveal the True.
They illuminate the **Celestial Scriptures of the Constellation**,
Unfold the **River-Luo diagrams**,
Explain the **unspeakable principles**,
Exhaust the **limitless depths**,
Open the **Dao’s Triple Mystery**,
And proclaim the **multitude of wonders**.
They unfold the **Mixed Unity’s secrets**,
And reveal the **Sages’ divine hearts**.

At this auspicious moment,
How could we forget repaying our roots?

At this pure and clear dawn,
Ascending the altar to perform the Dao,
We invite the assembly of law to kindle the second incense strand,
Praying that this fragrant smoke may ascend to the heavens,
Offering devotion to the **Three Supreme Lords of the Jade Emperor**,
The **High Perfected Ones who expound the Law**.

With body, spirit, and life surrendered,
We prostrate ourselves in reverence,
And with this incense strand’s merit,
We dedicate it to the **certain family’s Nine Mysterious, Seven Ancestral ritual officials**,
And to the **lingering spirits and lost souls**.

May sins be purged and the **Red Cliff’s path** opened to salvation;
May we transcend the Dao’s shores and wander freely at the **Xian’s Gate**.
May blessings flow endlessly,
And virtuous fragrance blaze brightly,
So that living kin may share in these joys.
May the **Black Register’s guilt be erased**,
And the **Green Tablet’s lifespan extended**,
Restoring the **Dao’s innate clarity**,
And securing **pure and lasting happiness**.

Now, through this incense offering,
We take refuge in the **Great Saintly Perfected Ones’ supreme virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
We ascend to the **Formless Realm**,
And align with the **True and Perfect Way**.

We have heard:
**"Mysterious, yet more mysterious—
Great, yet transforming—this is called Sage."**
The Dao is not the ordinary Dao;
Divine and enlightened, it resides within humanity.

From **One**, the **Three** emerge—
Who contains the **Three** yet remains **One**?
Only through **verification’s mystery**,
Can the **rare and wondrous winds** be fully realized.

Now, donning the scholar’s cap,
We humbly await the **True One’s chariot**.

At this pure and clear dawn,
Ascending the altar to perform the Dao,
We invite the assembly of law to kindle the third incense strand,
Praying that this fragrant smoke may ascend to the heavens,
Offering devotion to the **Three Realms’ Supreme Lords and Saintly Assemblies**,
The **High Spirits who transmit the Law and save beings**.

With body, spirit, and life surrendered,
We prostrate ourselves in reverence,
And with this incense strand’s merit,
We dedicate it to **certain ritual officials**,
Registering their names in the **Luck Ledger**,
And adding their years to the **Lifespan Book**.
Bathing in the **Three Realms’ radiance**,
And receiving the **Thousand Perfected Ones’ blessings**,
May calamities vanish and blessings abound.

Now, through this incense offering,
We take refuge in the **Great Saintly Perfected Ones’ supreme virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
We eternally preserve life,
And align with the **True and Perfect Way**.

**Chanting the Square Array, Repenting the Square Array, Commanding Demons—**
Three awakenings, three rites.
Reaffirming the **Law’s station**.

The **certain humble subject**, along with the assembled ritual officials,
Solemnly and sincerely petition:
The **Supreme Boundless Dao**,
The **Three Realms’ Supreme Lords**,
The **Celestial Jade Emperor of Boundless Heaven**,
The **Ten Directions’ Great Saints**,
The **Thirty-Six Divisions’ Venerable Scriptures and Mysterious Master of the Great Law**,
The **Spirits of the Sacred Treasure**,
The **Five Emperors and Three Officials**,
The **Round Sky’s Mysterious Symbols**,
All **Celestial Tribunals and Spirits**,
The **Cavernous Peaks and Sacred Waters’ Saints**,
The **Luck Registrars**,
The **True Lord who Oversees Offerings and Examinations**,
The **Officials who Record and Assess**,
The **Responsive Virtues of the Dao and Its Manifestations**,
And all **True Spirits**.

We have heard:
The **Dao’s Law is natural**,
Uniting the **Great Harmony** to universally save.
**Supreme Goodness, like water**,
Follows all desires that arise.

In silence, we trace the **origin of descent and oversight**,
And clearly perceive the **principle of mutual causation**.

We humbly reflect:
**Loving virtue** is one of the **Five Blessings**,
And **accumulating goodness** precedes **achieving renown**.

Like a spring’s source or a tree’s roots,
Thus, **Heaven’s bestowal** must be nurtured by **virtue’s foundation**,
And the **Bright Spirits’ guidance** must lead through **goodness’ path**.

The **certain ritual official**, from ancient times,
Has received the Dao’s transformation,
Fortunate to bathe in the **True Wind’s influence**,
Knowing that **virtuous deeds** open the **source of blessings**,
And that **accumulating goodness** establishes **renown’s foundation**.

Fearful of past transgressions obstructing progress,
And mindful of frail humanity’s anxieties,
We now invoke the **True Science of the Jade Register**,
And summon the **Chariot of the Celestial Capital**,
Hoping that **Heaven may bestow wisdom**,
And the **Bright Spirits illuminate our hearts**,
So that through **virtue**, demonic obstacles may not intrude,
And through **goodness**, malevolent fates may not prevail.
May we enjoy the **Five Blessings of a complete body**,
And fulfill our **lifelong aspiration to aid all**,
With the **young and old of our household** all sharing in rest,
And the **entire assembly of officials and scholars** alike enjoying blessings.

Yet we fear that **certain ritual officials**,
From past lives to this one,
May have committed **transgressions in the Three Realms**,
Or **accumulated sins through the Six Senses**,
Or remain unpardoned in the **Day Palace or Moon Bureau**,
Or be unexcused in the **Celestial Tribunals or Earthly Offices**—
All we beseech for **pardon and universal grace**.

May the **East’s Green Tablet** and the **South’s Red Script** record their **accumulated goodness**,
And bestow **honor and longevity’s blessings**.
What we pray for may reach the heavens,
And our sincerity may be fulfilled—
So that the **departed may escape suffering and ascend**,
The **living may extend their years and increase their blessings**,
And all **sentient beings** may thrive in life’s fulfillment.
Above, we honor the **Heavenly Sage’s nurturing benevolence**,
And below, we fulfill our **subjects’ sincere devotion**.
With reverence, we present this petition.

The **knowing gong sounds**,
And the **Twelve Wishes** are declared.

「For the **Dao/Way** is most supreme,
hence it serves as the foundation for all ranks;
For the **Dao/Way** is most divine,
hence it is entrusted to the common and the vulgar alike.

From the **primordial simplicity** it disperses to form vessels and officials,
each must rely upon its own kind—
the virtuous become teachers to the unvirtuous,
the talented nurture those without talent.

**This humble servant**, dwelling in the midst of worldly filth,
has practiced the **scholar’s cap** and its traditions.
**Holding fast to antiquity while mastering the present**,
to serve as a net for the **auspicious blessings of the current reign**;
**delving deeply into learning and pondering with precision**,
to meet the demands of the **examiners of the Moral and Auspicious Registers**.

**Reflecting upon fate’s decree** in gain and loss,
**knowing wealth and noble status** lie in **Heaven’s will**.
Those who seek but fail to obtain
are bound by the **innate hindrances of the lowest rank**;
Those who feel and must comply
are blessed by the **boundless compassion of the supreme Dao/Way**.

Thus, with **sincere and earnest devotion**,
I invoke the **Mysterious Influence** of the **True Lord of the Moral and Auspicious Examinations**.

Gazing toward the **Celestial Gate** in the distant void**,
my spirit wanders the **jade steps of the Divine Palace**;
**Disseminating fragrant incense through the boundless expanse**,
in silent contemplation, I envision the **Golden Countenance**.

**We, Your servants**, bearing the **sacred scriptures of the Dao/Way**,
proclaim the **pure teachings of the Celestial Capital**,
now humbly present this petition—
**to earnestly plead for divine favor**,
and with **midday sincerity**, declare our **supreme devotion**.

**The declaration is made.**

Upon **scrutinizing these words with clarity**,
**the True Lord perceives our utmost sincerity**.
**Surely the Most High will show mercy**,
**and regard this heart’s submission**—
**forgiving even the gravest offenses**,
**bestowing blessings abundantly as rivers overflow**,
**with incense rising in praise**,
**and bowing in humble reverence**.

**This servant hears** that within the **Four Great Realms**,
**Your Majesty reigns supreme**;
and that in the **Nine Categories of the Great Range**,
**the Imperial Sovereign establishes the ultimate foundation**.

The **worthy and capable** rely upon You to ascend in office,
the **people** depend upon You for peace and security.

At this **midday hour**, ascending the altar to perform the **Dao**,
we request the **law-assembled** to light this first incense strand,
wishing its fragrant smoke to ascend to the heavens,
offering **supreme reverence** to the **Three Realms’ Most Honorable Sovereign**,
the **Primal Dao’s Precious Treasure**.

We submit **body, spirit, and fate**,
prostrating with heads to the earth,
and with this incense’s merit,
we pray for our **current Emperor**.

May his **lifespan endure like Southern Mountain’s grandeur**,
his **virtue/power** vast as the boundless sea.
May **arms lay down in repose**,
and the **Great Unity** endure without end;
may the **four seas** know tranquil peace,
and the **Five Stars** align in harmony.

Let **worthy scholars** rise from obscurity,
and **talented people** gather beneath the **pure radiance**;
bestow blessings upon the common folk,
and flourish the myriad multitudes.

Now, through this incense-burning,
we **take refuge** in the **Dao’s Great Sage’s Most Authentic Virtue/Power**.
After attaining the **Dao**,
we **preserve Heaven’s eternal existence**,
harmonizing with the **True and Authentic**.

We hear that in **corrupt ages**, no grace surpasses **nurturing life**;
and that **mortal bodies**, once abandoned,
are **hardly repaid** in this world.
This **body** depends upon it for **action**,
this **Dao** relies upon it for **establishment**.

「With the present moment upon the **Midday Star** (☉),
ascending the altar to perform the **Dao’s rites** (道),
we humbly request the **lawful assembly** (法眾) to take this second pinch of incense,
wishing that this incense smoke may **ascend to the heavens** (腾空俓上),
offering reverence to the **Celestial Jade Emperor** (太上琼楼玉检),
and to all **sacred scriptures** (一切經寶).

We, the subjects, **take refuge** (皈) in **body** (身),
**take refuge** in **spirit** (神),
and **take refuge** in **fate** (命),
prostrating our heads to the earth.
Through this act of lighting the incense,
we **dedicate its merit** (功德)
to the **current ritual master** (今辰醮官某家),
for the **ascension and guidance** (資度) of our **ancestors** (曾萬祖),
and the **nine generations of departed spirits** (九世先靈).

May we **refine and purify** (煉沐) our **spirit and soul** (神魂),
and **transcend the path of delusion** (超出群迷之徑).
May we **cleanse our sins** (浄除愆咎),
and **enter the realm of blessed fortune** (別生景福之天).

May we **ascend to the Mysterious Gate** (入希夷門),
**sever the cycle of rebirth** (斷輪迴路),
and **illuminate the realm of existence** (光生阀阅).
May our **descendants** (子孫) rejoice in this merit,
and our **present revered kin** (見在尊親)
share in the **blessings and joys** (利樂).

May the **True Qi** (真氣) gather and flourish abundantly,
and the **Spirit of the Grain** (穀神) be complete and harmonious,
strengthening the **foundation of blessings** (福基),
and extending the **measure of longevity** (寿算).

Now, through this incense-burning,
we **take refuge** in the **Sutra’s Great Sage’s Most Authentic Virtue/Power** (經尊大聖眾至真之德).
After attaining the **Dao** (得道之後),
we **ascend to the Formless** (升入無形),
harmonizing with the **True and Authentic** (和與道合真).

We hear that **rank and fortune** are **not bestowed in vain** (禄岂徒致),
for their attainment **must have its foundation** (致之必有其基);
and that **reputation and name** are **not achieved without cause** (名岂徒成),
for their fulfillment **must have its root** (成之必有其本).
**Rank comes from accumulated goodness** (禄以善积而始致),
and **reputation arises from cultivated virtue** (名因德修而及成).

With the present moment upon the **Midday Star** (☉),
ascending the altar to perform the **Dao’s rites** (道),
we humbly request the **lawful assembly** (法眾) to take this third pinch of incense,
wishing that this incense smoke may **ascend to the heavens** (腾空俓上),
offering reverence to the **Celestial Jade Emperor of the Mysterious Capital** (太上玄都瑶阙证真),
and to all **sacred scriptures** (一切師寶).

We, the subjects, **take refuge** (皈) in **body** (身),
**take refuge** in **spirit** (神),
and **take refuge** in **fate** (命),
prostrating our heads to the earth.
Through this act of lighting the incense,
we **dedicate its merit** (功德)
to the **current ritual master** (醮官某).

May **Heaven enlighten our wisdom** (天启智能),
and the **Divine aid our virtuous deeds** (神扶德業),
so that our **accumulated goodness may grow like a mountain** (俾善功之山積),
and **rank and fortune arrive like a cauldron** (致科名之鼎来).
May we **cleanse past transgressions** (除已往之愆),
and **gather abundant blessings** (集有餘之慶).

For all those in their **years of life** (行年之上),
or **fateful moments** (命運之中),
whether they face **hidden calamities** (暗曜) or **silent misfortunes** (默符),
or encounter **critical reversals in fortune** (值運元之衝破),
or **the decline of their vital essence** (當氣本之衰微),
we humbly pray that each may **bathe in celestial grace** (各沐玄休),
and **revere the Dao’s influence** (仰承道荫),
transforming **ill fortune into good** (變凶為吉),
and **bestowing rank and prolonging life** (注禄延龄).

Now, through this incense-burning,
we **take refuge** in the **Teacher’s Great Sage’s Most Authentic Virtue/Power** (師尊大聖眾至真之德).
After attaining the **Dao** (得道之後),
we **eternally preserve Heaven’s existence** (永保長存),
harmonizing with the **True and Authentic** (和與道合真).

**Recite the spell** (唱方), **confess the spell** (忏方), **command the demon** (命魔),
**three invocations** (三啟), **three obeisances** (三禮).
**Reaffirm the sacred position** (重稱法位).

We, the **subjects of each rank** (具位臣某),
along with the **assembled ritual officials** (合坛官眾等),
sincerely and together **invoke** (上启):
the **Celestial Way of the Supreme Extremity** (太上無極大道),
the **Three Realms’ Most Revered Sovereign** (三境至尊),
the **Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Supreme Clarity** (昊天玉皇上帝),
the **Ten Directions’ Great Sages** (十方大聖),
the **Thirty-Six Departments of Sacred Scripture** (三十六部尊經),
the **Mysterious Master of the Supreme Middle Law** (玄中大法師),
the **Spiritual Treasures of the Numinous Jewel** (靈寶眾真),
the **Five Emperors and Three Officials** (五帝三官),
the **Celestial Bureau of the Rounded Concave and Mysterious Symbols** (圓穹玄象天曹一切靈仙),
the **Holy Assembly of the Penetrating Peaks and Sacred Altars** (洞天岳渎聖眾),
the **Celestial Registrars of Rank and Fortune** (司禄主者),
the **True Lord of the Imperial Examinations** (職貢舉真君),
the **Celestial Officials in Charge of Records and Examinations** (掌籍考校官屬),
the **Divine Response of the Dao and its Moral Influence** (道德應感),
and all **true spirits** (一切真靈).

We hear that the **high and low** (高者下者),
are all **manifestations of the wondrous Dao** (皆妙道之委形).
All **life and nurturing** (生之畜之) are **the vital breath of the Great Unity** (尽一元之冲气).」

The Dao is indeed the primordial ancestor of the Great Unity—who can fathom its divine mystery?
Humans dwell within the dual forces of yin and yang, yet alone possess the refined essence.

Though the Nine Schools differ in doctrine, all partake of the harmonious Five Phases.
Some stars and constellations store their essence, some mountains and rivers nurture their purity—
truly relying on the molding of Creation,
to become the flutes and drums of virtue and the Dao.

Endowed with noble spirits, granted wondrous functions,
simple yet vast as the uncarved block, profound as the valley,
acting virtuously when opportunity arises, responding to the times with goodness—
thus establishing governance among the common folk,
and spreading harmony across all lands.

This humble ritual official, entrusted with the keys of mystical power,
carrying the embryo of Creation’s work,
has yet to repay the boundless grace with even a speck of dust,
and drifts through this transient world, vainly consuming years in vain.

Now, I wish to respond to the call of the enlightened age,
to repay the sincerity of past days.
Yet I fear my karmic obstacles are profound, my blessings meager—
reverently offering pure and solemn rites,
earnestly opening the altar of purification,
relying on the wondrous patterns to present my sincerity,
through incense and smoke, to convey my earnestness.

I humbly pray that the Nine Celestial Worthies look down with favor,
that the assembled saints radiate their light,
that they take pity with boundless compassion,
and open the path of great forgiveness.

As for this ritual official, from countless past lives,
down to this present incarnation,
unaware of the True Way, ignorant of scriptures and precepts,
indulging in licentious desires, abandoning righteousness for wrong,
with accumulated sins too numerous to count—
my ancestors are already condemned, my descendants suffer calamity.

Now, having entered the gate of repentance,
I seek the path of renewal.
May those not yet pardoned be pardoned,
those not yet absolved be absolved—
granting my earnest wish for merit and fortune,
heeding my sincere desire to return to the Way,
transforming my fate of decline into one of joy,
fulfilling my lifelong aspiration for the crimson cassia’s high rank;
may I, like the aged yellow crane, share in the prosperity of this flourishing age.

May blessings be evenly bestowed upon all beings,
may the radiance of grace extend to the eight extremes—
above, illuminating the Heavenly Sovereign’s boundless mercy,
below, fulfilling the devotion of these humble servants.

With deepest reverence, I present this petition.

*(Know the gong’s strike, twelve wishes fulfilled.)*
**Ritual:** Focus the spirit, burn incense.

**High Functionary:** Rekindle the incense burner.
**Incense Officials and Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, Attendant Spirits of the Incense—**
Command that the place where this humble one formerly ascended the altar at noon,
now spontaneously generates golden elixir, emerald jade, mushrooms, and hundred-spirits’ herbs,
as the assembled worthies gather before this incense burner.

May the celestial youths and jade maidens of the Ten Directions
attend to the fragrant mist,
and swiftly convey the sincerity of this humble one’s petition
to the presence of the Most High Dao of the Boundless Supreme,
the Three Pure Ones, and the Heavenly Sovereign of Jade Sovereignty.

**Ritual:** Exit the hall to chant the hymn.
**Exit the door,** lead to the Six-Curtain Hall.

**Second Petition:**

**Ritual:** Lift the incense, focus the spirit and burn incense.
**High Functionary:** Rekindle the incense burner and proclaim the **Spirit-Safeguarding Incantations**.

As the Five Stars shine brightly and auspicious **qi** floats aloft,
**Yuan Shi** gathers the divine essence, and Heaven and Earth exchange their cycles.
With jade talismans and sacred seals in hand, the **Dao/Way’s** subtle command resounds—
Flame is cast and majesty displayed, leaving no room for malice or deceit.
Ten thousand demons are subdued, their chaotic forms dispelled;
Monstrous beings and evil forces are crushed, as the **Dao/Way’s** vital **qi** circulates freely.
Divine light illuminates the night, dispelling all darkness.
Ten thousand spirits descend in order, riding the gusts of celestial breeze,
And all living beings prosper, with blessings spread across the **Dao/Way’s** sacred land,
In perfect harmony with the **Dao/Way’s** true essence.

Strike the **Dharma** drum twenty-four times.

**High Functionary:** Open the incense burner.

Convoke the **Supreme Three Heavens’** **Xuan Yuan Shi**—the **Three Five** (of the Three Pure Ones),
the **Supreme Dao Lord**, and the **Supreme Old Lord**—
to summon forth from our bodies the **Thirty-Six Officials of the Dao/Way**,
the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
the Left and Right Incense Bearers,
the **Cavalry Dragon** and **Brilliant Officials**,
the **Golden Boys** who attend the incense,
and the **Jade Maidens** who scatter flowers and transmit words.
Also, the **Five Emperors’** direct talismans,
the **Direct Day** incense officials,
each thirty-six in number, shall emerge.

Those who exit shall don solemn and resplendent attire,
with caps and sashes trailing their fine ribbons.
Open the **Mysterious Dao/Way’s** altars, summoning the **Land Spirits** and **Divine Beings** of the realm.

This humble one, in quiet night,
ascends the altar to practice the **Dao/Way**,
and now humbly presents this **sincere petition**,
with all earnestness of heart already recorded and heard.
May the **Supreme Dao/Way’s** most exalted **qi** of the Ten Directions,
the **Sacred Treasure’s** luminous blessings,
descend and flow into our bodies,
so that this humble one’s sincere supplication
may swiftly reach the **Most High Dao/Way’s** presence of the Boundless Supreme,
the **Three Pure Ones**, and the **Heavenly Sovereign of Jade Sovereignty**.

**Ritual:** Invoke the **Dharma** positions.
**All Officials and the High Functionary of this humble one**,
in unison with the assembled worthies,
now humbly present this **sincere petition**,
addressing the **Supreme Natural Yuan Shi** of **Voidless Primordial Heaven**,
then the **Nine Sovereigns of the Nine Heavens**,
the **Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors**,
the **Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors**,
all **Heavenly Sovereigns**,
the **Star Lords** of the **Purple Enclosure (Zi Wei)** and **Supreme Enclosure (Tai Wei)**,
the **Five Emperors**,
the **Three Primordial True Ones**,
the **Eleven Great Luminaries**,
the **Star Lords of the Northern Dipper (Bei Dou)** and **Southern Dipper (Nan Chen)**,
the **Twenty-Eight Constellations**,
the **Star Lord of Eastern Literature and Talent (Dong Bi Wen Chang)****,
the **Seven Stars of Virtuous Worthies (Xian Liang)****,
the **Twelve Constellations of the Celestial Lodges (Shi Er Gong)**)**,
the **Star Lord of Literature and Prosperity (Wen Chang)****,
the **Star Lords of the Three Platforms (San Tai)****,
the **Star Lord of Advancing Virtue (Jin Xian)****,
the **Star Lords of the Minor Multitude (Shao Zhong)**)**,
the **Star Lords of the Round Enclosure (Yuan Qiong)**)**,
the **Supreme Pure Star Lord of the Southern Vermilion (Nan Zhu)**)**,
the **Supreme Nine Breaths (Qi)** of the **Dao/Way**,
the **Celestial Officials of the Literature and Prosperity Palace (Wen Chang Gong)**)**,
the **Star Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Cavalry Dragon (Jian Sheng Dou)**)**,
the **Star Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Ninefold Sage of Qingcheng Mountain (Qingcheng Shan Jiu Tian Zhang Ren)**)**,
the **Star Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Commanding Officer of Lushan Mountain (Lushan Shan Jiu Tian Cai Fang Shi Ren)**)**,
the **Star Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Messenger of Lushan Mountain (Lushan Shan Jiu Tian Cai Fang Shi Ren)**)**,
the **Five Sacred Peaks’** **Holy Emperors**,
the **Four Great Waters’** **Source Kings**,
the **Officials of Auspicious Registration and Examination (Si Lu Zhu Ren)****,
the **Star Lord of Examination and Registration (Gong Ju Zhang Ji Kao Xue Guan Shu)**)**,
the **Mighty and Loyal King of Martial Splendor and Broad Salvation (Ying Xian Wu Lie Zhong You Guang Ji Wang)**)**,
the **Examiners and Registrars** who oversee records and assessments,
and all **Divine Beings** who respond to moral conduct.

This humble one has heard that the **Dao/Way** was established in the **Mixed Primordial** era,
and all beings were classified under the **Great Balance (Hong Jun)**.
The **Listed Saints** govern their respective domains,
nurturing and refining the **Great Virtue** of the **Perfectly Molded** (i.e., humanity).
The forests and myriads of celestial lodges
correspond to the **Central Kingdom (Zhong Hua)**.
The **Purple Enclosure (Zi Wei)** and **Supreme Enclosure (Tai Wei)****
oversee the selection of worthy talents,
while the **Southern Pole (Nan Ji)** and **Northern Pole (Bei Ji)****
determine the bestowal of ranks and blessings.
The **Eastern Literature and Talent Star (Dong Bi)**** governs the repository of books,
the **Southern Star (Nan Xing)**** ranks the worthy in the **Palace of Virtuous Worthies (Xian Liang Gong)**)**,
where officials of noble and lowly station are appointed,
and where the fates of life and death are sealed.
All are under the jurisdiction of the **Celestial Ruler (Zai)****,
who governs both **Heavenly Officials** and **Earthly Spirits**.
The **Grand Mountain (Tai Shan)**** holds sway over all official duties,
while the **Seven Curves (Qi Xu)**** controls the affairs of examination and registration.
The **Mysterious Dao/Way’s** exalted mechanisms and sacred regulations
intertwine like the **Great Principles** and **Minor Details**,
promoting the worthy and governing the state.
Thus, we witness the **Heavenly and Human** correspondence,
and understand the **Hidden and Manifest** mutual support—
harmonizing the **Great Unity** for all living beings,
and applying **subtle support** to the **Buddha’s vital breath (Fan Qi)**)**.

This is not merely a weighty tradition of the **Imperial Dao/Way**,
but also a profound mechanism of the **Heavenly Sovereign**.

The **Ritual Official** (of this humble one),
gratefully receiving the **Dao/Way’s** refining and nurturing,
and bearing the **Bright Spirits’** protective favor,
hopes to achieve renown in this age,
and to fulfill one’s conduct in these prosperous times,
to repay the **Great Grace** above,
and to realize one’s innate aspirations below.
With **Garments of the Clouds** as pure companions,
and the **Cloudy Registers** opened in the **Spiritual Hall**,
this humble one cleanses the heart and harbors the spirit,
praying to **Heaven** and petitioning the **Commanding Spirits**.

This humble one has devoted their life to the **True Realm**,
and expounds the **Teachings of the Dao/Way** among mortals.
When called upon to **transmit the Dao/Way** through fasting and ritual,
one must faithfully proclaim its **Loving Benevolence**.
How much more so when entrusted with the **Sacred Essence** and **Solemn Vows**—
dare one not present this petition to **Heaven**?
In this quiet night, with words of sincerity,
one now humbly proclaims the **supplication**.

**Proclamation of the Petition:**

Upon careful observation of the words,
one sees the **Supreme Sincerity** clearly revealed.
Thus, the **Dao/Way** is informed of this humble one’s **devotion**—
the utmost sincerity of their **innermost heart**.
And thus, the **Auspicious Favor** is obtained—
for the **Dao/Way** must surely answer the **sincere wishes** of their supplication.

The fragrant vapors ascend in unbroken succession,
as I pour forth my devout and concentrated essence,
my reverent contemplation deepening,
and I humbly pray for Heaven’s luminous discernment.

I have heard that **Taqing** expounds the Teachings,
valuing emptiness and stillness as the essence of the heart;
**Master Ni** [Confucius] proclaimed the two principles—
the **Middle Way** and the **following of one’s nature**.
He fanned the **Mysterious Wind** beneath the pillars,
and transmitted the **Hidden Meaning** by the **Zhou River’s banks**.
Only because **Heaven** has not abandoned this **Sacred Tradition**,
has the **Holy Dao/Way** endured unbroken, like a sash.

Now this **Supreme Teaching** is truly entrusted to the **Enlightened Ruler**.
In this still night, ascending the altar to perform the **Dao/Way’s rites**,
I pray that the assembled faithful may first light their incense,
and that this fragrant smoke may rise to the heavens,
offering reverence to:
**Dongzhen, the Natural and Original Heavenly Venerable**,
**Dongxuan, the Jade Canopy Dao/Way Lord**,
**Dongshen, the Great Dao/Way Lord of the Mixed Primordial**,
**Tai Shang Haotian, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Heavenly Sovereign**,
and **all the Illustrious Dao/Way Lords**.

With **surrender of body, spirit, and fate**,
we prostrate ourselves in homage,
and with this incense-lighting merit,
we bless the **current Emperor**.

May **virtue/power** flourish ever greater,
and the **Celestial Pattern** endure eternally.
May all the people be nourished by the **Teaching’s rain**,
and scholars alike bathed in its **Dao/Way’s winds**.

May officials and ministers shine like stars of excellence,
and those in governance be as steadfast as mountains and rivers.
May longevity match the **extreme of the Eight Wings**,
and blessings equal the **unshakable foundations of the hills**.

Now, the offering of this incense,
from the outset, **surrendering to the Dao/Way’s** Illustrious Sage, the Great Perfect **Virtue/Power** of the **Most Authentic** Assembly.

After attaining the **Dao/Way**,
we safeguard the **Celestial Longevity** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

We have heard that the **Precious Pearl** descends like autumn grains,
spreading the **wondrous and incomprehensible methods**;
the **Jade Array** transmits the **Sutra**,
expounding the **most authentic and correct** interpretations.

We kindle the **flame of the Primordial Dao/Way**,
illuminating the **lost paths of all ranks**.

With this **Dao/Way’s** transcendence to **supernality**,
we must ever recall the **original foundation of this body**.

On this **quiet night**,
ascending the altar to perform the **Dao/Way’s** rites,
we, the **Assembly of All Laws**, solemnly offer these **two incense sticks**,
wishing this incense smoke,
to rise high into the **void**,
and pay homage to the **Most Supreme Lord of the Three Boundless Realms**,
the **Jade Emperor of the Supreme Heavenly Sovereign**,
and all the **Illustrious Dao/Way Lords**.

We, the subjects,
**surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
prostrate our heads to the earth,
and with this merit of lighting incense,
we dedicate it to the **officiant of the certain household**,
the **Nine Mysteries and Seven Ancestors**,
and the **historical lineage of the clan**.

May our **guilt and karma dissolve** like ice in water,
and our **innate nature** shine bright as the moon.
May we roam freely through the **Three Realms**,
and wander in the **Forest of the Sage’s Treasures**.
May **blessings and prosperity** descend upon our **future descendants**,
and **glory and honor** radiate to our **future lineage**.
May our **present parents and kin** alike share in these **benefits and joys**.

May the **True Primordial Essence** grow ever more steadfast,
and **longevity extend to the Southern Pole’s extreme**.
May **blessings and fortune** come in pairs,
and we forever bask under the **shade of the Supreme Clarity**.

Now, the offering of this incense,
from the outset, **surrendering to the Sutra’s** Illustrious Sage, the Great Perfect **Virtue/Power** of the **Most Authentic** Assembly.

After attaining the **Dao/Way**,
we safeguard the **Celestial Longevity** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

We have heard that to **proclaim the Dao/Way’s mysteries**,
one must rely on the **Supreme Virtue/Power of the Dao/Way**;
to **spread the winds of the Profound Dao/Way**,
one must depend on the **Most Holy Sage of the Triple Profound**.

We discern the **root qualities of all beings**,
and respond to the **pure sincerity of the common folk**.

In **rank between Heaven and humanity**,
our **principles** permeate the **obscure and manifest**.

On this **quiet night**,
ascending the altar to perform the **Dao/Way’s** rites,
we, the **Assembly of All Laws**, solemnly offer these **three incense sticks**,
wishing this incense smoke,
to rise high into the **void**,
and pay homage to the **Most Supreme Lord of the Dao/Way’s** Sacred Texts, the **Precious Heavenly Sage**,
the **Jade Emperor of the Supreme Heavenly Sovereign**,
and all the **Illustrious Dao/Way Lords**.

We, the subjects,
**surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
prostrate our heads to the earth,
and with this merit of lighting incense,
we dedicate it to the **officiants of the certain households**.

May **grace extend to the Six Paths**,
and **mercy reach the Four Generations**.
May all **sentient beings rejoice in the Three Ascensions**,
and the **Four Seas attain the Five Blessings**.

We raise the **Bridge of the Law** to the **Dao/Way’s** shore,
and all escape the **cycle of rebirth**.
We issue **talismans and decrees** to the **netherworld’s gates**,
and universally grant **liberation and enlightenment**.

May the **officiant of the certain household**,
have **evil connections severed**,
and **good fruits perfected**.
Whether it be **a single inch of merit to record**,
to fulfill **renown and fame**,
or to **promote broad salvation**,
we aspire to **repay the refining and nurturing** of the **Dao/Way’s** **Molding**.

Now, the offering of this incense,
from the outset, **surrendering to the Teacher’s** Illustrious Sage, the Great Perfect **Virtue/Power** of the **Most Authentic** Assembly.

After attaining the **Dao/Way**,
we safeguard the **Celestial Longevity** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

We **chant the Square**,
**repent the Square**,
and **command the Demon**,
with **three invocations** and **three obeisances**.

We **reaffirm the Law’s station**.
We, the **subjects of all ranks**, along with the **officiants of the altar**,
sincerely present this **humble invocation**,
to the **Supreme Most Boundless Dao/Way**,
the **Most Supreme Lord of the Three Boundless Realms**,
the **Jade Emperor of the Supreme Heavenly Sovereign**,
the **Great Sages of the Ten Directions**,
the **Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Sutra’s Profound Middle Law**,
the **Sacred Assembly of the Numinous Treasure**,
the **Five Emperors and Three Officials**,
the **Circular Vault of Mysterious Symbols of the Celestial Tribunal**,
all the **Spiritual Immortals**,
the **Holy Assembly of the Caverns and Peaks**,
the **Keeper of Blessings and Officials**,
the **True Lord of Recorded Merit and Examination**,
the **Superintendent of Officials and Moral Retribution**,
and all **True Spirits**.

We have heard that the **Heavenly Sovereign favors none**,
only **the virtuous** are His recipients;
the **Dao/Way’s** **illumination** is **obscured** if not **practiced**,
and it is **precious** for the **superior scholars** to **diligently follow**.

「The **Golden Mouth’s** teachings,
the **Jade Classics’** writings firmly established,
thus knowing that **self-perfection leads to perfecting others**,
**governed by the virtue/power of sincerity and clarity**.

**Those with virtue must speak**,
**their words rooted in conduct and practice**.
For the **scholar’s** study is the **Dao/Way**,
and the **Dao/Way’s** transmission is through **scripture**.

If **conduct** is **abundant** yet **scripture** is **mastered**,
then **scripture** shall not **float above** true practice—
**both conduct and scripture** in harmony,
**bringing radiance to one’s undertakings**.

This is why **finding worthy talent** has always been **difficult**,
and **wise discernment** has ever been **a burden**;
**trusting in the Highest Truth’s** protection,
**conduct and scripture must surely align**.

**Officials of the ritual** (hereafter), humble **Confucian scholar** though I be,
**studying the Sage’s Dao/Way**,
yet my **nature is dull and obtuse**,
my **conduct low and common**—
I **know the Dao/Way** yet **see it dimly**,
I **grasp the difficulty of practice** yet **act with feeble resolve**.
I **wear out my senses** in chasing trivial gains,
I **exhaust my spirit** while turning from the True,
leading to **countless errors in my black records**,
and **lamenting the long road ahead** still **blocked by obstacles**.

Now I **turn to the Great Dao/Way**,
**repenting my past transgressions**,
**walking the hundred paths without arrogance**,
**preserving the One True Principle** while **overcoming self**—
to **establish the foundation for worldly success**,
to **fulfill the rites of serving Heaven**,
**humbly hoping for the True Mercy**,
that my **intentions may harmonize**,
**bestowed with wings of transcendence**,
**opening the path to virtuous governance**.

I **solemnly present** the **model for ascension** in the **Lanfang Register**,
the **Heavenly Decrees’** **cloud-etchings**,
**declaring the Three Realms**,
**repenting to the Ten Directions**,
**fixing my thoughts and offering words**,
**following the proper timing to walk the Dao/Way**.

The **lamp’s** **law-flame** burns brightly,
**dispelling darkness** with its **radiant light**;
the **incense’s** **sincere fragrance** ascends,
**piercing the void** to **reveal its purity**.

**I earnestly pray** that the **Mysterious Capital of the Purple Palace**,
the **Golden Gates and Jade Canopy**,
may **bestow the Ten Directions’** **Sages’** **boundless compassion**,
and **spread the Thousand Truths’** **protective grace**—
**commanding the Three Realms**,
**proclaiming to all Heavens**,
to **grant longevity and blessings**,
to **remove calamities and dispel obstacles**,
**freeing me from the twelvefold misfortunes of the Hostile Stars**,
**clearing the disasters of the Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams’** **field divisions**,
all **accumulated sins**,
**endless retributions**,
**past grievances and debts**,
**wrongful killings and unintended harms**—
through **the Three Karmas and Six Roots**,
even **excesses and transgressions**,
**now, through repentance**, I **beg for complete absolution**,
so that I may **earn my merit early** and **fulfill my aspirations**.

**Above**, I pray for the **Heavenly Sovereign’s** **blessings** to **last eternally**,
for the **Imperial Design** to **be firmly rooted**—
**no wars shall arise**,
**border alarms shall cease**,
**droughts and locusts shall not plague**,
**auspicious omens shall come to fruition**.

**Below**, I hope for the **Seven Ancestors’** **transcendent ascent**,
for the **Nine Abysses’** **cessation of judgment**,
that the **Five Sufferings** may **all attain the Dao’s shore**,
and the **Three Paths** may **all be bathed in the Mysterious Wind**—
**spreading the Great Compassion’s** **enlightened grace**,
**equally bestowing merit and virtue**,
**above, clarifying the Heavenly Sovereign’s** **Great Mercy**,
**below, fulfilling my subjects’** **sincere devotion**,
**thus I humbly report**.

**Knowing the Ritual of the Chime-Stone**,
**twelvefold aspirations** (presented).
**Aspiration**: **Concentrating spirit and burning incense**.

**High Functionary restores the furnace**.
**Incense Officials, Messengers, and the Dragon-Tiger Attendants**,
**standing left and right**,
shall **command me** to **ascend the platform** in the **stillness of night**,
**where my Dao-practice** has been—
**naturally producing golden nectar and emerald elixir**,
**mushroom and herb essences of myriad spirits**,
**as the assembled Truths gather**,
**here, before this incense furnace**.

**Aspiration**: **Tenfold Sages and Jade Maidens** of the **Ten Directions**,
**attending the fragrant clouds**,
shall **transmit my sincere offerings**,
**swiftly reaching the Supreme Sovereign’s** **Highest Truth, the Boundless Dao/Way**,
the **Three Pure Ones, Most Exalted Sages**,
and the **Heavenly Sovereign’s** **Jade Emperor’s** **Numinous Presence**.

**Aspiration**: **Exiting the hall to chant praises**.
**Stepping beyond the door**,
**leading to the Six-Panel Hall**.

**Aspiration**:
**The Dao/Way’s Ritual Canon Complete—Volume Twenty-Two concluded, Volume Twenty-Three commenced**
**Master Guangting Du’s Revision of the Ritual Precepts of the Dao-door**
**The Chapter on the Auspicious Worship of the Literary Star (Wenchang) and the Dao-field Rites**
**Invoking the Gods and Practicing the Dao/Way**
**Ritual procedures for ascending the platform as prescribed.**

**Aspiration**: **All** pay homage to the **Master**—**concentrate the spirit** and **offer incense** as the law dictates.
**The High Functionary** proclaims the **Soul-Guarding incantations**.
**The Five Stars** align in radiance, **illuminating the Five Directions**.
**The Water Star** repels calamities, **the Woodly Virtue** brings prosperity.
**The Wandering Star** dispels misfortune, **the Great White Star** wards off soldiers.
**The Steady Star** secures fourfold blessings, **benefiting family and nation**.
**Names inscribed on jade tablets**, **characters recorded in the Imperial Archives**.
**Riding the gusts**, **dispersing the brilliance**—
**soaring through boundless space**, **entering and exiting the unseen realms**,
**feasting in the Ten Directions**.
**Five clouds** hover as canopies, **summoning deities** and **restraining the winds**.
**Commanding myriad spirits**, **protecting the Celestial Elder**,
**harmonizing with the Dao/Way’s True Essence**.

**Aspiration**: **Strike the Law-drum twenty-four times**.
**The High Functionary** ignites the incense furnace.
**The Supreme Sovereign’s Three Heavens**—**Primordial Beginning of the Three Mystic Breaths (Sanqi)**, **Most Exalted Five Spirits Elder Lord (Laojun)**—
**summon forth** from my body the **Three Five Officials (Sanwu Gongcao)**,
**left and right attendants and messengers**, **left and right incense-bearers**,
**Dragon-riding couriers and officials**, **golden boys attending the incense**,
**jade maidens transmitting words and scattering flowers**, **the Five Emperors’ direct talismans**,
**incense officials of the True Sun**, **each thirty-six in number**.

**Aspiration**: **The departed**, **strictly attired in resplendent garments**,
**turbans and sashes trailing their emblems**,
**opening the Mystic Platform’s earthly guardians** and **territorial deities**.
**I now ascend the platform to practice the Dao/Way**,
**sincerely presenting this as my heart’s intent**—
**all my earnest aspirations already inscribed and reported**.

**Aspiration**: **I pray** that the **Most Exalted Dao/Way’s True Essence of the Ten Directions**,
**the Spirit-Treasury’s Auspicious Radiance**,
**descend and flow into my body**,
**so that my sincere offerings may swiftly reach**—
**directly presenting to the Most Exalted Boundless Dao/Way**,
**the Three Pure Ones, Most Exalted Sages**,
**and the Heavenly Sovereign’s Jade Emperor’s Numinous Presence**.

**Aspiration**: **Invoke the Law’s station**.
**In my official station**, **I**, **lowly servant** **[name]**, together with the **assembled platform officials**,
**sincerely unite in offering**—
**to the Seven-Bend Mountain’s Auspicious Master (Silu Zhuren)**,
**the Official of True Merit (Zhigong Zhenjun)**—**the Illustrious and Martial Sage of Loyal Aid and Universal Salvation (Yingxian Wulie Zhongyou Guangji Wang)**,
**the Illustrious and Benevolent Empress**,
**the Prince of Bestowing Blessings and Benevolent Duke**,
**the Gentle and Responsive Lady of Praise and Loyal Aid, the Quiet and Upright Consort**,
**the Duke of Nurturing Beauty**, **the Consort of Benevolent Aid**,
**the Duke of Enduring Grace**, **the Consort of Obedient Aid**,
**the Duke of Mighty Deeds**—
**overseeing the cassia-register attendants and all subordinates**,
**all manner of mighty and numinous spirits**.

**Aspiration**: **I hear** that **divine mysteries are unfathomable**,
**expanding wisdom beyond all measure**;
**the common folk cannot comprehend**,
**employing numinous power to interact with the world**.

---

**We humbly look up to the True Sovereign of the Water Realm,**
**whose abode rests upon the peerless peak of Seven Bends,**
**where the Purple Enclosure shines over the Tong River,**
**and the Imperial Lodge spreads its grace across all prefectures.**
**Clouds march and rains descend, thunder roars and winds soar,**
**your august spirit discerns all without remainder,**
**your enlightened virtue flows ceaselessly without end.**
**You nurture the vast heavens’ transformations,**
**hold the pivot of calamity and blessing—**
**no petition goes unanswered, no inquiry remains unfulfilled.**

**With reverence for the Mysterious Canon,**
**we solemnly invoke the Celestial Rites.**
**May the Sacred Seal and Vermilion Standard**
**temporarily depart the Cavernous Palace,**
**and the wind-driven chariot gather at the Splendid Altar.**

**Overseeing our earnest devotion,**
**your boundless grace shines forth in its purity,**
**and we, your servants, are moved to the utmost sincerity in our reverence.**
**We present our first libation.**
**Music is played.**

**We, the assembled officials and servants,**
**with utmost sincerity, humbly petition the Sovereign of Seven Bends,**
**the Master of Offerings and True Virtue,**
**and all the numinous spirits of the congregation.**

**We hear that the Dao is ever kind in aiding humanity,**
**yet never abandons them;**
**the Most Exalted does not dwell in unvirtue,**
**thus virtue is ever manifest.**

**With the mundane seeking the Sacred, doubt arises from its lofty distance;
With the Sacred responding to the mundane, it shines forth in boundless compassion.**

We humbly revere the Sovereign of Seven Bends, the Master of Offerings and True Virtue,
Who penetrates the subtleties of the Dao, delving deep into the Sacred Realm.
For seven score and three generations as a Confucian sage,
Spanning countless centuries through the ages of Han and Cloud,
Illuminating the brilliance of words and deeds,
Standing resolute as frost and thunder—
Slicing through demons in an instant,
Shaking the winds and thunder with but a breath.
His benevolence flows like rivers, his grace permeates all;
He rescues the Shù people from the jaws of wolves,
Restoring the Black Thread’s land to the domain of longevity.
Yet the ignorant remain blind, the foolish unaware.

Though the Shù Mountains were carved and stones inscribed,
Their virtue cannot be fully recorded;
Though the Mín River’s waters were drained to ink the deeds,
Their glory cannot be fully written.

How could the Most True, in responding to the common,
Appear as but a fleeting dream of half a night,
Or fulfill a single plea in the blink of an eye?

This is called the Dao’s exalted height—never abandoning humanity,
And virtue’s grandeur—yet claiming no ownership of it.

Now, we, the ritual officials, in awe of your sacred might,
Solennly open the Splendid Altar,
Humbly praying for your compassionate gaze to descend,
And for your grace to fulfill our earnest devotion.

We submit our petition through the Minister of the Gate,
Daring not to delay—
Our sacred scripture shall be duly proclaimed.

**Proclaim the words.**
**Examine the scripture’s sincerity—its truth is manifest.**

With utmost sincerity and reverence,
Our hearts pour forth in every word;
In solemn purity and devotion,
We seem to draw near to the Divine’s discernment.

We partake in this evening’s grand rites,
Basking in the radiant fortune of auspicious light—
All shall be prosperous, all shall come to fruition.

We, your servants, are moved to the utmost in pious supplication,
And present our second libation.
**Music is played.**

We hear that Heaven acts without action,
Yet relies on divine might for its support;
The Great Dao is most wondrous,
And draws upon divine virtue for its manifestation.

Like the twin luminaries illuminating the heavens,
Or the Northern Dipper as the Emperor’s voice—
It is the harmony of virtue and the Dao,
Uniting essence and function in perfect accord.

We revere the Sovereign of Seven Bends, the Master of Offerings and True Virtue,
Who walks with Heaven as his companion,
Holds the ancient Dao,
And receives the Mandate from the Most High,
Commanding the vast principles of the lower realm.

When the wooden horses sweat in battle,
It reveals the Great Compassion’s courage;
When the rain-soaked paths burn with fire,
It shows the attainment of One’s radiant spirit.

Now, we in awe of your virtue and might,
Once more extend our sincere devotion.

May your presence come without need of summoning,
Displaying the boundless wonders of your workings;
May all desires be fulfilled,
Aligning with Heaven’s heart to bestow blessings.

We, your servants, are moved to the utmost in pious prayer,
And present our final libation.
**Music is played.**

We, the officials, in utmost sincerity, once more petition:
The Sovereign of Seven Bends, the Master of Offerings and True Virtue,
The Illustrious and Loyal King of Broad Salvation, Warlike Virtue,
Who governs the celestial registers and attends with officials,
And all the numinous spirits of the congregation.

We hear that symbols establish the hierarchy of Heaven and Earth,
And the trigrams weigh the coming and going of great and small;
No age exists without relying on worthy talent,
No talent thrives without the age’s support—
Thus, the principle of mutual benefit dictates
That there must be those who take the lead.

We reverently behold the vast Heaven and august Sovereign,
Who turns His gaze westward,
Entrusting the celestial register to the True One of Seven Bends;
Incomprehensible in thought,
He establishes the mighty hook for the four quarters’ virtuous.

Thus, in harmony with the effortless transformation,
He achieves the wondrous workings of yin and yang’s awe,
Spreading joy among all beings,
And opening enlightened governance across the six directions.

We, the ritual officials, reflect that our nature is dull and blunt,
Our station low and meager—
Yet we have received the boundless grace of your favor,
And been touched by your unfathomable virtue.
Though we have long cherished the classics,
We have yet to attain the broad path.
Relying on the Daoist ranks and talismans,
We seek to fulfill the scholar’s ambition for officialdom—
May the great numbers of your blessings be answered,
And our humble prayers granted:
That the firewood of the lower stove may burn bright,
And our remaining talents may flourish;
That the moon’s immortal osmanthus may grow anew.

May the Sacred Sovereign live long, and the four seas prosper in peace,
His august might tremble the nine barbarians into submission.
Let the scholars gather in harmony, achieving the auspiciousness of advancement;
Let the officials unite in reverence, fulfilling the rites of communication.

May all living things, great and small, be bathed in your blessings.

We, the ritual officials, may have impurities of body or mind,
Or failings in ritual propriety—
Yet with all assembled officials and spirits,
Our myriad faults and sins,
We humbly pray for your boundless compassion to descend,
And grant us pardon—
Above, to honor the Divine’s boundless grace,
Below, to fulfill our collective pious devotion.

**We proclaim the Twelve Wishes.**
**We focus the spirit and burn incense.**

The High Functionary restores the censer.
The Incense Officials, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
And the attendant spirit officials of incense—
Let them command that the place where I once stood in quiet night,
Ascending the altar to practice the Dao,
Shall naturally produce golden elixirs and jade-green herbs,
Hundreds of numinous plants,
As the spirits gather here before this censer’s flames.

May the celestial children and maidens of the ten directions
Attend the fragrant mists,
And swiftly convey my sincere petition
To the presence of the Most High, the Supreme Dao of Non-Extreme,
The Three Pure Ones, the Jade Emperor of Heavenly Sovereignty.

**We proclaim the return of the Heavenly Sovereign’s crane and chariot.**

**We focus on virtue, transform wealth, and dedicate merit to the multitude.**
The *Daoist Rituals and Precepts Comprehensive Collection*, Volume Twenty-Three, concluded.
Volume Twenty-Four: *Master Du Guangting’s Edition of the Broad Chengxian Rituals.*
**The Chapter on the Worship of the Literary Star and Daoist Assembly.**

**Dispersed Altar Dao Practice**
Ritual procedures for ascending the altar as follows:

**The Master presides, and all officials bow in reverence as prescribed.**
The High Functionary recites the protective incantations of the *Ling* (spirit).

**The Five Stars shine forth, illuminating the five directions.**
The Water Star repels calamities, the Wood Star brings prosperity.
The Upholding Star (Mars) dispels misfortune, the Great White Star (Jupiter) wards off war.
The Stationary Star (Jupiter’s Retrograde) secures stability, benefiting family and state.
**May my name be inscribed on the jade tablets, my words recorded in the Imperial Registry.**
**Riding the wind’s gusts, I scatter my essence, ascending the boundless heavens.**
**Entering and exiting the unseen realm, I wander and feast across the ten directions.**
**The Five Clouds hover above, summoning spirits and controlling the winds.**
**I command the myriad numinous beings—**
**The High Functionary lights the censer,**
**And the Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin of the Three *Qi* (vital essences),**
**The Most High Dao Sovereign, the Most High Lao Sovereign,**
**Call forth my inner Three *Wu* (Five) Functionaries,**
**Left and Right Officials, Left and Right Incense Bearers,**
**Postal Dragons and mounted couriers,**
**Incense-bearing Golden Boys,**
**Petitioning Jade Maidens scattering flowers,**
**The Five Emperors’ direct talismans,**
**Direct-Day Incense Officials—**
**Thirty-six each, now emerge.**

**Those who appear must don resplendent attire,**
**Hats and sashes trailing their emblems,**
**Opening the sacred Daoist altars and summoning the local deities and domain spirits.**

**I now establish this *jiao* (ritual offering) and ascend the altar to practice the Dao.**
**With solemn sincerity, I present my petition as an inner offering—**
**All my earnest devotions have been recorded and conveyed.**
**May the Most High Dao *Qi* of the ten directions descend,**
**The numinous treasures and auspicious radiance flow into my body,**
**So that my sincere petition may swiftly reach**
**The presence of the Most High, the Supreme Dao of Non-Extreme,**
**The Three Pure Ones, the Jade Emperor of Heavenly Sovereignty.**

**Let the ritual positions be invoked.**
**In my name, [official rank] certain, along with the assembled ritual officials,**
**With united sincerity, I humbly petition:**

**The Most High Primordial Origin of Natural Emptiness,**
**Next, the Nine Sovereigns of the Nine Heavens,**
**The Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors, the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors,**
**All Heavenly Sovereigns,**
**The Purple Enclosure and Great Micro-Enclosure Imperial Throne Stars,**
**The Five Emperors, the Three Primordial Sovereigns,**
**The Thirty-Six Departments of Sacred Scriptures, the Supreme Master of Mystic Dao,**
**The Eleven Great Luminaries, the Northern Dipper and Southern Pole Stars,**
**The Twenty-Eight Constellations, the Eastern Literary Star of Merit,**
**The Seven Stars of Virtuous Worth, the Twelve Constellations of Numinous Deity,**
**The Literary Star Sovereign, the Three Platform Stars,**
**The Sovereign of Merit and Worth, the Minor Assembly Stars,**
**The Round Enclosure Stars,**
**The Supreme Pure One of the Great Micro-Enclosure, the South Red Literary Star,**
**The Nine *Qi* (vital essences) of the Literary Star Palace,**
**The Sovereign of the Starry Dipper of Life,**
**The Nine-Heavened Old Man of Qingcheng Mountain,**
**The Nine-Heavened Life Officer of the Hidden Mountain,**
**The Nine-Heavened Commissioner of Gatherings from Lushan Mountain,**
**The Five Sacred Peaks, the Four Sacred Rivers,**
**The Officers of Literary Star and Merit,**
**The Sovereign of Loyal Auxiliary and Broad Salvation,**
**The Merit Officials overseeing records and examinations,**
**The responsive *virtue/power* of Dao and Teachings,**
**All numinous spirits.**

**I have heard that the Great Dao is most tranquil,**
**Widely opening paths for prayer and petition;**
**The High Heavens are kind in response,**
**Broadly unveiling gates of deliverance and salvation.**

**With sincerity, there is sure passage;**
**With no concealment, there is no oversight.**

Thus, through fasting and purification, one may serve the Sovereign,
And with humble offerings, one may venerate the numinous spirits.
If one offers prayers with pure intent and concentrated devotion,
Surely one’s wish for celestial descent will be fulfilled.

This humble *science-officer* [醮官], **[Name]**, steadfastly upholds the Confucian path,
Aspires to success in the imperial examinations,
And earnestly hopes that the **Divine Treasures** [灵宝] may grace him with rules of reverence,
And that the **Sacred Talismans** [仙箓] may mark his rites with hallowed authority.
With utmost sincerity, I establish a solemn altar,
To atone for sins and purify my person, that my **body and vessel** [身器] may shine with clarity;
To attend the descent of the **High Worthies** [高真], that my **mind and spirit** [心神] may transcend earthly bounds.
In grand scale, I emulate the **Heavenly Pattern** [法天] and **Earthly Symbol** [象地];
In modest scope, I offer libations of water and flowers,
Reciting the **Cloud Chapters** [云章] of the *Jade Saddle* [玉笈],
And chanting the **Phoenix Scriptures** [凤篆] of the *Treasure Repository* [宝函].

Now, in perfect stillness, not a speck of dust disturbs,
Nor a murmur stirs the ten thousand sounds.
Faintly, the **jade ornaments** [琼佩] sway in resonance,
As the **Celestial Melodies** [仙韶] begin to play.
Incense swirls, sealing the **sandalwood decrees** [檀篆],
And the **vessels** [器] are cleansed, their **gourd cups** [匏樽] purified.

I humbly pray that the **Assembled Saints** [列圣] may take pity,
And that the **Numinous Worthies** [众真] may respond in harmony.
With **whirlwind chariots** [飙轮] and **cloud-borne thrones** [云驾],
Let them descend together in the **Six Void Realms** [六虚];
With **jewel-palaces** [玉宇] and **crystalline towers** [琼楼],
Let them preside over the **Nine Earthly Regions** [九地].

I summon all spirits to gather in assembly,
To partake in the **concentrated sincerity** [一意] of my devotion,
To embrace the **hundred blessings** [百禄] bestowed upon the **ornamented and dignified** [簪绅],
And to receive the **profound benevolence** [湛恩] of the **ranked and refined** [品汇].

This humble *science-officer* [醮官] and I,
With boundless reverence and earnest supplication,
Prostrate ourselves in hope of celestial favor,
To welcome the **Worthy’s Procession** [仙驾].

Descend the **Saints** [圣], offer tea,
Pour the **first libation** [初进酒], and play music.
The assembled officials, **[Name]**, with utmost devotion present this petition:

To the **Most Venerable of the Three Void Realms** [三境至尊],
The **Celestial Jade Emperor of the Highest Heaven** [昊天玉皇上帝],
And to the **Saints of All Heavens, All Earths, All Waters, All Mountains** [诸天诸地诸水诸山],
And the **Ten Directions of the Three Realms** [三界十方],
To the **Assembled Saints** [证明列圣].

I have heard that the **Great Dao** [大道] acts without action yet accomplishes all,
And that the **Supreme Saints** [上圣] save all beings without abandoning any.
The **Dao** relies upon humanity to flourish,
And **virtue/power** [德] depends upon humanity to manifest.

Thus, it is said that the **Dao** does not proceed in vain,
Nor does **virtue/power** stand alone.
Above, it draws and nurtures the **scholar-officials** [群士],
Below, it transforms and guides the **common folk** [烝人],
Expanding the **unifying wind** [抱一之风] of the **Dao**,
And opening the **keys to the utmost truth** [至真之教].

This humble *science-officer* [醮官], **[Name]**, has from early days been bathed in the **Mysterious Transformation** [玄化],
And clothed in the **Great Benevolence** [洪恩].
Though I have not yet attained the **Dao’s subtleties** [道微],
I bear the **inherent resources of the fixed and true** [固有之资],
And though I have not yet elevated my **virtuous deeds** [德业],
I possess the **innate potential of good ability** [良能之素].
Now that the **Holy Ruler** [圣主] opens the path to **worthy scholars** [进贤],
And the **examiners** [有司] display the **standards of merit** [较艺之章],
I have awakened the **pure resolve of mutual salvation** [兼济之纯衷],
And kindled the **great vow of active practice** [力行之大愿].
Thus, I rely on **auspicious omens** [羽],
And lift my gaze to the **high vault** [高穹].

What I contemplate is the **Dao**—the **Dao** accomplishes all;
What I depend upon are the **Saints**—the **Saints** abandon no being.
I lay bare my heartfelt plea with utmost sincerity,
Focusing my thoughts and refining my devotion,
Hoping to gather the **wondrous causes** [妙因],
And to swiftly fulfill my **lifelong aspirations** [素志].

The **Assembled Saints of the Circumambient Heaven** [周天众圣],
Shall surely witness my **vermilion sincerity** [丹诚];
And the **Earthly Spirits** [大地灵神],
With compassion, shall surely accept my **pure night’s offering** [清夜].

I submit this petition with solemn reverence—
How dare I fail to present it above?
The **science-officer’s words** [醮词] are sincere,
And I shall faithfully proclaim them.

**Proclamation of the Petition.**

With careful scrutiny of the words,
And piercing insight into the **supreme sincerity** [至诚],
My **heart’s design** [心画] ascends to the **Highest** [上通],
And immediately reaches the **Worthy’s hearing** [高真之听];
The **benevolent light** [慈光] descends to illuminate below,
And surely grants the **desired compliance** [所欲之从].

The **Dao-official** of humble station reflects deeply—
How rare the chance of life’s encounter,
How swiftly the years pass by!
He strives to master learning in anticipation of inquiry,
Hoping to fulfill his aspirations and act upon them.

With deepest reverence, he prays:
May the **Dao’s luminous grace** descend and spread,
May **Heaven’s blessings** be vast and far-reaching,
Purifying the sins of all living beings,
So that he may harmonize with the **prosperous age’s** examinations,
Find his **true master** and meet his **proper time**,
Practice **righteousness** and thereby realize the **Way**.

He humbly hopes that his **ancestors of old**—
Both near and distant, both high and low—
May forever depart the **dark paths**,
Ascending to the **Nine Heavens’** divine ranks;
May their **dense blessings** descend eternally,
Transmitting the **hundred-leaf glory** to posterity.

The **Dao-officials** kneel with utmost devotion,
Offering wine in the **second libation**.
*Music plays.*

They have heard that the **Great Dao** is profound and wondrous,
Shaping all with a single **qi**;
The **Supreme Truth** is natural and spontaneous,
Nurturing all with a single **spirit**.
**Qi** permeates and unites all things,
**Spirit** animates and inspires the multitude—
Though their names differ, they arise from one source,
Mingling as one, yet unseen by things,
Yet endowed in humans as **soul**.
Thus, the **most noble body** is truly a **vessel of the True**,
Whereby its **mysteries** unfold,
And its **heavenly depths** are preserved.
To achieve this harmony of function,
One must ensure **longevity’s permanence**.

The **Dao-official** receives **divine qi** from the **Great Dao**,
And cultivates his **affairs** as a **scholar**.
Like a **sprout that blossoms**,
He must then be worthy of **action**;
Like a **blossom that bears fruit**,
He must then be capable of **fulfillment**.

With deepest prayer, he beseeches the **Worthy Ones**—
May they **springtime regard** him,
May the **Holy Saints** illuminate his path,
Descending **true spirits** to nurture his **spirit**,
Flowing **Dao-qi** to fill his **qi**.
If granted **clever wisdom**,
He shall surely be bestowed with **honored name**;
If granted **honored name**,
He shall surely be extended **longevity’s grace**.
Thus, his **sincere heart’s intent** may take effect,
And the **vision of mutual aid** be realized.

He humbly hopes that his **present revered elders**—
May their **calamities be dispelled**,
Their **auspicious signs** gather,
Their **pine-like faces** resist aging,
Their **jade-like essence** endure eternally,
So that **blessings** may flourish in the future,
And **pure fragrance** descend upon descendants.

The **Dao-officials** kneel with utmost devotion,
Offering wine in the **final libation**.
*Music plays.*

With solemn sincerity, they petition above:
To the **Supreme, Boundless Great Dao**,
The **Three Sovereigns of Ultimate Veneration**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven’s Highest Court**,
The **Ten Directions’ Great Saints**,
The **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Masters of Esoteric Law**,
The **Soul Jewel’s Assembled Worthies**,
The **Five Emperors and Three Officials**,
The **Celestial Bureaucracy of the Round Sky’s Mysterious Symbols**—
All **spirits and immortals**,
The **Holy Multitudes of the Cavernous Peaks and Sacred Waters**,
The **Officials of Destiny and Merit**,
The **True Prince Who Oversees Sacrificial Offerings**,
The **Registrars and Examiners of Moral Worth**,
All **responsive moral forces** and **true spirits**.

They have heard:
Though the **mysteries** are unobserved, their **auspices** are manifest;
Though **stillness** is clear and **tranquil**, **movement** brings forth life.
To enter **being** without losing **non-being**,
Though responding to **action**, one must not depart from **stillness**.
This is how the **Dao’s function** operates,
And how **virtue’s practice** is realized.

Since the **Ancient Worthies** decreed the **eternal patterns**,
They valued **diligent learning** and **entering governance**,
Not neglecting the **ruler-subject relationship**,
Thus upholding the **moral winds** of the **Way**.

The **Dao-official**, reverently following the **True Principles**,
Duly examining the **Sages’ instructions**,
Eagerly cultivating his **self**,
Anxiously seeking his **sovereign**,
With a **single, upright heart**, awaiting his **time**,
To respond to the **pure dynasty’s** selection.

With deepest prayer, he beseeches:
May the **Emperor** awaken his **wisdom**,
May the **Spirits** guide his **innermost sincerity**,
So that he may **penetrate the mysterious roots**,
Forever unfolding the **mysteries’ functions**,
Storing **rainbow-hued treasures** in his **chest**,
Displaying **embroidered brilliance** at his **pen’s tip**,
Swiftly advancing upon the **great thoroughfare**,
Practicing **scholarly affairs**,
Above, wishing the **Emperor** **longevity without bound**,
That **virtuous ministers** may fulfill their **assisting roles**,
That the **five grains** flourish as the **five offerings** are refined,
And that the **four seas** be at peace while the **nine barbarians** submit.

The **Dao-officials**, with no words to express their **gratitude and reverence**,
Kneel and present the **soup offering**.
*The proclamation is declared.*

The **officers of the assembly**, with utmost sincerity, petition above:
To the **Golden Gate’s Void Three Pure Ones**,
The **Six Celestial Sovereigns of Heaven’s Highest Court**,
The **Heavenly Worthies** and **Heavenly Emperors**,
The **Soul Jewel’s Assembled Worthies**,
The **Five Emperors and Three Officials**,
The **Celestial Bureaucracy of the Round Sky’s Mysterious Symbols**—
All **spirits and immortals**,
The **Holy Multitudes of the Cavernous Peaks and Sacred Waters**,
The **Officials of Destiny and Merit**,
The **True Prince Who Oversees Sacrificial Offerings**,
The **Registrars and Examiners of Moral Worth**,
All **responsive moral forces** and **true spirits**.

They have heard:
The **Sages’ writings** unfold the **Heaven’s profound intent**;
The **examination system** follows the **Jade Records**,
Establishing the **sacred platform for merit’s invocation**.
The **offerings** are now presented,
The **fragrant sacrifices** prepared—
The **Dragon’s chariot** lingers through the **eternal night**,
The **cinnamon wine** ascends in **three reverent libations**.

The **Grand Music Master’s** **august spirit** descends to the **impure realm**,
The **Hundred Spirits’ Sovereign Ruler** pierces through to the **heart-mind**.

The humble petitioner, together with the **officiants of the Daoist ritual (jiào)** and others,

In past lives and this present existence,
Has never yet awakened to the **Dao/Way**;

The **six senses** and **three activities**,
Long steeped in transgressions and errors,
Either killing and harming **sentient beings (yǒuqíng)**,
Or encroaching upon the **common folk (shùlèi)**,
Betraying the **true spirits (zhēn)** and straying from the **Dao/Way**,
Thus committing misdeeds and accumulating guilt,
Our crimes reaching the **Upper Palaces (Shàng Gōng)**,
Our names inscribed in the **Black Registers (hēi bù)**.

Some are bound within the **Seven Elemental Bureaus (Qí Yuán Cáochú)**,
Some within the **Three Officials’ Palaces (Sān Guān Gōngfǔ)**,
Some as **keepers of the Five Sacred Peaks (Wǔ Yuè zhǐshǐ)**,
Some as **clerks of the Four Sacred Waters (Sì Dú zhǔshǔ)**,
Yet we have not received pardon,
Nor have we repented and been absolved.

Again, we fear the **Seven Celestial Luminaries (Qí Yào)**** may descend with censure,
The **Five Agents (Wǔ Xíng)** may inflict retribution,
The **branches and stems (zhīgàn)** of our fate may be exhausted,
Our **great and minor destinies (dàxiǎo yùn)** may reach their end,
Our **three life-spans (sān mìng)** may decline,
The **Nine Celestial Palaces (Jiǔ Gōng)** may be blocked,
**Curses and hexes (zhòuzhòu)** may become obstacles,
**Litigious specters (zhǒngsòng)** may bring calamity—
Unless we entrust ourselves to the **Highest True Ones (Shàngzhēn)**,
There is no means for redemption and release.

Now, we humbly extend our **repentance and purification (chànxǐ)****,
Hoping for universal **pardon and absolution (shèchú)**.
We pray that the **ancestral halls (Zōngmiào)** may be forever safeguarded,
That **arms and conflict (gāngē)**** may forever cease,
That the people shall be free from **epidemic afflictions (yìlì)**,
And the times shall know no **deficiencies of water or drought (shuǐhàn)**.

That the **worthy and talented (xiánjùn)**** may rise to office,
That **thieves and bandits (dào zéi)**** may vanish,
That **barbarians and outsiders (mán yí)**** may submit in harmony,
And that **auspicious qi** may flow universally—
Far and near, all shall cease to voice complaints,
And **all living things** shall flourish in their **natural inclinations**.

That the **Three Paths of Suffering (sān tú)**** may be abandoned,
And the **Six Realms of Rebirth (liù cù)**** may be transcended—
Long receiving the **blessings of the Ultimate Dao/Way (Zhìdào)**,
Forever repaying the **transformations of the Highest True Ones (Gāozhēn)**.

Now, the rites are complete with **three reverent libations (sān xiàn)**,
And no further words need be spoken—
We dread the **ritual lapses (yíjiǔ)**** that may befall,
The **faults of the common and unenlightened (fán yú)**,
And the **profanity (xièdú)**** of our humble acts—
All are earnestly implored for **pardon and forgiveness**.

We look upward, hoping the **Highest True Ones of the Upper Realm (Shàngjiè Gāozhēn)****
May swiftly return to the **Jade Gates (Yáo què)**;
And below, that the **ranked Saints of the mortal world (Lièshèng)****
May once more ascend to the **Palaces of the True Spirits (Xiān cáochú)**.

May the **radiant light (liúguāng)**** return to our ritual hall,
And all our **sincere supplications (sùyuàn)**** be answered.

The humble petitioner and the **officiants of the Daoist ritual (jiào)**,
With no words to express our deepest gratitude—
In truth, trembling and fearful,
We **kneel and prostrate ourselves (qǐshǒu dùnshǒu)**,
Twice bowing to offer the **True Saints (Zhēnshèng)**.
