The humble servant hears that the transformations of the Most High God must be measured by those who follow the Dao in their deeds, and the gates of all wonders must be sought by those who grasp the mysteries of wondrous things. In silent exploration of the ever-renewing principle, and in secret mastery of the ceaseless functions, all things flow in form, spanning heaven and coiling earth. Only the august Sovereigns of the Three Realms and the ranked Saints of the Ten Directions are vast beyond the rivers and seas, lofty beyond the mountains and peaks—yet their blessings endure through the unbroken lineage of their descendants, and their virtue is revered by all virtuous folk.

The **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name] of modest virtue, though unaware of his own merit, has accumulated good deeds that now shine forth. At the outset, he sought the harmony of his descendants; at the end, he prayed that this son might be forever preserved. Together, they align their forms with the Nine Qi and share their fate with the Three Primordials. The **Born Gods** respond in reverence as they do in song, and the **Minister of Fate** obeys with respect as he does with deference. They examine the month of birth and expand the functions of life, harmonizing the Six Qi at the Great Balance and opening the Eight Desolations into the Domain of Longevity. Thus may they attain enduring blessings and maintain a solemn, reverent heart.

In accordance with the Daoist rites, I now invoke the True Vehicles, praying for the prosperity of my descendants from the Sacred Axis and offering sincere devotion to the Jade Void. As the first wishes are uttered and the grand rites commence, I give thanks to Heaven and Earth for their creative grace and pray for the longevity and prosperity of my descendants. The humble servants, with utmost reverence, prostrate themselves twice and present incense. Pure tea is offered in tribute. Flowers are scattered.

With sincere hearts, we now address the **Natural Three Pure Ones of the Void**, the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**, and the ranked Saints of the Three Realms and Ten Directions.

The humble servant hears that the **Work of Transformation** secretly moves within the floating, dreamlike realms of the **Dharma Realm**, while the **Great Dao** remains hidden yet reveals its virtue of nurturing life. It divides the Three Talents to establish order and distributes the Nine Qi to form all things. All people under heaven are born through the nurturing of their parents, yet their essence connects to the **Jade Purity**, and their spirits are transformed by the **Primordial Origin** as it sows its essence and moves its spirit, universally delivering all beings.

Thus, reflecting inward, one finds that one’s fate is decreed by Heaven. Since the **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name], took his wife, no child has been born. Fearful of failing to uphold the ancestral rites and grieving that the line of sacrifice may not continue, he now humbly appeals to the High Saints, guiding and welcoming their blessings. With sincere devotion, he follows the ritual precepts and invokes the sacred altar.

Now, as incense is burned, I turn my body, my spirit, and my fate toward the **Boundless Dao of the Ten Directions**, wishing to dedicate these merits to all beings, seen and unseen. May the Three Realms shine their light, and all spirits guard and protect. May they perceive this sincere red heart and illuminate it, and may the winds of the **Celestial Chariot** descend to attend. May my petition be inscribed in the Imperial heart, and may my descendants flourish eternally. The divine response shall be conveyed to the **Supreme True Boundless Dao** on high.

**Chanting the Square**, **Repentance**, **Three Invocations**, **Three Offerings**. The **True Scriptures** are proclaimed. The **Law Positions** are solemnly repeated. The humble servants, [Name] and the assembled officials of the altar, with sincere hearts, now address:

The **Supreme Boundless Dao**, the **Sovereigns of the Three Realms**, the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**, the **Great Sovereign Emperor of the Hook-and-Line**, the **Great Sovereign Emperor of the Purple Forbidden Enclosure and Northern Pole**, the **Earthly Sovereign Empress Who Follows Heaven’s Law**, the **Nine Sovereign Emperors of the Divine Constellations**, the **Celestial Sovereign Emperors**, the **Celestial Sovereign Emperors of All Realms**, and all **True Spirits** who respond to invocation.

The humble servant hears that in the **Primordial Ancestral Eon**, the **Origin** gave birth to all heavens; when the **Two Complements** emerged from the womb, the vast oceans and lands were established. The seven orifices were carved from **Chaos**, and the five sacred marks were planted by the **Divine**. When the winds return, they fan the **Azure Palace** with empty song; when the mists gather, they pierce the **Purple Void** with lush brilliance. Distinguishing life and classifying beings, they open the way for all things and fulfill their functions; observing footsteps and omens, they reveal the lessons of blessing the virtuous and punishing the licentious. All transformations of things dare not ignore this heartfelt devotion.

The **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name], has cultivated the cause of countless eons and the Daoic nourishment of the Three Primordials. Reflecting on the aged without children—called "lonely"—he laments the plight of the common folk, yet knows that Heaven’s greatest virtue is to give life. Thus, he follows the ancient teachings and devotes himself to incense and offerings, humbly beseeching mercy.

Though unworthy, the humble servants have been entrusted with this ritual office and now reverently perform the **Taoist Rites**. To preserve the living and restore the extinct is to rely upon Heaven’s might; to benefit all beings and nurture life is to spread the Dao’s transformations. With sincere hearts, we dare not fail to report this, and with true devotion, we now proclaim our petition.

The words are examined in detail, and the utmost sincerity is revealed. We humbly pray for Heaven’s attentive ear and its gracious, far-reaching blessings. We consider the officials of the Nine Heavens and the ministers of the Three Realms—those who record crimes and deeds, who always present their petitions in order. Both seen and unseen shall rely upon this, with nothing great or small omitted.

Now, the **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name], has purified his spirit and devoutly observed the fasts, modeling himself after Heaven and Earth. He has erected the star altar, offered water and flowers, and taken refuge in the Dao’s treasures. He recites the **Sacred Chapters** at noon and in the pure night, presenting cloud-inscriptions to the heavens. The **Upper Saints** descend, and our highest wishes are extended. Incense is burned to demonstrate sincerity, spread throughout the Ten Directions; lamps are lit to continue their glow, illuminating the Nine Nights.

In accordance with the fast’s precepts, we now host the invocation and report it to the **Supreme Three Honored Ones**, the **Ten-Directional Saints**, the **Great True Master of the Mysterious**, the **Supervising Master of the Fast**, the **Most Sacred Treasures of the Lingbao**, and the officials of the Three Realms. May they descend to inspect and review what has been presented.

We pray that the **Attendant Spirits of the Scripture**, the **Supervising Officials of the Ministry of Punishments**, and the **True Officials of the Lands and Districts** may cooperate in heart and strength, encircling and guarding, sweeping away external forces, purifying the altar, subduing demons and spirits, and annihilating malevolent influences. Thus may we attain peace of mind and stillness of spirit, with divine responses clearly communicated. When the rites are complete, we shall continue to report, and the fast shall be fulfilled without obstruction.

On the following morning, the Dao will be enacted, and further reports shall be made. This is now declared.

**The Twelve Vows** are recited. The incense burner is relit. The **Incense Officials and Messengers**, the **Left and Right Dragon and Tiger Lords**, and the **Attending Spirits of the Incense** shall now cause the place where the humble servant has invoked the Dao to naturally produce **golden elixir and jade-green herbs**, **hundreds of sacred plants**, and the gathering of all True Ones before this incense burner.

The **Twelve Vows** are fulfilled. The incense burner is reignited.

The **Incense Officials and Messengers**, the **Left and Right Dragon and Tiger Lords**, and the **Attending Spirits of the Incense** shall now cause the place where the humble servant has invoked the Dao to naturally produce **golden elixir and jade-green herbs**, **hundreds of sacred plants**, and the gathering of all True Ones before this incense burner.

---

On this morning of purity, the Dao is enacted as prescribed. The rites are performed in full. The **Incense Officials and Messengers** solemnly offer their obeisance to the Master, invoking his presence as per the Dao.

The **Vigilant Spirit Incantations** are proclaimed: the **Green Yang Illumination** shines forth, its radiance returning the sun’s essence. The **Divine Tiger Repels Evil**, its celestial bells tolling as it soars. The **Subduing of Deceit and Annihilation of Trials** binds all ten thousand demons in form. The **Nine Mysteries Revert to the Dao**, the **Eight Wonders Subdue Spirits**. The **Thousand True Ones** inspect and verify, the **Three Elements** disperse impurities. The **Left Whistle** summons the **Central Yellow**, the **Right Drum** commands the **Six Ding**.

Through **Seven Rotations and Eight Harmonies**, they circle the **Celestial Scriptures**. The **Sacred Transformation** stands majestic, the **Great Dao** now unfolding. The **Auspicious Clouds** flow and spread, merging with the **Yellow Court of Illumination**, their essence blending with the **True Dao of the Way**.

The **Supreme Law Drum** is struck **twenty-four times**.

The **Three Sovereigns of the Highest Heaven**—**Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Three Essences**, **Supreme Daoist Lord**, and **Supreme Old Lord**—now summon from within the humble servant’s body:
- the **Three Five Officials of Destiny**,
- the **Left and Right Officials and Messengers**,
- the **Left and Right Incense-Bearers**,
- the **Postal Dragon and Mounted Officials**,
- the **Golden Boys Attending the Incense**,
- the **Jade Girls of Transmission and Scattering Flowers**,
- the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**,
- the **Direct Incense Officials of the Sun**,
each in groups of **thirty-six**.

Those who emerge are clad in **splendid robes and official attire**, their **headgear and ribbons** trailing in reverence. They open the **Mysterious Daoist Altars** to the **Local Deities and Territorial Spirits**, and to the **Divine Ones of the Realm**.

Now, on this morning of purity, as the humble servant invokes the Dao, we earnestly pray that the **Supreme Dao of the Ten Directions**, the **Numinous Treasure of Illuminating Light**, may descend and flow into the servant’s body, ensuring that all supplications are swiftly conveyed to the **Supreme Dao of the Highest Heaven** and the **Celestial Sovereign of Jade Clarity**.

We request the **Proclamation of the Daoist Stations**.

The humble servant, **[Name]**, along with the **Assembled Officials at the Altar**, now presents our **sincere and united invocation** to:
- the **Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Void and Naturalness**,
- the **Numinous Treasure of the Jade Dawn Dao**,
- the **Moral Teacher, Master of All Heavens**,
- the **Celestial Sovereign of Jade Clarity, Supreme Emperor of the Highest Heaven**,
- the **Great Emperor of the Starry Enclosure of the Horned One**,
- the **Imperial Master of the Central Heavenly Stars, the Purple Forbidden of the Northern Pole**,
- the **Earthly Sovereign of the Posterior Soil, who Follows Heaven’s Law**,
- the **True King of the Divine Morning, the Great Emperor of Eternal Life**,
- the **Great Emperor of the Green and Flowery, who Binds the Extremes and Records Life**,
- the **Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Three Elements, the Auspicious Thunderous Emperor**,
- the **Supreme Emperor of the Nine Heavens’ Thunderous Ancestor**,
- the **Great Emperor of the Highest One, the Purple Microcosm and Azure Jade Palace**,
- the **Great Emperor of the Six Heavens and Six Abysses**,
- the **Imperial Master of the Six Waves**,
- the **Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Nine Heavens, who Loves Life and Preserves the Good, the Lord of the Celestial Balance**,
- the **True Lord of the Nine Heavens, who Inspects and Visits, Responds to the Primordial and Preserves the Destiny**,
- the **Supreme Emperor of the Nine Heavens**,
- the **Supreme Emperor of the Thirty-Two Heavens**,
- the **Supreme Emperor of the Five Elders**,
- the **Daoist Lord of the Eastern Hua, the Wooden Official**,
- the **Daoist Lord of the Western Ling, the Golden Mother**,
- the **Imperial Master of the Sun’s Palace**,
- the **Celestial Sovereign of the Moon’s Abode**,
- the **Five Directions’ Five Virtues Star Lords**,
- the **Twenty-Eight Constellations Star Lords**,
- the **Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper**,
- the **Six Primordial Lords of the Southern Dipper**,
- the **Supreme True Lord of the Five Blessings and Ten Spirits**,
- the **Four Residual and Four Radiant Star Lords of the Highest Purity**,
- the **True Lords of the Celestial Tribunals**,
- the **Three Element and Three Official Great Emperors**,
- the **Heavenly Lords of the Three Celestial Provinces, the Three Ministers, and the Three Counsellors**,
- the **True Lord of the Supreme Daoist Master of the Mysterious Middle**,
- the **True Lord of the Supreme Daoist Master of the Three Heavens**,
- the **Four Sacred True Lords of the Northern Pole**,
- the **True Lord of the Supreme Daoist Master of the Thunderous Court**,
- the **Nine Officials of the Thunderous Court**,
- the **True Lord of the Nine Heavens, who Records Life and Oversees Birth**,
- the **Celestial Lord of the Nine Heavens, who Directs the Bestowal of Fortune, the Lord of the Azure Cavern**,
- the **Divine Mother of the Nine Heavens’ Vigilant Hall**,
- the **True Lords of the Three Heavens’ Provincial Offices, the Three Elements’ Departments, the Talismanic and Scriptural Divisions, and the Masters of Daoist Rituals**,
- the **Three Primordial Lords of the Three Heavens’ Gate**,
- the **Spiritual Officials of the Sacred Petitions and Proclamations**,
- the **Five Sacred Emperors of the Five Mountains**,
- the **Divine Officials of the Celestial Peaks, Blessed Terrains, and the Calm Abodes of Transformation**,
- the **Primordial Daoist Master of the Original Peace**,
- the **Assembled True Ones**,
- the **True Lords who Guide the Scriptures and Rituals**,
- the **Great Emperor of the Northern Darkness, the Primordial Sovereign of the Black Capital**,
- the **Great Emperor of the Eastern Blaze, the Pillar of the Sun’s Forest**,
- the **Four River and Four Marsh, Five Lake and Four Sea Dragon Kings**,
- the **Direct Rulers of Mountains and Streams**,
- the **Two True Lords of the Nine Heavens’ Golden and Jade Gates, the Lords of Spiritual Salvation and Abundant Grace**,
and the **Yearly Seasonal Deities of Wind, Thunder, Rain, and the Mighty Sacred Hosts**, as well as the **City Deities and Local Shrines**, and all **True Spirits**.

We, the humble servants, hear that there exists a **Substance of Chaos**, which gave rise to the **manifested** before **Heaven and Earth**; and that there is a **Void of Independence**, which transcends even **Yin and Yang**.

---

Though it may be recorded without seeing its form,
And though its name be unknown, it is called **Dao**.

Thus, the **Yang** abides in **Great Xia**,
Nurturing and fostering all things as its duty.
The **Heavenly Ancestor** encompasses all beings,
And embraces and covers all without distinction.

All things, great and small, are entirely entrusted to its cultivation.
Without words, it is understood;
The four seasons proceed, and all things are born.
No malevolent *qi* can prevail—
The five grains ripen, and the myriad people flourish.
The **transformative work** depends upon it,
And blessings are bestowed in due measure.

The **Temple Official** [Name], having long cultivated virtuous roots,
Has now heard the **True Dao**.
Reflecting upon himself and acknowledging faults,
How dare he not reverently fear the **Celestial Above**,
And observe the precepts while fasting in devotion,
Hoping to appease the **Childless**,
That I, the humble servant, may present this plea,
And seek the **Sage’s return and reliance**,
With sincere words at dawn,
Dutifully declaring my intent.

**Proclamation of Words:**
As stated in the petition, the sincerity is profound and earnest.
With reverence, I await the **Celestial’s gracious hearing**,
And humbly beg for **merciful indulgence**.
I pray for the **greatest of blessings**,
That my **long-lasting prayers** may be granted.

I have heard that the *Yijing* speaks of the **Great Ultimate**,
From which the **Two Principles** arise.
Great is the **Primordial of Heaven**,
The origin of all things.
All who dwell beneath Heaven and tread upon Earth
Naturally balance **Yin and Yang**.
Those who receive the **Great Dao** attain a nature of **Purity and Harmony**;
Those who receive but little manifest as **soaring and crawling creatures**.
Thus, no thing fails to be nourished by **dew and rain**,
And all sentient beings emerge from **molding and refining**.

All who rely upon this **transformative birth**—
How dare we forget to return and align with it?
Though the **sunflower’s heart** be distant,
Its sincerity still turns toward the **Sun**;
Though the **otter’s sacrifice** be humble,
It still performs rites to **Heaven**.
How much more so for those in **humanity’s path**,
Residing in this **transitional age**—
With offerings and prayers,
We must be **precise and singular** in devotion.

The **Temple Official** [Name], in fasting and ceremonial attire,
Choosing this auspicious day,
Reverently obeys the **Celestial Above**,
And solemnly serves the **Most High Emperor**.
Hoping the **hundred spirits** will come to witness,
I pray that **one prayer may yield a son**,
Fulfilling my supplication,
And glorifying the **transformative power**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **first incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Dao Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To bless the **Current Emperor of China**.
May he and his **descendants for a hundred generations** live **ten thousand years**,
With **royal lineage secure** and **Heaven’s decree fulfilled**.
Following **Jiang Yuan’s** footsteps in **military virtue**,
Nurturing the people as **Di Xin** did;
Exceeding **Di Jian’s** prayers to Heaven,
And receiving the **auspicious phoenix**.
Enhancing the **prosperity of the ancestral halls**,
And fulfilling the **blessings of longevity**,
May this grace extend to the **Temple Official**,
And flow to his **future descendants**.

Thus, the **ancestral halls** shall flourish like **sage and bamboo**;
**Sincerity in harmony with Heaven** shall bring **auspicious cranes and harmonious offspring**.
Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Dao’s Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **preserve Heaven’s eternal life**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **second incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Scriptural Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To the **Spirits of the State and Ancestral Temples, the Revered and Sacred Forefathers**.

May the **clan and ancestral halls** be **cared for with compassion**,
And the **ancestral temples** maintained in **solemn reverence**.
Though the **ancestors above** may be distant,
Their blessings extend as **nine autumns of longevity**;
The **glory of the lineage** shall align with **Heaven’s decree**,
And **match the Emperor’s virtue without partiality**.
Descending to the **Temple Official**,
May **ancestral grace** be bestowed upon his **forebears**,
And may he **joyfully ascend to the Imperial Abode**,
His praises **resounding in the Celestial Court**;
His **sorrowful incense** shall **shine in the divine *qi***,
And his **humble offerings** shall **bring blessings to the living**.

Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Scriptural Treasures’ Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **preserve eternal life**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **third incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Master Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To **all distant and near, encompassing the dim and the luminous**.

May the **three luminaries** move in **harmonious order**,
And the **four seas** unite in **civilization**;
May **floods and droughts** be forever **dissipated**,
And **wars and punishments** **cease**.
Let there be **five days of wind and ten days of rain**,
Without fear of **broken branches or shattered earth**;
Let there be **ten thousand granaries and ten thousand chests**,
With **ease in tilling and reaping**.
May **one household’s blessings** extend to **all under Heaven**,
And all **share in the happiness of Hua Xu**,
Ascending to the **Mystic and Wondrous**.

Even the **calf of the plow-ox** shall bear **fine horns and multiply**;
The **old clam** shall **radiate brilliance**, its **pearls fully formed**.
Grace shall be **equally bestowed upon all living things**,
Each fulfilling its **natural destiny**.

Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Master Treasures’ Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **permanently prosper and flourish**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

**Chant the Square**, **Confess the Square**, **Three Invocations**, **Three Rites**.
Reaffirm the **Law’s station**.
The **officiating servants** [Names],
With **sincere hearts**, now **humbly present our petition** to:
The **Supreme and Limitless Dao**,
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
The **Responsive Deities of the Three Realms**,
And **all True Spirits**.

I have heard that when **disaster strikes**, one should **fear and reflect**,
And **great virtue** shall **descend in guidance**.
Seeing **goodness**, one must **follow its path**,
As the **Teachings of Righteousness** instruct.
**Heaven is supreme**—
**Repentance must come first**.
When **sacrificial rains return** and **winds reverse**,
**Bright Virtue** is **manifested**.
When **Mars retreats**,
It **aligns with virtuous speech**.
Though it may lack **sound or scent to trace**,
Its response is **as certain as the echo of a hollow vessel**.

「Then how much more so for wicked men who fast and bathe in purification,
Yet still may **manifest reverence** before the **Supreme Emperor**;
For the **Noble Ones** who fear and reflect in **self-cultivation**,
May also **preside over sacrifices** as the eldest sons.

Not only do they transform calamity into auspicious fortune,
But they turn hearts back toward the **Dao/Way**.
This **Dao/Way** is the **Supreme and Limitless Dao**,
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
The **Responsive Deities of the Three Realms**,
And **all True Spirits**.

I, **a Daoist Official**, humbly reflect:
Since my **past lives** until this present birth,
My **mind-monkeys** have galloped wild,
My **heart-demons** have raged unrestrained,
Shaming **Heaven and Earth**,
Defaming **sages and teachers**,
Disobeying my **two parents**,
Severing ties with my **nine clans**.
I have **forgotten filial piety**, neglected rites—
Sometimes **not venerating** my **ancestors**;
Or **abandoning children**, **destroying fetuses**,
Long ago **inflicting harm** upon my own **kin**.

With **treacherous deceit**, I **offend superiors**,
Conceal the **virtuous**, harm the **able**,
Gleefully **corrupt** without restraint,
**Hoarding grain** while ignoring the people’s suffering.
If **profit** lies at the **tip of a needle**,
I **privately covet** **honor and wealth** in **land monopolies**;
I **rejoice in disaster**, **delight in others’ ruin**,
**Arbitrarily severing** the **sacrifices of rival sects**;
**Exploiting orphans**, **ravaging graves**,
**Cunningly expanding** my own **fields and gardens**.

I **lack compassion**—
My deeds are those of the **tyrant and oppressor**.

Or I **burn mountains**, **exhaust marshes**,
**Boil silkworms**, **overturn nests**,
**Wrongfully harming** **all living beings**,
Yet **unfulfilled** my **past karmic debts**,
**Bringing ruin upon myself**,
And thus **offending the Divine**.

Or as a **subject**, I **fail in loyalty**,
**Condemning men to death** under false pretenses.
I **exhaust the people**, **disturb the masses**,
Becoming the **chief of calamity** in an age;
I **hold office without merit**, **feasting idly**,
**Wasting Heaven’s work** among the **hundred officials**.
I **fell the sacred cows** of **Mount Niu**,
**Piercing the vast net** of **Heaven’s justice**.

All my actions—
**None know their limits**,
And if one **engages in such deeds**,
**None shall escape ruin**,
Leading to **licentious partners** in my home,
And **extinction of my lineage**,
**Lacking virtue and greatness**,
My **clan shall fall**.

These are the **precepts of the sages**,
And **Heaven’s will** is **dreadful indeed**.
Thus, I **preserve sincerity**, **purify myself**,
**Rectify my past**, **cultivate my future**,
With **vigilant devotion** all day long,
And **trepidation** in my smallest thoughts,
**Confessing my karmic sins**,
And **humbly beseeching mercy**.

I pray that the **vast and august Heaven**,
The **magnificent Sovereign Emperor**,
May **unleash the great virtue of life-giving**,
And **bestow boundless compassion**,
So that **all may renew their hearts**,
And **this humble clan** alone **may be spared**,
Its **lineage preserved**, its **rites upheld**.
**Nurturing and sustaining life**,
May we **raise noble offspring** like **lan and jade** in the courtyard;
**To inherit and continue**,
May we **learn the arts** of **archery and metallurgy**,
Like **Ji and You**—
So that the **Eight Dragons of the Xun Clan** may **not shame**,
Nor the **Three Phoenixes of Hedong** **be dishonored**,
And may we **receive Heaven’s favor**,
**Emulate the virtuous descendants** of the **Empress**.

My **earnest prayers** are **offered day and night**,
And **prolific blessings** depend **on moral cultivation**.
The **lonely one in Zhao** became a **feudal lord for ten generations**,
And the **meritorious in Liang** was a **prime minister for eight**;
Some **advised their rulers** and **earned descendants** like **Zang and Sun**,
Others **accumulated hidden virtue** and **were trusted** like **the Bing Clan**.

Though **publicly renowned** like **Zhang Tang and Yang Shen**,
Even if **one or two** were counted,
Though **a thousand or ten thousand** were named,
**None would be exhaustive**—
These are the **hundred auspicious signs** of **doing good**,
And **Heaven’s aid** comes **from a single virtue**.

If **one perseveres in difficulty** afterward,
**Dragged by past deeds**,
Yet **reviews ancient precedents**,
**Heaven’s warnings** remain clear.

The **Han Marquis** who **broke the law**—
His **clan perished** in **four or five generations**, leaving **no survivors**.
**Yu Xu** who **harbored many grudges**—
His **lineage died out** in **twenty years**, **not passing a single mouth**.

Some **schemed treacherously** and **overthrew their rulers**,
Others **plotted to destroy** the **Three Dynasties** and **ruin their clans**.
Even if **one receives the jade seal** and **falls into disgrace**,
**Evil retribution** shall **still be incurred**;
If **one marries first** and **buries their parents last**,
**How can auspicious fortune** be **guaranteed**?

Yet **Heaven’s condemnation** is **plainly evident**,
Even if **other virtues** exist, **none can redeem** it.
If **one sees their faults** and **reflects inwardly**,
They shall **return to righteousness**—
**No greater joy** than this.

I, **a humble petitioner**, dare **not defy Heaven’s might**,
But **submit to the creative transformation**,
And **pledge from this day forward**,
Until **future lives**,
To **rectify my errors** and **renew my heart**,
And thus **invite auspicious fortune** and **gather blessings**.

**Life and its beginnings** rely **on the interplay of Heaven and Earth**,
**Form and completion** owe **their debt to Heaven and Earth**.
**Early signs of good fortune** descend,
**To comfort all beneath**,
And **to reveal Heaven’s great mercy**,
While **below**, my **sincere submission** is **fulfilled**—
Thus, I **humbly present** this **petition**.

**Twelve Vows** are **restored**.
The **Incense Official and Messengers**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals**,
And the **Attendant Spirits of Incense**,
Shall **command** that at my **former sites of Daoist practice**,
**Golden elixir and emerald dew**,
**Mushrooms and herbs of all kinds**,
And **gathered True Spirits**,

I **hope to convey sincere devotion** [庶通蠲洁之诚],
To **reach the lineage of Auspicious Prosperity** [以格蕃昌之裔].

**With deepest reverence, I pray:**
That the **Heavenly Mother of the Nine Heavens** [九天圣母]
**Descends upon the Cloud-Carriage** [浮驾云轮],
And the **Eight-Directional Fetal Deities** [八方胎神]
**Each lead their respective officials** [各领官属].
May they **dispense the breath of Supreme Truth** [流布至真之气],
And **irrigate the gates of prenatal life** [灌溉胞命之门].
May the **Fetal Essence be knotted in the Yellow Chamber** [胎元结於黄房],
And the **Auspicious Smoke seal the doors of mortality** [祥烟塞於死户].

At the **auspicious month and favorable day** [时贵月吉],
When the **Three Realms gather in unison** [拥三界以齐临],
And **form and spirit are complete** [形具神全],
May they **preserve the Ten Thousand Spirits in celebration** [保万灵而称庆].
I **trust in Heaven’s blessings** [允获自天之佑],
And **lean upon the benevolent grace of the Celestial Deities** [旁依锡类之仁].

Thus, **my descendants and their descendants** [乃子乃孙],
May **build halls and construct ancestral temples** [肯堂肯构],
**Honoring the Heavenly Emperor’s vast mercy** [上明天尊大慈之泽],
And **fulfilling our sincere submission to fate** [下副臣等皈命之诚].
**Respectfully declared and submitted** [谨启以闻].
**Twelve Petitions** [十二愿].
**Reignite the Incense Altar** [复炉].
**Incense Officials and Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and Attendant Spirits of Fragrant Incense** [香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官],
May **command my humble servant to ascend to the Daoist practice at the meridian hour** [当令臣向来临午行道之所],
Where **golden nectar and crimson elixir naturally form** [自然生金液丹碧],
And **mushroom sprouts and myriad sacred herbs flourish** [芝英百灵].
May **all True Spirits gather here before this incense altar** [众真交会],
And **my sincere petitions be swiftly conveyed** [在此香火炉前].

**My first prayer is:**
That **my devotion reaches Heaven** [当愿忱诚上达],
And **divine grace flows to all sides** [睿泽旁流].
May **my past transgressions be forgiven** [赦已往之愆尤],
And **the path to self-renewal be opened** [开自新之轨路].
May the **Nine Mysteries and Seven Ancestors** [九玄七祖]
**Release me from karmic disputes and elevate my form** [释注讼以升形];
And may the **Six Stars and Three Elements** [六甲三元]
**Protect the prenatal Truehood and solidify my foundation** [保胎真而固本].

Thus, **I may attain a peaceful and fragrant child** [庶获宁馨之子],
And **lead them to the Daoist realm of Ren’s longevity** [率归仁寿之乡].

**My second prayer is:**
That **the Ten Thousand Daoist Immortals and Jade Maidens** [十方仙童玉女]
**Attend to the fragrant incense** [接侍兰烟],
And **transmit my humble petitions** [传臣向来所启之诚]
**Swiftly to the Supreme Court of the Jade Emperor, the Highest Dao** [速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**With reverence, I depart the Hall** [出堂颂].
**With reverence, I exit the Gate** [出户].

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Code, Volume Twenty-Eight: The Great Ritual for Seeking Descendants**

**Evening Dao Practice**

Proceed with the ritual rites as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Dao.

**Invoke the Sacred Protective Incantations.**
The Five Stars shine resplendent, auspicious *qi* ascends in flight.
The Primordial Sovereign gathers the spirits—heaven and earth unite in harmony.
The Jade Talismans and Sacred Nodes command with celestial might;
Their summons pierces the depths of the unseen.
Fires are cast, their might proclaimed—evil and malevolence are banished.
Ten thousand demons are subdued, their chaotic forms dispersed.
Monstrous and wicked forces are crushed, the Dao’s *qi* flows universally.
Divine radiance illuminates the night, all obscurity vanishes.
Ten thousand spirits descend in order, their blessings sweep across the land like a breeze,
And all living beings prosper, grace permeating the sacred land—harmony with the Dao, truth perfected.

**Strike the sacred drum twenty-four times.**

The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Sovereign of the Three *Qi*,
The Most High Dao Sovereign,
The Most High Laozi,
**summon forth from my body the Three Five Officials of Merit,**
the Left and Right Attendants, the Left and Right Incense-Bearers,

flowing into my body,

All are the **Most High’s boundless virtue of cherishing life**, commanding the **Primordial Yang** to open the people of **Great Possession**—
teaching the people to know the **Dao** and thus know their bodies,

Yet, considering the **later generations** who aspire to the **Immortal Way**—

Bestowing **qi** and extending years, it is the path to **transcend the mundane and attain sainthood**,
the ladder to **obtain the Dao**.
Not only can women practice it,
but it also ensures the **form and spirit** remain undivided.

From the day we were entrusted with this duty,

With **sincere hearts**, we now humbly proclaim our supplication.
**Proclamation of the Petition.**

According to the intent of the words,
we have laid bare our **crimson sincerity**.
We pray for the **Mysterious Favor** to **pierce through and renew** the **Great Creation**.

In awe of the **Great Dao**, we have always striven with **single-minded devotion**;
with **urgent humility**, we do not shrink from **repeatedly offending** in our earnestness.

**On the Human in the World,**

From within the womb, we are called **body**—
born from a single source,
yet branching into six functions:
the eyes perceive the five colors,
the ears hear the five tones,
the nose discerns the five fragrances,
the tongue discerns the five flavors.
Sometimes we move the arms and bend the fingers,
sometimes we wield strength and race like the wind—
all from that single **spark of luminous spirit**,
the workmanship of **transformation**.

Like shaping clay into vessels,
turning the potter’s wheel to perfect them;
or like carved wooden figures,
activated by their mechanisms to serve their purpose.
How much more so for those in the **Human Way**—
truly endowed with **self-cultivation**—
who kindle the **Lan-cauldron’s flame** at midnight,
shake the **cloud-axe** beyond the heavens,

Further, we hope for **abundant blessings**,
extending to all **sentient beings**.

while **humanity follows Earth**,
Earth follows Heaven,
Heaven follows the Dao,

The **commoner’s nature and fate** all depend on the **Dao’s generation**;
all **sages and worthies** emerge from the **womb’s nurturing**.

The **pearl congeals from qi and fluid**,

the **fire refines the golden essence**,
concealing the **meaning of the Three Fields’ reversal**.

For those who cultivate—
they may **merge with the Hundred Spirits**;

**Universal salvation** of the **living and the dead**,

The humble servant and the assembled officials of the fast, with deepest sincerity and fervent devotion, prostrate ourselves twice and present incense and sacred wash.

**Daoist Scripture and Ritual Disciple Zhòng Lì compiles,
Oath of Fire to Avert Calamities and Exhortation of Precepts.**

**Ritual Procedures for Ascending the Platform as Prescribed:**

Recite the **Pure Heaven-and-Earth Incantation**.
Sprinkle water, then arrange the formation.
The **High Master** presides at the altar and delivers the precepts.

**We, the officials of such-and-such rank, humbly offer:**
Daoist incense, **virtue-incense**, the incense of **Non-Action, Tranquility, and Natural True Fragrance**,
With sincere supplications to:
**The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void-Natural,**
**The Supreme Daoist Lord,**
**The Supreme Old Lord,**
**The Jade Emperor of the Azure Sky,**
**The Nine Sovereigns Most High,**
**The Ten-Directional Saints,**
**All Revered Lords and Elders,**
**The Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Master of the Mystic Great Law,**
**The Lord of the Fire-Star Upholding the Rounded Firmament,**
**The Lord of the Upholding Star of the Fire-Mandate,**
**The Lords of the Fire-Star’s Head and Tail,**
**The Lords of the Constellations of Yong, Qin, Zhou, Luo, Chu, and Jing,**
**The Lords of the Stars of the Four Directions,**
**The Lords of the Earthly Mound and Cavernous Palaces,**
**The Masters of the Mountains and Waters,**
**The Three Realms of Responsive Spirits,**
**All True and Numinous Essences.**

**May all behold Your Boundless Mercy and Condescend to Pierce with Insight.**

We now **proclaim Your Will**—our **sincere devotion** has been laid bare before You.
**Trusting in Heaven’s Grace and the Clarity of Our Ritual Offerings,**

We humbly submit that the **Lord of the Southern Fire-Star, the Upholding Star (Mangzhuo),**
**Oversees all things, illuminates the hidden and profound,**
**Bestows blessings on the virtuous and calamity on the licentious,**
**Assists Heaven in its transformations.**
**Examining past dynasties, the evidence is clear:**

According to the *Han Records on Astronomy*:
*"When the Upholding Star emerges, great armies rise;
When it retreats, armies disperse and cease hostilities.
Its appearance portends death, robbery, and chaos.
If battles are fought in its domain, victory is unattained."*

In the **fourth year of Emperor Jing’s reign (150 BCE), on the seventh month’s *gengwei* day,**
it entered the **East Well, traversing the Yin Path.**
Again, in the **ninth month’s *gengwei* day, it entered the *Yuche* constellation.**
On a *wuren* day, it emerged—**the omen read: ‘Execution, warfare, and fire calamities.’**
When it guarded the **Southern Dipper during the Yuan Ding era,**
the omen read: **‘The realm it guards will face rebellion, bandits, and military defeat.
Its nation will sever worship of the Southern Dipper,
transgressing its celestial domain—**
**later, the king and empress dowager will be slain in mutual slaughter.’**
The Han armies exterminated them, and their state perished.
**In the Han, the Upholding Star manifested seventeen or eighteen times—**
**each instance heralded disaster and chaos.**

In the **second year of Zhongyuan (57 BCE) of the Later Han,**
when the **Fire Star invaded the Southwest stars of Taiwei,**
it foretold the **dismissal of high officials—**
**the Grand Commandant and Minister of Works—**
**for their offenses.**
In the **thirteenth year of Yongping (70 CE),**
when it invaded *Yuche*, **great mourning ensued;**
when it invaded *Zhi*, **high officials were executed.**
Later, **King Ying of Chu and Yan Zhong** were exposed for treason and put to death.
**In the Later Han, the Upholding Star manifested twelve times—**
**each time, calamity struck.**

From the **Jin, Song, Sui, and Five Dynasties onward,**
the records are too numerous to enumerate.
**Such are the disasters that arise within its celestial course.**

According to the *Five Stars’ Manifest Essence Scripture*:
*"When the Upholding Star shines upon a person,
their lifespan is shortened, poverty ensues.
If they submit to fate, they may live to fifty,
but **wives and sons will suffer misfortune,**
and **obstacles will multiply.**
If it shines upon sickness or peril,
**wind and labor will bring affliction.**
If it opposes the celestial station,
**death will come within the year.**
**Such are the calamities it brings when it illuminates mankind."**

**When Zhūróng and Huìlù manifest in the mortal world,**
**fire descends from Heaven—this is called *disaster*.**
**It arises from the accumulation of humanity’s sins.**
**The Qin built the Alang Palace, spanning three hundred *li*,**
**with a pavilion every five steps and a gallery every ten,**
**exhausting every grain of wealth like dust and sand.**
**The Chu burned it, and the flames raged for three months—**
**this was the work of humanity.**

**Mo Chu once returned to Luoyang by carriage from home.**
Before arriving, a woman begged for passage.
As they parted, she said:
*"I am a Heavenly Being.
I was sent to burn the Mo family’s eastern sea estate.
Now that I’ve borrowed your carriage,
I cannot fail to set it ablaze.
You must return quickly—I will come later."*
Mo Chu hurried home, gathered his valuables to flee,
and by noon, the fire blazed fiercely—**a warning to all.**

**Huán Jǐng of Sìnán was told by Fèi Chángfáng:**
*"On the ninth day of the ninth month,
your home will face a fire calamity.
Quickly depart—**
**have each family member carry a crimson pouch of *zhūyú* berries,**
ascend a high mountain, and drink chrysanthemum wine.
Only then will the disaster be averted."*
Jǐng followed his words, leading his household to the heights.
**Soon after returning, he saw his cattle, poultry, and dogs—**
**all violently dead.**

Subsequent generations thus retained this practice, establishing methods of exorcism and disaster warding.

During the Han Dynasty under Emperor Huán, at the New Year’s grand assembly with his ministers, Lè Bā held wine and spat toward the southwest. The Emperor asked the reason, and he replied: *"Shu is suffering from a fire calamity, so I am warding it off."* The Emperor sent envoys to investigate, and indeed, it was said that a great rain came from the northeast, carrying the scent of wine within—this was a method of salvation and relief.

In the past, when *Xīnghuǒ* (Mars) occupied the *Xīn* (Heart) constellation, corresponding to the celestial division of the State of Sòng, Duke Jing of Qi was troubled by it. He then issued three imperial edicts, and the calamity shifted three times.

When **Liú Kūn** governed Jianglíng, a household fire broke out. Kūn knelt before the flames, begging forgiveness, and soon, the wind reversed, extinguishing it—this was a method of turning disaster.

For indeed, the coming of calamities and blessings all stem from human summoning. The Heavenly Will is benevolent and loving, and the Dao permits supplication and exorcism. Now, certain Daoist practitioners—[names omitted]—with sincere devotion, have constructed a solemn vow-fire exorcism ritual platform. They command us to proclaim the rites and regulations, to pray for blessings and ward off disasters, and to safeguard the peace of the land.

At the beginning of the platform’s establishment, if we do not first recite the ritual matters and expound the precepts and prohibitions, how then can we move the High Celestial Spirits?

Now, we shall proclaim the **Ten Precepts for the Ritual Platform** to all assembled here, that each may receive and uphold them. Listen carefully:

**The First Precept:** Do not disturb the body and spirit. Maintain unwavering focus—let joy, anger, sorrow, and delight not arise within. Strive for clarity and precision to commune with the Most Holy Above.

**The Second Precept:** Do not treat the Sacred and True with arrogance or neglect. Hold reverence and awe, gazing upon the honored images. With sincere devotion, the Heavenly True Ones descend from the void to receive you.

**The Third Precept:** Do not slight the Sacred Scriptures. Hold them with faith and weight. Study, recite, and ponder the Three Caverns’ classics, awakening to their truth and seeking the fruit of the Dao.

**The Fourth Precept:** Do not slander the Dao’s teachings. Hold them with respect, spreading the Way and clarifying the Law. Save both the living and the dead, guiding all to take refuge and gain liberation.

**The Fifth Precept:** Do not defile the ritual grounds. Maintain purity—bathe and fast before approaching the sacred platform. Avoid foul odors, blood, and slaughter. Keep poultry, dogs, and livestock from intruding.

**The Sixth Precept:** Do not indulge the body and mind—no shouting, cursing, idle chatter, or drunken revelry. Serve the Celestial Worthies with solemnity, as before one’s sovereign and parents.

**The Seventh Precept:** Do not falter in Daoist resolve. Hold firm—let no petty frustration extinguish your sincerity. Persevere in devotion, and boundless blessings shall follow.

**The Eighth Precept:** Do not neglect the ritual duties. Be diligent and earnest—chant the Dao, recite the scriptures, and pay homage to the True Ones. Let your merits be complete, that both the living and the dead may share in the grace.

**The Ninth Precept:** Do not err in petitioning or ritual offerings. Be precise—if reckless or careless, without proper deliberation, the Three Heavens may reject your supplications, turning blessings into misfortune. This is deeply to be feared.

**The Tenth Precept:** Do not haggle over profit. Be humble and yielding—let giver and receiver both rejoice, without resentment. Do not harm your own field of merit.

**These Ten Precepts—can the assembled officials uphold them?**
*Answer:* We can uphold them.

The Celestial Worthy speaks: *"When petitions are made and the Dao is practiced, the Four Heavenly Sovereigns ride upon flying clouds in green palanquins and eight-scenery jade carriages. Attended by True Persons and Jade Maidens bearing flower-adorned banners, they are preceded by phoenix hymns and followed by the Celestial Balance. White cranes and lions chant in unison, while incense smoke and scattered flowers drift from the void. Those who observe the rites and hear the Law shall see the Heavenly True Ones descend, and all spirits gather in homage. How then can one not exhaust the fullness of the ritual?"*

First, receive the Ten Precepts, then practice the Dao. Walk with measured steps, quiet the mind, and still the will. In sitting, standing, or repose, do not stray from proper form. Let the Heavenly True Ones rejoice, and your name shall be inscribed among the Upper Clarity Immortals—thus attaining the Dao’s gate within the mind.

To the ritual officials: The ritual’s solemnity is strict, its prohibitions grave. Sweep and purify the courtyard, ensuring absolute cleanliness. Discipline both inner and outer attendants—great and small—to maintain perfect silence. Do not mix mundane affairs with the Sacred, lest you offend the Celestial Spirits.

If any devout men or women wish to hear the Dao, let them bathe and fast in purity, then come to the ritual platform to pay homage and take refuge, sharing in the blessings. But if they are insolent or dismissive, unfaithful to the True—such shall surely invite retribution in the dark. Let those who partake in the ritual take heed.

**The vow is sealed; the platform is closed.**

In ignorance of shared karmic bonds, fearing unmeasured calamity,
I tremble through each passing day, my sincerity urgent and sincere,
pouring forth my heart and liver’s essence,
offering flowers and libations with reverent devotion,
strictly following divine injunctions,
solemnly submitting to august power,
gazing upon the Purple Banners’ vanguard,
following the Emerald Clouds’ hunt,
seeking universal protection,
that all may dwell in peace,
ensuring auspicious omens for dwellings and settlements,
guarding the tranquility of neighbors and lands.

At the outset of our solemn oath,
broad salvation takes precedence—
observing the language of reverent awe,
worthy of inclusion among the sacred rites.

We humbly pray to the Great Work,
may our devout petitions be graciously received.

The ritual officials’ words are sincere—
we now formally present them for proclamation.

Examine the words with care—their sincerity is evident.
Never forgetting the supplications and expiations of past years,
we seek the compassionate protection of all numinous beings.

The ritual rites are now solemnly observed,
the fast’s regulations meticulously laid out—
we exhaust our utmost devotion in presenting our plea,
pouring out our deepest sentiments in hope of divine consideration.

May the Divine Presence be moved by our humble supplications,
the Dao’s power extending far—
even without descending from the Mysterious Seat,
spanning all ten directions,
rising beyond mundane repose to transcend dust and eons.

Daring to rely on tranquil contemplation,
we solemnly serve the Void Sovereign,
offering minimal rites of fear and sacrifice,
as a means to guard the mind’s retreat.

We humbly beseech the Saints of the Celestial Metropolis,
the High Immortals of the Purple Extremity,
to pierce our sincerest intentions,
and graciously bestow a wondrous response.

Command the Supervising Fast Officials,
the local Daoist officials,
the Golden Boys who present petitions,
the Jade Maidens who convey messages,
the officials of the Numinous Treasures—
all united in harmony,
to descend upon this altar,
purifying within and without,
subduing demons and malevolent forces.

Let us, the servants, be guarded by a hundred spirits,
our minds cleansed and pure,
our petitions harmoniously received,
our thoughts answered as they arise—
may the ritual’s merit ascend to the heavens,
recorded by the Celestial Registries.

Extending universally to the ritual officials’ households,
dissolving a thousand calamities,
lengthening a hundred blessings,
quelling fires and conflagrations,
sweeping away pestilence and malevolence,
all returning to the winds of Dao and virtue,
together rejoicing in the harmony of the Ascendant Peace.

On the morrow, we shall proceed according to the prescribed rites,
continuing to report as we go.
Respectfully submitted.
