Through **aeons**, may it **last eternally**, from **this day to ancient times**.
The **True Root** shall **not be obscured**, **deluded thoughts** all **eradicated**.

**Upper Petition for the Emperor’s** brilliance to match **Xī’s** and **Hòu’s** splendor,
For **Nóng** and **Huáng** to follow **Zhuó’s** footsteps,
Ascending **Ào’s Peak** in equal **fortune**, expanding the **Peng’s Sea** to **lengthen years**.
May the **Empress, Consorts, and Princes** **stabilize the Great Treasure**,
**Literati and Martials** **support the Bright Foundation**.
May the **Two Symbols** later **radiate in harmony**, the **Three Lights** **remain true and upright**,
The **Fragrant Winds** **conform to rhythm**, the **Harmonious Qi** **regulate the seasons**.
May **agricultural labors** accumulate in the **capital’s plains**, **people’s customs** **ascend to **Ren’s Longevity**.
The **Three Attendants and Nine Nights**, **moving, growing, flying, and sinking**—
All shall **equally share the boundless grace**, **together fulfill the true fruit’s promise**,
Above **manifesting the Celestial Lord’s** **Great Compassion**, below **matching our subjects’** **earnest sincerity**.
Humbly **petitioned and reported**.

**Twelve Petitions** completed.
**Relighting the censer**.

**Incense Officials and Messengers**, the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords**, the **Attendant Spirit Officials**—
Let them **cause** where we **previously performed the midday Dao-work**,
**Naturally** generating **golden elixir and jade-green**, **mushrooms and hundred-spirits’** **essences**,
**True Ones** gathering—**here**, before this **incense-fire censer**.
May the **Ten-Directional Celestial Children and Jade Maidens** **attend the orchid-scented smoke**,
**Transmit our previous petitions** swiftly to the **Direct Presence of the Supreme True One of Boundless Dao**, before the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**.

**Exit the Hall in Praise**.
**Exit the Door**.

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Canon, Volume 33 Complete**
**The Complete Daoist Ritual Canon, Volume 34**
*Compiled by the Three Caverns Scripture and Talisman Disciple Zhong Li*
**Ritual of the Oath-Fire for Disaster Aversion**
**Evening Dao-Work**

Conduct the Dao-affairs upon the elevated platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Law.
Proclaim the Sacred Spirit Incantations.

The Five Stars shine resplendent,
Auspicious qi ascends in flight.
The Primordial Gathering of Spirits,
Heaven and Earth in harmonious cycle.
Jade Talismans and Sacred Seals,
Summoned by the Whispered Command of the Profound.
Hurl the Fire, Display the Might—
Wickedness and malevolence have no refuge.
Ten Thousand Demons cower subdued,
Chaotic omens disperse.
Monstrous evils crushed, malevolence extinguished,
Dao-qi circulates universally.
Divine Light illuminates the night,
Darkness and obscurity vanish.
Ten Thousand Spirits descend in order,
Waving banners, bearing the wind.
All living beings prosper,
Grace pervades the Land of God—
In harmony with the Dao’s True Essence.

**Strike the Law-Drum twenty-four times.**

The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Originator of the Three Qi,
The Most High Dao Lord,
The Most High Laozi,
Summon forth from within my body the Three Five Functionaries,
Left and Right Officials and Messengers,
Left and Right Incense-Bearers,
Postal Dragon Cavalry Clerks,
Attendant Golden Boys,
Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens,
The Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans,
Direct-Day Incense Officials—
Each thirty-six in number—**to emerge**.

Those who emerge must don resplendent attire,
Crowns and sashes with trailing ribbons,
Opening the Mysterious Daoist Altars of Land and Domain,
Inviting the territorial and divine spirits of the region.

Now, in this quiet night of Dao-work,
I humbly petition with sincere intent.
My earnest devotion is recorded and reported.
May the Most High Dao-qi of the Ten-Directional True Ones descend,
The Sacred Treasure Light of Auspiciousness flow into my body,
So that my petition may swiftly reach the Direct Presence of the Supreme True One of Boundless Dao,
Before the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault.

**Invoke the Law-Position.**

With my rank and name, I and the assembled officials
Solemnly present our sincere petition to:
The Void-Natural Primordial Heavenly Venerable,
The Most High Dao Lord,
The Most High Laozi,
The Most High Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault,
The Purple Cloud Heavenly Sovereign Emperor,
The Purple Cloud North Pole Emperor,
The Sacred Ancestor Heavenly Venerable Emperor,
The Earthly Sovereign of the Rear Soil,
The Great Saintly Mother of the Primordial Heaven,
The Ten-Directional Boundless Dao,
All Heavenly Emperors,
The Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scripture Masters of the Mysterious Middle,
The Fire Star Law-Enforcing True Lord of the Rounded Canopy,
The Star Lords of the Manifested and Transformed,
The Sovereigns of the Thick Earth Caverns and Mountain-Spirit Altars,
The Southern Fire Department Officials of the Vermilion Position (Homogeneous and Fire Branches),
The Three Realms of Responsive Spirits,
All True and Sacred Spirits.

I have heard that the Yang-Spirit manifests auspiciousness,
The Fire Virtue inherits Heaven,
Dividing the solar domain to perpetuate brightness,
Commanding the Vermilion Quarter to establish position.
Thus, it governs the summer calendar,
To rectify the annual functions.
Hence, it ascends and descends through the Crimson Expanse,
Circulating the Yellow Dao,
Responding to its appointed time without fail,
Manifesting without partiality.

Though it suspends the celestial symbols for the sake of the nation,
Its disasters and blessings also extend to all living beings.
We, though favored by divine grace,
Dwelling in this prosperous age,
Have yet to purify our hearts and refine our essence,
Retreat to the misty peaks,
Mingling in the turbid world, conforming to mundane affairs.
Yet, to aid humanity and the state,
To rescue beings as our priority—
All who seek sincerity must be elevated in response.
How much more so when we present our heartfelt words,
Daring not to withhold them—
Thus, we solemnly proclaim our petition.

**Proclaim the Petition.**

As the words declare,
The sincerity is fervent and urgent.
When questioned, it is indeed so—
When examined, it does not stray.

It is reported that in the lofty vault above,
The profound and subtle realm,
The Fire Virtue shines resplendent—
The Imperial Response is the Quail Star.
Counting the Earth-Two Spirit’s power,
Its influence grows ever stronger;
Positioned at the Vermilion Bright’s apex,
Its eminence is unmatched.

Earth generates Metal, emerging from the Tiger Hour, entering the Dog Hour,
Examining the hot and cold to discern concealment and manifestation,
Observing the celestial symbols to distinguish calamity and blessing.
In its appointed duties, it is rewarded with the honor of the sacrificial feast;
When supplicating for relief from illness, it demands the solemnity of incense and fire.

Though we are but humble mortals,
Ever indebted to the True Ones’ grace,
We have long harbored the resolve of the deep ice,
Offering the sincerity of the wolf and badger,
Reverently consulting the secret texts,
Humbly presenting our clear offerings.

Now, in this quiet night of Dao-work,
I request the assembled Law-Masters to light the first pinch of incense.
May this incense-cloud ascend to the heavens,
Offering to the Most High Three Venerables.
We devote our bodies, our spirits, our fates,
Prostrating with our heads to the ground,
Supplicating the Great Saint Fire Star Law-Enforcing True Lord.

We humbly pray that You temporarily abandon Your mansion,
To preside over this assembly from afar.
With crimson banners and scarlet flags,
Purple mists and red clouds,
Sacred flames converging,
The fierce spirits in attendance.
Radiant at the celestial threshold,
Nurturing all beings.
The clear wind blazes forth,
Illuminating the void.
When You descend, blessings follow—
Where disaster lingers, it departs;
Where none arrive, they come.
Golden embers and orchid incense,
Illuminating the nine abysses of darkness;
Sandalwood smoke and jade waters,
Driving away the misfortunes of unvirtuous times.

We earnestly hope that the Great Fire flows in tranquility,
That the Gradual Departure is banished,
Joining the Five Phases in auspiciousness,
Warding off the Three Scorches with no fear,
Raising the hundred blessings of cessation,
Returning to the multitude of virtuous scholars,
Obscure yet vast—this humble heart.

Now, we burn this incense,
Solemnly devoting ourselves to the Dao-Venerable Great Saints’ True Essence.
After attaining the Dao,
We preserve Heaven’s longevity,
In harmony with the Dao’s True Essence.

Now, in this quiet night of Dao-work,
I request the assembled Law-Masters to light the second pinch of incense.
May this incense-cloud ascend to the heavens,
Offering to the Most High Three Venerables.
We devote our bodies, our spirits, our fates,
Prostrating with our heads to the ground,
With this pinch of incense’s merit,
Supplicating the Great Saint Fire Star Law-Enforcing True Lord,
Whose void contains the Vermilion,
Embodying the Water-Stilling Virtue;
Whose essence is the Sun’s crystal,
Embracing the Moon’s generation and transformation.

With bitterness nurturing sweetness,
Ever bound by propriety,
Our pious sincerity is answered,
Illuminating without partiality.

We earnestly hope that the ancestral altars and sacred spirits,
The ancestral halls and forefathers,
May delight in the Vermilion Palace,
Attest to the Vermilion Court,
Flow their blessings upon the Imperial Map,
Perpetuate the Great Undertaking,
Flourish for ten thousand years,
Gathering a thousand auspicious signs.

Now, we burn this incense,
Solemnly devoting ourselves to the Scripture-Venerable Great Saints’ True Essence.

---

After attaining the Dao, ascending into the Formless,
And harmonizing with the True Essence of the Way.

Now, in this tranquil night of Daoic practice,
We humbly request the gathered assembly to perform these three incense offerings,
May this incense smoke ascend and billow,
Piercing the heavens to venerate the **Supreme Three Sovereigns** [太上三尊].
We, the subjects, **return our bodies, spirits, and fates** [皈身、皈神、皈命],
Bow our heads to the earth in reverence,
And with these incense merits, **solemnly invoke the Great Saint Fire Star Law-Enforcing True Lord** [大圣火星执法真君].

May we **hide from the dreadful radiance and light** [藏烜惧威光],
So as not to incur the **fault of harming the gate or fish** [不致侵门害鱼之咎];
May we **beg to halt the fierce and violent manifestations** [乞止赫烈形势],
And forever **avoid the calamity of burning stables and injuring people** [永无焚厩伤人之忧].
Before any **evil arises**, may all **auspicious signs manifest** [凶悉未萌，吉皆来兆],
Our prayers heard without error, our requests granted upon sight [闻祈不忒，见请皆从].

Moreover, we earnestly hope that for our household,
The **Vermilion Talismans** [丹箓] may **ward off disasters** [祛灾],
That **Pure Virtue** [清都] may **bestow blessings** [介福],
Our family’s **prosperity may flourish** [家门叶泰],
And our **benevolent thoughts may renew** [善念惟新].
Within the **gathered assembly of the Daoic scriptures** [旁周品汇之中],
All may **align with the wondrous constancy of the True** [俱契真常之妙].

Now, we burn this incense,
And **devote ourselves to the Virtue of the Scripture-Venerable Great Saints** [自归依经尊大圣众至真之德].
After attaining the Dao, we **forever preserve peace and tranquility** [永保平康],
And harmonize with the True Essence of the Way.

Three **invocations**, three **reverences** [三启，三礼].
We **repeatedly proclaim the sacred Daoic ranks** [重称法位].
We, the subjects of all **Daoic stations** [具位臣某], along with the **officers attending the altar** [与临坛官众],
Solemnly **offer our sincere prayers**:
To the **Supreme Three Pure Ones and Saints** [太上三清上圣],
To the **Jade Sovereign of the Celestial Vault** [昊天玉皇上帝],
To the **Nine Sovereigns of Ultimate Reverence** [九皇至尊],
To the **Ten Directions’ Scripture-Venerable Saints** [十方上圣],
To the **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Scripture Masters of the Mystic Dao** [三十六部尊经玄中大法师],
To the **Fire-Deity Supreme True One** [火德上真],
To the **Three Realms’ Responsive True Spirits** [三界应感],
And to **All True Spirits** [一切真灵].

We, the subjects, have heard that **misconduct in human affairs** [滥处人伦]
And **erroneous residence in the sacred age** [缪居圣世],
Fortunately **received the nurturing grace of the Numinous Treasures** [幸承灵宝荫育],
And **glimpsed the true Daoic teachings** [得睹蕊笈真科].

We know that **blessings arise from virtue, calamities from licentiousness** [有福善祸淫],
And that **they originate from the intentions of the heart** [在操心之所致].
We fear that if one **believes in falsehoods and reverses one’s vision** [信邪倒见],
They may **fail to repent and return to the Dao** [莫反念以归依].

Only the **Supreme Most High** [无上之元尊],
Through **marvelous Daoic methods of the provisional** [假有为之妙法],
Has **manifested in sacred scriptures** [昭垂经典],
And **forever enlightens the obscured and ignorant** [永觉昏蒙],
**Warding off calamities even before their signs appear** [禳於未兆之间],
So that **there may be no regret for past deeds** [安有追前之悔].

Now, the **Daoic official** [醮官] humbly **devotes himself to the Great Dao** [投诚大道],
And **earnestly supplicates all the heavens** [沥恳诸天].
We **often reflect upon our own unawareness** [每惟自不觉知],
And how **small transgressions may lead to great consequences** [渐小愆而致甚].
We **constantly worry about shifting fate and cosmic cycles** [常忧变更运数],
Or that **accumulated karmic deeds may prove inescapable** [或积业以难逃].

Day and night, we **never cease in our vigilance** [夙夜靡遑],
And **our actions and retreats are guided by reflection** [行藏在念].
We **consider the seven treasures and five grains** [七珍五谷],
Lest they **bring accumulated harm and misfortune** [虑有积而不散之非].
We **fear for the six livestock and two silkworms** [六畜二蚕],
For their **extreme abundance may invite retribution** [恐昭物极恶盈之罪].

Now, we **present these humble Daoic rites** [陈菲薄醮礼],
And **pray to the Upholder of the Fire Star** [祷谢荧惑星君],
**Reverently following the rules of the Celestial Gate** [恭按阙伯之规模],
And **hoping to fulfill the benevolent response of Duke Jing** [愿遂景公之仁感].

We **take pity on this humble reverence** [悯兹惕若],
And **grant it peace and security** [锡以安然],
So that our **neighborhoods may know no sudden disasters** [里域无卒暴之惊],
And our **abodes may rest in tranquil comfort** [居止有清闲之慰].

In **all four seasons**, we **enjoy serenity** [四时宁谧],
And in **the eight festivals**, we **rejoice with delight** [八节欣怡].
We **extinguish the improper light of lamps and candles** [绝灯烛非次之光],
And **quell the unusual flames of stoves and hearths** [息炉灶殊常之焰].

We **extend this blessing universally to all households** [普及各门],
Bringing **peace and prosperity to every realm** [康泰一境],
**Purifying and harmonizing** [澄清], so that **all may dwell in virtuous contentment** [乐业],
And **reside in tranquility and embrace benevolence** [安居怀仁].
We **sincerely pray for the flourishing of goodness** [率善上愿],
May the **Two Principles** [二仪] **shine in harmony** [昭泰],
The **Three Illuminations** [三景] **radiate in splendor** [辉华],
The **nine grains** [九谷] **prosper abundantly** [滋丰],
The **five weapons** [五兵] **be sheathed in restraint** [韬戢],
And the **Dragon Spirits** [龙神] **stand guard in vigilance** [警卫],
So that **plagues and poisons may not intrude** [疫毒无侵].
For those **who plan their livelihood**, may they **find ease and joy** [谋生遂安逸之欢],
And for those **dwelling in the wilds**, may they **sing in celebration** [在野有讴歌之乐].

May **all things rise and fall in accordance with nature** [飞沉遂性],
And **movement and growth flourish in harmony** [动植舒荣].
May the **Nine Nights of Illumination** [九夜开光] **be fulfilled**,
And the **Three Paths of Judgment** [三途] **cease their demands** [罢对].
May we **witness the boundless responses of the Great Dao** [见大道无方之应],
And **fulfill the prayers that invoke the enlightened Saints** [契圣明有感之祈].

We **extend this grace to the distant and obscure** [普及幽遐],
All may **ascend to the shores of blessings** [俱升福岸],
Above **manifesting the Celestial Sovereign’s vast compassion** [上明天尊大慈之泽],
Below **fulfilling our subjects’ sincere devotion to the Dao** [下副臣等皈命之诚].
We **reverently present these prayers and report them** [谨启以闻].

**Twelve Prayers** [十二愿].
**Return to the Furnace** [复炉].
The **Incense Officials and Messengers** [香官使者],
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** [左右龙虎君],
And the **Attendant Spirits of the Incense** [侍香诸灵官],
Should **command that in our subjects’ former places of Daoic practice** [臣向来静夜行道之所],
There **naturally arise golden elixirs, dan-blue jade waters** [自然生金液丹碧],
And **mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits** [芝英百灵].
May the **gathered True Spirits** [众真交会]
Assemble **before this incense furnace** [在此香火炉前].

May we **pray that the Ten Directions’ Immortal Children and Jade Maidens** [十方仙童玉女],
**Attend to the fragrant smoke** [接侍兰烟],
And **transmit our subjects’ former prayers** [传臣向来所启],
**Swiftly reaching the Celestial Vault of the Jade Sovereign** [速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Exit the Hall and Chant** [出堂颂].
**Exit the Doorway** [出户].

「The Complete Daoist Ritual Regulations, Volume Thirty-Four concluded. Volume Thirty-Five begins.

Compiled by the **Three Caverns** [三洞] Ritual and Precept Disciple, Zhòng Lì [仲励].

**Ritual of the Oath-Fire for Averting Disasters** [誓火禳災儀]
**Establishing a Daoic Feast** [設醮行道]

The **ritual proceedings ascend the platform** [法事升坛] as prescribed. Each pays homage to the **Master of the Precepts** [師] with reverent devotion in accordance with the **Way** [法].

**Proclaim the Sacred Incantations** [宣衛靈咒] to safeguard the **Way** [道].

The **Five Stars** [五星] align and radiate their brilliance, illuminating the **Five Directions** [五方].
The **Water Star** [水星] repels calamity,
The **Wood Virtue** [木德] brings prosperity.
**Yinghuò** [荧惑, Mars] dissipates misfortune,
**Tàibái** [太白, Mercury] wards off war.
**Zhènxīng** [镇星, Jupiter] holds firm in fourfold dominion,
Benefiting **family and state** [家国].
Their names are inscribed on **jade tablets** [玉简],
Their decrees recorded in the **Imperial Archives** [帝房].
They ride the **tempests and disperse the mists** [乘飙散景],
Ascending and descending the **vast void** [飞腾太空].
Entering and exiting the **dark and formless** [出入冥无],
They traverse and revel in the **Ten Directions** [游宴十方].

The **Five Clouds** [五云] float as banners,
Summoning **divine spirits** [招神] and restraining the **winds** [摄风].
They **command and subdue the myriad spirits** [役使万灵],
Guarding the **Immortal Sage** [上卫仙翁],
In harmony with the **True Dao** [和与道合真].

**Sound the Daoic Drum** [鸣法鼓] **twenty-four times** [二十四通].

We now **invoke the Supreme Three Heavens’** [无上三天] **Primordial Origin of the Dao** [玄元始三炁],
The **Supreme Dao Lord** [太上道君],
The **Supreme Old Lord** [太上老君],
And **summon forth** [召出] from within our subjects’ bodies the **Thirty-Five Officials of the Dao** [身中三五功曹],
The **Left and Right Officials and Messengers** [左右官使者],
The **Left and Right Incense-Bearers** [左右捧香],
The **Dragon-Courier and Mounted Attendants** [驿龙骑吏],
The **Golden Boys Attending the Incense** [侍香金童],
The **Jade Maidens of the Transmitted Words and Scattered Flowers** [传言散花玉女],
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** [五帝直符],
And the **Direct-Day Incense Officials** [直日香官],
Each **thirty-six in number** [各三十六人], to appear.

Those who emerge are **arrayed in solemn, resplendent garments** [严装显服],
With **headdresses and sashes trailing their ribbons** [冠带垂缨],
Opening the **Mysterious Daoic Altars** [关启玄坛] to the **Land Spirits** [土地] and **Divine Sovereigns of the Regions** [方域神真].

Our subjects now **establish this Daoic Feast** [今设醮行道],
And **solemnly present this invocation** [谨奏为入意],
Having already **recorded and transmitted** [已录告闻] the **sincere intentions** [诸诚意].
May we **obtain the Supreme Dao’s** [太上十方至真道炁] **blessed light and luminous treasures** [灵宝瑞光],
Descending and **flowing into our subjects’ bodies** [下降流入臣身中],
That our subjects’ prayers may **swiftly reach the Celestial Vault of the Jade Sovereign** [令臣所启速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Request the proclamation of the Daoic ranks** [请称法位].

In full assembly, our subjects **so-and-so** [某] and the **officiating officials** [临坛官众],
**Together present this sincere invocation** [谨同诚上启] to:

The **Primordial Origin of the Jade Sovereign of the Natural Void** [虚无自然元始天尊],
The **Supreme Dao Lord** [太上大道君],
The **Supreme Old Lord** [太上老君],
The **Jade Sovereign of the Celestial Vault** [昊天玉皇上帝],
The **Grand Sovereign of the Purple Cluster** [紫微天皇大帝],
The **Grand Sovereign of the Northern Polarity** [紫微北极大帝],
The **Divine Ancestor, Sovereign of the Dao** [圣祖天尊大帝],
The **August Land Spirit, Earthly Sovereign** [后土皇地祇],
The **Primordial Great Sage, Empress of Heaven** [元天大圣后],
The **Dao of the Ten Directions’ Limitless Extent** [十方无极大道],
The **Sovereigns of All Heavens** [诸天天帝],
The **Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scriptures, Master of the Mysterious Central Dao** [三十六部尊经玄中大法师],
The **True Lord of the Dao Who Executes the Law of the Fire Star in the Round Dome** [圆穹上象火星执法真君],
The **Manifested and Transformed Celestial Hosts and Star Lords** [所变所化、列宿星君],
The **Sovereigns of the Earthly Caverns and Mountainous Altars** [厚地洞天、岳渎主宰],
The **Officials of the Southern Fire Position, Ranked Homogeneous and Heterogeneous** [南方离位丙丁巳午火部官属],
The **Three Realms of Response and Sensation** [三界应感],
And **all True Spirits** [一切真灵].

Our subjects **hear** that the **Great Dao is profound and mysterious** [大道玄妙],
The **origin of the Supreme Ultimate** [混成太极之初];

That the **Ultimate Truth is naturally so** [至真自然],
The **ancestor of Heaven and Earth** [悼为天地之祖].

With **mechanisms and powers of transformation** [机权造化],
They **open and close the yin and yang** [开阖阴阳],
Dividing the **Eight Trigrams** [八卦] to nurture all forms,
Establishing the **Four Seasons** [四时] to fulfill all gatherings.

Thus, the **Yang** resides in the **Great Summer** [大夏],
As the **region of long cultivation** [长养之方];
The **Southern Fire** responds in **divine resonance** [南讹],
Focusing on the **matters of transformation and nourishment** [化育之事].

Therefore, the **Flame Emperor governs the Celestial Vault** [炎帝御宇],
And **Yinghuò** [荧惑] **oversees the region** [司方],
Dividing the **Five Affairs** [五事] in the **ritual texts** [礼文],
And **specializing in the Fourfold governance of Fire** [专四方之火政].

Sometimes they **appear and then suddenly vanish** [或当见而忽伏],
Sometimes they **withdraw and then reemerge** [或既缩而复盈].
Their **changes are not constant** [其变不常],
All for the sake of **manifesting just punishments** [皆为明罚].

「Now the **Ritual Master of the Dao** [醮官] **reverently presents** [某严陈] **ancient precedents** [故事],
Devoting himself solely to the **Yang Spirit** [阳灵],
Aligning with the **Fire Star’s proper season** [火之正时],
Repaying the **radiant virtue of the Fire Deity** [报离明之盛德],
Inviting **Daoist companions** [道侣] to gather,
Strictly adhering to the **auspicious timing** [冲科],
Formally establishing the **ritual altar** [坛场],
And earnestly summoning the **celestial winds and chariots** [飙驭].

**Humbly praying** [伏愿],
That the **Imperial Chariot** [帝车] **arrives swiftly** [接轸],
From the **Tiger Pass and the Celestial Gates** [虎关阊阖];
That the **Star Chariot** [星驭] **moves in harmony** [交骖],
Descending from the **Lion’s Tail and the Hooked Array** [豹尾勾陈].

The **sacrificial wine** [涧苹] is offered,
And the **libations** [浻酌] are made in solemnity [有严].

With **deepest reverence and longing** [无任瞻望激切屏营之至],
I twice bow and gaze toward the clouds,
To **reverently welcome the Celestial Procession** [奉迎仙驾].

**Descending the Sage** [降圣],
**Offering tea** [献茶],
First **presenting** [初献], then **scattering flowers** [散花].

I now **solemnly and sincerely** [谨虔诚] **report to** [上启],
The **Supreme Three Pure Ones** [太上三清],
The **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault** [玉帝],
The **Jade Sovereign of the Supreme Heaven** [昊天玉皇],
And the **Three Realms’ responsive spirits** [三界应感],
All **true and genuine essences** [一切真灵].

I have heard that the **Great Sun** [太阳] **divides its light** [分景],
This is the **Star of Yinghuò** [荧惑之星];
The **Virtue of Fire** [离德] **declares its essence** [宣精],
It is also called the **Son of the Vermilion Sovereign** [赤帝之子].

It **ascends eighty myriads of li** [八十万里] **and radiates colors** [腾彩],
And **spans over a hundred days** [一百余日] **to complete its celestial cycle** [周天].

Wherever it **remains or departs** [居留],
It **certainly shapes calamities or blessings** [必形灾福].
When it **disturbs the natural order** [乱常],
It serves as a **warning against corrupt governance** [以戒昏政];
When it **follows its appointed course** [循度],
It **clearly marks the passage of time** [以表明时].

When it **converges with the Five Stars** [同五星聚],
The world **unifies in harmony** [而天下咸归];
When it **aligns with the Four Stars** [与四星合],
The **rulers receive congratulations** [而王者受庆].

Should **chaos and disorder arise** [亡乱],
And **virtue be lost** [失德],
Then its **fluctuations** [盈缩] **become erratic** [无常].

Gazing upward at the **Celestial Patterns of Heaven** [乾文],
The **divine records of calamities** [灾数] **are preserved** [皇存].

When it **converges with the Year Star** [合岁星], there will be **famine** [则饥馑];
When it **aligns with the Great White Star** [合太白], there will be **upheaval and migration** [则播迁];
When it **unites with the Earth Star** [与土合], governance **becomes increasingly misaligned** [则政益乖];
When it **joins with the Star of the Hour** [与辰合], the **armies fare poorly** [则兵不利];
When the **moon eclipses its mansion** [月蚀其宫], there will be **war and strife** [则为战乱];
When the **heart of the star deviates from its course** [心孛其度], there will be **conflagration and burning** [则主燎焚].

Only by **cultivating virtue** [修德] can such calamities be **warded off** [可禳],
And by **self-reflection and reverence** [省躬而知畏].

Though **celestial cycles and omens** [运数] **concern the fate of nations** [关於国论],
**Calamities and auspices** [灾祥] are **indeed bound to the people’s lives** [寔系於民生].

The **Dao Master** [醮主] of humble name, deeply concerned by accumulated karma inviting calamity, humbly composed this supplication and petitioned for divine favor. With reverence, I dare to unfold my sincere words before the **Celestial Assembly** [法席], and now solemnly proclaim them.

**Proclamation of the Supplication:**

As the words declare, my sincerity is profound and earnest.

The Dao Master, born in this age of wondrous transformation, has long revered the **True Wind** [真风]. Now, at the height of summer’s heat, the **Mars** [荧惑] traverses its degree. Though I have always relied upon **virtue** [德], my heart has long held **awe and reverence** [祇畏]. Yet when disasters arise, I must invoke the **preemptive rites of warding** [预禳之典].

I recite the **secret incantations of the Precious Scripture** [宝经], reveal the **true characters of the Cloud Sigil** [云篆], and present the **wondrous patterns** [妙范] in full array, with all rites meticulously observed. **Heaven and humanity interact**, relying upon the **sublime essence** [精祲] to incline in devotion; the **ritual implements are abundant**, and the **fragrant offerings ascend in splendor** [馨香之昭格].

With the **multitudes of the True Ones** [众真] in attendance, I gaze upon the **Celestial Sovereign’s lofty seat** [上帝之端居], my single mind devoted in reverence, as the **hundred spirits converge**.

I humbly pray that the **Dragon Banner and Phoenix Canopy** [龙旗凤葆] may open **auspicious blessings** [休祥] upon the lower realms, and that the **Sun’s Chariot and Radiant Clouds** [日毂霞车] may amplify the **sublime might of the Celestial Officials** [炎官之威烈].

Your servants, overwhelmed by this petition for grace, now present the **first offering of wine**.

**Scatter flowers.**

I have heard that **diligence in ending as one begins** [谨终如始] is the foundation of human conduct, and that **fearing calamity while turning to virtue** [惧灾向善] is the natural order. Life’s formation depends upon **Heaven and Earth** [乾坤], and all motion and stillness are governed by **Water and Fire** [水火].

**Yin and Yang** [阴阳] form the cosmic framework, overseeing **spirit and vital essence** [魂魄]. In winter, they govern affairs through the **Hour Star** [伺辰], and in summer, they wield authority through **Mars** [荧惑].

Now, in this ninth month of summer, the **Three Stars** [三星] appear in the twilight. How could one not recognize that the **cyclical records of the ancient sages** [阏伯之纪时] align with the **procession of Zhurong** [祝融之行度]?

The Dao Official, reflecting upon my mundane existence and my place among humanity, kindles fire by day and lights the **Dao’s lamp** [烛道] by night. Though my actions depend upon **human flame**, I may yet fall prey to **celestial disaster** [天灾].

The **impartial virtue** [无私之德] is boundless, yet common folk ever fear their **transgressions** [有过之民]. With utmost sincerity, I purify my **community altar** [祓社], heeding the **exhaustive rites of Zheng Xia** [郑侨之尽礼], yet I lack the **insight of the Fire Official’s omens** [裨灶之知天].

I now unfold the **secret scriptures** [秘典] once more, bearing my wishes before the **Lofty True Ones** [高真], hoping the **Heart Star** [心星] may retreat and restore the **Celestial Degrees** [天度] in the **high vault** [高穹], nurturing the **abundance of all things** [万物之丰成], so that all beings may **cross safely** [群生之共济].

May we **roast or boil our offerings** [可燔可炙] without fear of **poisonous winds** [扇毒之虞], and may we dwell and reside **without dread of shifting flames** [徙薪之虑].

Now, the **lotus lamps** [莲灯] flicker toward extinction, yet the **glowing sun’s remnants** [赫曜日之余光] persist. The **precious sigils** [宝篆] are fading, dissolving into the **light mist of floating clouds** [浮云之轻霭]. The **thousand True Ones** have gathered, and the **three offerings** [三献] have concluded.

The **Dragon returns to the Vermilion Celestial Heights** [丹霄], and the **Phoenix attendants** [鸾仗] prepare to withdraw to the **Crimson Palace** [绛阙]. Fearful of further presumption, I dare not linger beneath the **imminent celestial威**.

I further pray for **boundless compassion** [洪慈] to descend, granting **forgiveness and mercy** [宽贷].

Your servants, overwhelmed by this final petition, now present the **concluding offering of wine**.

**Scatter flowers.**

**Reaffirm the Dao’s station.**

The humble servant of lowly rank, **Dao Official** [醮官], now humbly reiterates this supplication to the **Nine Pure Ones, Supreme Saints** [九清上圣], and the **True Spirits of the Three Realms** [三界真灵].

Your servants have solemnly performed the **ritual of the sacred censer** [祭爟之仪] to purify the **original calamity** [燎原之厄].

To the **Supreme Saint of the Jade Capital** [玉京上圣], who receives the **auspicious radiance** [迂景] upon the **Purple Altar** [紫坛], and to the **Stars of the Southern Pole** [南极众星], who also incline their light upon the **embroidered seat** [黼座], we have already exhausted the **flowing wine offerings** [流霞之献] and now ascend the **bright candles’ glow** [明烛之辉].

Again, we pour out our **earnest prayers** [沥恳] before the **Heavenly Hosts** [诸天], beseeching the **cessation of calamity** [弭灾] from the **Celestial Symbols** [上象]. Having already unfolded the rites at **Mars’ degree** [荧惑之度], we now extend our **sincerity to the Variable Star** [变化之星].

Only the **residual light of the Law** [执法之余光] disperses the **flaming essence** [炎精] to demonstrate **divine retribution** [示罚].

The **Dawn Star** [析旦] grows strong in **sovereign governance** [君道], and **Zhaoming** [昭明] presides over **war and mourning** [兵丧]. **Chiyou’s banner** [蚩尤如旗] signals the **sovereign’s campaigns** [王者之征伐], while **Tian Chan** [天搀如剑] foretells the **slaying by generals** [将帅之杀伤]. **Si Wei** [司危] serves to **pacify discord** [平乖争], and the **Red Comet** [赤彗] wields **authority over extermination** [掌诛灭]. These are all **phenomena linked to the Sun** [附日而有象], yet there are also those **associated with the Moon** [因月而垂芒], such as the **Heavenly Obscuration** [天阴晋若] and the **Celestial Official’s Outbreak** [天惑官张].

The **Red Comet’s strange hues** [赤若异彩] and the **Heavenly Chui’s anomalous forms** [天崔殊形]—all are **officials of calamity** [灾厄之官], each with their **mandate of oversight** [照临之分].

When they descend, they become the **Wind Lord** [风伯]; when they manifest as deities, they are called the **Fire Spirits** [火精].

Their **flames and forces** [势焰] surge in tandem, their **portents and marvels** [光怪] intertwine. I pray that, under the **Celestial Sovereign’s Dao-essence** [天尊之道炁], the **residual might of the Fire Virtue** [火德之余威] may be fully harnessed.

May the **nation’s path be unburdened** [国步无艰], lest **martial might be unleashed upon the multitudes** [扬威於多垒]; may the **realm rejoice in prosperity** [邦家有庆], so that the **four classes may pursue their labors in harmony** [乐业於四民].

May there be no **small conflagrations consuming stables** [焚厩之小栽], nor **premonitory warnings of bandits on the roads** [表道之先警]. May the **summer rains arrive in season**, so that **epidemic miasmas** [沴气] do not arise, and may **Yin and Yang harmonize**, yielding **abundant harvests year after year** [年谷屡丰].

Yet I still fear the **Five Stars’ transgressions** [五星凌犯] and the **comets’逆流**, for if they appear in the **eastern quadrant of the Azure Dragon’s seven mansions** [青龙七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the Green Emperor** [青帝真文] for **dissolution and warding** [解禳].

If the **Five Stars transgress and the Red Comet逆流** in the **southern quadrant of the Vermilion Bird’s seven mansions** [朱雀七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the Red Emperor** [赤帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

If the **Five Stars transgress and the White Comet逆流** in the **western quadrant of the White Tiger’s seven mansions** [白虎七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the White Emperor** [白帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

If the **Five Stars transgress and the Black Comet逆流** in the **northern quadrant of the Dark Tortoise’s seven mansions** [玄武七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the Black Emperor** [黑帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

If the **Five Stars transgress and the Yellow Comet逆流** in the **central region of the Hooked Array’s Three Enclosures and the Imperial Seat of the Northern Dipper’s Seven Stars** [勾陈三垣帝座北斗七元星君], I beseech the **True Characters of the Yellow Emperor** [黄帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

May the **Emperor and Sovereign reign for ten thousand years** [帝主万年], their **lineage enduring a hundred generations** [本支百世]. May the **celestial patterns remain in order** [天文有序], and the **earthly cycles endure** [地纪常容]. May the **nation grow wealthy and families prosperous** [国富家康], the **times harmonious and the people flourishing** [时和俗阜].

Only then shall the **Dao Official and his household** [醮官某家等] find **spiritual peace and bodily ease** [神安体裕], their **fortunes extended and longevity assured** [益算延龄], their **blessings and merits renewed** [福禄维新], with **no return of misfortune** [凶衰不作], their **kinfolk thriving and their dwellings serene** [眷属亨泰，所止肃清], their **towns and villages at rest** [井邑静安], and their **regions in tranquility** [方隅宁谧].

All petitions shall be **fully granted** [悉荷保全], extending **universal protection to all living beings** [普及生灵], so that all may **equally share in divine favor** [均叨庇佑].

Your servants, overwhelmed by this **final gratitude** [祈谢之至], now **bow before the Celestial Throne** [拜首天阶] and humbly present this **concluding offering**.

**Reignite the incense brazier.**

**Incense Officials and Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the Attendant Spirit Officials of the Incense**, now command that at the site where this **Dao Rite** [设醮] was established, **golden elixirs and jade-green herbs** [金液丹碧], **mushrooms and hundred-spirits’ blessings** [芝英百灵] shall naturally manifest. The **multitudes of True Ones** shall converge at this **incense and flame altar** [香火炉前].

Now let the Ten-Direction Daoist youth and maiden attendants,
attend to the fragrant incense vapors,
and swiftly transmit our humble petitions
to the **Supreme Ultimate Great Dao of the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Court** [至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Conclude the offering, transform the wealth.**

---
**Complete Collection of Daoist Regulations and Systems, Volume Thirty-Five** concluded.
**Complete Collection of Daoist Regulations and Systems, Volume Thirty-Six**

Compiled by **Comrade Zhongli**, a disciple of the **Three Caverns Scriptures and Talismans**

**Ritual of Invoking Fire and Exorcising Calamities with Three-Time Universal Repentance**

**Dawn of Purity**

We, Your servants, with utmost sincerity, **submit to the command of the Great Fire Star Exorcist True Lord of the Southern Realm** [南方大圣火星执法真君],
the attendant spirit officials and celestial ministers,
the star court deities and all spirit officials.

We, Your servants and followers, humbly hear that **the Celestial Sovereign’s will is unfathomable** [上帝匪忱],
and that **the Dao does not discriminate in its judgments** [道无私於降鉴].
**The Highly Pure respond to sincerity** [高真应感],
and **the divine is moved by genuine devotion** [诚自格於灵承].

Thus, we lay bare our sincere hearts,
and **supplicate the august creation** [仰干洪造].

We observe that **the stars align with their seasons** [纬星应候],
and that **Mars governs the vermilion brightness** [祀关伯於朱明].
The **celestial luminaries mark their positions** [列曜奠方],
and **Zhùróng is paired with the quail’s peak** [配祝融於鹑首].

In silence, they govern the celestial order,
and **hold supreme authority over transformation** [优持造化之权].
Their **manifestations are timely** [其伏见有时],
and their **auspicious or inauspicious signs are clear** [其吉凶有兆].
The heavens act without disorder,
and their responses are without favoritism.
If one harbors **reverence for the stern and the awe-inspiring** [严知畏之心],
then **uncommon blessings shall descend** [必降殊常之祉].

We, the Daoists of such-and-such lineage, are fortunate to dwell in an era of enduring peace,
and to **partake in the harmonious unity of the age** [膺保合之和].
The **Five Phases’ transformations** [化被五行]
and the **Six Ministries’ governance** [政修六府]
are in perfect order.

The **Fire Officials**, who **consume the heart and the pearl** [食心食珠],
and the **Fire Rectifiers**, who **take willow and sassafras** [取柳取槐],
adhere to the **four-seasonal laws** [法有四时之变].

The **qi and symbols harmonize in sequence** [象气交顺],
and **sincere devotion communicates with the divine** [精诚感通].
The **celestial alignment is auspicious** [运合升明],
and **no disasters or calamities arise** [祥无灾燀].

The **sounds echo the Flame Emperor’s order** [音阐炎帝之纪],
**upright and unerring** [充正而不乖];
the **origin of the Great Yin** [太阴之原]
**neither exceeds nor falls short** [无过与不及].

From the capital to the remotest lands,
**fire rituals are meticulously performed** [火焚具修],
and **seasonal offerings are duly made** [时令咸举].
Families fear **displaced hearths** [徙薪之虑],
and people suffer from **burning afflictions** [烂额之伤].

Thus, we **devote ourselves to the Golden Precepts** [刻意金科],
and **knock at the Jade Throne with sincere hearts** [叩心玉陛].
We present **elaborate pure offerings** [设苹繁之净供],
and **offer humble sincerity** [荐豺獭之微诚].
With **wholehearted devotion**, we submit to the command of:
the **Upper True Dao Lord of the Crimson Heavenly Realm** [南方离位丹天赤皇上真道君],
the **Fire Virtue Exorcist True Lord** [火德执法真君],
the **Lord of the Manifesting Dawn Star** [析变析旦昭明星君],
the **Lord of the Deceptive Star, Chiyou** [蚩尤司诡星君],
the **Lord of the Crimson Comet Star** [天搀赤彗星君],
the **Lord of the Dark Quail Star** [天阴晋若星君],
the **Lord of the Celestial Disruptive Star** [官张天惑星君],
the **Lord of the Crimson Ruinous Star** [赤若天崔星君],
and **all deities and spirits within the Great Fire Constellation**.

We humbly pray that the **Dao’s vision illuminate and protect** [道眼照临，灵威覆护],
that **the wandering star be guided along its path** [耀荧惑以循轨],
and that **the backflowing star bring blessings** [弭回禄而降休].
May **auspicious signs gather across ten thousand li** [千里储祥],
and **ten thousand households receive divine favor** [万家蒙佑].

May the people **live in peace and prosperity** [人民平泰],
free from **water, drought, pestilence, or famine** [无扎瘥水旱之殃];
may the **celestial patterns harmonize** [气运协和],
and **dispel the ominous brilliance of the sun’s variations** [消伏明赫曦之变].

Then shall the **lands be tranquil** [方隅宁静],
and the **residences secure** [居止镇安].
All shall **depend on the Dao’s shelter** [咸依道荫].

After attaining the Dao,
one **ascends to the Formless** [升入无形],
and **harmonizes with the True Dao** [和与道合真].

**Midday**

We, Your servants, humbly hear of the **crimson flames of the divine crossbow** [赤熛神弩],
and the **fierce might of Zhùróng** [祝融烈威].

---

**Midday**

We, Your servants, humbly hear of the **crimson flames of the divine crossbow** [赤熛神弩],
and the **fierce might of Zhùróng** [祝融烈威].

**On High, You govern authority** [在天司权],
with roles as **either sovereign or minister** [有或君或相之职];
**on Earth, You oversee the flow of seasons** [在国出纳],
with the **times of spring and autumn** [有季春季秋之时].
Above, You **purify the radiant emotions of the Sun’s warmth** [上则洁阳燧感格之情],
and below, You **enforce the strict prohibitions of the Metal Bell** [下则严木铎修行之禁].
When **dikes fail or are lost** [堤防或失], Your **stern punishment descends from Heaven** [厉降自天];
when **mercy is extended or delayed** [延发有加], none **escape Your grace** [幸免无地].
We fear the **habit of reckless ignorance** [大惧昏顽之俗],
and the **unrepentant hearts that defy sacred prohibitions** [罔悛僭戒之心].
For Heaven **detests excess** [天恶其盈],
and the **Ghosts observe and impose retribution** [鬼瞰而罚].
May we **forever cease from burning ruin** [永惟焦头烂额而遏绝],
and instead **purify our thoughts and wash our hearts** [涤虑洗心而祷祠],
so that **repentance arises at the first stir** [悔悟一萌],
and **Your mercy shines like the depths of a mirror** [昭回渊鉴].
We, Your servants, **devote our lives to the Dao’s shelter** [捐躯道荫],
and **bow in reverence to Your True Benevolence** [稽首真慈].
Though we are **mere creatures like wolves or jackals** [豺獭报微],
we **dare not neglect Your inspection** [敢图省察];
though we are **humble as ants or crickets** [蝼蚁诚至],
we **all earnestly seek Your complete hearing** [咸冀彻闻].
We pray that **Your sacred radiance ascends to the celestial hour** [惟灵辉上次之辰],
and **Your divine chariot descends to the mortal realm** [与仙驭下游之分].
May You **relieve Your wrath and bestow hidden blessings** [望蠲威命],
so that **our homes are serene and our wells tranquil** [阴锡庬休，里闬清宁，井闾澄泰],
with **no fears of calamity** [不虞自息] and **no unintended offenses** [非意罔干].
In **wars and fires** [兵火灾伤], we **measure the perils of destruction** [寻度危亡之厄];
in **eclipses and winds and rains** [晦明风雨], we **rely on Your auspicious favor** [更叨利顺之功].
How could we **not submit in devotion** [敢不皈依] to repay Your **nurturing of all** [以酬化育]?

With **sincere hearts**, we **submit to the command of the South**:
**the True Sovereign of the Crimson Heaven** [南方离位丹天赤皇上真],
**the Dao-Master of the Fire Virtue** [道主火德荧惑星执法真君],
**the Celestial Spirits born of the Sun’s essence and Moon’s breath** [精炁所变传日旁月彗孛异星星君],
**and the divine officials among the stars** [星中神仙诸灵官].
May You **extend compassion to the world below** [垂慈人世],
**take pity on the common and lowly** [悯察凡庸],
**descend to the dusty realm** [俯降尘寰],
**oversee our earnest sincerity** [监斯诚悃],
**pour forth Your blessings and grant forgiveness** [流恩赐福，赦罪释愆],
**extinguishing the flames that spread like wildfire** [绝焰焰之燎原],
and **banishing the deceitful whispers of calamity** [无嘻嘻之妖语].
May **no birds cry at the sacrificial grounds of Mò** [鸟不鸣於亳社],
so that **our households may dwell in peace** [家以靖安];
may **no stars appear ominous in the Great Hour** [星无孛於大辰],
so that **all may prosper in health** [人皆康阜].
May **the crows and magpies vanish** [鷝鴭消去],
**preventing baseless disasters** [预禳无妄之灾];
and may **the quails rest content** [鹑首居饮],
**reaping the joy of great fortune** [终获大来之庆].
After attaining the Dao,
one **ascends to the Formless** [升入无形],
and **harmonizes with the True Dao** [和与道合真].

---

**Quiet Night**

We, Your servants, humbly hear of the **Crimson Heaven’s Vermilion Palace** [丹天绛府],
which **holds dominion over life and death without favor** [掌生录以无私];
and the **Jade Palace of the South** [离位朱宫],
which **spreads the Sun’s radiant might** [布阳威而有赫].
You **emanate Your luminous essence to dispel darkness** [运灵芒而烛暗],
and **vigorously dispense Your pure *qi*** [腾正气以流辉].
All who dwell beneath Your light
**may follow and submit in reverence** [得遵皈仰].

Now, we, Your servants,
**present humble offerings of wild plants and clay** [择芹捧块],
and **bare our hearts and livers at the Vermilion Terrace** [露肝胆於朱陵].
With **pure intentions and tranquil hearts** [洁志清心],
we **invoke the clouds and mists at the Crimson Palace** [降云霞於赤府].
With **sincere devotion**, we **submit to the command of the South**:
**the Great Sage of Fire Virtue** [南方大圣火德上真荧惑星真君],
**the True Person among the stars** [星中真人],
**the Great God among the stars** [星中大神],
**the Celestial Spirits of the Star Palace** [星宫神仙],
**and the divine officials** [诸灵官].

We **earnestly pray that the Earth’s threefold return** [地回三舍]
**confirms the brilliance of past decrees** [验彰前典之中];
and that **the Dao’s praise ascends to the Nine Heavens** [道赞一人，珠贯九霄之上].
May Your **sacred insight turn back** [回圣鉴],
and **long observe our crimson sincerity** [久察丹诚].
May You **ascend upon the red mists and clouds** [蹑丹霞红雾以上流],
and **descend in the radiant crimson carriage** [拥绯饰明舆而下降].
May You **accept our earnest devotion** [纳斯垦悃],
and **grant us extraordinary blessings** [锡以殊祥],
**removing the disasters that plague our bodies** [祛身罹命偶之灾],
and **clearing the faults that arise from our words and deeds** [除口发心为之过].

May **the wild grasses and humble huts** [草茅生聚]
**enjoy the cooling of summer’s heat** [度暑景以清凉];
and may **the earthen and wooden dwellings** [土木形骸]
**align with the sequence of the Primordial Yang** [计元阳之气序].
May **every household be free from fear of flying embers** [比屋免飞烟之恐],
and **every connected roof unalarmed by fierce flames** [连甍无烈焰之惊].
May **all creatures alike** [普及群生]
**depend on the Great Transformation** [同依大化].

After attaining the Dao,
one **ascends to the Formless** [升入无形],
and **harmonizes with the True Dao** [和与道合真].

**End of the Thirty-Sixth Chapter of *The Complete Daoist Rituals and Precepts***
**Beginning of the Thirty-Seventh Chapter of *The Complete Daoist Rituals and Precepts***

**Thirty-Seventh Chapter of *The Complete Daoist Rituals and Precepts*
*Ritual for Securing the Abode and Warding Off Calamities*
*Compiled by the Three Cavern Scripture and Talisman Disciple Zhòng Lì*

**Establishing the Altar and Invoking the Dao**
Conduct the ritual as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.
Proclaim the Sacred Warding Incantations.

**East:**
Nine *qi* of Azure Heaven, the Bright Star Great God.
Illuminating the eastern quarter, piercing the Nine Gates.
Turning the torch of Yang-light, sweeping away filth and miasma.
Awaken the Bright Child, named **Xuanqīng**.
Guard my hall, facing the Celestial Sovereign.
Subdue demons and bind malevolent spirits, hunting down the wicked throng.
Uphold the True Dao, with crimson script and jade inscriptions.
Nine-Heaven talismans command, summoning the Dragon’s courier.
All under heaven secured—
I attain the Flying Immortal,
and **harmonize with the True Dao**.

**South:**
Three *qi* of Vermilion Heaven, radiant splendor and flowing light.
The Wandering Star turns the torch, piercing the Great Sun.
Above, the Vermilion Pure One, sealed in pact with the Void Sovereign.
Awaken the Spirit Child, named **Huáfáng**.
Command the Fire Soldiers, guarding the Jade Hall.
Sever evil and bind demons, beheading the Magical King.
The North Emperor’s mandate—
wind and fire dare not resist.
Chimes resound in brilliance, shielding the ritual ground.
The True Dao spreads—
who dares defy?
I reap the highest merit,
seated upon the Pole Star’s power.
For countless eons, I endure—
boundless as Heaven,
and **harmonize with the True Dao**.

**West:**
Seven *qi* of White Heaven, the Great White’s essence flows.
Glowing the Golden Gate, piercing the Great Darkness.
Within, the White Sovereign, named **Emperor of Spirits**,
preserving the divine and securing my form.
Severing the source of evil—
the Kingly Dao shines clear.
Palaces stand in order, the Three Luminaries aligned.
The Dao merges with Nature—
ascending to the Purple Court.
Sacred Talismans’ command benefits all beings.
The Primordial Sovereign’s *qi* merges with my body.
My merit surpasses all—
Heaven and Earth alike at peace,
and **harmonize with the True Dao**.

**North:**
Five *qi* of Dark Heaven, the Primordial Wanderer.
The Star of Destiny blazes, illuminating the Supreme Mystery.
The Black Spirit Venerable, named **Céngwēi**.
Commanding the Flying Celestial, robes of silk and feathered garb.
Guarding the Five Gates, seizing the essence and capturing the false.
Who dares attempt—
shattered and slain.
The Jade Talisman decrees—
the Spirit subdues the Eight Powers.
Evil gates sealed, the True Dao opens wide.
Reflecting upon my form, the Three Lights shine as one.
Mounting the void, riding the floating—
my body ascends as an Immortal,
and **harmonize with the True Dao**.

**Central:**
One *qi* of Yellow Heaven, regulating Heaven and Earth.
Forging Yin and Yang, commanding the Mysterious True.
The Star of Stability radiates, its brilliance flowing through the Nine Heavens.
Awaken the Bright Child, named **Tiànlín**.
The Primordial *qi*’s Yang-essence flares with crimson smoke.
Piercing all under Heaven, reaching my disciples’ forms.
A hundred evils crushed, ten thousand ghosts slain.
The Central Mountain’s incantation—
all under Heaven obeys.
The Five Spirits secure—
my body flies as a Celestial Immortal,
and **harmonize with the True Dao**.

**Strike the Ritual Drum twenty-four times.**
**Ignite the Furnace.**
**Invoke the Law’s Titles.**

**The present officials and all others humbly unite with the assembled congregation of all officers, now offering incense in devotion. By this merit, we honor the Heavenly Sovereign, kings and princes, all ministers and officials, the land and territorial deities, scripture masters, and those who dwell in mountains and forests, cultivating the Dao and seeking True Immortality. We also honor all fellow students, the nine degrees of kin, and all people of the world—both living and sentient beings alike.**

**Now, with sincere hearts, we extend universal repentance. The undersigned and all disciples humbly submit our bodies, our spirits, and our lives to the Supreme Ten-Directional Numen, the Natural and Primordial Dao of Boundless Truth. We beseech thee to grant us forgiveness—ourselves and the officiating assembly—for all transgressions of past and present lives, freeing us from the Three Evil Paths, the Ten Sufferings and Eight Hardships, and the Nine Calamities, that we may attain the Dao’s True Essence, traverse the void, ascend to Heaven in broad daylight, and attend upon the Dao Sovereign in the Boundless Golden Threshold and the Seven-Treasured Natural Palace, forever harmonizing with the Dao.**

**All petitions of Mysterious Grace are presented before the Supreme Dao of Boundless Truth.**
**Repentance is offered.**
**The Law’s Titles are solemnly invoked once more.**

**The present officials and all others, with united sincerity, hereby present our petition. To the Supreme Dao of Boundless Truth, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, the Supreme Dao Sovereign, the Supreme Lord of Old Age, the Jade Emperor of Augmented Heaven, the Great Imperial Sovereign of the Starry Enchen Court, the Grand Imperial Sovereign of the Celestial Pole, the Earthly Sovereign of the Five Empires, the Supreme Lord of Natural Earth, the Boundless Dao of Ten Directions, the Celestial Venerable of Moral Dao and Sacred Worthies, the Great Emperor of Supreme Truth, the Heavenly Emperor, the Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scriptures, and the Mysterious Master of the Central Dao—we humbly invoke thee, the Five Celestial Masters of Wuji and the True Spirit of Central Yellow.**

**In the Dragon and Han epochs, spanning countless kalpas, we were lost in the nameless chaos. When the Imperial Sovereign’s plan unfolded, the people’s customs were shaped by desire. The Primordial Dao divided its essence to respond to transformation, and the Divine Sacrificial Ox emerged with wisdom to awaken potential. After shifting from caves to dwellings, we raised beams and pillars. Through agriculture and cultivation, we gained the advantage of pestles and mortars; refining fur and blood, we found the utility of stoves and cauldrons. The Six Ministries were well-ordered, and the Three Hierarchies established. Thus, from the warmth of Yang and the chill of Yin, the harshness of Jia and the softness of Yi, life and death were hidden in the formless, and blessings and misfortunes concealed in the unfathomable. Only through the study of scriptures did we gradually perceive the ties of mundane existence.**

**Though we are but humble grass and insignificant dust, weak in nature and lowly in origin, we have been fortunate to inherit the lingering blessings of past ages and to encounter this enlightened time. Having secured a dwelling to reside in, we now earnestly seek the Heavenly Sovereign’s gracious favor, reverently observing the fasts and rites of purification, and giving thanks to the True Spirits.**

**As we have been entrusted with the office of the True Ministry and honored as leaders of the Dao, our duty is to propagate its teachings and our aspiration to establish merit. None who seek sincerity shall be left unanswered. Today, we present our heartfelt words and dare not withhold them. Our petition is now declared.**

**According to our words, we solemnly vow: We shall purify our five limbs with bathing, refine our six emotions, follow the rites for averting disasters and calamities, and perform the methods for securing a tranquil abode and harmonious dwelling. We arrange the altar as prescribed, and its design mirrors Heaven. With the offerings of the officiating household—silk, brocade, and devotional tokens—we pacify the Five Directions. With incense, flowers, lamps, and candles, we affirm our sincere and earnest resolve.**

**From this day forward, we establish this fast as its beginning. When the appointed time arrives and our petition is heard by the Supreme Truth, we shall pray for blessings and grace, for the peace of spirits and the resolution of offenses, all in accordance with the fast’s precepts. Previously, we have already presented our petition, and our gratitude is directed to the Supreme Three Venerables and the Ten-Directional Sacred Worthies, who deign to inspect and reflect upon our supplications. We now command the appointed inspectors, the land and territorial deities, to unite in heart, to join in strength, and to sweep away all impurities within and without. May the altar be cleansed and the path to the void be opened, that the True Saints may descend in response, granting our hearts tranquility and our spirits steadfastness. With our thoughts focused and our petitions heard, let our good deeds be fulfilled without obstruction.**

**On the following bright dawn, we shall continue our Dao practice and renew our petition.**
**Twelve Vows are hereby declared.**

**Reigniting the Incense Altar**

The incense officials and messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the attendant spirit officials of incense—now command that the places where I have previously established the altar and practiced the Dao shall spontaneously generate golden elixir and jade-green herbs, numinous grasses and spirits, as the myriad True Ones gather before this incense altar.

May I now vow that the celestial youths and jade maidens of the Ten Directions attend to the fragrant mists, transmitting my sincere supplications directly to the Supreme True One of the Unfathomable Dao, the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Court. **Exit the hall to chant.** **Exit the door.**

*End of Volume Thirty-Seven of the Grand Compilation of Daoist Rituals and Precepts*
*Volume Thirty-Eight of the Grand Compilation of Daoist Rituals and Precepts*
*Compiled by the Three Cavern Scripture and Talisman Disciple Zhong Li*
**Ritual Thirty-Eight: Anning and Exorcism Ceremony – Conducting the Dao at Dawn**

**Conducting the Dao at Dawn**
Perform the ritual rites upon the altar as prescribed. Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.

**Proclaim the Spirit-Guarding Incantations.**
The Azure Yang radiates in void, illuminating the sun’s return to life.
The Spirit Tiger repels malevolence; the flying heavens toll their bells.
The wicked are crushed, the trials extinguished—ten thousand demons bound in form.
The Nine Mysteries circle the Dao; the Eight Powers subdue the essence.
The myriad True Ones register their ranks; the Three Primordials sweep purity.
The Left summons the Central Yellow; the Right wields the Six Ding.
Seven rotations, eight harmonies—revolving through the Celestial Canon.
The Sacred Transformation stands majestic; the Great Dao is set in motion.
Auspicious clouds flow abroad, merging with the Yellow Court—harmony with the Dao’s True Essence.

**Strike the Law-Drum twenty-four times.**

The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin of the Three Breaths—
The Supreme Dao Lord,
The Supreme Laozi—
summon forth from within my body the Three Five Functionaries, the Left and Right Official Messengers, the Left and Right Incense-Bearers, the Relay Dragon Cavalry, the Attendant Golden Boys, the Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols, the Direct-Day Incense Officials—each thirty-six in number—**to emerge.**

Those who emerge must don their formal robes and adornments, their headbands and trailing ribbons, opening the gates to the Mystic Altar’s land and territorial spirits, the domain’s numinous worthies.

Today, at dawn, I conduct the Dao with utmost sincerity, my earnest intentions already recorded and presented. May the Supreme Dao’s numinous breath of the Ten Directions descend in its radiant treasure-light, flowing into my body, so that my supplications may swiftly reach the Supreme Unfathomable Dao, the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Court.

**Declare the Legal Title.**
With the assembled officials of the altar, I, [Name], humbly unite in sincerity to present our petition to:
The Supreme Unfathomable Dao,
The Primordial Heavenly Venerable,
The Supreme Dao Lord,
The Supreme Laozi,
The Celestial Sovereign, the Jade Emperor of the Highest,
The Gouchen Star Constellation’s Heavenly Emperor,
The Purple Forbidden’s Celestial Star Master,
The Earthly Sovereign who follows Heaven’s law,
The Ten-Directional Supreme Dao,
The Heavenly Venerables of Dao and Virtue,
The Supreme True Emperor,
The Heavenly Emperor,
The Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Masters of the Mystic Middle Law,
The Five Emperors of the Soil Palace—Great Sovereign, Great Origin,
The Central Yellow’s Steward of the Five-and-Six Responsive Spirits.

I have heard that the Heavenly Venerable’s transformation gives birth, the Great Dao bestows its work—
the Two Breaths shape form, all spirits derive their beginning.
The Round and Pure above bind, suspending sun and moon, arraying stars;
The Square and Impure below congeal, spreading mountains and rivers, blending seas and peaks.
Thus, the hundred spirits take their posts to stabilize the cardinal quarters;
The Five Emperors govern their divisions, each securing their place.
Even the Celestial Metropolis of Pure Clarity, its hundred-tiered nine-enclosed halls,
the counties, cities, human dwellings—
all bear their lawful symbols, corresponding to Heaven and Earth,
relying on the function of tranquil settlement to fulfill the blessings of universal peace.

My duty lies in teaching and assisting the state in its achievements. Whatever I petition must logically be presented. How much more so when commanded by decree—how dare I not report it?

**Proclaim the Petition.**
As the words state, the sincerity is urgent and profound—
through the power of spiritual resonance, it ascends to the True Spirits.

We, the disciples, follow the Dao’s flow, adhere to the ritual forms, arrange the altar in its proper pattern—
the ritual ground mirrors Heaven, the dragon’s brilliance spreads to the Ten Directions,
our sincere words ascend to the Three Realms.

At this dawn, conducting the Dao, I request that the assembled ritualists light the first incense strand.
May this incense cloud ascend to the Supreme Dao-Treasure Heavenly Venerable of the Ten Directions.

We, with body, spirit, and fate, prostrate ourselves in homage,
offering this incense’s merit to bless the current Emperor.

May I humbly pray that the Five Mountains stabilize the land, forever aligning with grand designs;
that the Eight Seas float beneath Heaven, eternally harmonizing with auspicious ages.

「Thus, the blessings surpass those of the Zhou and Han dynasties, while the sage’s virtue excels that of Xīn and Nóng.

The consorts and heirs of the royal line are filled with the radiant virtue of the Sage Emperor.
The princes and princesses are granted harmonious auspicious signs.

The wheels of the chariot blend with the Nine Enclosures,
the ladders and stakes gather in the Ten Thousand Abodes.

Now, in this solemn burning of incense,
I humbly return to rely on the Dao-Way’s Venerable Great Sage, the Most True and Universal Virtue.

After attaining the Dao, I preserve Heaven’s enduring existence,
harmonizing with the True and Perfect Way.

At this dawn, conducting the Dao,
I request the assembled ritualists to light the second incense strand.
May this incense smoke ascend to the Supreme Dao-Treasure Heavenly Venerable of the Ten Directions.

We, with body, spirit, and fate,
prostrate ourselves in homage,
offering this incense’s merit to bless the household of the Ritual Official [name],
for nine generations and seven rebirths,
that they may transcend the Night Realm;
and for the six kinsfolk and five clans,
that they may all attain the Immortal Stage.

May their dwellings remain serene and peaceful,
with dragon spirits guarding them,
evil calamities extinguished,
and malevolent forces not arising.

Now, in this solemn burning of incense,
I humbly return to rely on the Scripture-Way’s Venerable Great Sage, the Most True and Universal Virtue.

After attaining the Dao, I ascend to the Formless,
harmonizing with the True and Perfect Way.

At this dawn, conducting the Dao,
I request the assembled ritualists to light the third incense strand.
May this incense smoke ascend to the Supreme Teacher-Way Heavenly Venerable of the Ten Directions.

We, with body, spirit, and fate,
prostrate ourselves in homage,
offering this incense’s merit to flow throughout Heaven and Earth,
benefiting all sentient beings,
that they may universally partake in the Dao’s blessings,
and all attain the True Fruit.

The Ritual Official’s [name] misfortunes are dispelled before they manifest,
and boundless blessings descend.
All ride upon the wondrous Dao’s merit,
and eternally verify the essence of longevity.

Now, in this solemn burning of incense,
I humbly return to rely on the Teacher-Way’s Venerable Great Sage, the Most True and Universal Virtue.

After attaining the Dao, I preserve Heaven’s enduring existence,
harmonizing with the True and Perfect Way.

Repentance is offered three times, three bows are made.
The sacred titles are reverently invoked once more.

The Ritual Official [name] and all present,
with sincere hearts, humbly petition:
The Heavenly Venerable of the Formless and Most True Three Realms,
the Ten Directions’ Boundless Great Dao,
the Heavenly Venerable of the Universal Virtue of the Thirty-Six Divisions of Sacred Scriptures,
the Soil Realm’s Five Sovereigns of the Supreme Yellow Emperor and the Stewarding Five,
and the Responsive True Spirits of the Central Yellow Emperor and the Stewarding Five.

We hear that before the Dao’s transformation,
the primordial chaos was the origin of all.
The Formless Virtue was not yet carved,
and the True One was in perfect unity with Non-being.
When the Two Symbols divided and spirits emerged,
the Three Talents established their positions,
clearing and turbid harmonized with the essence of Heaven and Earth,
darkness and brightness distinguished the day and night.

The myriad spirits of yin and yang
each govern their respective duties.

Thus, we construct these dwellings,
replacing the layered nests of old.
Taking the Dao from the Celestial Pass,
we proclaim it through the Yin Veil.

Therefore, the Heavenly Stem’s (乾) beneficence and the Earthly Branch’s (兌) abundance
each have their sovereigns to oversee,
and the Fire of Separation (離) and the Wind of Gathering (巽)
alternate in their waxing and waning.

To follow them brings certainty of fidelity and good fortune,
to defy them invites retribution and blame.

From ancient times to the present,
all have adhered to this Dao-Way.

The Ritual Official [name], having divined and built,
fears transgressions may have occurred,
making the divine path unclear,
and human understanding obscure.

Having completed the work of earth and wood,
we now present the rites of incense and lamp,
offer repentance for sins and pray for mercy,
dispel calamities and atone for offenses,
greatly expand the Ritual Offerings,
and ascend to the Most True.

Thus, we arrange and establish the ritual platform,
following the prescribed forms and rituals.

The orchid lamps scatter their brilliance,
illuminating the Nine Abysses below;
the incense strands condense their smoke,
ascending to the Three Realms above.

As we chant the scriptures and conduct the Dao,
we universally repent and pray.

For offenses against the divine spirits,
or for harming the souls of the Underworld;
for slaughtering living beings or defiling sacred traces,
or for provoking the dragon deities and violating prohibitions—
whether through labor or disputes,
or by relocating without proper timing and direction,
accumulating grievances and entanglements,
or dwelling within the Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams,
or within the Twelve Earthly Branches,
or offending the seventy-two gods of yin and yang,
binding them to the earthly officials—

We now petition the Celestial Realm,
through today’s repentance and atonement,
to also beg for their sweeping removal,
that the Ritual Official’s blessings may universally extend,
and their virtuous merits reach far and wide.

Descending the Nine Dragon Talismans,
we proclaim to all the heavens;
invoking the Three Treasures’威神,
we command the Three Realms.

This reaches the Night Realm,
opening all luminous paths,
securing the Emperor’s celestial domain in the Nine Heavens,
and spreading the mysterious peace throughout the Ten Thousand Lands.
The Five Armies rest in order,
and the hundred grains flourish in abundance.

In the Ritual Official’s household,
both the living and the dead are at peace,
the clans prosper in auspicious harmony,
the children and grandchildren are loyal and filial,
their descendants flourish in glory,
their faults are pardoned in the Underworld,
and their names are inscribed in the True Realm.
The duties of yin and yang,
both inner and outer deities,
protect the Dao and bring peace to all,
benefit the times and aid living beings,
together extolling the Dao’s transformation,
assisting the righteous and repelling the evil,
reaching even to the distant and obscure,
all attaining the wondrous Dao-Way.
Above, we honor the Heavenly Venerable’s vast salvation,
and below, we fulfill our sincere devotion to fate.
Humbly, we petition and submit.

**Twelve Vows.**

**Reignite the Incense.**

The incense officials and messengers,
the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals,
and the attendant spirits of incense,
should now command the Ritual Official’s previous place of ritual,
where naturally arise the golden elixir and emerald-green essence,
mushrooms and herbs of myriad blessings,
and the gathering of all the True Ones,
right here before this incense burner.

May it be so that the Ten Directions’ Immortal youths and maidens
attend to the orchid incense,
and swiftly convey the Ritual Official’s previous petitions
to the Supreme Court of the Formless, Most True, and Boundless Great Dao,
and before the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign.

**Exit the Hall and Chant.**

**Exit the Door.**

**Dao Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Thirty-Eight Complete**
**Dao Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Thirty-Nine**
*Compiled by the Three Caverns Scripture and Talisman Disciple Zhongli*

**An Residence Crime-Expiation Rite**
*Performed at Midday*

The ritual platform is ascended as prescribed.
Each pays respect to the Master in accordance with the law.
The **Wei Ling** incantation is proclaimed.

The **Dan Ling** and **Zhu Fire** blaze,
flaming clouds and gusting winds surge.
The **Red Wheel** rolls with vigor,
celestial light surges forth.

Thunderous might envelops all,
transformations ripple through the Ten Directions.
Molten gold cascades, demons vanish without trace.
Evil is dispelled, the Dao’s primal virtue shines forth.
Golden talismans summon and command—
riding clouds, wielding dragons.
Hymns of joy resound, flowers scatter through the void.
Divine transformations unfold—
the Four Quarters flourish in peace.

Humbly prostrated before the Celestial Sovereign,
none dare be disrespectful—
harmony with the Dao, unity with the True.

**Twenty-four strikes of the sacred drum.**

The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Beginning Three Qi**,
the **Supreme Dao Lord**,
the **Supreme Venerable Lord**,
summon forth from within my body:
the **Three Five Officials of Merit**,
the Left and Right Official Messengers,
the Left and Right Incense-Bearers,
the **Postal Dragon Cavalry Clerks**,
the **Golden Boys Attending Incense**,
the **Speaking and Flower-Scattering Celestial Maidens**,
the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**,
the **Direct Sun Incense Officials**—
each, thirty-six in number, now emerge.

The departed don **solemn ritual attire and vows**,
adorned with caps and trailing ribbons,
opening the **Mysterious Platform’s Land and Domain Spirits**,
the **Regional Deities and True Ones**.

Now, as I perform the midday ritual,
I humbly present my sincerest petition.
My deepest aspirations are recorded and conveyed.
May the **Supreme Dao’s Ten Directions’ Most True Qi**,
the **Numinous Treasure Radiance**, descend and flow into my body,
so that my petitions swiftly reach the **Supreme Boundless Dao**,
before the **Celestial Sovereign Jade Emperor**.

**Proclaim the Legal Title.**

I, **Position-Holder [Name]**, along with all platform officials,
sincerely present our petition to:
the **Supreme Boundless Dao**,
the **Primordial Heavenly Venerable**,
the **Supreme Dao Lord**,
the **Supreme Venerable Lord**,
the **Ten Directions’ Supreme Boundless Dao**,
the **Moral and Virtue Holy Saints of Heaven**,
the **Most True Great Emperor**,
the **Heavenly Emperor**,
the **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Scripture Masters of the Mysterious Middle**,
the **Earthly Bureau’s Grand Imperial Five Emperors of Origin**,
the **Central Yellow Steward of the Wu-Ji Responsive True Spirit**.

We have long been favored by the Mysterious Grace,
encountering the Dao’s transformation.
The Five Scripts illuminate the landscape,
the Three Caverns radiate light—
drawing profound principles from the Heavy Mysterious,
unfolding divine power in wondrous application.
Having attained the secrets of the arcane,
we now present our vows and deeds.
From the outset of our pledge,
we established merit as our foundation.
All who turn toward the Dao—
how could we fail to report upward?
Our sincerest aspirations are now proclaimed.

**Proclaim the Words.**

As the words declare, our devotion is sincere and exalted.
We, who bear the Mysterious Sciences,
ought to open the path to enlightenment.
The **Ritual Official [Name]**, having recently undertaken repairs,
with earthworks and construction underway,
fears offending the True Spirits.
Thus, we humbly petition for expiation.

We dare to follow the **Three Pure Ones’ ordinances**,
unveil the **Nine Petitions’ rites**,
present our faith-filled words,
and request the **Fast’s Direct Petition**,
hoping to rely on the **Gate’s Petition**,
to reach the Most True above.

Now, as we perform the midday ritual,
we request the assembled ritualists to light the **first incense strand**,
wishing this incense cloud to ascend and supply the **Ten Directions’ Supreme Dao-Treasure Heavenly Venerable**.

We, having **surrendered body, spirit, and fate**,
prostrate our heads to the ground,
offering this incense-strand’s merit
to nourish the ancestral temples’ numinous spirits,
the ordered ranks of saints,
ascending to the sacred grades above,
bestowing blessings upon the imperial lineage below.

The Emperor’s virtue follows **Xīn and Nóng**,
illuminating like the sun and moon,
holding the **Golden Mirror** over the Four Seas,
adjusting the **Jade Candle** to nurture all under heaven.
Loyal ministers serve in court,
no talent is left untapped in the wilds.

Now, we burn this incense,
and **return to rely on the Dao-Venerable Great Saints’ Most True Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
we preserve the Heavenly Eternal—
harmony with the Dao, unity with the True.

Now, as we perform the midday ritual,
we request the assembled ritualists to light the **second incense strand**,
wishing this incense smoke to ascend and supply the **Ten Directions’ Supreme Scripture-Treasure Heavenly Venerable**.

We, having **surrendered body, spirit, and fate**,
prostrate our heads to the ground,
offering this incense-strand’s merit
to flow back to the **Ritual Official [Name]’s ancestral nine generations’ solemn rites**—
ascending to heaven, awakening to the Dao;
the **Seven Mysteries’ swift ascent**, attaining the True grades.

Even the **Residence Dragons and Spirits**,
the **Yin-Yang Officers and Clerks**,
each return to their appointed domains,
harmonizing with the **Non-Action**,
ascending in rank upon the numinous stages,
achieving singular merit in the Dao’s fruits.

Now, we burn this incense,
and **return to rely on the Scripture-Venerable Great Saints’ Most True Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
we ascend to the **Formless**—
harmony with the Dao, unity with the True.

Now, as we perform the midday ritual,
we request the assembled ritualists to light the **third incense strand**,
wishing this incense cloud to ascend and supply the **Ten Directions’ Supreme Teacher-Treasure Heavenly Venerable**.

We, having **surrendered body, spirit, and fate**,
prostrate our heads to the ground,
offering this incense-strand’s merit
to flow to the **Ritual Official [Name]’s blessings**—
the **Dao-Wind’s far-reaching influence**,
longevity extending to eternal fortune,
guilt erased, calamities extinguished.
Then, in the **Nightly Bureau’s Cold Courts**,
through the **Three Realms and Six Paths**,
all are liberated from stagnation,
united in contracting with the Most True.

Now, we burn this incense,
and **return to rely on the Teacher-Venerable Great Saints’ Most True Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
we endure the **Heavenly Eternal**—
harmony with the Dao, completeness with the True.

**Chant the Square, Repent the Square, Command the Demons—**
three petitions, three rites.

**Re-proclaim the Legal Title.**

I, **Position-Holder [Name]**, along with all platform officials,
sincerely present our petition to:
the **Golden Gate’s Void-Nothing Nine Pure Celestial Sovereign**,
the **Earthly Bureau’s Grand Imperial Five Emperors of Origin**,
the **Central Yellow Steward of the Wu-Ji Responsive True Spirit**.

We have heard:
When the Great Dao was divided,
the Sage established teachings,
drawing from the **Easy Symbols**,
modeling the **Upper Mysterious**.

He framed the **rules for dwellings**,
replaced the **animal nests’ customs**,
for the benefit of all under heaven,
to shelter all living beings.
Thus, he commanded the **Heavenly Earthly Deities and Spirits**,
the **Yin-Yang Officers and Clerks**,
to rank in stages, each with their appointed roles.
Ancient and modern alike adhere—
no discrepancy in auspicious or inauspicious matters.

The **Ritual Official [Name]**, having recently undertaken repairs,
with earthworks and construction underway,
fears piercing the **Spirits’ sacred traces**,
intruding upon the **Deities’ positions**,
offending the **auspicious Kingly Qi**,
violating the **forbidden prohibitions**.
