**Translation:**

Thus, we open the ritual hall,
to extend our sincere repentance and gratitude.

We, the officials, follow the **rankings of the River Chart**,
unfold the **rites of the Three Caverns**,
strive to emulate the **Dao’s flowing law**,
and diligently refine our **fasting and rectitude**.
We bow our heads beneath the **Three Primordials**,
and bare our hearts before the **Ten Thousand Saints**,
to repent our sins and blemishes,
and pray for mercy and pardon,
hoping through our devout sincerity
to move the **True Spirits** to descend in favor.

We humbly petition on behalf of disciple **[Name]**:
to the **Lord of the Granary** who rescues the defeated,
the **Lord of the Golden Gate** who secures the celestial realm,
the **Lord of the Auspicious Kingly Qi**,
the **Lord who Repels Calamity and Averts Misfortune**,
the **Lord of the Red Sands** who governs celestial officials,
the **Lord of the Divine Clerks** who calculates peace,
the **Lord of the Beginning** who oversees construction,
the **Lord of the Green Dragon** who transforms the Dao,
and the **Lord who Ensures Residential Safety and Prosperity**,
to remove disasters and repel malevolent spirits,
to exterminate and annihilate the **malignant Qi**,
to subdue and tame the **evil essences**,
to crush the **poisonous influences** and repel the **hostile forces**,
to eliminate the **malevolent and demonic** and extinguish their breath.

We further petition the **Lord of the Han Dynasty’s Brightness**,
the **Lord of the Supreme Supervising Qi**,
the **Jade Maiden of the Furnace Flame**,
to lead the **Vanguard of the Great Army**,
and to collect the spirits dwelling within the residence,
as well as those of the **well and hearth**.

We also petition the **Lord Yang Fangping of the Stone**,
to collect the **earthly Qi** and the **harmful earthly spirits**.

We further petition the **Lord Gao of the Celestial Artisan**,
to collect the **Qi of the mounds and tombs beneath the earth**,
and the **forbidden and taboo spirits**,
so that the **right qi** may circulate freely,
and the **malevolent and evil** be crushed and subdued,
allowing us to dwell in **purity and celestial peace**,
to always enjoy **health and harmony**,
to have **auspicious omens** in our homes,
to be free from **untimely calamities**,
to let the **six kinsmen** share in blessings,
and to grant the **nine ancestors** ascension to **Heaven**,
to extend our **longevity and fortune**,
to dissolve our **guilt and blame**,
to reconcile our **grievances and feuds**,
to silence our **litigations and disputes**,
to ensure **inner and outer tranquility**,
and to make our **actions and stillness** clear and unobstructed.

May we pray that the **Sages’ designs** endure eternally,
and that our **lineage’s blessings** extend far and wide,
so that the **ten thousand nations** may dwell in harmony,
and the **eight trigrams** align with **nature’s transformations**,
that the **heavens be clear and the earth bright**,
that the **land be rich and its people joyful**,
that **auspicious omens** and **harmonious signs** appear,
that **propitious days** be recorded in the calendar,
that the **winds and clouds** display their **bountiful blessings**,
and that the **seas and mountains** rest in **serenity**.

May all beings in the **Six Realms** and **Nine Depths**,
those with life and sentience,
share in this **great benevolence**,
and each attain **freedom and ease**.

The **Dragon Gods of the Residence**,
the **proper officers of Yin-Yang**,
the **meritorious deeds of the Daoists**,
and the **peaceful settlement of the four directions**,
from the **dark to the bright**,
let all ascend to **celestial harmony**.

We, your disciples, seek to repay the **Lord’s boundless grace**,
and to fulfill our **sincere vows of submission**,
thus humbly present this petition.

**Twelve Vows.**

We renew the **furnace**.

The **Incense Officials and Divine Messengers**,
the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords**,
and the **Attendant Spirits of the Incense**,
should now command us to visit the **midday ritual site**,
where **golden nectar and emerald elixir**,
**mushrooms, herbs, and myriad sacred essences**,
and the **gathered True Ones**,
will naturally arise at this **incense burner**.

May we vow that the **Ten Thousand Celestial Children and Jade Maidens**,
attending the **fragrant incense vapors**,
will swiftly transmit our **earlier petitioned sincerity**
directly to the **Supreme Dao of the Boundless Primordial**,
before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor**’s **Celestial Court**.

**We exit the hall and chant.**
**We exit the door.**

**Dao Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Thirty-Nine Complete**
**Dao Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Forty**
*Three Caverns Scripture and Talisman Disciples’ Compendium of Admonition*
**An Residence Purification Rite**
**Evening Dao Practice**

The ritual platform is ascended as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master with reverent devotion.

The **Sacred Guardians’ Incantations** are proclaimed.
Five stars radiant, auspicious qi ascending.
**Primordial Sovereign** gathers the spirits—
Heaven and Earth in harmonious cycle.
Jade talismans and sacred seals command the unseen.
Flame hurled, might upheld—
Wickedness and malevolence crushed.
Ten thousand demons subdued, chaotic omens dispersed.
Monstrous evils annihilated, Daoic *qi* circulating.
Divine light illuminates the night—
Darkness and obscurity withdrawn.
Ten thousand spirits descend in ranks,
Wafting on zephyrs, blessing the scene.
All living beings prosper,
Grace extending across the land—
In harmony with the True Dao.

**Twenty-four strokes of the Law Drum** resound.

The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Sovereign**, the **Three *Qi* of the Highest Dao Lord, the Highest Venerable Lord**,
summons forth from my body:
The **Thirty-Six Functionaries of the Five and Nine**,
Left and Right Official Messengers,
Left and Right Incense-Bearers,
Postal Dragon Cavalry Clerks,
Attendant Golden Boys of Incense,
Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens,
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**,
Direct-Sun Incense Officials—
each, thirty-six in number, now emerge.

The emerged ones arrayed in solemn splendor,
Crowns and sashes adorned with trailing ribbons,
Opening the **Mysterious Platform’s Land and Domain Spirits**,
All territorial deities and True Ones.

I, in this quiet night of Dao practice,
Humbly present this as my sincere intent.
My deepest vows already recorded and reported—
May the **Supreme Dao’s Ten Thousand Directions’ True *Qi***
and **Numinous Treasure Auspicious Light** descend,
Flowing into my body,
So that my petition may swiftly reach
The **Supreme Boundless Dao, the Jade Emperor of Heaven’s Celestial Court**.

**Law Position is invoked.**
I, **Subject of Rank [X]**, with all platform officials,
Solemnly together present with sincerity:
To the **Supreme Boundless Dao**,
**Primordial Sovereign of the Beginning**,
**Highest Dao Lord**,
**Highest Venerable Lord**,
**Ten Thousand Directions’ Supreme Boundless Dao**,
**Heavenly Saints of Dao and Virtue**,
**Most True Great Emperor**,
**Thirty-Six Departments’ Celestial Emperor’s Scripture Master of the Mysterious Middle**,
**Five Emperors of the Soil Bureau’s Grand Primordial Sovereign**,
**Central Yellow Steward of the Wu-Ji Responsive True Spirit**.

I have heard the **Highest Sovereign’s decrees**,
The **Primordial Emperor’s teachings**,
Melting all things, dispelling poisons across the lands.
The **Three Caverns’ Jade Scriptures** descend to the Nine Purity,
Manifesting wondrous truths;
The **Heavenly Great Saints** proclaim the Dao’s profundity to guide all.
Assisting the realm is paramount,
Compassionate salvation is fundamental.
For any petition or plea,
How dare we fail to report?
With fasting sincerity, we now proclaim.

**Proclamation:**
We, the fasting officials, according to this sincere petition,
Rightfully present our case.
**Fasting Official [X]**, in his residential abode,
Has undertaken repairs—
Lest we offend the numinous and violate prohibitions,
We humbly confess and atone for our transgressions.

Thus, we follow the prescribed rites,
Reverently honoring the platform’s solemnity,
Opening the **Celestial Capital’s Jade Registers**,
Adhering to the **Yellow Talisman’s concise texts**,
Modeling the ritual ground upon Heaven—
We fast and practice the Dao.

With today’s quiet night Dao practice,
The assembled petitioners now offer the **first incense strand**,
Wishing this incense cloud to ascend and venerate
The **Ten Thousand Directions’ Supreme Dao Treasure Heavenly Saints**.
We prostrate body and spirit, surrendering life and fate,
With this incense’s merit flowing to our ancestral temples,
Ascending to the ancestral ranks,
Spirits congealed in joy, transcending time’s constraints,
Praying for the Emperor’s elevation to higher realms,
Stabilizing the grand design,
Balancing the two luminaries to illuminate all lands,
Aligning the Three Lights to nurture all beings.
Consorts and concubines in the palace halls
Shine with auspicious brilliance.
Ministers of civil and martial ranks
Assist in realizing the sage’s transformations.

Now, this incense is offered—
We take refuge in the **Dao Saints’ Most True Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
We preserve Heaven’s longevity,
In harmony with the True Dao.

With today’s quiet night Dao practice,
The assembled petitioners now offer the **second incense strand**,
Wishing this incense’s essence to ascend and venerate
The **Ten Thousand Directions’ Supreme Scripture Treasure Heavenly Saints**.
We prostrate body and spirit, surrendering life and fate,
With this incense’s merit flowing to **Fasting Official [X]’s** nine generations of ancestral spirits,
Wandering joyfully in the Azure Palaces;
Sixth-degree kin and relations
Ascend to the ranks of the Immortal Assemblies.
Within the residence itself,
Dragon spirits and officials take their stations,
Purifying malevolence, ensuring perpetual peace,
Fulfilling auspicious omens forevermore.
Now, this incense is offered—
We take refuge in the **Scripture Saints’ Most True Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
We ascend to the Formless,
In harmony with the True Dao.

With today’s quiet night Dao practice,
The assembled petitioners now offer the **third incense strand**,
Wishing this incense smoke to ascend and venerate
The **Ten Thousand Directions’ Supreme Teacher Treasure Heavenly Saints**.
We prostrate body and spirit, surrendering life and fate,
With this incense’s merit flowing to all under Heaven,
Sentient beings near and far,
Reaching even the dim and luminous realms,
Equally sharing blessings.
**Fasting Official [X]’s** household’s calamities extinguished,
Lifespans extended, longevity assured,
Forever inheriting the Dao’s winds,
All attaining the True Immortal’s fruit.
Now, this incense is offered—
We take refuge in the **Teacher Saints’ Most True Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
We endure Heaven’s eternity,
In harmony with the True Dao.

**Chant the Square, Confess the Square, Three Invocations, Three Homages.**
**Law Position is invoked again.**
I, **Subject of Rank [X]**, with all platform officials,
Solemnly together present with sincerity:
To the **Three Realms’ Void Sovereigns of the Six Palaces**,
**Ten Thousand Directions’ Attained Dao Heavenly Saints**,
**Five Emperors of the Soil Bureau’s Grand Primordial Sovereign**,
**Central Yellow Steward of the Wu-Ji Responsive True Spirit**.

We have received the Most True teachings,
Studied the profound mysteries,
Yet our merit has not extended to plants and creatures,
Our transformations not perfected for all living beings.
Ever mindful of assisting the realm and guiding people,
Promoting the Dao and upholding the Law,
Proclaiming the Mysterious and Profound,
Broadly benefiting humans and heavens.

**Fasting Official [X]**, in constructing his dwelling,
Moved earth and stone—
Perhaps disturbing Dragon spirits;
Or raised low and lowered high—
Perhaps violating prohibitions;

「。
　　Yet further, we humbly beseech:
　　Perhaps the site of his dwelling harbors ancient **sacred sites** and **spirits’ abodes**;
　　Or the direction of excavation contains **ruined shrines** and **collapsed ramparts**;
　　Perhaps it defiles **immortal realms**;
　　Or intrudes upon **renowned traces**;
　　Perhaps it disregards the **Five Soil Classifications’** auspiciousness;
　　Or it contravenes the **Two Residences’** advantages.

　　Through his repairs and embellishments,
　　Misfortune and calamity ensue—
　　We devoutly establish **altars and ritual grounds**,
　　And broadly petition for **atonement and expiation**.

　　In accordance with the **Celestial Master’s** rank and dignity,
　　And following the **Orthodox Unity** scriptural tradition,
　　We respectfully request the **Twelve Departments of Salvation**—
　　The **Celestial Officials**, **Generals**, **Soldiers**, and **Ministers**—
　　To expel the **residual *qi***,
　　To purify and disperse **demonic malevolence**,
　　To repel the **earthly spirits of soil and wood**,
　　And the **wandering corpses and dependent ghosts**,
　　To alleviate the **Earthly Deities’** predatory harm,
　　To dissolve the **Five Directions’** forbidden calamities,
　　So that all **disastrous demons** are utterly banished—
　　Thus auspicious omens gather, and misfortunes vanish.

　　We humbly pray that the **Supreme Celestials**,
　　May extend their **merciful gaze**,
　　Descend **flowing *Dao-qi***,
　　And cover with their **auspicious protection** that place.

　　By imperial decree, let **orthodox spirits** be settled,
　　And let their **positions be secured**,
　　Ever in harmony with **purity and good fortune**,
　　Forever preserving **tranquility and prosperity**.

　　May the **Imperial Dao** flourish and the **Celestial Mandate** extend far—
　　The **three borders** be at peace,
　　The **eight seas** without turmoil,
　　Plagues and poisons not intrude,
　　And the **stars and constellations** align benignly.

　　Thus, within the **nightly domains of the underworld**,
　　He may long behold **radiant light**;
　　And all **sentient beings**,
　　Shall not lose their **rightful abode**.

　　For the **Fasting Official’s** household,
　　May **high purity** be attained,
　　And **spiritual rank** be confirmed in **Heavenly Birth**,
　　So that descendants perpetuate **loyalty and filial piety**,
　　And both near and far enjoy **eternal peace and blessings**—
　　With **Dragon spirits** in secret guardianship,
　　And **tranquility** in all **movements and stillness**,
　　Universal immersion in **mysterious efficacy**,
　　And joint ascent to the **true realm**.

　　Above, we honor the **Heavenly Celestials’** great **merciful grace**,
　　Below, we fulfill the **devout sincerity** of the petitioner—
　　Thus, we humbly submit and report.

　　**Twelve Petitions** completed.
　　Return to the **incense altar**.

　　**Incense Officials** and **Envoys**,
　　The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Celestial Generals**,
　　And the **attending spirits** of the **Incense Altar**,
　　Shall command the **Fasting Official** to return to his **serene nightly Dao-practice**,
　　Where **golden elixir** and **emerald jade** naturally arise,
　　And **mushrooms, herbs, and myriad sacred essences** flourish—
　　Thus all **true spirits** gather here,
　　At this **incense and fire altar**.

　　May the **Ten Thousand Directions’** **celestial children** and **jade maidens**,
　　Attend to the **fragrant vapors**,
　　And swiftly convey the **Fasting Official’s** sincerely submitted petitions
　　Directly to the **Great Dao of the Boundless Supreme**,
　　Before the **Heavenly Sovereign, Jade Emperor of the Supreme Heaven**.

　　**Exit the Hall** in praise.
　　**Exit the Door**.」

**The Complete Daoist Rituals and Precepts, Volume Forty-First, Compiled by the Disciple Zhongli of the Three Caverns Canon**

**Ritual for Pacifying the Home and Resolving Crimes**

At the appointed hour, the **Way** is practiced, and the ritual is performed according to the prescribed manner. Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.

The **Sacred Guardians’ Incantations** are proclaimed,
As the **Five Stars** align in radiance, illuminating the **Five Directions**.
The **Water Star** repels calamities, the **Wood Virtue** brings prosperity.
The **Uranus Star (Yinghuo)** dissipates misfortune, the **Mars Star (Tai Bai)** wards off soldiers.
The **Jupiter Star (Zhen Xing)** holds firm its fourfold dominion, benefiting the **home and state**.
Their names are inscribed on **jade tablets**, their words recorded in the **Imperial Registry**.

Riding the **tempestuous winds**, they scatter their **auspicious light**,
Soaring through the **vast expanse**, entering and exiting the **mysterious void**.
They roam and feast across the **Ten Thousand Directions**,
With **five clouds** floating as their canopy, summoning **spirits** and restraining **winds**.
They command the **Ten Thousand Spirits**, ascending to guard the **Dao** in harmony,
And align with the **true essence of the Way**.

Twenty-four **supreme incantations** are struck upon the **law-drum**.

The **Supreme Three Heavens**—**Primordial Beginning (Xuanyuan Shi)** of the **Three Essences (San Hun)**, the **Supreme Dao Lord (Taishang Daojun)**, and the **Supreme Old Lord (Taishang Laojun)**—
Call forth from my body the **Thirty-Six Officials of the Five Agents (San Wu)**, the **Left and Right Officials and Messengers**, the **Left and Right Incense Bearers**, the **Dragon Couriers and Mounted Attendants**, the **Golden Boys Attending Incense**, the **Jade Maidens Conveying Petitions and Scattering Flowers**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**, and the **Direct Day Incense Officials**—each **Thirty-Six in number**—to emerge.

Those who emerge are adorned in **solemn and splendid robes**,
With **headdresses and sashes** trailing their **pendant ribbons**.
The **land and domain spirits** of the **mysterious hall** are invoked,
And the **divine beings** of the **Four Quarters** are summoned.

Now that I ascend the **altar** to practice the **Way**,
I humbly present this **prayer** to express my **true intent**.
My **sincere petitions** have already been recorded and heard—
I pray that the **Supreme Dao’s Essence of the Ten Thousand Directions**,
The **precious blessings** of its **radiant light**,
May descend and flow into my body,
So that my **petitions** reach the **Supreme Boundless Dao**,
Before the **Heavenly Sovereign, Jade Emperor of the Supreme Heaven**.

I request the **invocation of the Law’s station**.

I, the **disciple of such-and-such rank**, along with all the **officers of the altar**,
Humbly present this **sincere petition** to the:
**Supreme Boundless Dao**,
**Primordial Beginning Heavenly Sovereign**,
**Supreme Dao Lord**,
**Supreme Old Lord**,
**Supreme Boundless Dao of the Ten Thousand Directions**,
**Heavenly Sovereign of the Moral and Transformative Saints**,
**Great Supreme True Emperor**,
**Heavenly Emperor**,
**Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scriptures, Supreme Law Master of the Mysterious Middle**,
**Earthly Officials, True Sovereign Emperors of the Five Agents**,
**Central Yellow, the Fifth and Sixth Agents, and the Responsive True Spirits**.

I have heard that the **Great Dao harmonizes the True Essence**,
The **Primordial Sovereign rules the celestial operations**,
The **Five Talismans** open their **teachings**,
And the **Three Caverns** proclaim their **rituals**.

The **Heavenly Sovereign** bestows the **Great Compassion’s Precepts**,
The **Supreme Lord** spreads the **Boundless Blessings**,
Molding all beings and rescuing all life.
I, with **countless eons of good karma**,
Have been blessed by the **mysterious transformations**,
And through the **Dragon Scriptures** and **Phoenix Records**,
The **jade decrees** and **precious texts**,
I have been able to **cultivate and refine**,
And thus **ascend and attain**—
While at the **beginning of my oath**, I have taken **rescue as my priority**.

Whatever I may **present in supplication**,
Shall not be **left unanswered**,
And since I **offer these words in accordance with the Dao’s will**,
How dare I **fail to submit them**?
With **sincere fasting intentions**,
I shall **proclaim them faithfully**.

**Proclamation of the Petition**.

As the **words are spoken**, my **sincerity is profound and my devotion fervent**.
The **situation calls for** the **Dao’s compassionate intervention**.
I humbly consider that before the **Five Supreme Lords**,
The **Three Spirits** differentiated from the **Primordial Essence**,
Since the **Great Antiquity**,
They have not mingled with the **profane and impure**.
In **winter’s hollows** and **summer’s nests**,
They **embrace the Dao** and **hold virtue**,
Each finding their **proper place** in **mysterious unity**.

From the **countless myriads of yin and yang**,
The **celestial symbols** descend upon the **foundations of the world**.
**Good and bad fortune**, **virtue and vice**,
Depend upon **alignment or defiance**.
To **follow them** brings **auspicious blessings**,
To **violate them** invites **calamity and misfortune**.
The **Saints and True Ones** guide with their **teachings**,
Their **compassion** is boundless—
**Confessing sins** and **praying for mercy**,
So that **sacred fasting** may be **properly honored**.

I and my **compatriots**, holding hands in **unity**,
Follow the **rituals and precepts**,
Establish the **altar** in its **proper form**,
To **divide and bestow blessings**.

Now, as I **ascend the altar** to practice the **Way**,
I request the **Law Master and assembly** to perform this **first incense offering**.
May this **fragrant incense** ascend to the **Supreme Dao’s Precious Heavenly Sovereign of the Ten Thousand Directions**.

I and my **compatriots**,
**Repent our bodies, repent our spirits, repent our fates**,
Bow our **heads to the earth**,
And dedicate the **merits of this incense offering** to:
The **spirits of the ancestral halls and state**,
The **ancestors and venerable saints**,
The **Pure Celestial Court** and **Luminous Essence**,
The **Violet Extremity (Zixi)** and its **auspicious blessings**,
The **blessings descending upon the Imperial Residence**,
And the **joy spreading to the Heavenly Descendants**.
May we **compare with Mount Song and Mount Heng** in **virtue**,
And **align with the sun and moon** in **clarity**.

The **Prince and all the Kings**,
Shall **support and uphold the sacred work**.
The **virtuous ministers and loyal advisors**,
Shall **commend and assist in the planning**.
All **states shall ascend in order**,
And all **beings shall prosper in clarity**.

Now, through this **incense offering**,
I **take refuge in the Dao’s Supreme Sovereign and the True Essence of the Saints**.
After **attaining the Dao**,
I shall **preserve the Heaven’s longevity**,
And **harmonize with the True Essence of the Way**.

Now, as I **ascend the altar** to practice the **Way**,
I request the **Law Master and assembly** to perform this **second incense offering**.
May this **fragrant incense** ascend to the **Supreme Scripture’s Precious Heavenly Sovereign of the Ten Thousand Directions**.

I and my **compatriots**,
**Repent our bodies, repent our spirits, repent our fates**,
Bow our **heads to the earth**,
And dedicate the **merits of this incense offering** to:
The **Nine Ancestors and Seven Mysterious Ones** of my **fasting official’s family**,
The **spirits of my ancestors** and **subtle essences**,
The **Divine Abode of the Vermilion Gardens**,
The **Refining Platform of the Cinnabar Field**,
The **inheritance of my mother’s essence** to **ascend the True**,
The **riding of the celestial clouds** to **embody transformation**,
The **blessings bestowed upon my descendants**,
The **mercy extending to the living and the dead**,
The **bearing of the Dao’s rest**,
And the **constant reception of Primordial Auspiciousness**.

Now, through this **incense offering**,
I **take refuge in the Scripture’s Supreme Sovereign and the True Essence of the Saints**.
After **attaining the Dao**,
I shall **ascend to the Formless**,
And **harmonize with the True Essence of the Way**.

Now, as I **ascend the altar** to practice the **Way**,
I request the **Law Master and assembly** to perform this **third incense offering**.
May this **fragrant incense** ascend to the **Supreme Teacher’s Precious Heavenly Sovereign of the Ten Thousand Directions**.

I and my **compatriots**,
**Repent our bodies, repent our spirits, repent our fates**,
Bow our **heads to the earth**,
And dedicate the **merits of this incense offering** to:
The **relatives and kin** of my **fasting official’s family**,
So that **auspicious blessings** may **prolong their lives**,
And **calamities and misfortunes** be **dissipated**.

To the **Dragons and Spirits of the Home**,
The **Yin and Yang Officers and Messengers**,
I **transfer the merits** of **abundant rewards**,
And **bestow ranks and honors**.
May **auspicious fortune** be **received in the Central Palace**,
And **disasters and malevolence** be **cleansed from the Four Quarters**.

Now, through this **incense offering**,
I **take refuge in the Teacher’s Supreme Sovereign and the True Essence of the Saints**.
After **attaining the Dao**,
I shall **permanently preserve the Heaven’s longevity**,
And **harmonize with the True Essence of the Way**.

**Chant the Directions**, **confess the Directions**, three **invocations**, three **homages**.
**Reaffirm the Law’s station**.

I, the **disciple of such-and-such rank**, along with all the **officers of the altar**,
Humbly present this **sincere petition** to the:
**Golden Gate of the Void, Nine Pure Heavenly Sovereigns**,
**Jade Platform and Precious Gate, Marvelous and Existent High True Ones**,
**Earthly Officials, True Sovereign Great Emperors**,
And **all responsive true spirits**.

「The disciple hears that the **Dao’s transformations** have been manifest,
And the **mysterious winds** spread far and wide,
Giving rise to **spirits of life** and their **variations**,
To fully display the **virtue/power** of the **spirits**.

From this, **feathered halls and misty chambers** emerge,
Where **clouds condense** and **qi coalesces**,
Floating clouds symbolize **forms**,
Responding to things and manifesting **spiritual efficacy**.

In the **Upper Antiquity**, the **saints** followed Heaven and embodied the Dao,
Establishing **palaces** to replace **cavernous nests**,
Taking the **principles of the Two Poles** (yin-yang) as their model,
And dividing the **five types of qi** (wuxing),
Thus setting the **positions of yin and yang**,
And clarifying the **distinctions between calamity and auspiciousness**.

The **Heavenly and Earthly officials** govern their duties accordingly.
When **virtue** prevails, it **prolongs blessings** and **brings good fortune**,
Ensuring **safety and tranquility**;
When **evil** prevails, it **invokes misfortune** and **brings disaster**,
Leading to **calamitous retribution**.

Thus, the **rites for rectifying and averting** were established,
To solemnly **express prayers of thanks and repentance**.

Moreover, our **intentions lie in achieving merit**,
And **solely in benefiting others**.
All who **petition and appeal**,
How could we **dare not present** their cases?

The **disciple of such-and-such rank**, through the **construction of this dwelling**,
Not knowing the **prohibitions and taboos**,
Fears that due to **repairs and renovations**,
We may **offend the spirits** and **transgress the Dao**.

We dread **offending the Heavenly Sovereign**,
The **four seasons and six qi** (six climates),
**Defying the True Dao** and **inviting calamity and decline**.

We also fear **offending the Celestial Officials**—
The **Grand Duke of the Year** (太岁), **Grand Duke of the Moon** (太阴), **Flying Yen** (飞廉), **Tiger’s Tail** (豹尾),
The **officers of yin and yang**, the **gods of punishment and slaughter** (刑杀), and the **Ten Celestial Stems and Twelve Earthly Branches deities** (支干众神).

We further fear **offending the Earthly Officials**—
The **Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams** (九宫八卦),
The **Earthly Palaces and Soil Sovereigns** (地宫土府),
The **spirits of the yin realm** (阴境灵祇),
And through **construction and labor**,
**Disturbing the Dao’s harmony**.

We also fear that the **land where we reside**,
May be **deeply marked by time and fate**—
Perhaps it was once an **ancestral homestead or field**,
A **ruined palace or imperial site**;
Or a **sacred mountain or spirit’s trace** (灵迹),
A **blessed land of eminent residence** (福地胜居);
Or the **mounds and tombs of ancient sages and virtuous ones** (先哲古贤);
Or the **city gods’ shrines and ancestral altars** (城隍社庙, 郊祀坛场);
Or a **collapsed fortress or abandoned camp**,
A **battlefield**;
Or a **site of oaths and alliances** (盟坛誓处);
Or a **ruined marketplace**;
Or a place where **corpse-ghosts** (腐骨穷魂) linger as **support**,
Or where **wandering spirits** (游神之鬼) still **rely upon**—
When **malevolent apparitions** appear and **disasters arise**,
Human emotions cannot **fathom them**,
And **rites of rectification and repentance** are **without method**.

Now, according to the **Scripture of the Numinous Treasure** (灵宝真经)
And the **Orthodox One’s Grades** (正一科品),
We **carry the Dao’s faith** and **revere the sacred space**,
Establishing a **Daoist altar** that **mirrors the Heavenly pattern**,
And **pray for blessings** while **repenting past sins**.

We **follow the established rites** with **devotion**,
And **sincerely prepare** the **incense offering and purification**,
To **report to the Supreme True Ones**,
**Dissolving disasters and atoning for guilt**,
And **repenting and purifying** the **Ten Directions**.
We **return to the Three Treasures** (三宝) in **humble reliance**.

We **humbly hope** that the **Supreme Saints** will **shine their light**,
And the **High True Ones** will **descend to aid**,
Commanding the **Four Celestial Officials and their attendants** (四司官属),
The **Five Celestial Emperors’ awe-inspiring spirits** (五帝威灵),
To **wash away and dispel** our **transgressions and misfortunes**,
And **bestow Heavenly blessings**,
So that the **Dragon-spirits** may **fulfill their duties**,
And **calmly govern their regions**,
While **noxious qi and malevolent essences** (沴气邪精)
**Retreat into the depths of the Earth**,
And **calamity and disaster** are **extinguished**,
**Impure qi vanishes**,
Our **residence becomes tranquil**,
And our **lives are secure and prosperous**.

The **Five Plagues and Four Toxins** (五瘟四毒) shall **not harm humanity**;
**Floods, fires, knives, and weapons** (水火刀兵) shall **not injure the world**.

The **Seven Mysteries** (七玄) shall **open their degrees**,
And **eternal night** shall **radiate with clarity**,
**Longevity and prosperity** shall **extend far**,
And our **descendants** shall **be loyal and filial**,
With **no untimely deaths within**,
And **auspicious omens** (祯祥) **abounding in the home**.

The **Heavenly Sovereign’s benevolent influence** (帝泽宸波) shall **permanently secure the North Pole**;
The **Five Winds and Ten Rains** shall **all be in harmony with the Central Sky**.

**Hundreds of grains** shall **abundantly flourish**,
And the **Five Types of Armies** (五兵) shall **lay down their weapons**,
While **flying and submerged creatures** (飞沉蠢动) shall **submit to the Dao’s efficacy**,
And the **Nine Nights and Three Paths** (九夜三途) shall **share in the merit of this purification**.

We **solemnly present** this **petition** to the **Heavenly Sovereign**,
And **the Twelve Vows** (十二愿) are **fulfilled**.
The **incense burner** is **replaced**.

The **Incense Officials and Messengers** (香官使者),
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals** (左右龙虎君),
And the **attendant spirits of incense** (侍香诸灵官),
Shall **command** us so that in **all our past Daoist practices**,
**Golden Elixir and Azure Jade** (金液丹碧) shall **naturally emerge**,
Along with **mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits** (芝英百灵),
And the **multitude of True Ones** shall **gather here** before this **incense burner**.

We **vow** that the **Ten Directions’ immortal children and celestial maidens** (仙童玉女),
Shall **attend and receive** the **fragrant incense**,
And **transmit our petition** directly to the **Supreme True One, the Boundless Dao** (至真无极大道),
Before the **Grand Celestial Jade Emperor, Sovereign of the Highest Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝御前).

**Praise upon leaving the hall.**
**Praise upon leaving the door.**

**The Complete Daoist Rituals and Regulations, Volume Forty-One Complete**
**The Complete Daoist Rituals and Regulations, Volume Forty-Two**
Compiled by Disciple Zhong Li of the *San Dong Jing Lu* [Three Caverns Scripture Registers]

**Ritual for Dispelling Crimes and Ensuring Residence**
**Scattered Hall Dao Practice**
**Ritual Proceedings as Prescribed**

Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Daoist law.
**Proclaim the Sacred Protective Incantations** [宣卫灵咒, *xuān wèi líng zhòu*].

The **Five Stars** [五星, *Wǔxīng*] shine in array,
Illuminating the **Five Directions** [五方, *Wǔfāng*].
The **Water Star** [水星, *Shuǐxīng*] repels calamities,
The **Wood Virtue** [木德, *Mùdé*] brings prosperity.
The **Upholstery Star** [荧惑, *Yínghuò*] dissipates misfortune,
The **Great White Star** [太白, *Tàibái*] wards off soldiers.
The **Asterism of the Constellation** [镇星, *Zhènxīng*] holds fast in four positions,
Benefiting the **family and state** [家国, *Jiāguó*] with auspicious harmony.

**Names inscribed on jade tablets** [名刊玉简, *Míng kān yùjiǎn*],
**Characters recorded in the Imperial Archives** [字录帝房, *Zì lù dìfáng*].
Riding the **tempestuous winds** [乘飙, *Chéng biāo*], they **scatter the landscape** [散景, *Sàn jǐng*],
Soaring through the **vast heavens** [飞腾太空, *Fēi téng tàikōng*].
They **enter and exit the realm of darkness** [出入冥无, *Chūrù míngwú*],
**Roaming and feasting in the Ten Directions** [游宴十方, *Yóuyǎn shífāng*].

The **Five Clouds** [五云, *Wǔyún*] drift as canopy,
**Summoning deities and capturing winds** [招神摄风, *Zhāo shén shè fēng*].
They **command all spirits** [役使万灵, *Yìshǐ wànlíng*],
**Protecting the Highest Heaven** [上卫仙翁, *Shàng wèi xiāngwēng*],
And **harmonizing with the True Dao/Way** [和与道合真, *Hé yǔ Dào hézhēn*].

**Strike the Law Drum twenty-four times** [呜法鼓二十四通, *Wū fǎgǔ èrshísì tōng*].

To the **Supreme Three Heavens** [无上三天, *Wúshàng sāntiān*], **Primordial Origin of the Mysterious Three** [玄元始三炁, *Xuānyuánshǐ sānqì*],
The **Great Dao Lord** [太上道君, *Tàishàng Dàojūn*],
The **Great Dao Lord, the Venerable Old Lord** [太上老君, *Tàishàng Lǎojūn*],
We **summon forth** from within my body
The **Three Five Officials of the Five Daoist Caverns** [三五功曹, *Sānwǔ gōngcáo*],
The **Left and Right Official Attendants** [左右官使者, *Zuǒyòu guānshǐzhě*],
The **Left and Right Incense Bearers** [左右捧香, *Zuǒyòu pěngxiāng*],
The **Dragon-Courier and Horsemen** [驿龙骑吏, *Yìlóng qí lì*],
The **Golden Boy Attendant of Incense** [侍香金童, *Shìxiāng jīntóng*],
The **Jade Maiden of Spoken Petitions and Scattered Flowers** [传言散花玉女, *Chuányán sǎnhuā yùnǚ*],
The **Five Sovereigns’ Direct Talismans** [五帝直符, *Wǔdì zhí fú*],
The **Direct Day Incense Officials** [直日香官, *Zhí rì xiāngguān*],
Each **thirty-six in number**, to **emerge**.

Those who **emerge** are **adorned in solemn and splendid robes** [严装显服, *Yán zhuāng xiǎnfú*],
With **headdresses and trailing ribbons** [冠带垂缨, *Guàn dài chuí yīng*],
**Opening the Mysterious Gate** [关启玄坛, *Guān qǐ xuántán*] for the **Heavenly Soil and Earthly Deities** [土地, *Tǔdì*; 方域神真, *Fāngyù shénzhēn*].

I now **establish this Daoist fast** [设醮, *Shè jiào*] and **practice the Dao** [行道, *Xíngdào*],
**Solemnly offering** this as my **sincere intent** [入意, *Rùyì*].
All my **earnest petitions** [诸诚悃, *Zhū chéngkěn*] have been **recorded and announced** [已录告闻, *Yǐ lù gàowén*].
I pray that the **Great Dao/Way’s Boundless True Qi** [十方正真道炁, *Shífāng zhèngzhēn Dàoqì*] of the **Ten Directions**,
And the **Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Light** [灵宝瑞光, *Língbǎo ruìguāng*] may **descend and flow** [下降, *Xiàjiàng*; 流入, *Liú rù*]
Into my **body’s essence** [臣身中, *Chén shēn zhōng*],
So that my **petitions** may **speedily reach and directly ascend** [速达径御, *Sùdá jìngyù*]
To the **Supreme True Dao/Way of the Boundless** [至真无极大道, *Zhìzhēn wújī Dàodào*],
And the **Grand Celestial Jade Emperor, Sovereign of the Highest Heaven** [昊天玉皇上帝御前, *Hàotiān yùhuáng Shàngdì yùqián*].

**Request the invocation of the Daoist ranks** [请称法位, *Qǐng chēng fǎwèi*].

**The Daoist of this rank** [具位臣某, *Jùwèi chén mǒu*] and the **entire assembly of ritual officials** [阖坛官众等, *Hétán guānzhòng děng*],
**Together with utmost sincerity** [谨同诚, *Jǐn tóngchéng*] present our **supplication** [上启, *shàngqǐ*]:

To the **Great Dao/Way of the Boundless** [无极大道, *Wújī Dàodào*],
The **Primordial Origin Celestial Lord** [元始天尊, *Yuánshǐ Tiānzūn*],
The **Great Dao Lord** [太上道君, *Tàishàng Dàojūn*],
The **Venerable Old Lord** [太上老君, *Tàishàng Lǎojūn*],
The **Boundless Dao/Way of the Ten Directions** [十方无极大道, *Shífāng wújī Dàodào*],
The **Celestial Lords of Virtue and Power** [道德众圣天尊, *Dàodé zhòngshèng Tiānzūn*],
The **Great Sovereign of Supreme Truth** [至真大帝, *Zhìzhēn Dàidì*],
The **Heavenly Sovereign** [天帝, *Tiān Dì*],
The **Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scripture, Grand Master of Mysterious Middle Dao** [三十六部尊经玄中大法师, *Sānshíliù bù zūn jīng xuánzhōng Dàfǎshī*],
The **Five Sovereigns of the Earthly Palace** [土府太皇太始五帝, *Tǔfǔ Tàihuáng Tàishǐ Wǔdì*],
And the **Nine Yellows, Five Olds, and Stewardly Spirits of the Eight and Fourteen Residences** [中黄戊己应感真灵, *Zhōnghuáng wùjǐ yìnggǎn zhēnlíng*].

I hear that **all phenomena** [万象, *Wànxiàng*] were **not yet formed** [未形, *wèixíng*],
When the **Primordial One** [一元, *Yīyuán*] **first began** [肇启, *zhàoqǐ*].
The **Dao/Way of the Void** [虚无大道, *Xūwú Dàodào*] is the **root origin of life and transformation** [生化之根元, *shēnghuà zhī gēnyuán*],
The **Pure and Tranquil True Wind** [清净真风, *Qīngjìng zhēnfēng*] is the **source of yin and yang** [阴阳之宗本, *Yīnyáng zhī zōngběn*].

Thus, **first dividing the Two Qi** [先分二气, *Xiān fēn èrqì*],
Then **manifesting the Three Talents** [后显三才, *Hòu xiǎn sāncái*].
The **ranked positions of high and low** [尊卑之位, *Zūn bēi zhī wèi*] were **clearly established** [既彰, *jìzhāng*],
And the **functions of covering and loading** [覆载之功, *Fùzǎi zhī gōng*] were **attained** [攸着, *yōuzhuó*].

The **cycles of winter retreat and summer habitation** [冬穴夏巢之代, *Dōng xué xià cháo zhī dài*] **remained unchanged** [淳朴未移, *Chúnpú wèiyí*],
While the **rituals of upper eaves and lower rooms** [上栋下宇之仪, *Shàng dòng xià yǔ zhī yí*] **were yet to be formed** [易象方作, *Yìxiàng fāngzuò*].

None failed to **measure the form of Heaven and Earth** [裁形天地, *Cái xíng tiāndì*],
And to **take the pattern of the Sky and the Earth** [取法乾坤, *Qǔfǎ qiánkūn*],
**Establishing the rules of square and round** [定方圆之规, *Dìng fāngyuán zhī guī*],
And **listing the numbers of yin and yang** [列阴阳之数, *Liè yīnyáng zhī shù*].

To **follow them** [顺之, *shùnzhī*] is to **naturally receive Heaven’s blessings** [自天垂佑, *zìtiān chuíyòu*],
With **endless fortune** [福被无疆, *Fú bèi wújīang*].
To **violate them** [违之, *wéizhī*] is for **all things to suffer calamities** [万物延灾, *Wànwù yánzāi*],
And for **disasters to arise unmeasured** [祸生不测, *Huò shēng bùcè*].

**Auspicious and inauspicious events** [吉凶斯在, *Jíxiōng sīzài*] thus **lie in wait**,
And **ancient and modern beings** [今古攸遵, *Jīngǔ yōuzūn*] **must adhere** to them.

Moreover, **in this world of manifold paths** [处世多端, *Chǔshì duōduān*],
If **cultivation of the heart** [修心未至, *Xiūxīn wèizhì*] is **not yet complete** [未至, *wèizhì*],
Then **every action brings regret and loss** [动贻悔吝, *Dòng yí huǐlìn*],
And **faults easily accumulate** [易积愆瑕, *Yì jī qiānxiá*].
Without **entrusting oneself to the Supreme True** [非托上真, *Fēi tuō shàngzhēn*],
There is **no means to dispel and atone** [无由解谢, *Wúyóu jiěxiè*].

I have heard that the **Celestial Lord** [天尊, *Tiānzūn*] **established teachings** [设教, *Shèjiào*],
And the **True Scripture** [真文, *Zhēnwén*] **initiated the methods of expiation and suppression** [启禳镇之科, *qǐ rángzhèn zhī kē*].
The **Great Dao/Way** [大道, *Dàodào*] **bestowed its mercy** [垂慈, *chuízī*],
And the **Sacred Treasure** [灵宝, *Língbǎo*] **possesses rituals of repentance and supplication** [有忏祈之典, *yǒu chìqí zhī diǎn*].

Daring to **follow this intent** [敢缘斯旨, *Gǎn yuán sīzhǐ*],
I have **prepared the Daoist fast altar** [辄备醮坛, *Zhé bèi jiàotán*],
And **earnestly petitioned all the Heavens** [沥恳诸天, *Lìkěn zhūtīan*],
**Pledged to the Five Sovereigns** [告盟五帝, *Gàoméng wǔdì*],
Hoping to **receive their discerning blessings** [冀蒙鉴佑, *Jì méng jiànyòu*],
And **condescending descent of their sacred power** [俯降威灵, *Fǔjiàng wēilíng*].

So that the **Heavenly Soil and Earthly Deities** [天地灵司, *Tiāndì língsī*],
And the **yin and yang ministers** [阴阳僚属, *Yīnyáng liáo shǔ*],
**Returning clouds and bending the landscape** [回云迂景, *Huí yún yū jǐng*],
May **descend to observe my petitions** [下察启祈, *Xiàchá qǐqí*],
**Adopt and accept my sincere offerings** [采纳丹诚, *Cǎinà dāncéng*],
And **bestow upon me the mist of boundless fortune** [雾流鸿福, *Wù liú hóngfú*].

I, along with the **fasting officials** [斋官, *Zhāiguān*] and the **assembled ritual officials** [合坛众等, *Hétán zhòng děng*],
With **no limit to our reverent anticipation** [无任瞻望天衢激切钦伫皈向之至, *Wú rèn zhānwàng tiānqú jīqiè qīnzhù guīxiàng zhī zhì*],
**Solemnly bowing and prostrating twice** [诚惶诚恐, *Chénghuáng chéngkǒng*; 稽首再拜, *Qǐshǒu zàibài*],
**Solemnly welcome the Celestial Procession** [奉迎仙驾, *Fèngyíng xiān jià*].

**Descend the True Ones** [降真, *Jiàngzhēn*],
**Offer tea** [上茶, *Shàngchá*],
**First presentation** [初献, *Chūxiàn*],
**Scatter flowers** [散花, *Sǎnhuā*].

I **earnestly present my sincere supplication** [谨重诚上启, *Jǐn zhòngchéng shàngqǐ*] to the **Nine Pure Celestial Saints** [九清上圣, *Jiǔqīng shàngshèng*],
And the **Three Realms’ Sacred Spirits** [三界威灵, *Sānjiè wēilíng*].

I **hear that supreme sincerity** [至诚, *Zhìchéng*] can **move the spirits** [感神, *gǎnshén*],
And that **creating virtue** [作德, *zuòdé*] can **dissipate transformations** [销变, *xiāobiàn*].
**King Jing of Qi** [景公, *Jǐ

If one has offended the **Ten Heavenly Stems’ Great Deities** [甲、乙、丙、丁、戊、己、庚、辛、壬、癸十干大神], may the **Celestial Censor Lord** [天上御史君] absolve and atone.

If one has offended the **Eight Trigrams’ Great Deities** [乾、坎、艮、震、巽、离、坤、兑八卦大神], may the **Dao/Way and Virtue Lord** [道德君] absolve and atone.

If one has offended the **Twenty-Eight Lunar Mansions’ Deities** [建除满平定执破危成收开闭神], may the **Heavenly Nobleman Lord** [天一贵人君] absolve and atone.

If one has offended the **Heavenly Dao, Earthly Dao, Human Dao, and Spirit Dao** [天道、地道、人道、神道], may the **Lord of Eternal Life** [长生君] absolve and atone.

**Humbly praying** that all may **settle peacefully in their stations** [各安乃位], **eternally secure in their abodes** [永奠厥居], **forgive faults and pardon transgressions** [赦罪宥愆], **bestow grace and confer blessings** [流恩注福], **extend the nurturing virtue of Heaven and Earth** [敷佐天育物之德], **and promote the benevolent intent of the Dao/Way’s transformation** [推助道兴化之心], **safeguarding the household’s tranquility** [保家宅之安宁], **and inviting the harmony of the numinous** [冀神明之协相], **thus manifesting the august creation** [式彰洪造], **and humbly soothing the common heart** [俯慰凡情].

**I, the servant**, along with the **fasting officials and the assembled congregation**, are **utterly remorseful and grateful for the divine favor** [无任忏谢希恩之至], **presenting the secondary wine offering** [酒陈亚献].

**I, the servant, earnestly and sincerely supplicate** the **Supreme Three Venerables** [太上三尊], **Five Elders of the Celestial Sovereign** [五老上帝], **the Three Treasures and All Saints** [三宝众圣], **the Inner and Outer Spirit Officials** [内外灵司], **the Six Heavenly Stems’ taboos** [六甲禁忌], **and all divine manifestations** [一切神明].

**Humbly hearing** that the **True Dao/Way is profound and mysterious** [真道杳冥], **embodying non-action yet transforming all things** [体无为而化物]; **the Sage spreads its marvelous teachings** [圣人敷妙], **establishing doctrine to perpetuate its scriptures** [因立教以垂文]. **Good and evil must be manifest** [善恶必彰], **and auspiciousness and calamity shall not err** [吉凶无爽].

Now, **I, the servant**, **a ritual officiant of such-and-such**, **fear that in my actions and undertakings** [运行举措], **I may have transgressed against the divine** [违悮神明]; **in selecting a dwelling through divination** [相宅卜居], **I may have violated the Heavenly Stems’ prohibitions** [犯干禁忌].

Perhaps I have **diverted rivers, blocked ravines** [移川塞涧], **raised the low and lowered the high** [增下损高], **engaged in construction that harms the land’s nature** [土木兴工，穿凿伤性], **ignoring the principles of yin and yang** [不明阴阳之理], **and unaware of the suitability of decline and flourishing** [罔知衰旺之宜].

Moreover, **from ancient times to the present**, **mountains have shifted and valleys transformed** [陵迁谷变], **making the origins of the dwelling unclear** [所居之地，终始难明]. Perhaps it was **the ruins of an ancient city** [城邑遗基], **the site of a former spirit shrine** [神祠旧址], **or a true altar’s sacred ground** [真坛福地], **the remnants of an ancient temple** [古庙灵踪], **a battlefield of past wars** [昔人战斗之墟], **a gathering place of ancient sages** [先哲会盟之所], **or once a kiln or furnace** [或曾为窑灶], **or an old mound** [或旧有丘陵], **or a former sage’s ritual platform** [或先圣坛场], **or the lair of a dragon spirit** [或龙神窟宅], **or a grove of strange trees** [或丛林聚异], **or a place where water and stone conceal spirits** [或水石藏灵].

Since **I have been compelled to dwell here** [既迫俗居], **how could there be no desecration** [宁无亵渎]? **I fear that through offense**, **disaster and decline may ensue** [恐因触犯，遂结灾衰].

On this **auspicious day and favorable hour** [今谨有吉日良时], **I open my heart to the Dao/Way**. **Following the Master’s rites** [按天师科格], **conforming to the Sacred Treasure’s rituals** [遵灵宝文仪], **I devoutly petition the gods**, **humbly extending my repentance and gratitude**.

If within my dwelling, **I have offended the Year General** [太岁将军], may the **Constellation Lord of the Purple Forbidden Enclosure** [紫微宫方伯君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Year-Killing Deity of the Great Yin** [太阴岁杀神], may the **Celestial Nobleman Lord** [天上贵人君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Year Punishment and Year Destruction Deities** [岁刑岁破神], may the **Constellation Lord** [镇星君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Yellow Banner and Leopard Tail Deities** [黄旛豹尾神], may the **White Tiger Lord** [太白君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Earthly Tiger of the Dwelling** [土豹宅神], may the **Earthly Marquis Lord** [地侯君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Day’s Journey and Month’s Station Deities** [日游月建神], may the **Lord of the Sun’s Chariot** [羲和君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Great Yin and Great Yang Deities** [太阴太阳神], may the **Heaven and Earth Lords** [乾坤君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Thunder God and Lightning Deities** [雷公霹雳神], may the **Purple Forbidden Enclosure Lord** [紫微君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Mighty Warriors of the Cauldron of Salt Deities** [咸池力士神], may the **Li and Dui Lords** [离兑君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Heavenly Dog and Earthly Sack Deities** [天狗地囊神], may the **All-Heavenly Father Lords** [诸天父君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Year Punishment, Month’s Calamity, Day’s Evil, and Hour’s Malevolent Deities** [年刑月害日恶时凶神], may the **Primordial Maiden Lady** [元女君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Azure Dragon Deity** [青龙神], may the **Eastern King Father** [东王公] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **White Tiger Deity** [白虎神], may the **Western Queen Mother** [西王母] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Vermilion Bird Deity** [朱雀神], may the **Flame Emperor Lord** [炎帝君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Dark Warrior Deity** [玄武], may the **Darkly Mysterious Lord** [玄冥君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Xuan She and Rear Soil Deities** [螣蛇后土神], may the **Hu-Yue Lords** [胡越君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Five Soil Attendant Deities** [五土眷属神], may the **Five Spirit Elders** [五灵老君] protect.

If I have offended the **Yin-Dwelling and Yang-Dwelling Fate and Fortune Deities** [阴宅阳宅刑福神], may the **Sun and Moon Lords** [日月君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Fei Lian and Guo Ji Deities** [飞廉郭忌神], may the **Supreme One Lord** [太一君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Death, Mourning, County, Prison, and Heavenly Calamity Deities** [死丧县狱天祸神], may the **Han Lord and丈人 Lord** [韩君丈人君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Deities of the Golden Coffin and Jade Hall, Heavenly Blessing Dwelling Virtue, Heavenly Granary and Heavenly Storehouse, Heavenly Gate and Earthly Door, Human Path and Ghost Road** [金匮玉堂、天福宅德、天仓天府、天门地户、人道鬼路神], may the **Marshal Lord** [都统君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Great Exhaustion and Lesser Exhaustion, Four Agitations and Three Punishments, Heavenly Net and Earthly Web, Eight Chiefs and Nine Demons, Crescent, Waning, New Moon, and Eclipse Deities of Yin and Yang Destruction** [大耗小耗、四激三刑、天罗地网、八魁九妖、弦望晦朔、阴阳灭没神], may the **Dao/Way Transformation Lord** [道化君] absolve and atone.

If I have offended the **Deities of Parents and Ancestral Attendants, or the Twelve Seat Deities of Fate** [父母眷属、十二命坐神], may the **Lord of Extended Longevity and Augmented Destiny** [延寿益算君] protect.

If I have offended the **Deities of the Six Livestock and Silk Positions** [六畜蚕命之位神], may the **Lord of Benevolent Birth and Deliverance** [好生度命君] guard.

**I beseech** that the **seventy-two gods, twenty-four officials, yin and yang officials, and inner and outer spirits** [七十二神、二十四吏、阴阳正职、内外神灵] **settle and pacify their domains** [安镇其方], **each residing in their appointed regions** [各居所部], **banishing malevolence and decline from the four borders** [屏凶衰於四境], **and removing calamities and epidemics from the eight directions** [除灾沴於八方], **so that disasters and retributions may forever vanish** [殃咎永消], **and auspicious omens descend in secret** [休祥密降].

**May longevity be added to the register of life** [增寿年於生录], **and prosperity renewed** [禄祚惟新]; **may sins be absolved in the underworld** [释罪目於阴曹], **and plagues not arise** [疫疠无作].

**May filial piety and fraternity be passed down through generations** [家传孝悌], **and loyalty and virtue inherited in the household** [门袭忠良], **constantly receiving the Dao/Way’s supreme favor** [常承至道之恩], **and successfully bearing the divine’s protection** [克荷神明之佑].

**I, the servant**, along with the **ritual officiant and the assembled congregation**, are **utterly remorseful and grateful** [无任忏谢之至], **presenting the concluding wine offering** [酒陈终献].

**Reiterating the ritual rank**.

**The humble servant of such-and-such**, along with all others, **earnestly and sincerely supplicate** the **Nine Pure and Ten Extremes’ Exalted Saints and True Ones** [九清十极众圣高真], **the Six Heavenly Stems’ Three Elements’ Yin and Yang Officials** [六甲三元阴阳正职], **and the responsive spirits of the three realms** [灵坛应感三界威灵].

**We follow the clear rites**, **reverently presenting the ritual offerings** [依按明科，恭陈醮礼], **receiving the True Ones’ descent and favor** [荷真灵之降顾], **and sincerely honoring their earnest devotion** [享诚意之恪勤].

**Having completed our supplications and thanks**, **we ascend to the celestial palaces**.

**Cloud chariots and feathered canopies** [云軿羽盖] **shall return to the void origin** [将返虚元].

**Invoking the descent of the lost rites**, **offering the oblation contrary to proper ritual**. **May the Heavenly Sovereigns pity our offenses** and **hope the hundred spirits forgive our folly and incompetence**.

**With the hearts of the people as our own**, **we benefit the people for their own good**, **giving more as we receive more**, **and thus enriching without exhausting, nurturing without harming**. **The earth is level, the heavens complete** [地平天成], **and the responsive forces of yin and yang subtly assist**.

**Let us not deprive them of their guidance**, **so that we may escape the faults of our former anxieties**; **let us harmonize with their abiding presence**, **so that we may fulfill the natural order of life and creation**.

**We, the humble servants**, **fix our gaze upon the Dao’s descent**, **and focus our thoughts upon the boundless expanse**, **lamenting the dust of the mundane world**, **unable to retain the sacred footsteps of the True Ones**.

**We, the humble servants with the officiants**, **with utmost longing and devotion**, **earnestly beseech the celestial palaces**. **We respectfully report this to the heavens**.

**Reigniting the censers**.

**The incense officials and messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals** [左右龙虎君], **and the attendant spirits of the incense** [侍香诸灵官], **are to command that at the places where we have set up the ritual and practiced the Dao**, **there shall naturally arise the golden elixir and emerald green essence** [金液丹碧], **the hundred spirits of the immortal herbs and flowers** [芝英百灵], **and the gathered assembly of the True Ones**, **all before this incense burner**.

**We now vow that the Ten Directions’ Celestial Children and Jade Maidens** [十方仙童玉女], **shall attend the fragrant vapors**, **and that our humble supplications** **shall swiftly reach the Unbounded and Supreme Dao of the Great Ultimate** [无极大道], **and the Celestial Jade Emperor’s presence** [昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Conducting the farewell to the spirits, transforming the offerings, and invoking blessings**.

**The Complete Collection of Daoist Rituals and Methods, Volume Forty-Two concluded. The Complete Collection of Daoist Rituals and Methods, Volume Forty-Three**.

**San Dong Jing Luo Disciple Zhong Li’s Compilation**
**Ritual for Pacifying the Residence and Expiating Offenses**

**The Ten Directions**
We, the humble disciples, now offer incense, **returning our bodies and our spirits**, and dedicate ourselves to **Master [Certain Family] of the Daoist Ritual**. **We humbly express our gratitude** to the **Unbounded Dao of the Ten Directions**, the **Most High, Most Precious Celestial Sovereign** [太上灵宝天尊], the **Ten Ultimate Celestial Lords** [十极天君], the **Five Elders of the Supreme** [五老上帝], the **Twenty-Eight Lodges**, the **Twelve Constellations’ Divine Ones**, the **Stellar Branches and Celestial Stems’ Taboos**, the **Eight Directions’ Rulers**, and the **Supreme Spirits Above and Below**.

We **fear that our dwelling and its construction** may **offend the Eight Trigrams**, **disturb the Nine Palaces**, **obstruct the Celestial Light**, and **damage the Earth’s Veins**. Now, we **establish this ritual and practice the Dao**, **seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings**. **We earnestly pray** that the **Great Dao may descend with its mercy**, **universally granting pardon**, **cleansing our sins and blemishes**, **perpetuating virtue and prosperity**, **ensuring the safety of our kin**, **restoring the Dragon Spirits to their proper positions**, and **after attaining the Dao, ascending into the Formless**.

**The Three Lights**
We, the humble disciples, now offer incense, **returning our bodies and our spirits**, and dedicate ourselves to **Master [Certain Family] of the Daoist Ritual**. **We humbly express our gratitude** to the **Heavens of the Sun, Moon, and Stars**, the **Most Supreme Great Sage** [至真大圣], the **Divine Ones of the Three Lights**, and all **Spirits of the Assembly**. We **fear that our dwelling and its construction** may **offend the Divine Spirits**, **violate taboos**, **dishonor the Three Lights**, or **go against the celestial periods of the Stars, Sun, and Moon’s movements**, thereby **accumulating guilt and inviting disaster**. Now, we **establish this ritual and practice the Dao**, **seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings**. **We earnestly pray** that the **radiance of the Three Lights may subtly spread**, **their luminous glow descend to illuminate**, **the Spirits find peace and settle into their proper abodes**, **our people find stability in their dwellings**, **the residence remains secure and tranquil**, **the Dragon Spirits guard vigilantly**, **the hidden pathways become clear**, **all living things flourish**, and **after attaining the Dao, ascending into the Formless**.

**The Five Sacred Mountains**
We, the humble disciples, now offer incense, **returning our bodies and our spirits**, and dedicate ourselves to **Master [Certain Family] of the Daoist Ritual**. **We humbly express our gratitude** to the **True Lords of the Five Sacred Mountains** [五岳真君], the **Flying Immortals** [飞仙真人], the **Divine Ones of the Named Mountains and Caverns who have attained the Dao**, and all **Spirits of the Assembly**. We **fear that our dwelling and its construction** may **offend the Divine Spirits**, **violate Heaven’s prohibitions and Earth’s taboos**, and fall under the **jurisdiction of the Five Emperors and Five Sacred Mountains**, thereby **accumulating guilt without receiving pardon**. Now, we **offer incense and practice the Dao**, **seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings**. **We earnestly pray** that the **Divine Assembly of the Mountain Lodges** and the **Rulers of the Named Mountains** **specially forgive our offenses**, **perpetually bestow auspicious fortune**, **extend our longevity and blessings**, **cleanse away disasters and decline**, **ensure the safety of our kin**, **prosper our gates**, and **after attaining the Dao, ascending into the Formless**.

**The Water Realms**
We, the humble disciples, now offer incense, **returning our bodies and our spirits**, and dedicate ourselves to **Master [Certain Family] of the Daoist Ritual**. **We humbly express our gratitude** to the **Great Emperor of the Eastern Red Pine** [扶桑大帝], the **Divine Kings of the Yang Valley** [旸谷神王], the **Three Rivers and Four Seas, Nine Streams’ Water Emperors** [三河四海、九江水帝], the **Twelve River Sources and Four Marshes’ Divine Ones** [十二河源、四渎神君], the **Divine Ones of the Water Realms**, and all **Spirits of the Assembly**. We **fear that our dwelling and its construction** may **block and restrict springs**, **damage the water veins**, **go against the nature of benevolent virtue above**, **impair the nourishing function below**, **lightly provoke the Sacred and True**, **dishonor the rivers and seas**, thereby **accumulating guilt within the Water Realms**, **entangling across generations**, and **not receiving absolution**. Now, we **offer incense and practice the Dao twice**, **seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings**. **We earnestly pray** that the **Dao’s mercy may aid in virtue**, **its blessings may extend like flowing water**, **our sins be cleansed and renewed**, **our sources of prosperity remain unexhausted**, and **after attaining the Dao, ascending into the Formless**.

**The Sacred Scriptures**
We, the humble disciples, now offer incense, **returning our bodies and our spirits**, and dedicate ourselves to **Master [Certain Family] of the Daoist Ritual**. **We humbly express our gratitude** to the **Thirty-Six Supreme Divisions of the Most Supreme Dao** [至真无上三十六部尊经], the **True Texts and Precious Talismans**, the **Orthodox Teachings of the Three Caverns**, the **Ten Directions’ Secret Treasures**, the **Spirits guarding the Scriptures**, and all **Divine Administrations**. We **fear that our dwelling and its construction** may **offend the True Spirits**, **dishonor the sacred traces**, **damage auspicious lands**; or that **the relics of the Three Treasures** [三宝]—where **Scriptures and Teachings are practiced**, with **Spirits of the Assembly and attendants of the True Ones** present—**unknown to the common folk**, may have been **violated or dishonored**, thereby **accumulating guilt within the Three Treasures’ Realms**, **without receiving pardon**. Now, we **offer incense and practice the Dao**, **seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings**. **We earnestly pray** that the **Ten Thousand Saints may illuminate the Dao**, **the Divine Assembly may inspect and bestow blessings**, **our offenses be cleansed away**, **virtue and prosperity come to us**, **longevity and blessings increase**, **the Dragon Spirits return to their proper positions**, **our people find stability in their dwellings**, **all our movements bring honor**, **the hidden and the manifest flourish**, and **after attaining the Dao, ascending into the Formless**.

**Ritual for Pacifying the Residence and Expiating Offenses of the Ten Directions**

**The Eastern Direction**
We, the humble disciples, now dedicate ourselves to **Master [Certain Family] of the Daoist Ritual**. **We humbly express our gratitude** to the **Eastern Direction’s Most Supreme, Unbounded Green Emperor** [东方至真无极青帝], the **Nine Qi Celestial Lords**, the **Green Dragon and Eastern Dipper**, the **Seven Stars of the Horn, Intercalary, Room, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket**, the **Wood Virtue of the Celestial Stems and Branches Jia and Yi** [甲乙寅卯木德震神], the **Nine Yi Old Lord of the Minor Yang Qi**, the **True Spirit of the Hooked Mouth, Great Tao, and Spring King** [勾芒太皞春王正神], and the **Wood Official of the Year Star, Emperor’s Chariot, Emperor’s Enclosure, and Emperor’s Assembly** [帝车帝辖帝会岁星木官].

We **fear that our dwelling** may **offend the Divine Spirits**, **violate taboos**, and **invite disaster**. Now, we **offer incense**, **return our command to the Most Precious Celestial Sovereign** [灵宝天尊], **establish this ritual and practice the Dao**, **seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings**. **We earnestly pray** that our **offenses may be removed**, **auspicious fortune be granted**, **the Central Earth Qi’s calamities and misfortunes be dispelled**, **guilt be absolved**, **disasters and decline be averted**, **life and death both attain peace**, **fortune and blessings be renewed**, and **after attaining the Dao, ascending into the Formless**.

**The Southern Direction**
We, the humble disciples, now dedicate ourselves to **Master [Certain Family] of the Daoist Ritual**. **We humbly express our gratitude** to the **Southern Direction’s Most Supreme, Unbounded Red Emperor** [南方至真无极赤帝], the **Three Qi Celestial Lords**, the **Red Bird and Southern Dipper**, the **Seven Stars of the Well, Ghost, and the Three Stars of the Gourd, Bow, and Wing**, the **Fire Virtue of the Celestial Stems and Branches Ding and Ren** [丙丁巳午火德离神], the **Eight Rong Old Lord of the Major Yang Qi**, the **Fire Emperor Zhufu** [祝融火帝], the **Summer God Xinghuo**, and the **Year Star’s Nine Purple Serpents, Emperor’s Chariot, Emperor’s Enclosure, Emperor’s Assembly, and Yin-Yang Assembly of All Spirits** [帝车帝辖帝舍螣蛇九紫阴阳众神].

We **fear that our dwelling** may **offend the Divine Spirits**, **violate taboos**, and **invite disaster**. Now, we **offer incense**, **return our command to the Most Precious Celestial Sovereign**, **establish this ritual and practice the Dao**, **seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings**.

**Northwest (Metal):**
We, as ritual officers, bow in gratitude to the **Northwest’s Most True, Boundless *Fanqi* Heavenly Lords**, and to the **Green Dragon and Commanding Spirits of the Heavenly Gate** [下谢青龙司命天门之神], the **Hai Palace, Heavenly Position, and Ren-Jia Divine Lords** [亥宫乾位壬甲神君].

We fear that our dwelling may offend the Divine Spirits, violate taboos, and invite disaster. Now, we offer incense, return our command to the Most Precious Celestial Sovereign, establish this ritual and practice the Dao, seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings.

We pray that our sins be cleansed through repentance, that blessings arrive, that disasters cease, and that fortune and longevity extend. May auspicious omens arrive, our home find peace, and people flourish. May descendants be loyal and filial, and life and death alike share in honor. May our petitions be granted as requested, and we humbly receive Your profound grace. After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the Formless.

---

**Upper Realm (Heaven):**
We, as ritual officers, bow in gratitude to the **Upper Realm’s Most True, Boundless *Fanqi* Heavenly Lords**, the **Supreme Celestial Lords**, the **Highest Saints**, the **Sun, Moon, and Star Hosts**, the **Eight Winds and Five Phases**, the **Wind, Rain, Thunder, and Lightning**, and the **Yin-Yang Righteous Spirits**. We offer thanks to the **Heavenly Pattern of the Dao**, the **Sun’s Journey and Moon’s Course**, the **Eight Dragons and Nine Tigers**, the **Ten Essences of the Supreme One**, the **Flying Banners and Eight Executioners**, the **Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper**, and **All Spirits of Heaven and Earth**.

We fear that our dwelling may offend the True Spirits, violate taboos, and defile the Three Lights. We do not revere the Heavenly Dao above nor fear the Ghosts and Spirits below. Our accumulated sins have invited disaster. Now, we offer incense, return our command to the Most Precious Celestial Sovereign, establish this ritual and practice the Dao, seeking forgiveness and hoping for blessings.

Now, we light incense and return our allegiance to the **Most Precious Celestial Sovereign of the Dao** (灵宝天尊). We establish this ritual and practice the **Dao/Way**, expressing gratitude and praying for blessings. We seek the dispersal of a thousand calamities and the absolution of ten thousand sins, that our entire household may be blessed, both the living and the dead may find peace, that fortune and longevity be extended, and that misfortune be eradicated while blessings arise. May we receive as you have instructed, and may we be graced by your profound **Dao/Way’s virtue/power**. After attaining the **Dao/Way**, we ascend into the **Formless Realm**.

**Below the Formless Realm**,
We, the humble servants, present ourselves as **Ritual Official** [某] of the **Dao/Way’s Pure Offering**. We humbly thank the **Formless Realm of the Below** (下方无极世界), the **Divine and Immortal True Essence** (神仙至真), the **High Sovereign Earthly Office** (高皇土府), and the **True Person of the Nine Palaces** (九宫真人), as well as the **Four Directors and Five Emperors** (四司五帝), the **Twelve Immortal Lords** (十二仙君), the **Spiritual Groves and Rivers and Lakes** (灵洞川泽), and the **Venerable Deities of the Five Sacred Mountains** (五岳尊神). We thank the **Yin-Yang forces in motion**, the **Eight Trigrams and Nine Palaces**, the **Five Phases and Two Dwellings**, and the **True Essence of the Earthly Sovereign** (后土至真). We also thank the **Earthly Lords and Marshals** (地下侯伯), the **Four Cardinal Deities and All Spirits** (四正诸神), the **Eight Taboos and Prohibitions** (八部禁忌), the **General Who Guards the Dwelling** (守宅将军), the **Five Earthly Officials and Their Descendants** (五土官属、五土子系), and the **Generals of the Year, Tiger’s Tail and Yellow Banner** (及将军太岁、豹尾黄旛), the **Scholars Who Present Petitions** (奏书博士), and the **Spirits of Retribution and Virtue** (刑德众神), along with the **Seventy-Two Inner and Outer Deities** (七十二位内外神灵).

We fear that our dwelling and its construction may offend the **Spiritual Authorities**, or harm the **Earthly Geography**, or obstruct the **Spring Sources**, or violate the **Prohibitions**, or displease the **Dragon Spirits** in the unseen. Our accumulated misdeeds have no means of redemption.

Thus, we now establish this **Dao/Way’s Pure Offering** and practice the **Dao/Way**, seeking repentance and praying for blessings. We earnestly hope that all **Sages** (众圣) will illuminate our path, that blessings flow from the **Ten Directions**, that the **Hundred Deities** (百神) will bring protection, and that the **Five Emperors** (五帝) will grant respite. May our transgressions be absolved, and may we be granted the opportunity for self-renewal. May our guilt be erased, our calamities washed away, our kin find peace and security, our fortune and lifespan be extended, our dwelling be fortified and tranquil, and the **Dragon Spirits** (龙神) guard and protect us. After attaining the **Dao/Way**, we ascend into the **Formless Realm**.

**Ritual for Pacifying the Dwelling and Resolving Offenses**,
We, the humble servants, now light incense and dedicate our **body** and **spirit** (归身、归神), presenting ourselves as **Ritual Official** [某] for this household’s **Dao/Way’s Pure Offering** and practice of the **Dao/Way**.

We humbly thank the **Most Precious Celestial Sovereign of the Dao** (灵宝天尊) in the **Ten Directions**, the **Formless Supreme One** (无极太上), the **Sage Who Has Attained the Dao** (已得道大圣), the **All True Essences** (众至真), and the **Lords and Elders** (诸君丈人), as well as the **Sun, Moon, and Stars**, the **Three Realms and All Celestial Beings** (三界诸天), the **Five Sacred Mountains and Water Talismans** (五岳水符), the **Three Treasures and Their Venerable Spirits** (三宝威神), the **All Spirits Above and Below Heaven** (天上天下、十极尊灵), and the **Central Yellow Earth and Nine Soils** (下及中黄九土), the **Earthly Sovereign of the Stewardly Cycle** (戊己黄神), the **Earthly Office and Five Emperors** (土府五帝), the **Six Celestial Stems and Five Phases**, the **Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams**, the **Yin-Yang Righteous Spirits**, the **Yearly General and Spirits of Retribution and Virtue**, and **All Spirits**.

We earnestly consider that our dwelling and its construction may offend the **Spiritual Authorities**, or harm the **Earthly Geography**, or obstruct the **Spring Sources**, or violate the **Prohibitions**, or displease the **Dragon Spirits** in the unseen. Our accumulated misdeeds have no means of redemption.

Thus, we now establish this **Dao/Way’s Pure Offering** and practice the **Dao/Way**, seeking repentance and praying for blessings. We hope that all **Sages** (众圣) will illuminate our path, that blessings flow from the **Ten Directions**, that the **Hundred Deities** (百神) will bring protection, that the **Five Emperors** (五帝) will grant respite, and that our transgressions may be absolved, allowing us to be granted the chance for self-renewal. May our guilt be erased, our calamities washed away, our kin find peace and security, our fortune and lifespan be extended, our dwelling be fortified and tranquil, and the **Dragon Spirits** guard and protect us. After attaining the **Dao/Way**, we ascend into the **Formless Realm**.

**Complete Collection of Daoist Ritual Standards, Volume Forty-Three** ends.
**Complete Collection of Daoist Ritual Standards, Volume Forty-Four** begins.

「The Daoist disciple Zhònglì, having compiled the *Three Caverns Canon Register* (三洞经录), now performs the **Ritual of Absolution and Blessing for Household Protection** (安宅解犯谢宠仪) in the stillness of night, ascending the altar as prescribed. The ritual proceedings follow the usual course.

The undersigned [certain rank] and the resident Daoist practitioner [name], together with this household, now humbly offer incense and earnestly invoke the following deities:
The **Great Sage of the Celestial Allocation** (大圣司命君) and his consort,
The **Six Jǐ Jade Maiden** (六癸玉女),
The **Lady Guang’s Attendant** (光姑室女),
The **Fire Hearth Cooking Mother** (下炊母),
The **Fire Force Officer** (行火力士),
The **Fire Father and Fire Mother** (火父火母),
The **Literati and Ink Officials** (文墨小吏),
The **Firewood-Carrying Laborer** (担柴力士),
The **Gao Liang Gentleman** (膏粱君子),
The **Upper Attendant** (上女),
The **Pestle Mortar Boy** (硎上童子),
The **Five Directions’ Auspicious Deities** (五方旺相君),
The **Great and Lesser Lords of the Five Directions** (大小君),
The **Purple Palace Celestial Deity** (紫微天神),
The **Lady of the Jade Pool** (玉池夫人),
The **Five Directions’ Six Bureaus’ Deities** (五方六府神),
The **Left Exhortation Celestial Emperor** (左扶天帝神) and the **Right Enclosure Celestial Emperor** (右房天帝神),
The **Left Nurturing Celestial Emperor’s Cherished Son** (左温天帝娇孙) and the **Right Nurturing Celestial Emperor’s Cherished Daughter** (右温天帝娇女),
The **Thirty-Six Lords Above Heaven** (天上三十六君) and the **Thirty-Six Lords Below Earth** (地下三十六君),
The **Three Primordial and Four Initiating Deities of the Five Soils** (三元四始、五土众神),
The **Filial Devotion and Benevolent Attendant Deity** (主簿孝眷神),
The **Five Prohibitions of Heaven and Earth’s Deities** (天禁地忌五行神),
The **Returning Soul General** (回灵将军),
The **Daily Guardian Earthly Deity** (日直土地),
The **Five Directions’ Dragon Kings and Celestial Emperors** (五方龙王天帝),
The **Lords’ Subordinates** (君部属),
And all **Spirits and Beings** (一切众灵).

Humbly, we acknowledge that our establishment of this altar and acceptance of official status are names already recorded in antiquity; our use of golden vessels and observance of these rites are also documented in the earlier scriptures.»

「The **Yellow Emperor** (黄帝) established the ritual rules for filial and respectful sacrifices to the **Hearth Deity** (灶君), and for ten thousand generations, none dared to neglect the **personal sacrifice** (躬之祭).

Within our household, the **highborn and lowly** (良贱之人), from dawn till dusk, engage in myriad deeds without understanding or discernment. They transgress the **divine hearth** (神灶), their worries unceasing, and in both public and private affairs, their schemes and undertakings are fraught with **entanglements and setbacks** (虑结迍邅之事). Sometimes, they invoke **misfortune and malevolent spirits** (祸横之灵), and though they offer thanks and apologies, they lack proper means. Only **fear and trepidation** (惶惧) follow.

Now, we select this **auspicious day** (良日), and perform the **rites of sacrifice and offering** (礼仪) with utmost solemnity. We **invite all the deities** (众神), humbly beseeching their **mercy and compassion** (慈怜) and praying for **universal blessings** (普降).

The **sacred spirits within and without** (中外神圣) graciously accept our sincere **devotions** (虔祈). They follow the **fragrant incense** (香雾) to our **ritual fast** (斋临), their hearts inclined toward us in **favor and grace** (流贶). Their **enlightened wisdom** (圣智) shines forth, **never neglecting our earnest efforts** (靡怠情勤).

Your humble servant, **unworthy of such devout prayer** (虔祷), prostrates and bows twice, presenting the **initial offering of wine** (初献). Scattered flowers.

A **proclamation or invocation** (宣牒或词) is made. Now, we **burn incense again** (焚香), earnestly reiterating our **supplications to the deities above** (上启). To the **Greatest Saints of Antiquity** (太古大圣), the **Heavenly Hearth Deity and his retinue** (灶君部属), the **Heavenly Hearth Deity who presides over the Five Spirits of Hearth** (司命五灵灶君), and all **divine beings who respond to inner and outer offerings** (内外感应), and **every spirit** (一切神灵),

We **humbly reflect** that in the **prosperous Three Dynasties** (繁昌三代), the **auspicious yellow ram** (黄羊) appeared at **morning and evening** (晨昏); in **all ages, this singular moment** (万世一时), the **white house** (白屋) may be **added to daily rituals** (日用). Your **power is shared with the Fire Element** (威分火德), your **radiance aligns with the Sun’s Dao** (道合太阳). Your **name is inscribed in Heaven** (名应上天), your **virtues proclaimed to Earth** (功宣下土). There exists the **principle of transforming calamity into auspice** (变祸为祥之理), and the **demonstration of dispelling malevolent forces and warding off evil spirits** (祛魔却怪之能). Your **transformative and nurturing power** (化生熟) extends blessings to **both ancient and modern times** (古今), while your **unimpeded spiritual efficacy** (运灵通) encompasses **mercy as vast as the universe** (恩如寰海). Your **divine might is unfathomable** (神威罔测), your **wondrous efficacy boundless** (妙用无穷).

Yet, this humble servant, **unworthy of refined understanding** (卑凡性识), entangled in **mundane affairs** (尘俗行藏), along with our **elders, young, females, and males** (老幼女男), and **those of high and low station** (尊卑良贱), have **recklessly stirred intentions and actions** (起心运意), **offending the sacred and defying the divine** (误圣违神).

At the **commencement of building the hearth** (建灶之初), and in its **very construction** (营造之始), we **moved earth without regard to omens** (动土工而无论凶吉), **laid bricks and stones without knowing their auspiciousness** (加砖石而岂识利宜). Sometimes, the **structure was flawed** (状失规模), **mixing old and new elements** (□杂新故); sometimes, the **clay was unclean** (泥涂不洁), the **design improper** (式样乖疏). We **chose days rarely auspicious** (择日罕遇於良辰), and **offered sacrifices without following proper rites** (奉祭莫遵於轨范). The **cauldron was once used in unclean places** (釜曾经於秽所), the **ground may have been buried with the dead** (地或瘗於伏尸).

Among our **kinsmen and attendants, near and distant** (眷属亲疏), some **treated the deities lightly** (轻神), **offered insufficient rites** (薄礼). We **mistakenly prioritized great and small offerings** (大小误错), **sampling food before the sacrifice** (於未祭以先尝). Even in **gathering firewood for domestic use** (入宅樵薪), we **recklessly ventured into ancestral mounds and shrines** (宁测於丘陵社庙). In **preparing meals and cooking** (供时烧爨), we **did not heed the harm of winds and □** (焉知其风□雷伤).

Our **ritual fasts were improperly conducted** (困损误修), **our Dao names violated taboos** (道名触讳). Our **cups and bowls for food** (杯盂食器) were **not made in accordance with the Hearth Deity’s standards** (罔同制於灶君); our **chickens and pigs** (鸡豚), along with **hair and feathers** (毛发), were **offered without proper reverence** (冒冲於前后).

We **did not guard against forbidden omens** (不防於忌讳) in our **soup and water**, **pouring them out or extinguishing flames**; we **did not consider the weight of offerings** (弗顾於重轻) in our **cooking and steaming**, **presenting high or low sacrifices**. We **failed to offer sacrifices at the auspicious hours of the Tiger and Rabbit** (无生於寅卯), **neglecting the proper timing for water and metal elements** (水金乏祭於时辰).

Now, we **offer sincere repentance** (忏谢必伸), **begging for divine forgiveness and pardon** (乞垂赦宥).

Your humble servant, **unworthy of utmost devotion** (不任精诚恳祷之至), bows twice and burns incense, presenting the **secondary offering of wine** (亚献). Scattered flowers.

We **earnestly reiterate our supplications** (谨重诚上启), to the **Greatest Saint, Hearth Deity of the Five Spirits** (司命五灵灶君), and all **seated sacred spirits** (合坐一切众圣).

Now, we **devout disciples** (奉道弟子某), both **elders and juniors** (一家长少), **pour out our sincere offerings** (再倾丹赤), **collectively informing all the deities** (共告诸神).

We **humbly pray for your consideration** (乞念凡微) of our **lowly and devout reverence** (鉴其虔仰). **Benevolently open your divine creation** (俯开圣造), and **bestow extraordinary blessings** (深布殊休).

This humble servant and all our **household, young and old** (合家幼艾等), **confess our past errors and misdeeds** (从来之误作故为), **sincerely repenting and offering thanks**. For your **future grace and forgiveness** (此去之垂恩降宥), we **solemnly vow to reform** (惟卜自新).

We **pray for honor and advancement in public office** (仕公有迁达之荣), and **prosperity and flourishing in private life** (处私获昌隆之福). In **times of wind, cold, heat, and dampness** (风寒暑湿之候), may we **borrow your divine light and protection** (各假恩光). In **cooking and steaming at all times** (炊蒸动作之时), may we **especially receive your benevolent grace** (尤加善贶).

May all **transformations and nurturing be complete** (化生成熟), **all blessings and auspices depend on your divine power** (锡福储祥). Truly, we **universally accept your boundless mercy** (寔普承於惠渥).

The **Hearth Deity’s celestial consort** (灶上姹女), the **Purple Darkness Heavenly Spirit** (紫微天神), **guides the smoke and flames to ascend the sky** (扶烟焰以飞空), **collecting warmth and radiance** (拘收燠赫). They **dissipate malevolent influences** (散神威而荡恶), **warding off evil spirits** (屏绝妖精).

The **Lady of Jade Pond** (玉池夫人) **removes all ills from smoke and fire** (蠲除烟火); the **Highly Virtuous Gentlemen** (高良君子) **bring joy and contentment to all spirits** (悦豫众神).
