**The *Comprehensive Daoist Ritual Precepts Collection* – Master Guangtong Du’s Revised *North Dipper Prolonging Life Pure Ritual Rites***

**On Establishing the Ritual Platform**

Should one who serves the **Supreme Celestial** (上真) fail to align with the **Heavenly Symbols and Earthly Patterns** (法天象地), constructing the platform according to the **Dipper’s Ladle** (随斗杓而建坛), they violate the **Dao’s Teachings** (违道训). It is better not to perform the rites at all than to proceed thus. The ritualist must first purify their **inner realm** (内境), clarifying their **spirit and vital essence** (召魂集神), so that the **Ten Thousand Things** respond to their command and transform in accordance with their will. Only then can their sincerity be manifest—otherwise, though offerings may be abundant, they will yield no benefit. Thus, **invoking the incense** (祝香) must come first.

Next, one must **recite the ritual precepts and teachings** (叙陈科教), for without this, the **Daoist and layfolk** will lack proper cause and effect, and their **faith will wane**, making it difficult for the **Celestial Worthies** to descend. Thus, **reciting the ritual’s purpose** follows.

Once the purpose is declared, if one cannot **describe the celestial patterns** (纪述天文) and **proclaim the Primordial Mystery** (对扬元妙), they will fail to honor the **Dipper’s Sovereignty** (北斗之尊). Thus, **narrating the Worthies’ virtues** comes next.

After recounting the Worthies’ virtues, if no **sincere words** are spoken, sincerity cannot stand. Thus, **proclaiming the invocation** follows.

Yet even then, if one’s **petitions for blessings and averting of calamities** are not made with **practiced Dao and vowed aspirations**, placing others before oneself, they cannot align with the **Celestial Intent**. Thus, **offering the three incense** follows.

Once the incense is offered, one’s **past karmic burdens and grave offenses** must be **repented**. The **Mysterious Virtues and Marvelous Benevolence** must be **striven for**. Without this, sins will not be extinguished, and blessings will not descend. Thus, **repentance** follows.

After repentance, one must **contemplate the Seven Celestial Worthies’ Virtues** (七元之德), holding them in mind as if they were present, so that their **auspicious aid may be secured**. Thus, **praising their virtues** follows.

Once the virtues are praised, one must **take refuge**, exhausting their **sincere aspirations**, so that the **Divine Presence may surely accept them**. Thus, **the Seven Refuges** follow.

After taking refuge, one may **offer the coarse wine** (浊醪) as a ritual expression of the heart. Thus, **the three libations** follow.

Once the libations are complete, the **ritual decorum is fulfilled**, the **gracious blessings obtained**, and the **words of thanksgiving** must be spoken to **send the Worthies back to the void**, while **gazing upward in reverence**. Nothing further can be added, so the **dismissal of the platform** concludes the rites—**a single phrase suffices**.

---
**The Invocation of Incense**

*"Dao Incense, Virtue Incense, the Incense of Effortless Naturalness*—now burning in the heated censer—**I summon the Three Treasures of the Great Luo, the Jade Seal Celestial Sovereigns, the Golden Gate Jade Emperor, the Central Heavenly Star Sovereign of Purple Micro, the Native Star Sovereign of the Southern Dipper and Northern Dipper, and all the Celestial Worthies of the Encompassing Heavenly River and Constellations.**

With this **true incense**, I **universally offer reverent homage**.

I, **your humble disciple of the [Surname] household**, now **proclaim the ritual precepts and practice the Dao**, petitioning for blessings and averting calamities. First, I shall **recite the ritual’s chapters and extol the virtues**, so that within this **ritual platform**, both **Daoists and layfolk** may witness and hear, and all generate **reverent devotion**.

I **humbly pray for celestial favor**, seeking even a slight alignment with the **Heavenly Will**. It is proper to **lay this out in detail**; I pray you **deign to inspect it with favor**.

I have heard that the **Most High established Virtue**, setting forth the **lofty winds of purity and stillness**; the next was to **establish Teachings**, expounding the **marvelous scriptures of compassion**.

They compiled the **Daoist canons**, hiding them in **sacred mountains**, sometimes revealing their traces to **deliver beings**, or bestowing **ritual precepts to save the world**.

They **detailed the cycles of the Lower Primordial** and **expounded the causes of one’s native star**, opening the way for all people to **take refuge in the Great Dao**, so that they might **cultivate the heart and nourish the qi**, confess sins to **prolong life**, and at the **times when Celestial Worthies descend**, always **grant sincere prayers**.

At the **Three Primordial Festivals and Eight Seasonal Nodes**, at one’s **native star’s birth hour**, they **solemnly established the ritual platform**, **reverently observing fasts and pure rites**, whether in **temple halls or domestic settings**.

They held **various incense and flowers**, offering them with **sincere devotion**; they arranged **fragrant wines and fruits**, their **virtues shining bright**. They **modeled the rites after Heaven and Earth**, **embodying the decorum of awe** in their offerings.

When observing fasts, they **extended from one day to seven**, according to their **capacity to perform merit**; when commissioning the Dao, they **gathered from one person to seven**, inviting them to **conduct the rites**.

Some **recited the numinous spells**, others **acknowledged the true forms**, directing their hearts to the **Dipper’s Sovereignty**, bowing beneath the **Purple Micro**, **humbling themselves before the Three Officials and Five Emperors**, **reaching sincerity to the Nine Palaces and Four Departments**, **offering blessings to prolong life**, **dissipating calamities and warding off misfortune**, **broadening boundless blessings**, and **receiving the greatest of celestial favor**. They **pondered the True Worthies’ unerring will**, **avoided false sects**, **purified the decay of calamities**, **shared in the dissolution of sins**, **attained virtuous fruits for the body**, and **secured blessings and longevity for life**, **ascending to the Ten Extremes**, **never sinking into the Three Abysses**. All this is the **power of invocation**, none other than the **support of the Worthies’ virtues**.

Yet there are those of the **Lower Primordial** born into lands afflicted by **epidemic scourges**, where **plagues spread**; or years struck by **famine and scarcity**, where **harvests fail and goods are not produced.**"

The corpses lie sprawling across the plains, the *qi* congealing beneath the vaulted heavens. Many face the specter of famine and hunger, while lands are ravaged by blade and war.

In reverence to the **Northern Emperor**, we erect the **Star Altar** below, expressing mortal sincerity and chanting divine incantations—thus summoning the **Thunderous Spirit’s** might to the earth. We deploy **celestial chariots** across the four quarters, cast nets a thousandfold, and unleash **flaming arrows** ten thousand *li* far. We gather the **five demonic weapons’** malevolent *qi* and ensure the **five grains** flourish in harmony. The year shall rejoice in abundance, and the people shall know no untimely death.

Yet there are those of the **Lower Primordial** afflicted by sudden calamities, where pestilence and miasma cannot be evaded, and they often encounter the **Six Cavern Demons**, suffering countless torments. Their homes are plagued by misfortune, and they know no rest. Disaster and decay lurk, seizing them at their most vulnerable. Their vital breath is bound, and chronic illness ensnares them for long. Some wander in hardship, others are choked by debt. Their fortunes show signs of decline, their lives lack smooth prosperity—calamities multiply beyond description.

In reverence to the **Northern Emperor**, we erect the **Star Altar** below, presenting our mortal pleas and chanting divine incantations—thus augmenting **divine insight** and **fate’s calculations**, trimming death’s register while extending life’s. Demonic scourges are dispersed, and all undertakings bring auspicious fortune.

Yet there are those of the **Lower Primordial** whose fields are ravaged by **locusts and borers**, whose lands teem with **plague insects**, destroying crops and leaving no harvest. Though they yearn for abundance, they reap nothing.

In reverence to the **Northern Emperor**, we erect the **Star Altar** below, solemnizing the fields with ritual purity and arraying the **threatening implements** in order. Following the **science**, we recite the incantations and dispatch petitions to the heavens—thus invoking the **Thunderous Spirit’s** stern command to slay the **disaster insects**, nurturing the **grains** to double their yield.

Yet there are those of the **Lower Primordial** who pray for descendants at their gates, whose women bear the joy of pregnancy. Some suffer within the **Six Hexagrams**, their fetal *qi* damaged; others perish within the **Ten Years**, their lives cut short. On the critical day of their pregnancy, they encounter the **Demoness’s** calamity, harboring malevolent *qi* that cannot be preserved, consuming the **essence of life** without securing it. They suffer from **withering yellow sickness** and are plagued by **strange dreams**—cats, mice, dogs, and monkeys transform into ominous forms, secretly devouring their offspring, leading to frequent deaths and deepening the sorrow of their parents, severing the lineage of their ancestors.

In reverence to the **Northern Emperor**, we erect the **Star Altar** below, expressing mortal sincerity and chanting divine incantations—thus moving the **Thunderous Spirit** of the upper realms to descend as the **Jade Maiden**, guarding the inner chambers and harmonizing the **five viscera**, ensuring the **auspiciousness of childbirth** and the **longevity of life**.

Yet there are women who labor in childbirth with agonizing pain, their suffering caused by the **Ghost Mother’s** devouring, weakening their **blood and viscera**, obstructing them for over a decade in endless terror.

In reverence to the **Northern Emperor**, we erect the **Star Altar** below, performing the **Way** with utmost sincerity and reciting the incantations—thus summoning the **Spirit Boy** to descend alongside the **Jade Maiden**, safeguarding the **grass mat** of childbirth in peace and ensuring swift, smooth deliveries for both mother and child.

Yet there are women who, as **tiger-wolf consorts**, consume the **essence of their children’s viscera**, desperately seeking sons yet bearing none in their lifetimes.

In reverence to the **Northern Emperor**, we erect the **Star Altar** below, purifying the hall with solemnity and offering **incense and flowers** in abundance, focusing our hearts on **single virtue** and reciting the incantations ten thousand times—thus sweeping away demons and banishing evil, ensuring **abundant progeny**.

All these **divine responses** are recorded in the **Precious Scrolls**. Thus it is known that the **Nuns’** atonements and the **Seven Primordials’** salvation encompass all.

This is the **Most High’s** expedient means, the **Most Holy’s** compassionate mercy, their **sincere devotion** for the people and **wholehearted benevolence** for all things. Unenlightened to **true principles (未明真理)**,

Some **follow the fateful calculations of the heart (念运心)**,
**Defying the Great Dao (乖违大道)**,
In every **action and rest (行藏动息)**,
**Offending the True Spirits (犯冒真灵)**;
Others **carry sins from past lives into this one (前代今生愆瑕未涤)**,
Or **increase their faults through conduct (立身履行过咎旋增)**,
**Binding their sins to the Underworld Ledger (结罪目於酆都)**,
And **incurring demonic peril in the Earthly Records (着凶危於地简)**;
Or **face years of stagnation (年逢厄滞)**,
And **encounter declining fate (命值衰微)**,
When the **Eight Auspicious Stars are at their most dire (八禄当绝尽之期)**,
And the **Three Fates meet the calamitous number (三命遇休囚之数)**;
When the **Five Stars traverse their courses (五星行度)**,
And **some bear ill omens (有所照临)**;
When the **Eight Trigrams fly their flags of misfortune (八卦飞旗)**,
And **I am struck by penal calamities (罹刑厄)**;
Or **indulge in reckless rituals (兴修任性)**,
**Defying the gods (抵犯神祇)**;
Or **slaughter without restraint (烹宰恣情)**,
**Creating karmic debts (因成冤对)**.

As described above,
I have **never repented or atoned (曾未忏除)**,
Thus **my calamities multiply (厄滞多端)**,
And **my disasters are incalculable (灾凶莫测)**.
Morning and night, **I am plagued by anxiety (忧惧)**,
And **dare not rest in peace (不敢遑宁)**.

I have heard that the **Jade Emperor opens the path of compassion (玉皇开慈悯之科)**,
And the **Great Emperor establishes the ritual of atonement (大帝垂醮陈之典)**;
Thus, I **rely on sacred teachings (凭宝训)**,
And **prepare the ritual platform (备醮坛)**,
**Daring to invoke the sacred presence (冒渎威灵)**,
And **summon the True Saints (延降真圣)**.

I **humbly beg that the primordial grace may descend to the mortal realm (胎恩下俗)**,
And that **the sacred favor may reach the common folk (介福凡愚)**,
Granting **permission to reform (许以自新)**,
And **accepting my repentance and purification (容其忏洗)**.

I **aspire that the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault (玉皇上帝)**,
The **Seven Venerable Star Lords (七元尊神)**,
May **specially absolve me of past calamities and accumulated sins (解除宿殃积罪)**,
Of **old and new disasters (旧厄新灾)**;
Within the **Three Fates and Nine Palaces (三命九宫)**,
And the **Five Phases of stellar alignment (五行列宿)**,
May **disasters and calamities cease (灾凶殄息)**,
And **the path to fortune open (厄难开通)**.

I **humbly beg for the removal of calamities from years, months, days, and hours (岁月日时灾厄)**,
And those **calculated by fate (算尽之厄)**;
Of **calamities from the Eight Trigrams and Nine Palaces (八卦九宫)**,
And the **Five Ghosts’ fatal strikes (五鬼绝命)**;
Of **calamities from the Six Jiǎn and Three Fates (六壬三命)**,
From **Earthly Nets and Heavenly Snares (地网天罗)**,
And the **Five Phases’ decaying and clashing penalties (金木水火土五行衰绝刑克)**;
Of **calamities to my kin and the Six Relationships (眷属六亲)**,
And those **that obstruct and harm (妨害之厄)**;
Of **public and private slander (公私口舌)**,
And **unjust disasters or horizontal calamities (非灾横祸)**,
And **imprisonment (囚系)**;
Of **calamities from malevolent thieves and bandits (恶人盗贼)**,
And **violent assaults or plots to harm (侵暴谋害)**;
Of **calamities from construction and labor (起造兴工)**,
And **infringements or offenses (侵伤触犯)**;
Of **calamities from the four directions and five routes (四方五路)**,
And **blockages that impede progress (滞塞不通)**;
Of **calamities from travel by land and sea (水陆游行)**,
And **misfortunes with boats, carriages, oxen, and horses (舟车牛马)**;
Of **calamities from debtors and enemies (冤家债主)**,
And **litigious disputes or fate’s scrutiny (诉讼考注)**;
Of **calamities from the departed returning to haunt the living (先亡家墓复连)**;
Of **calamities from neighbors in the four directions (四方邻里)**,
And **ill omens from broken arrows, direct talismans, or fate’s marking (破射直符注煞)**;
Of **calamities from unsettled residence (居止不安)**,
From **lost wealth and spirits’ depletion (财帛遗亡、神鬼益耗)**.

If **a child is born in the year of Geng (庚) or Shen (申)**,
And **suffers disasters at any hour (年月日时灾厄)**,
I **invoke the Northern Dipper’s Star of Greed (贪狼星君)** to absolve them;
If **a child is born in the year of Chǒu (丑) or Hài (亥)**,
And **suffers disasters at any hour (年月日时灾厄)**,
I **invoke the Star Lord of the Great Gate (巨门星君)** to absolve them;
If **a child is born in the year of Yín (寅) or Xū (戌)**,
And **suffers disasters at any hour (年月日时灾厄)**,
I **invoke the Star Lord of Auspicious Retention (禄存星君)** to absolve them;
If **a child is born in the year of Mǎo (卯) or Yǒu (酉)**,
And **suffers disasters at any hour (年月日时灾厄)**,
I **invoke the Star Lord of Literary Grace (文曲星君)** to absolve them;
If **a child is born in the year of Chén (辰) or Shēn (申)**,
And **suffers disasters at any hour (年月日时灾厄)**,
I **invoke the Star Lord of Chastity and Integrity (廉贞星君)** to absolve them;
If **a child is born in the year of Wèi (巳) or Wèi (未)**,
And **suffers disasters at any hour (年月日时灾厄)**,
I **invoke the Star Lord of Martial Grace (武曲星君)** to absolve them;

If **a child is born in the year of Wǔ (午)**,
And **suffers disasters at any hour (年月日时灾厄)**,
I **invoke the Star Lord of the Shattered Army (Pòjūn Star Lord, 破军星君)** to absolve them.

May I **pray that no calamity intrudes unnaturally**,
That disasters and decline be cleansed away,
That the soul and spirit be steadied,
That dreams and waking align with truth,
That **Dao-qi nourishes within**,
That **original harmony pervades fully**,
That past misfortunes be washed clean,
That grievances and debts be dissolved,
That pestilence and epidemics do not approach,
That blessings and longevity increase,
That the living and the departed be graced,
That kin and dependents share in honor.

Thus, **I humbly receive the grace of the myriad sages’ protection**,
The benevolence of the **Most True’s compassionate regard**,
The **Heavenly Venerable’s great mercy from above**,
And **fulfill my sincerity in repentance below**,
Devoutly presenting this petition.

**Twelve Vows.**
**Reignite the furnace.**

With solemn reverence, I **dispatch the incense-official messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the attendant spirit officials of incense**,
To command that **my former place of nocturnal Dao-practice**
Shall naturally birth **golden elixir and jade-green essence, numinous herbs and spirits**,
Where **multitudes of True Ones gather**—
All before this incense furnace.

May I **pray that the celestial boys and jade maidens of the Ten Directions**
Attend to the fragrant mists,
And swiftly convey my sincere petition
Directly to the **Most True, Supreme Dao of the Boundless Extreme, before the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign**.

**Exit the gate.**

**Translation:**

By the sacred rites, we invoke the descent of the Holy—
To purify the vulgar heart through cleansing.
By the teachings’ prescribed words, we earnestly plead at the Celestial Throne—
To receive the Emperor’s compassion.

We present offerings complete,
Like humble reeds and rushes in shared humility;
We proffer wine and libations,
Like turbid waters flowing in sinful streams.

Yet our sincerity is clear,
Our loyalty unyielding—
To fulfill the rites of repentance,
And restore the pure nature of our original essence.

Thus may we avoid transgression’s doom,
And escape the guilt of error.

With rites and sincerity exalted,
Words follow the heart’s deepest intent.
We display the solemnity of this day,
And convey our meaning in this hour.

May the crimson banners and rainbow standards
Not linger long upon the mortal earth,
While the cloud-chariot and crane-canopy
Shall return to the lofty vault above.

May the blessings of Your grace
Flow eternally, nurturing virtue’s growth,
And magnify the boundless恩 of nurturing care,
To soothe the common heart and manifest the Dao’s glory.

Thus may the officiant of this ritual,
**South Palace** receive blessings and **North Bureau** avert calamities,
With households welcoming a thousand auspices,
And gates inviting a hundred fortunes.
May descendants flourish,
And sickness and pestilence retreat.
May hidden disasters of water and fire dissolve,
And clarity protect both public and private fortune.

May ancestors be liberated,
And grievances ascend to transcendence—
All wishes fulfilled, no plea unanswered.
We rely on the boundless blessings of the Supreme,
To attain the greatest felicity.

Yet, reflecting on our many offenses,
Defilement lingers, dust remains uncleansed,
Externally lacking the adornments of ritual,
Internally forgetting the unity of the refined essence—
We cannot yet invite the descent of blessings,
Lest we first incur guilt and punishment.

Oh, the **Seven Stars of the Big Dipper** and the **Assisting Celestial Lords**,
The gathered **True Saints** of the Assembly—
Have mercy on our ignorance and folly,
And grant universal pardon.

Thus, this is fitting and proper,
To eternally honor our devout and reverent supplication;
Like the **Big Dipper’s stars** or wings of a crane,
We humbly receive Your far-reaching grace.

With bowed obeisance, we send forth the cloud-chariot,
Our longing too deep to bear.

**The officiant and ritual master**, with deepest reverence,
Prostrate in awe before the Sacred Procession,
And with utmost devotion, submit this prayer.

**Twelve Wishes** fulfilled.
**The incense burner is extinguished.**

With solemnity, we command the **Fragrant Officials and Envoys**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords**,
And the **Attendant Spirits of Incense**—
To manifest, at the place of our former nocturnal Daoist practice,
The spontaneous emergence of **golden elixir and jade-green essences**,
**Mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits**,
As the **Celestial Worthies** gather before this incense burner.

May the **Ten Directions’ Immortal Youth and Jade Maidens**
Attend the fragrant mists,
And swiftly convey our sincere supplications
Directly to the **Supreme Dao of the Boundless and True**,
Before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor’s Celestial Throne**.

**The hymn of departure is chanted.**
**Exiting the hall, the Holy Procession is sent forth.**

**The Complete Daoist Canon of Rituals and Regulations, Volume Fifty-Seven, concluded. Volume Fifty-Eight, edited by Master Guangting Du: The Ritual of the Northern Dipper’s Prolonging Life and Expiatory Lamp.**

**Humbly heard**, the **Primordial Sage** opened his teachings,

The **Supreme Primordial Lord** extended his mercy,
And all creatures received the blessings of his virtues.

Thus, the **Golden Tablets and Jade Registers** were revealed,
Displaying the **Fast Rituals and Regulations**.
The **Golden Tablets and Glistening Records** were proclaimed,
To spread the **Great Expiation Method**.

**This path of prayer and atonement** is now opened,
And the **Ritual of Expiation and Repentance** is broadly extended.

All who receive life and form,
Should indeed **faithfully adhere** and **revere**.

Now, the **disciples of the fast** [certain],
By fortune, receive the **True Shade’s protection**,
And dwell long in the **auspicious cycle of time**.

Yet, though they possess wealth and extravagance,
They fail to grasp the **principles of ascetic discipline**.

**Reflecting**, their years may be in peril,
And calamities may cling to them.

Following the **True Ritual of the Yellow Registers**,
And the **Heavenly Hosts of the Northern Dipper’s Seven Stars**,
With **sincere devotion**, they establish the **Expiation Seat**,
And raise the **Star Altar**.

**The Celestial Worthies** gather in the **Perfect Circle of the Sky**,
And the **Northern Dipper’s Ladle** ascends in due order.
**Luminous Radiance** illuminates,
And the **Divine Incantations** softly spread,
To **attain blessings and rescue the departed**.

**Humbly praying**, the **Heavenly Worthies** may witness our offerings,
And the **Divine Vehicles** descend from afar.
Beholding our **sincere prayers and devotions**,
They grant **auspicious blessings and signs**—
That calamities be dispelled this very day,
And blessings descend upon this very hour.
Thus, all beings may **fruitfully bask in the divine light**,
And rejoice in **universal harmony**.

**With bowed heads**, we **faithfully adhere** and **revere**,
And with **sincere devotion**, we **chant praises**.

**This humble servant** [and all] **devote our hearts** to **faithfully adhere** to the **Pivot Palace’s Greedy Wolf Star Lord, the True Emperor of Bright Yang**,
The **Divine Worthies of the Dipper’s Center**,
And **harmonize with all Spirits**.

We **humbly contemplate** the **True Lord**,
Whose **divine movement** governs the **cyclical vault**,
And whose **virtue** aligns with the **Pivot of the Dao**.

He **commands the lofty heavens**,
And his **merits** match the **pure virtue of Heaven**.
Above, he **conforms to the Noble Sky’s perfection**,
Below, he **stabilizes the weak and the humble**.

He **presides over the Yang Virtue**,
And **revered as the True Star**,
Eternally **radiating divine light**,
And **secretly supporting the Holy Sovereign**,
To **ensure the perpetual blessings of the ten thousand years**,
And **permanently secure the peace of the lower realms**.

His **wondrous transformations** are **enduringly trusted**,
And his **mysterious powers** are **beyond measure**.

Now, **this humble servant** [certain]
**Humbly relies on** the **True Lord’s protection and blessings**,
And **by fortune**, is **granted human kinship**.
Having **received the radiant guidance**,
We **dare to pledge our adherence**.

**With solemnity**, we follow the **ritual regulations**,
And **establish the Star Altar**,
Arranging **incense and lamps** in full,
And **strictly observing the sacred rituals**,
To **faithfully adhere** to the **Pivot Palace’s Greedy Wolf Star Lord**,
The **True Emperor of Bright Yang**,
Who belongs to the **disciples of the Dipper’s Great Saints**.

**Humbly praying**, the **Heavenly Heart** may **bestow blessings**,
And the **Holy Power** may **support and uphold us**,
Inscribing our **lifespan calculations** in the **Green Book**,
And **erasing our sins** from the **Black Register**.
Thus, **auspicious blessings** will **fully arrive**,
And **merits of goodness** will **come to fruition**.

**With bowed heads**, we **faithfully adhere** and **revere**,

**We pledge faith** to the **Supreme Purple Enclosure’s Second Star Lord, the Greedy Wolf Star Lord of the Northern Dipper**.
**Greedy Wolf prolongs life**,
And the **Four Spirits of the Dipper** **return to their True Nature**.
His **flowing radiance** **illuminates below**,
And his **penetrating insight** **reaches the Primordial Darkness**.

Our **seven origins are recorded**,
And our **names are inscribed in the Jade Court**.
He **protects the body and extends longevity**,
And **perpetually blesses purity and chastity**.
He **opens our ears and eyes to clarity**,
And **calms our soul and spirit forever**.

He **nourishes our vital essence and spirit**,
And **shares his divine illumination**.
**Prolonging life naturally**,
We **ascend to Jade Purity**,
And **harmonize our wishes to attain eternal life**.

**This humble servant** [and all] **devote our hearts** to **faithfully adhere** to the **Star Palace’s Heavenly Pillar Star Lord, the True Person of the True Emperor**,
The **Divine Worthies of the Dipper’s Center**,
And **harmonize with all Spirits**.

We **humbly contemplate** the **True Lord**,
Whose **transformations and movements** are **our models**,
And who **embodies the subtle patterns of Heaven’s design**.

He **belongs to the human order**,
And **long perpetuates the True Ruler’s merit**.
He **commands the high virtue of Fire**,
And **governs the tranquil stability of the Liang realm**.
His **radiance illuminates benevolent thoughts**,
And **forever cherishes the wicked**—
**No longer fearing the remote and the humble**,
And **secretly eliminating the calamities of the inner walls**.

Now, **this humble servant** [certain]
**Humbly relies on** the **True Lord’s mystical creation**,
And **reverently adheres to his sacred authority**.
With **sincere devotion** and **filial piety**,
And **unwavering respect and humility**,
We **diligently follow the ritual regulations**,
And **establish the Star Altar**,
With **fast offerings and sacred rituals**,
And **incense lamps solemnly arranged**,
To **faithfully adhere** to the **Heavenly Pillar Star Lord**,
Who belongs to the **disciples of the Dipper’s Great Saints**,
And is the **True Lord of the Tiger and Dog-born**.

「May the divine mind swiftly respond,
And the sacred **virtue/power** subtly support,
So that **a thousand blessings** gather eternally at our gates,
And the **Five Auspicious Blessings** forever sustain our fate.
All actions bring prosperity,
And calamities and misfortunes are swept away.

With deepest reverence, we **take refuge** and **devoutly chant** in praise.

We **faithfully adhere** to the **Heavenly Pillar Star Lord**,
The **Third Star of the Dipper’s Great Saints**,
Who **transcends calamities** and **ascends as a high immortal**.
Whose **radiance pervades** all directions,
And whose **inner and outer realms remain serene**.
With **seven elements** recorded in the celestial ledgers,
And **name inscribed in the Purple Court**.
May he **support our life and extend our years**,
And **ensure our blessings and longevity endure**.
May our **organs and bowels** remain open and clear,
And **all movements and stillness** bring peace.
May our **radiance harmonize with the stars**,
And **share in the divine’s glory**.
May **calamities be naturally dispelled**,
And we **ascend to the Jade Capital**,
To **attain eternal life** through this **harmonious vow**.

We, the humble servants, **with sincere hearts, take refuge** in the **True Lord of the Tiger and Dog-born**,
The **Heavenly Pillar Star Lord**,
Who **harmonizes with all celestial spirits**.

We, the humble servants, **reverently rely on** the **True Lord**,
Who **controls all things with gentle authority**,
And **forever applies the weighty balance of cause and effect**.
Who **regulates the four seasons**,
And **distinguishes the proper signs of yin and yang**.
Who **embodies the gentle water virtue/power**,
And **nourishes the realm of pure clarity**.
For whom **heavenly principles are entrusted**,
And **the foundation of the land is sustained**.
Who **never raises conflicts from the frontier**,
But **commands the stern might of martial laws**.
Whose **mystical transformations** shine brightly,
And whose **sacred deeds** are wondrously profound.

Now, this humble servant **adheres to the Dao/Way** with reverence,
And **follows the immortal’s teachings** with devotion.
Through **accumulated merit and good deeds**,
We **attain the path of taking refuge in the True Lord**.
With **diligence**, we **follow the ritual regulations**,
And **establish the Star Altar**,
With **lawful rites of utmost solemnity**,
And **incense lamps blazing in splendor**,
To **take refuge** in the **True Lord of the Dipper’s Great Saints**,
The **Fourth Star of the Dipper’s Great Saints**,
The **Star Lord of the Purple Enclosure**,
Who **dispels calamities** and **opens the luminous yang**.
Whose **immortal spirits** appear and vanish,
And **radiance pierces through all ten directions**.
With **seven elements** mastered in the celestial ledgers,
And **name inscribed in the Purple Chamber**.
May he **guard our bodies and enhance our longevity**,
And **forever bestow blessings and good fortune**.
May **true virtue** descend as grace,
And **purge all malevolent disasters**.
May **refined essence and structured qi** align,
And **we share in the divine’s realm**.
May **calamities be naturally dispelled**,
And we **ascend to the Jade Hall**,
To **attain eternal life** through this **harmonious vow**.

We, the humble servants, **with sincere hearts, take refuge** in the **True Lord of the Balance Palace**,
The **Dan Yuan True Lord of the Dipper’s Great Saints**,
Who **harmonizes with all celestial spirits**.

We, the humble servants, **reverently rely on** the **True Lord**,
Who **stands upright and balanced in heaven**,
And **kindly bestows upon all things**.
Who **central harmony establishes the poles**,
And **serves as the guiding principle for the Five Sounds**.
Who **holds the earth virtue/power** while **containing radiance**,
And **divides the regions of the obscure and the luminous** to **preside over them**.
For those who **commit wicked and obstinate crimes**,
It is **difficult to evade the punishment of execution**.
Yet his **virtue lies in cherishing life**,
And his **power lies in eliminating evil**.

Now, this humble servant **abandons extravagance and arrogance**,
And **holds fast to simplicity** to **offer sincere devotion**.
With **steadfast vows and reverent gazes**,
We **dare to dedicate our hearts** in **praise of the Dao/Way**.」

With solemn adherence to the ritual canons,
We erect the star altar,
And prepare the utmost solemnity of law and faith,
Offering pure incense and lamps to invoke
The **Lian Zheng Star Lord**, the Great Saint of the Northern Dipper,
Whose birth hour belongs to **Chen-Shen** (4–6 AM).

May the divine efficacy resonate in response,
And the sacred blessings flow abundantly—
That calamities and decline be forever dispelled from our person,
And fortune and prosperity long sustain our household.
May our gates resound with joy,
And malevolent forces retreat in concealment.

With bowed heads, we take refuge and devoutly chant.
We pledge our faith to the **Lian Zheng Star Lord** of the **Purple Enclosure’s Fifth Star**.

Lian Zheng sustains the declining,
The True Sovereign descends in spirit.
Flowing clouds disperse and spread,
Divine processions intermingle in splendor.

The **Seven Elements’** records name him in the **Purple Camp**.
May he solidify the body and nurture longevity,
And blessings unite in harmony.

The High Mysterious guides us,
And we wander freely in the **Five Clarities**.
Riding the celestial light, we soar,
And share essence with the divine.

He sustains the declining naturally,
Ascends to the Jade Court,
And grants our harmonious wish for eternal life.

We, the humble servants, with sincere hearts,
Take refuge in the **Wu Qu Star Lord** of the **Northern Dipper**,
The True Sovereign of the **Fuyang Palace, Northern Pole**,
A divine immortal among the Dipper stars,
And the harmonious assembly of spirits.

We, the humble servants, reverently behold the True Lord,
Whose transformative power moves the celestial gates—
No virtue surpasses that of **Fuyang**;
Whose **qi** flows and resonates—
The **Six Harmonics** are fully preserved.

He governs the flourishing of **Wood Virtue/Power**,
And eternally presides over the **Zhao Domain**.
May we depart peril and attain security,
And forever have abundance without want.

May the people prosper in their granaries,
And blessings harmonize the realm and family.

Now, this humble servant, relying on the Dao’s grace,
Reveres the Heavenly Virtue/Power,
Ever offering sincere devotion,
And perpetually holding awe in our hearts.

With solemn adherence to the ritual canons,
We establish the altar steps,
Strictly uphold the **Zhenxin** (sincere faith),
And meticulously prepare incense and flowers
To invoke the **Wu Qu Star Lord** of the Northern Dipper,
Whose birth hour belongs to **Si-Wei** (10 AM–12 PM).

May the Mysterious Creation unfold broadly,
And the divine blessings swiftly descend—
Ever dispelling calamities,
Forever preserving auspicious signs,
And the Four Seasons bring tranquility,
With the entire household in purity and good fortune.

With bowed heads, we take refuge and devoutly chant.
We pledge our faith to the **Wu Qu Star Lord** of the **Purple Enclosure’s Sixth Star**.

Wu Qu scatters misfortune,
And the Mysterious radiance illuminates the sky.
Divine might stands guard complete,
And malevolent forces vanish without trace.

The **Seven Elements’** records name him in the **Purple Vermilion Camp**.
May he honor the body and extend life,
And blessings be boundless.

Divine officials guard and escort,
Ascending the clouds in step.
True **qi** descends and gathers,
And we share wisdom with the divine.

Misfortune scatters naturally,
Ascending to the Jade Palace,
And grants our harmonious wish for eternal life.

We, the humble servants, with sincere hearts,
Take refuge in the **Po Jun Star Lord** of the **Northern Dipper**,
The True Sovereign of the **Yao Guang Palace, Heavenly Barrier Star**,
A divine immortal among the Dipper stars,
And the harmonious assembly of spirits.

We, the humble servants, reverently behold the True Lord,
Whose luminous ladle points and oversees,
And orders the division of the Four Seasons;
Whose divine authority shifts and endures,
Forever presiding over the Seven Stars.

He embodies the firm and resolute **Metal Virtue/Power**,
And eternally commands the **Qi Domain**.
His troops are disciplined and precise,
And arms are orderly and stern.

Ever prepared to repel deceit,
And possessing great power to counter enemies.
With such martial virtue,
He governs the lands below.

Now, we, the humble servants, with reverent devotion,
Pay homage to the **Dao** and its teachings,
And venerate the mighty spirit,
Never slackening for an instant.
We earnestly seek refuge in the **Great Saint of the Northern Dipper, the Po Jun Star Lord**,
Born under the hour of the Horse—our natal star.

May the Heavenly Heart discern our sincerity,
And the Sacred Grace descend upon us.
May the Jade Tablets extend our years,
And the Golden Records chronicle our virtues.
May we forever be shielded from malevolent stars and ill omens,
And be spared from yearly and monthly calamities.
May our kin dwell in peace and prosperity,
And our homes be ever secure and fortunate.

With bowed heads, we take refuge and devoutly chant.
We place our faith in the **Supreme Po Jun Star Lord of the Seventh Star in the Northern Dipper, the Purple Micro Enclosure**.

The **Po Jun Star’s** auspicious influence spreads bright,
As luminous clouds disperse.
Radiant light pervades all,
And the True *qi* eternally sustains.
Our names are inscribed in the **Seven Celestial Registers**,
And recorded in the **Purple Scriptures**.
May we refine our bodies and extend our lives,
And dwell forever in joy.

Ascending as flying immortals, we dance in play,
And wander at ease in the **Mysterious Capital**.
Piercing through all veils, we reside with the gods.
The **Po Jun’s** blessings unfold naturally,
As we ascend to the **Jade Emptiness**,
And, with harmonious wishes, attain eternal life.

We, the humble servants, with sincere hearts,
Take refuge in the **Left Minister and Right Counselor Stars of the Northern Dipper**,
The True Sovereigns of the Dipper,
And the harmonious assembly of spirits.

We, the humble servants, now with devout sincerity,
Humbly address the True Sovereign of the Dipper,
The **Seven Celestial Ministerial Star Lords**—
Our natal star’s True Lords,
And the assembled holy ones.

Now, we, the **Dao** adherents, with solemn rites,
Reverently uphold the radiant forms,
And in quiet contemplation, focus our minds,
With hearts pure before the Sacred.

Following the **Dao’s** ritual protocols,
We serve the True Spirit of the **Fighting Star** at the Dipper’s Pole.
With reverence, we prepare incense and lamps,
And solemnly arrange the altar platforms.
The fragrant **orchid wax** burns bright,
As lotuses bloom in the midnight hour;
The precious flames shine in unison,
Illuminating the constellations below.

Bathing in the divine light’s dual radiance,
Our sins are dispelled;
Under the **Confession Law’s** proclamation,
Our ignorance and delusion are cleared.

Now, we pray for grace and atone for our transgressions,
As the rites conclude and the work is perfected.
We only hope the Sacred Grace extends far,
And its blessings reach all.

**First Wish:**
May Heaven endure as long as Earth,
And the land prosper with its people in peace,
With winds and rains in perfect harmony,
And all regions in tranquility.

**Second Wish:**
May we, the **Dao** adherents, with our **Linghun** and **Yuzhe**,
Forever display our accumulated virtues;
May the **Red Tablets** and **Jade Scripts** inscribe our eternal life.
May blessings align in a hundred ways,
And our homes gather a thousand auspices.
May our descendants, generation after generation,
Be utterly loyal and filial.
May disasters vanish like mist,
And blessings approach like clouds.
May we, through all four seasons, preserve our well-being,
And our homes forever enjoy protection and aid.
May even the **Nine Dark Realms** see light,
And all sentient beings ascend to the **Dao’s** shore.

With bowed heads, we take refuge and devoutly chant.
**The Scripture of the Dao is proclaimed.**

The sixth governs **The Five Grains** (五谷),
The seventh governs **Weapons of War** (兵戈).

Stars one to four are the **Pivot Stars** (魁魁, the first four stars of the Big Dipper),
And the **Raven’s Eye Stars** (璇玑, the third and fourth stars of the Big Dipper).
Stars five to seven are the **Ladle Stars** (杓杓, the last three stars of the Big Dipper),
And the **Jade Balance Star** (玉衡, the central star of the Big Dipper).

All aspects of **human life**—**fortune, longevity, and fate** (福禄寿命),
As well as **affiliated beings, slaves, and servants** (眷属奴婢),
Are governed by the stars of the Dipper (斗中主之).

According to the **Most High Laozi’s** (太上老君) words:
**The five components of human nature and life** (凡人性命五体),
Are all under the dominion of the **native star officials** (本命星官之所主掌).
The **native star generals and officials** (本命神将、本宿星官),
Constantly **bestow their auspicious shade** (垂荫佑),
**Oversee human life** (主持人命),
And **ensure the preservation of one’s Heaven-bestowed years** (使保天年).

The **True Saints of the Native Star** (本命真圣),
Each year descend **six times** (每岁六度) to the mortal realm.
The day of descent is the **critical period of one’s native star** (本命限期),
When one may **plant various incense and flowers, fresh seasonal fruits** (种种香花、时新五果),
**Model oneself after Heaven and Earth** (法天像地),
And **invite Daoist priests of the Orthodox Unity School** (请正一道士);
Either at **temples and observatories** (宫观),
Or within **domestic settings** (家庭),
To **establish ritual halls and perform expiatory rites** (修斋设醮),
And **invite and pray to the Northern Dipper’s Three Officials and Five Emperors** (启祝北斗三官五帝、九府四司),
Presenting **two petitions: one for bestowing blessings, the other for dispelling calamities** (荐福消灾二奏章恳愿),
And **fulfilling merits according to one’s capacity** (随力建功),
To **conduct the ritual affairs** (请行法事).
The **merits and virtues** (功德) are profound and weighty;
Their full extent cannot be enumerated (不可具陈).

For those whose **native star’s critical period** (本命限期) is approaching,
Yet who **do not know** (自身不知),
And **do not set up ritual halls or perform incense rites** (不设醮筵，不修香火),
Unable to **inform and pray to the Northern Dipper** (不能投告北斗),
Or **thank the True Sovereigns** (醮谢真君),
Nor to **recite and transmit the True Scripture** (转真经),
And **acknowledge the name of their native star’s True Sovereign** (认本命真君名号),
This is **reckless disregard for life and ignorance of one’s roots** (轻生迷本),
**Disdaining the human body** (不媿人身),
**Causing Heaven’s officials to strip one’s fortune** (天司夺禄),
**Reduce one’s lifespan and subtract one’s years** (减算除年),
And **result in many untimely deaths** (致多夭丧).

After **expressing gratitude to the native star** (身谢之后),
One falls into the **three abysses** (三涂, the three lower realms),
And **drifts through the six paths** (漂诸六趣, the six realms of rebirth),
A state deeply **worthy of lamentation and sorrow** (深可悲哀),
**Self-inflicted suffering** (自致斯苦).

Today, as disciple **某** (某) establishes this ritual,
We reflect upon the **day of our native star’s descent** (本命之日),
The **beginning of receiving our form from *qi*** (禀气受形之始),
And the **source of our transformation and birth** (化生之本).

The **Daoist teachings on the Great Cavern of the One** (道家大洞帝一之法),
All emphasize **cultivating and refining the spirit** (练神),
**Gathering *qi* to preserve life** (结气保命),
On the **day of one’s native star** (皆以本命之日).

The **method of generating the True and transmitting it to others** (生真诵度人之法),
Also requires **cultivating and preserving the soul-spirit** (行持魂神),
**Purifying and rectifying the ten thousand *qi*** (澄正万炁),
So that one may **long retain the roots of one’s native star** (长存则知本命之根本),
And **never pass over this day in vain** (不可虚过).

Today, all gathered in this **Daoist ritual hall** (道场),
Should know that **Heaven’s command is most weighty** (天命至重),
And **cannot be lightly prayed for** (不可轻祷).
Though we **wear the badge of the Most High Perfection** (佩至真),
And **participate in the Great Dao’s cultivation** (参修大法),
Our **bodies dwell amidst the five impurities** (处身五浊),
And our **traces are stained by the six dusts** (染迹六尘),
Yet even in **presenting our petitions** (启奏之间),
There may be **obstacles and hindrances** (不无窒碍).

First, we must **purify our spirits and calm our thoughts** (澄神静虑),
**Devoutly uphold the precepts** (仰奉戒约),
**Keep our bodies and minds clean and tranquil** (清静身心),
And **strictly follow the Dao’s instructions** (上遵法训).

The **Heavenly Venerable Ones** (天尊) say:
**When establishing ritual halls and practicing the Dao** (修斋行道),
All must **single-heartedly uphold the Ten Precepts** (一心请奉十戒),
**Receiving them clearly and never forgetting** (谛受勿忘),
**Focused and silently reciting them** (专精默念),
**Thinking naturally without movement** (动思自然),
**Avoiding all杂想** (勿怀杂想),
**Lest they disturb and confuse the form and spirit** (扰乱形神).

Those who can do so **must attentively listen** (能如是者，咸当谛听).

The **first precept** (第一戒) is:
**Do not dare to be arrogant or disrespectful toward the Holy True Ones** (不得傲忽圣真).
**Always maintain reverence and awe** (常怀恭敬),
**Facing upward to the Venerable Ones’ images** (仰对尊像),
**As the True Ones manifest their transformed bodies** (真应化身),
**When the heart arises with sincerity and devotion** (心起精虔),
**Offering and supplying them without deficiency** (供养无阙).

The **Celestial True Great Spirit** (天真大神),
**Descends from the void** (浮空而来),
**With focused and concentrated reverence** (专怀注想),
**Shall surely be granted communion** (必获降接).

The **second precept** (第二戒) is:
**Do not dare to slight or belittle the scriptures** (不得轻慢经文).
**Always hold them in deep faith and respect** (常怀信重),
For the **Three Caverns and Great Vehicle** (三洞大乘)
**Unfold the path for the foolish and lost** (开导愚迷),
**And awaken boundless Dao-intentions in all beings** (能发众生无量道意).
**In copying, reciting, or reading them** (传写读诵),
**With single-hearted contemplation** (一心玩味),
**From delusion to awakening** (从迷起悟),
**From awakening to true realization** (从悟成真),
**One shall surely attain the Dao-fruit** (必证道果).

The **third precept** (第三戒) is:
**Do not dare to defame or slander the Dao-gates** (不得诽谤法门).
**Always cherish and protect them** (常怀爱护),
**Teaching and guiding all beings** (教化众生),
**That each may take refuge** (令各归依),
**And widely gain deliverance** (广获受度),
**To uphold and flourish the True Teaching** (绍隆正教),
**To proclaim the Dao and clarify the law** (洪道明法),
**To rescue the living and the dead** (济度存亡),
**To aid the realm in transforming its people** (助国化人),
**With merit enduring through eternal kalpas** (功垂永劫).

The **fourth precept** (第四戒) is:
**Do not dare to pollute the Dao-field** (不得触秽道场).
**Always maintain purity and refinement** (常怀精洁),
With **fragrant baths and ritual cleansing** (香汤沐浴),
**Only then approaching the Mysterious Hall** (始近玄坛).
**Do not use kitchen fires to burn incense** (不得以灶火焚香),
**Nor impure wood to prepare food** (秽柴造食),
**And lamps, candles, or vessels must never be stained with grease or filth** (灯烛器皿，无染脂垢).
**Do not consume or take meat from the five kinds** (食啖荤肉，无来取祸).
**Women in the midst of their celestial period** (妇人天癸未绝者),
**Must not ascend the platform** (不得升阶).
**Those with foul or unclean bodies** (身有臭秽),
**Shall not be summoned by the assembly** (不在呼使).
**Chickens, dogs, and all manner of fowl and beasts** (鸡犬及一切禽畜),
**Must not be permitted near the Dao-field** (不得相近).

The **fifth precept** (第五戒) is:
**Do not dare to indulge or neglect the body and heart** (不得放纵身心).
**Always maintain solemn caution** (常怀畏谨),
**Not raising the voice in the hall** (不得临坛高声),
**Nor shouting, cursing, or scolding** (呼骂叱喝),
**Nor speaking or laughing lightly before the Holy Images** (及对圣像，语笑轻忽),
**Nor indulging in excessive sleep** (及贪睡眠),
**Nor drinking at improper times** (非时饮酒).
**When splendid colors pass before** (华色过前),
**Do not glance or peer sideways** (不得角眼斜视).
**Bow with utmost humility** (鞠躬小心),
**As though facing one’s sovereign or parents** (如对君父).

The **sixth precept** (第六戒) is:
**Do not dare to compete or contend for wealth and gain** (不得争竞财利).
**Always practice modesty and restraint** (常怀廉逊),
**For those who give and those who receive** (施者受者),
**Neither flatter nor resent** (勿谄勿怨).
**Let all rejoice and widely establish merit and virtue** (令各欢喜，广建功德),
**That blessings may pervade all beings in the dust-mote worlds** (禄力溥沾，尘沙世界).

The **seventh precept** (第七戒) is:
**Do not dare to diminish or neglect the Dao-affairs** (不得减省法事).
**Always be diligent and earnest** (常怀勤恪),
**In practicing the Dao and reciting scriptures** (行道诵经),
**Burning incense and making offerings of repentance** (烧香礼忏),
**That merit and virtue may be fulfilled** (使功德满足).
**The Ten Extremes and Highest Truths** (十极高真),
**All shall be attained in perception and hearing** (尽得见闻),
**Karmic debts forever dissolved** (冤债永消),
**And no encounter with roving demons** (横魔不值).
**Humans and heavens shall reap their fruits** (人天获果),
**And the hidden and manifest alike shall be blessed** (幽显蒙恩).
**Let the world’s dull and sentient beings** (使世间蠢动，一切含识),
**Forever enter the Dao-gates** (永入法门),
**And never fall into the bitter realms of suffering** (不沉苦趣).

The **eighth precept** (第八戒) is:
**Do not dare to falter or abandon the Dao-heart** (不得退转道心).
**Always hold it firm and unyielding** (常怀坚固),
**Lest from petty grievances** (勿因小嫌),
**One’s sincerity be diminished** (便减诚意).
**Take the supreme vow** (发增上愿),
**With zealous devotion and exalted reverence** (精进崇奉),
**That the Celestial True Ones may rejoice** (天真欢悦),
**And one’s name be listed among the Upper Clarity** (列名上清).
**The Nine Ancestors shall ascend in succession** (九祖超升),
**One’s self shall attain the Dao** (己身证道),
**And blessings for all beings shall be boundless** (见存眷属，福田无量).

The **ninth precept** (第九戒) is:
**Do not dare to err or misrecite the scriptural verses** (不得错误章奏).
**Always verify and correct them** (常怀审订),
For **great causes are hard to encounter** (大缘难遇),
And **great virtues are hard to complete** (大善难成).
**If one acts rashly or recklessly** (若卤莽灭裂),
**Without careful examination or comparison** (不加参对),
Then **even beneath the Three Heavens’ gates** (则三天门下),
**One may be rejected** (有所遣却),
**One’s aspirations unfulfilled** (志愿不伸),
**One’s efforts in vain** (事属徒劳),
**And blessings unattained** (福力未沾).
**Instead, one shall first incur blame** (先获咎戾),
**And deeply tremble in fear** (深可震惧).

The **tenth precept** (第十戒) is:
**Do not dare to disturb the form and spirit** (不得扰乱形神).
**Always maintain singular focus** (常怀专一),
**Lest the emotions of joy, anger, sorrow, and delight** (喜怒哀乐),
**Take root in the heart** (不萌於心).
**Strive to attain clarity and purity** (务致清明),
**And exhaust all efforts within one’s power** (尽其在己).
**Widely take the great vow** (广发大愿),
**To follow the Dao and cultivate true virtue** (奉道修真),
**That those who first attain the Dao** (愿先得道者),
**May in turn guide and liberate all others** (次第开度).

**The above Ten Precepts** (已上十戒),
**Can all uphold them faithfully?** (众等能持否?)
The **Celestial Venerable Ones** (天尊言) say:

In **practicing the Dao and observing the fasts** (修斋行道),
**The Four Heavenly Emperors and all Celestial True Ones** (四天帝王，与诸天真),
**Shall descend upon flying clouds in jade palanquins** (皆驾飞云缘軿，八景玉舆),
**With attendants of jade maidens** (侍从玉女),
**Holding flower banners** (手执花旛),
**Leading and following in procession** (前导后从).
**Lions and white cranes shall chant in melodious voices** (狮子白鹤，啸歌嗈嗈).
**Incense shall be burned and flowers scattered** (烧香散花),
**As they descend from the void** (浮空而来).

In **worship and Dao-practice** (瞻礼行道),
**Listening to the law’s resonant voice** (观听法音),
**The Ten Precepts shall first be granted** (当先授十戒),
**Then the Dao shall be practiced** (然后行道),
**With a heart at peace and silent** (夷心静默),
**And concentrated thoughts of non-duality** (专想不二).
**Midday shall not be tasted** (过中不味),
**And inner and outer shall be empty and pure** (内外清虚).
**All heavens shall oversee** (诸天监观),
**And myriad spirits shall guard in attendance** (万灵侍卫),
**Lest one grow arrogant** (不得自慢),
**And invite disaster and calamity** (以招祸灾).
**In all movements, maintain grace and propriety** (进退雍容),
**Never departing from ritual decorum** (不离仪格).
**The Celestial True Ones shall rejoice** (天真欢悦),
**And one’s name shall be listed among the Upper Clarity** (列名上清).

**Offer the precepts and dedicate their merit** (奉戒回向).
**The Complete Collection of the Dao’s Rules and Precepts** (道门科范大全集卷之五十九竟).

**The Complete Collection of the Dao’s Rules and Precepts, Volume Sixty**
*Edited by Master Guangting Du of the Broad Achievement Dao*

**Ritual of the North Dipper’s Longevity-Sustaining Dao Hall**
**Opening the Hall and Practicing the Dao**
**Ascending the Platform and Performing the Law Affairs as Prescribed**

Each reverently salutes the Master, holding thoughts in accordance with the Dao.

**Declaring the Sacred Warding Talismans**
The Five Stars arrayed in radiance, illuminating the five directions.
The Water Star repels calamity, the Woodly Virtue brings prosperity.
The Wandering Star dispels disaster, the Great White Star wards off soldiers.
The Stationary Star holds firm, benefiting the family and state.
Names inscribed on jade tablets, characters recorded in the Celestial Palace.

Riding the gusts and scattering brilliance, soaring through the boundless void.
Moving unseen in the dark, wandering and feasting across the ten directions.
Five clouds float as a canopy, summoning spirits and capturing winds.
Commanding myriad souls, guarding the Dao’s true and authentic essence,
And the Celestial Master of the Way, in harmony with the Dao’s primordial essence.

**Striking the Law Drum Twenty-Four Times**

Invoked are the Three Sovereigns of the Supreme Three Heavens—**Heavenly Primordial Origin (玄元始)**, **Heavenly Primordial Essence (始三炁)**, and **Heavenly Primordial Virtue (无上三天)**—
**The Supreme Dao Lord (太上道君)**, **The Supreme Lao Lord (太上老君)**,
And the **North Dipper Longevity-Sustaining Celestial Emperor (北斗延生尊帝)**,
Who summon forth the **Three Five Officials of the Middle (三五功曹)**—
Subordinates, left and right attendants, incense-bearers,
Postal dragon couriers, bridesmaids of the **Golden Boy (金童)**,
**Jade Girl messengers (玉女)** who convey words and scatter flowers,
**Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans (五帝直符)**, **Direct Day Incense Officials (直日香官)**,
And the **Thirty-Six (合三十六人)** in full array.

Those who emerge are clad in solemn, resplendent robes,
With headgear and sashes trailing streamers,
Opening the **Mysterious Dao Hall’s (玄坛)** earthly and territorial spirits,
And the **authentic deities of the domain (方域神真)**.

I, the humble servant, now practice the Dao in quiet night,
And earnestly present this invocation to enter the sacred intent.
With all sincerity and devotion, my pleas are already recorded and heard,
May the **Supreme Dao’s Ten-Directional True Essence (十方至真道炁)** descend,
And the **Luminous Treasure of Auspicious Light (灵宝瑞光)** flow into my being,
So that my invocation may swiftly reach the **Supreme Boundless Dao (无极大道)**,
Before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Supreme (昊天玉皇上帝)**.

**Requesting the invocation of the Law’s station.**

The assembled servants, [name] and others,
With utmost sincerity and reverence, now invoke:
The **Emperor of the Natural Void and Primordial Origin (虚无自然元始天尊)**,
The **Supreme Dao Lord (太上大道君)**,
The **Supreme Lao Lord (太上老君)**,
The **Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Supreme (昊天玉皇上帝)**,
The **Nine Celestial Sovereigns of the Upper Truth (九皇上真)**,
The **Ten-Directional True Saints Who Have Attained the Dao (十方已得道大圣)**,
All **Honorable Lords and Masters (众至真，诸君丈人)**,
The **Thirty-Six Departments of Supreme Scriptures and the Great Law of the Mysterious Middle (三十六部尊经玄中大法师)**,
The **Celestial Emperor of the Rounded Concavity (圆穹玄象)**,
The **Luminaries of the Sun and Moon, Stars and Dipper (日月星辰)**,
The **North Dipper Celestial Emperor (北斗尊帝)**,
The **Seven Primordial Stars of Auxiliary Support (七元辅弼星君)**,
The **Great Emperor of the Southern Pole (南极大帝)**,
The **Honorable Lord Marshal (丈人司马)**,
The **Six Departments of Celestial Officials (六司星君)**,
The **Native Star of My Fate (本命元辰)**,
The **Peaked Mountains and Encompassing Seas of the Perfected Realms (洞天海岳)**,
The **Three Realms’ Official Retainers (三界官属)**,
And **All Authentic Spirits (一切真灵)**.

We, the humble servants, now dedicate [name] as a disciple,
Who, in this hour, falls under the **Native Star of My Fate (本命所属)** and the **North Dipper’s [specific star] Celestial Official (北斗某星君)**.
Last night, we established a **flower-decked altar (华坛)**,
And solemnly prepared a **Luminous Treasure of Auspicious Light for Longevity and Blessings (延生注禄灵宝清醮)**.
We command the humble servants to perform this **month’s day and hour’s (月日时)** fasting and ritual,
To **offer blessings and dispel calamities (荐福消灾)**,
To **present petitions with earnest wishes (奏章恳愿)**,
To **augment longevity and fortune (增延福寿)**,
And to **rescue and guide the living and the departed (济度存亡)**.

I, the humble servant, consider that my disciple [name]’s life is bound to the mortal realm,
And their fate originates from the **Celestial Bureau (天府)**.
If we do not **perform the expiatory rites (醮)** and thank the **True Lords (真君)**,
Or **recite the scriptures and practice the Dao (转经行道)**,
Then the **Celestial Records of fate (天曹命历)** lack means to extend their calculations,
And the **Underworld’s register of sins (阴司罪簿)** lacks means to erase their names.

We, the humble servants, now earnestly and sincerely beseech,
And humbly pray for the **Heavenly Grace (天恩)** to wash away and forgive,
All the **innumerable sins from eons past (亿劫以来)**,
Even unto this very day, of the **three karmas and six senses (三业六根)**;
Or when the **soul and spirit are ensnared (魂神被系)**,
And **calamities strike like a bell (祸患来锺)**;
Or when **grave illnesses persist without cure (重病不痊)**,
And **malevolent spirits prevail in harm (邪妖克害)**;

Or when **tomb disputes summon the dead (冢讼征呼)**,
Or when the **departed return to haunt (先亡复连)**,
Or when **Heaven itself sends reproach (上天谴责)**,
Or when **ghosts below bring false accusations (下鬼诉诬)**—
All these woes we now beseech to sever,
That our bodies may be cleansed and tranquil,
Our petitions heard by the **Celestial Bureaus (天司)**,
And our fate aligned with **True Grace (真恩)**.

May we grant our disciple [Name] within his allotted lifespan
To **lengthen his years and fulfill his virtue (增绿增寿)**,
That he may **stand in merit, aid living beings (立功济物)**,
And when his **virtue is complete (功满德就)**,
Serve before the **Imperial Dao of Boundless Mystery (帝宸无极道)**.

**Repentance (忏悔)**.
**Reaffirmation of the Dao’s rank (重称法位)**.

We, the humble servants, in utmost sincerity,
Prostrate before the **Primordial Sovereign of Natural Void (虚无自然元始天尊)**,
The **Supreme Dao Lord (太上大道君)**,
The **Supreme Venerable Lord (太上老君)**,
The **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault (昊天玉皇上帝)**,
The **Nine Sovereigns of Truth (九皇上真)**,
The **Ten Directions’ Perfected Saints (十方已得道大圣)**,
The **众至真 (Crowd of Ultimate Truths)**,
The **Honored Masters (诸君丈人)**,
The **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Scripture Masters of Mysterious Great Law (三十六部尊经玄中大法师)**,
The **Celestial Vault’s Rotating Symbols—Emperors of Sun, Moon, Stars, and the Northern Dipper (圆穹玄象、日月星辰、北斗尊帝)**,
The **Seven Celestial Ministers of the Five Elements (七元辅弼星君)**,
The **Southern Pole Emperor (南极大帝)**,
The **Honored Marshal (丈人司马)**,
The **Six Celestial Bureaus’ Star Lords (六司星君)**,
The **Native Star of Fate (本命元辰)**,
The **Immortal Peaks and Sacred Isles (洞天海岳)**,
The **Three Realms’ Officials (三界官属)**,
And **all True Spirits (一切真灵)**.

We humbly hear that the **Zen Patriarchs expounded teachings (禅黎演教)**,
Opening the gate to **ward off calamities and deliver from peril (开禳灾度厄)**;
That the **Jade Bureau transmitted scriptures (玉局传经)**,
Holding the **method to erase death and prolong life (有削死延生之法)**.

Thus, we follow the **ritual canons (遵依科教)**,
Establishing the **fasting altar (开建斋坛)**,
Inviting **Heaven’s blessings (迎集天祺)**,
Cleansing the **sand of time (被除时沙)**,
Extending **luminous fortune (上延景贶)**,
And **preventing lingering misfortunes (以弭余迍)**.

From the outset of our petition,
We declare the fast’s beginning,
To **propagate the Dao’s transformation (宣行於道化)**,
To **broadly benefit all (洪济於斯人)**,
To **prolong life eternally (延永命於无穷)**,
And to **fulfill sincerity with response (达至诚於有感)**.

Moreover, receiving this edict,
How dare we not report it above?

**Proclamation of the Petition:**
As the words are clear and our devotion sincere,
We offer **incense of fragrant devotion (致苾芬)** to intercede,
And **burn sacred herbs (燎馥郁)** to ascend to Heaven.
With **sword and battle array (执锋步斗)**, the hundred demons retreat;
With **seal and scripture proclaimed (披篆宣文)**, the thousand calamities disperse.

We array the **Celestial Musicians in their pavilion (命霓裳於清馆)**,
And set the **expiatory feast in the Hall of Splendor (设醮席於华堂)**.
The **lamps blaze with radiance (明烛腾辉)**,
The **incense mills scatter sacred mist (灵磨散影)**,
The **bells and chimes mark the hymns’ rhythm (锺磬节空歌之奏)**,
And the **banners summon the Celestial Procession (旌幢引仙驭之临)**.

With **one chant, our focused intent ascends (一讽精意之升闻)**,
And the **multitudes of True Ones gather in response (感众真之来格)**.

May the **Three Pure Ones of Supreme Holiness (三清上圣)**,
The **Ten Extremes’ High Perfected (十极高真)**,
Descend in spirit to **oversee and inspect our sincere hearts (垂神省览，监察丹衷)**.
We pray that the **Overseers of Inspection (勒监察使者)**,
The **Local True Officials (里域真官)**,
The **Golden Boys who transmit petitions (奏事金童)**,
The **Jade Maidens who bear messages (传言玉女)**,
And the **Soul Jewel Officials (灵宝官属)**,
All in **unified devotion (一合同心)**,
May they **purify within and without (肃清内外)**,
And **guard this Dao-field (营护道场)**.

Thus may our spirits remain steadfast,
Our thoughts instantly answered,
Our petitions ascend unobstructed,
And the **fast’s merit be fulfilled (斋功成就)**,
So that our disciple [Name] may
**Attain rounded wisdom (智慧性圆)**,
**Awaken the Dao-heart (道心开发)**,
**Exit the path of delusion (出群迷径)**,
**Enter the Gate of the Mysterious (入希夷门)**,
**Return to the True Tradition (皈奉真宗)**,
And **realize the realm of life’s honor (达生荣界)**.

We, unworthy servants, prostrate in deepest supplication,
Twice bowing in reverence.

**Twelve Vows (十二愿)**.
**Reignite the Incense (复炉)**.

We now command the **Incense Officials and Messengers (摄香官使者)**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords (左右龙虎君)**,
And the **Attendant Spirit Officials (侍香诸灵官)**—
At the place where we formerly **practiced the Dao in quiet nights (静夜行道之所)**,
May **golden elixir and jade-green essence spontaneously arise (自然生金液丹碧)**,
And **mushrooms, herbs, and hundred spirits gather (芝英百灵)**,
As the **multitudes of True Ones assemble (众真交会)** here before this incense burner.

May we now pray that the **Ten Directions’ Celestial Youth and Maiden (十方仙童玉女)**,
Attending the **fragrant mist of orchids (接侍兰烟)**,
Transmit our **earlier sincere petitions (传臣向来所启之诚)**,
Swiftly to the **Presence of the Supreme Dao of Boundless Mystery (速达径御至真无极大道)** before the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault (昊天玉皇上帝御前)**.

**Exit the Hall in Praise (出堂颂)**.
**Depart the Gate in Chant (出户)**.

Their names are inscribed on the Jade Tablets, their characters recorded in the Imperial Archives.

They ride the gusting winds and scatter across the boundless sky,
Entering and exiting the unseen realms, feasting in the Ten Directions.
The Five Clouds float as banners, summoning spirits and capturing winds.
They command the myriad spirits, attend the Daoist Sage, and harmonize with the True Dao.

When the **Northern Dipper’s influence descends (飙驭下翔)**,

Now, as we **burn this incense (故烧香)**,

Since the **beginning of the Eternal Life Reformed Era**,

We pray to absolve this disciple from **all past karmic transgressions**,
From the **beginningless aeons** down to this very life,
Where we have **sacrificed our bodies** to receive this command,
And **entered suffering from suffering**—
Drifting through the **Six Paths of Rebirth**,
Mingling with the masses of beings,
Some rich, some poor,
Some noble, some lowly,
Some born in barbarian lands,
Some in the Central States,
Yet **none have awakened to the True Dao**,
Nor known the **Sutras and Precepts**.

We chase fleeting trends,
To gain worldly wealth,
**Losing our nature** and following **desires**,
**Greedy for gain**, betraying **virtue**.
We **envy the virtuous** and resent the good,
Not befriending those who surpass us;
We **flaunt false teachings** to commit evil,
Not fearing the **Yin Court’s records**.

Our **roots of sin** run deep,
Our **karmic bonds** entangle us.
Some offend the **Gods of Grain and Silk**,
Others face retribution from the **Yin Judges and Yang Punishments**—
Violating the **True Science’s doctrines**,
Breaking the **Three Caverns’ sacred canons**.

The **Five Emperors and Four Officials** note our **self-made sins**,
The **Three Officials and Nine Ministries** examine our **transgressions**.
We are **doomed by Heaven’s reckoning of years**,
With no **meritorious deeds** to **dispel disasters or atone for sins**.

Our **souls are bound**,
And **calamities chime** in.
Some suffer **year after year** with unhealing illnesses,
Others endure **decade upon decade** under **demonic and malevolent harm**—
Near at hand, **premature deaths** and **endless rebirths**,
Far afield, **ancestral disputes** and **summonings to the grave**.

Accused by **lower ghosts**,
Condemned by **Heaven’s decree**,
Our misfortunes **chain our ancestors**,
And **flow down to our descendants**.

Now we **enter the Gate of Redemption and Gratitude**,
And **beg release from the agony of ruin**.

For those **not yet pardoned**, grant pardon;
For those **not yet forgiven**, grant forgiveness—
Answering our plea for **blessed longevity**,
Hearing our vow to **offer vegetarian rites and Daoist expiations**.

Those who have **fallen from grace**,
All face **three calamities and nine adversities**;
Those who are **guarded and protected**,
Are under the **ten thousand saints and myriad truths**.

We **transform our shortened lifespan** into **extended years**,
And **change our fate of decline** into **auspicious fortune**.
May we attain **wealth, nobility, wisdom, and clarity**,
Standing as **the most exalted among mortals**;
And **joy and ease**, securing **boundless longevity**.

May blessings be **equally shared** among our household,
And **graces extend** to our posterity.
Above, we **acknowledge Heaven’s Worthies’ boundless compassion**,
Below, we **align with our humble servants’ sincere devotion**—
**Respectfully submitted** for their **hearing and approval**.

The **Twelve Vows** are fulfilled.

**Respectfully, we summon** the **Fragrant Officials and Messengers**,

To **manifest at this disciple’s former quiet Daoist retreat**,
Where **golden elixir and verdant jade** naturally arise,

May the **Ten Directions’ Celestial Youth and Jade Maidens**
Attend to the **sandalwood incense**,
And **carry forth** the sincerity of this disciple’s supplications,
Swiftly reaching the **Supreme Dao of the Boundless and Limitless**,
Before the **Celestial Jade Emperor of the Highest Heaven**.

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Canon, Volume 62**
*Revised by Master Guangting Du of the Broad Achieving Dao Hall*
**Ritual of the North Dipper Prolonging Life Altar**
**Establishing a Daoist Rite**

**Ritual Procedure:**
The officiant ascends the platform as prescribed.
Each disciple reverently invokes the Master’s presence in accordance with the law.
The **Sacred Protective Incantations** are proclaimed.

The **Five Stars** shine forth, illuminating the **Five Directions**:
The **Water Star** repels calamity,
The **Wood Star** brings prosperity,
The **Mars Star** dissipates misfortune,
The **Jupiter Star** wards off war,
The **Lunar Star** steadies the land—
For the **state and family**, auspicious and upright.
Their names are inscribed on **Jade Tablets**,
Their records filed in the **Celestial Archives**.
They ride the **gales**, scattering their radiance,
Soaring through the **vast heavens**,
Entering and exiting the **mystic void**,
Feasting and reveling across the **Ten Directions**.

**Five-colored clouds** float as banners,
Summoning spirits and harnessing winds.
They command **ten thousand spirits**,
Guarding the **Celestial Sage** above,
In harmony with the **Dao** and the **True**.

The **Supreme Law-Drum** is struck **twenty-four times**.

We invoke:
The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin Qi**,
The **Most High Dao Lord**,
The **Most High Laozi**—
To summon forth from this disciple’s body:
The **Three Five Officials of Merit**,
The **Left and Right Officials and Messengers**,
The **Left and Right Incense-Bearers**,
The **Dragon-Courier Clerks**,
The **Attendant Golden Boys**,
The **Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens**,
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**,
The **Direct-Sun Incense Officials**—
**Thirty-six in total**, now manifesting.

Those who emerge are **arrayed in solemn splendor**,
Their **headdresses and sashes** adorned with trailing ribbons.
They open the **Mystic Altar’s Earth and Domain Spirits**.

This disciple, now in **quiet nightly Dao-practice**,
Humbly presents this **sincere petition**,
With **heartfelt devotion already recorded and reported**.
We pray that the **Supreme Dao’s Ten Directions’ True Qi**,
The **Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Light**,
May descend and flow into this disciple’s body,
So that our supplications may swiftly reach
The **Supreme Dao of the Boundless and Limitless**,
Before the **Celestial Jade Emperor of Highest Heaven**.

**Law-Position is proclaimed.**

We, the **officiating disciples of such-and-such rank**,
Humbly and sincerely petition:
The **Primordial Origin Heavenly Worthy of the Void-Natural**,
The **Most High Dao Lord**,
The **Most High Laozi**,
The **Celestial Jade Emperor of Highest Heaven**,
The **Nine Sovereigns of Highest Truth**,
The **Ten Directions’ Already Enlightened Great Saints**,
The **Assemblage of True Ones**,
The **Thirty-Six Departments’ Worthy Masters of Mystic Law**,
The **Round Dome’s Celestial Symbols**—
The **Sun, Moon, and Stars**,
The **North Dipper Sovereign Emperor**,
The **Seven Elemental Ministers of Stars**,
The **Southern Pole Great Emperor**,
The **Sire Marshal**,
The **Six Bureau Star Lords**,
The **Native Star of Our Fate**,
The **Peak-Hall and Sea-Mountain Caverns**,
The **Three Realms’ Officials and Spirits**,
And **all True Spirits**.

We, your disciples, **prostrate in awe**, for:
**Life and fate** depend on the **Mystic Dao’s** birth,
**Form and body** are governed by our **Native Star’s** domain.
Our **Native Star** rides the **Celestial Steed**,
Bearing the **Heavenly Edict** to dissolve harm and disaster;
The **Seven Elemental Stars** observe human affairs,
To augment **auspicious virtue and longevity**.

When **sacred威仪** manifests in the world,
The **True Saints** surely hear its **resonant spirit**.

We reverently acknowledge the **North Dipper Native Star True Lord**—
The **Pivot of Creation**, the **Root of Yin-Yang**,
Who **presides over human fate** and **commands ten thousand spirits**,
With the **power to reverse death and bestow life**,
And the **method to atone for sins and dispel calamity**.

For the **Dao is the mother of ten thousand qi**,
And **Heaven is the ancestor of all spirits**.
Though **fate is governed by the Seven Stars**,
All matters **pertain to the Celestial Treasury**.
Thus, the **Five Phases** share their influence,
And the **Seven Celestial Officials** follow the same law.

When the **Native Star’s hour arrives**,
The **Assemblage of Spirits** descends in full.

The **officiating disciple of such-and-such name**,
Humbly extends **filial devotion**,
Unveiling the **essence of ritual**,
Elevating **sacred rites** upon the **Spiritual Altar**,
And receiving the **august presence** in the **quiet night**.

The **cloud-gongs resound in succession**,
Singing the **celestial hymns of the void**;
The **treasured scrolls are proclaimed anew**,
Releasing the **luxuriant, verdant qi**.

**Sacred feasts and fragrant wines** are prepared,
In **reverent accord with the Spirit’s timing**—
How dare we forget our **original source**?

We humbly pray:
May the **Eight Precious Ones** pause their journey,
The **Three Pure Ones** descend in pairs,
Their **Celestial Procession** descending from the sky,
Their **Jade Flowers** raining upon the courtyard.
**Five-colored clouds** drape the earth,
As the **Celestial Procession arrives**;
**Nine-Heaven True Qi** showers the altar,
And the **Emperor’s Presence** blazes forth.

**Ten thousand spirits** attend in guard,
**All Heavens** descend to witness—
Overseeing this **unwavering sincerity**,
Bestowing **inexhaustible longevity**,
Fulfilling the **Five Blessings**,
Accumulating the **Hundred Auspicious Fortunes**,
Erasing the **Three Ages’ sins**,
Gathering the **One Body’s divine essence**.

Thus may the **officiating disciple of such-and-such name**
Have **no deeds unrequited** yet naturally fall away,
And **meritorious acts** ever multiply—
May their **lineage bear loyal and filial descendants**,
Their **person accumulate Daoist and Immortal virtues**,
Living to receive **transcendence**,
And **water and land alike** be blessed by their grace.

We, the **officiating disciples and ritual attendants**,
Are **profoundly devout**, **earnest in prayer**, and **humble in supplication**,
Beseeching with **utter sincerity**—
We **prostrate and kowtow twice**, welcoming the **Sacred Procession**.

**The Saint is invoked.**
**First Offering.**
**Flower-Sprinkling.**

**Law-Position is proclaimed again.**

We, the **officiating disciples of such-and-such rank**,
Humbly and sincerely petition:
The **Three Pure Ones of Highest Holiness**,
The **Celestial Jade Emperor of Highest Heaven**,
The **Thrones of All Heavens**,
The **Three Treasures’ Divine Lords**.

We have heard:
The **Six Jia** are tamed within,
Following the **mechanisms of fate’s balance**;
The **Five Phases** succeed in cycles,
Marking the **tortoise-and-bird omens**.

Within the **three hundred and sixty decades**,
All **seventy-two seasonal shifts** are recorded.
A **year’s cycle** is ruled by **one star**—
Examine the **shift of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches**,
And the **hidden correspondences of geomancy** unfold.

Upon the **Emerald Tower’s Hall**,
The **consuming-disaster text** was spoken in the **Year of the Horse (丙午)**;
Within the **Jade Bureau’s Seat**,
The **prolonging-life secret** was revealed in the **Year of the Sheep (乙未)**.

The **Years of the Tiger (丁丑), Rabbit (丁卯), and Snake (丁巳)**—
The **Jade Maiden** presides;
The **Years of the Rat (甲子), Tiger (甲寅), and Monkey (甲申)**—
The **Three Sovereigns** govern.

**Lord Guan** met the **Most High** at **noon on a Gengwu day**,
**Ge Xuan** received the **Celestial True One** at **night on a Jingyin day**.

Thus it is known:
When the **Native Star’s hour arrives**,
The **hundred spirits** gather.

The **officiating disciple of such-and-such name**,
With **incense and flowers as offerings**,
First **aligns the body in sincerity**.
Gazing upon the **North Dipper’s Celestial Pole**,
They **direct the heart in petition**;
Standing at the **ritual’s incense-table**,
They **focus the mind on the august spirits**.

The **First Offering’s rites** are completed,
And the **Heavens’ and All-Heavens’ Saints** descend in rank.

To **honor the gods**, we value **virtue**, not **flavor**—
May we drink the **fragrance of Illuminated Virtue**;
To **sacrifice to Heaven**, we seek **substance**, not **form**—
Hoping to **transmit sincere and earnest prayers**.

---

With heartfelt words and earnest petition,
We open this **Red Character’s** scroll,
Summoning your **Purple Clarity’s** shade.

We beg for the **gale’s swift return**,
To behold our **solemn oaths**—
The disciple’s **green petitions** now unfold.

**Proclaimed words** are declared:
With **devout sincerity** clearly seen,
We seek **Original Command from Heaven**,
And solemnly perform the **science of rites**.

To preserve the **nature of the Sage-born**,
We eternally honor the **august spirits**.

May the **Supreme Saint** descend with grace,
The **Virtuous Sovereign** turn with favor.
Within arm’s reach, the **Celestial Capital’s** chariot arrives,
The **True Companions** gather in solemnity;
With **composed bearing**, the **Celestial Truth** descends,
Their **serene faces** radiant and dignified.

We station the **Celestial Ritual’s** array,
And convey our **sincere devotion** to the **Imperial Hearing**.

May the **divine response** align with our prayers,
And the **subtle omens** manifest—
Granting **auspicious responses** in secret.

Daring to seize this **Original Command’s** moment,
We pray for **Heaven’s universal blessings**.

We, the disciples and ritual officers,
With boundless joy and reverent exultation,
Prostrate ourselves in awe,
And humbly present the **Second Offering**.

**Scatter flowers.**

We, the humble officials of such-and-such rank,
With united sincerity, petition:
The **Northern Dipper’s Imperial Seat**,
The **Seven Stars of the Dipper’s Core**,
The **Five Blessings and Ten Gods**,
The **Twenty-Eight Constellations**,
The **Encircled Heavens’ Celestial Luminaries**,
All **august spirits**.

We have heard:
**Fate is decreed by Heaven**—
Who does not rely on the **Great Creator’s** work?
The **Northern Dipper** truly governs all beings.

From the **Great Polarity’s** emergence,
The **Three Lights** shone in succession—
The **Dipper’s Handle** above,
Called the **Imperial Chariot**, moving at the center.

It alone holds the **Symbolic Measure’s** exalted rank,
Turning the **Heaven and Earth** with precision;
Its **subtle transformations** work in mystery,
Bestowing **life’s essence** upon all beings.

The **radiant light of a single star**,
Governs the **fates of ten thousand folk**.

The ritual officer of such-and-such name
Remembers his **Original Nature’s** source,
Reflecting on the **beginning of his birth**—
His **Command** was opened first,
And his **form** was nurtured today.

He fears the **ancestors’ past delusion**,
And dreads the **Heavenly Lord’s** punishment for neglect.

He solemnly sets the **Daoist Ritual’s** feast,
And renews the **offerings’ rites**.

Incense curls in **auspicious mist**,
Divine lamps gleam with **sacred light**.
The **Law’s sounds** resound,
The **Celestial Ritual’s** steps are orderly.

At the **Heavenly-Human convergence**,
The time of **blessings and fortunes descending**,
The **spiritual contract** is fulfilled—
**Supreme sincerity** moves the divine.

May our **lifespan extend**,
Our **domain of longevity** boundless;
May we be **granted divine felicity**,
And our **foundation of blessings** forever firm.

The **Seven Thousand Gods of the Northern Dipper** guard and protect,
The **Three Thousand Officials of the Southern Mound** follow in attendance,
Sweeping away **disasters and obstructions**,
Dispelling **demons and malevolent spirits**.

The **Five Visceral Gods** ever preserve,
The **Three-Life Men** endure forever.

For women, it is said:
**Preserving the form** is supreme—
None may depart from the body.

The **Imperial Seat’s** radiance flows,
**Heavenly Essence** scatters its hues—
Each guards their **constellation’s station**,
Together storing **auspicious fields**.

We, the disciples and ritual officers,
With utmost **devotion and trembling reverence**,
Prostrate ourselves in awe,
And humbly present the **Final Offering**.

**Scatter flowers.**

We, the humble officials of such-and-such rank,
With renewed sincerity, petition:
The **Five Sacred Peaks and Ten Mountains**,
The **Three Rivers and Four Seas**,
