The **Ten Isles and Three Lands**,
The **Four Great Waters and Nine Rivers**,
The **Blessed Earths and Tranquil Abodes**,
The **Cavern Heavens and Sacred Transformations**,
The **Three Bureaus’ Official Administrations**,
All **mighty and spiritual beings**.

We have heard:
**East, the Morning Star shines; West, the Long Regard**,
**South, the Basket Weave; North, the Dipper stands**.
Gazing upward at the **Celestial Patterns**,
Their **resplendent and dazzling** marks appear—
These **Seven Stars**, each one
**Inspiring life’s fundamental source**.

They **emanate supreme purity** beyond form,
And **direct the Great Creator’s** work in Heaven.

Recognizing the **star of our Original Command**,
We set the **Spiritual Treasure’s** rites to the **True**.

This is to **know one’s roots**,
And thus **not treat life lightly**.

The disciple of such-and-such name,
At the **auspicious hour’s selection**,
Now **formally presents** the **clear offerings**—
Yet fears that though his **intent is self-exhorted**,
His **conduct may not align with the Dao**.

He **clears his mind of distractions**,
Turning toward virtue and away from guilt;
He **consults the Celestial Maps’** paths,
Seeking the **Way** and pursuing **spiritual efficacy**.

He **deepens his pure intentions**,
Hoping for the **spirits’ repeated blessings**.

Now the **ritual is strictly observed without cessation**,
And the **three offerings** are fully completed;
The **mysterious responses** have already communicated—
May we **preserve a hundred years of eternal life**.

We humbly hope the **Three Pure Ones** bestow their gifts,
And the **Ten Directions’ High Worthies** shower their light.

May the **roots of sin be extinguished**,
So we may **reverently receive the sacred luminaries**;
May the **Great Auspicious Assembly** be restored,
And **never fade from human life**.

Let the **three calamities and four killings** be dispelled,
The **five afflictions and six harms** removed—
Without the **Seven Injuries**, yet under the **Seven Celestial Protectors’** guard,
Without the **Eight Difficulties**, yet under the **Eight Heavenly Observers’** watch—
May husbands and wives **preserve their lifelong union**,
May men and women **know the joy of family**,
May women **avoid childbirth’s misfortune**,
May ghosts **no longer entangle** the living,
May all **diseases be cured**,
May **epidemics spare us**,
May **evil spirits be subdued**,
May **wolves and tigers hide**,
May **official disasters and lawsuits** be forever erased,
May the **Earthly Nets and Heavenly Snares** dissolve,
May our **associations lack curses and slander**,
May our **travels be free from bandits and robbers**—
Together in our homes,
All may **attain peace and well-being**.

We, the disciples and ritual officers,
With **uttermost piety and solemn vigilance**,
Prostrate ourselves in awe to report.

**Proclaim the Merit and Virtue Sutra.**

We, the humble officials of such-and-such rank,
With **renewed sincerity**, petition:
The **Three Pure Ones and Supreme Saints**,
The **Ten Extremes’ High Worthies**,
The **Ocean-Mountains’ Spirits**,
The **Heavenly and Earthly Celestials**,
The **Three Realms’ Officials**,
All **mighty and spiritual beings**.

We humbly establish the **Clear Science**,
And **solemnly proclaim the fragrant offerings**.

**Ascending to the Celestial Pole**,
We **pay homage to the Vermilion Palace’s** august might;
**Inviting the True Spirits**,
Their **jade light** shines in the **void**.

We **three times draw the pure nectar**,
And **once present our supplicating words**—
**Overseeing from on high**,
Our prayers **lack no response**.

We reflect:
The disciple of such-and-such name
Has no other **affections**—
Only **virtue** he cultivates,
Hearing and **acting without delay**,
And **ritual fasting** he holds supreme.

When the **auspicious hour** arrives,
And the **Original Command** draws near,
The **evening’s spiritual platform** opens,
And the **six degrees of clouds** descend in pairs.

**Imperial Clarity** now illuminates,
And **karmic obstructions** vanish—
**Separately extending Heaven’s Palace’s** fate,
And **never severing humanity’s seed**.

May we **flow with True Qi**,
And be **nourished by Great Harmony**,
**Shine with Mysterious Light**,
And be **bathed in Divine Dew**—
So that the disciple of such-and-such name
May **gradually ascend to wondrous fruit**,
And **reestablish the Mysterious Merit**,
**Attaining the Dao’s emptiness**,
And **possessing perfect penetration in sagely wisdom**,
**Soaring in the Purple Clouds’ realm**,
**Ascending through the Golden Gate’s door**,
**Harmonizing with the Ten Thousand Saints**,
**Transcending the Three Realms** in freedom,
**Forever free from the Wheel of Rebirth**,
With **lifespan boundless**—
Silently speaking of the **Dao’s path now opened**,
All beginning **from this very day**.

Next, I humbly pray that the seven ancestral spirits of my disciple’s family may ascend,
And the nine generations of ancestral rites be honored in the realm of the departed.
May they bathe in the **Hall of Flowing Fire**,
And walk the path of **Zhu Ling’s Palace**.

Riding the **Qi of the Cavernous Yang**,
They receive the **Record of the Three Pure Ones**;
Free from the **multitude of ghosts**,
They depart the **bends of the spirit springs**.

Suffering is forever severed,
And toil is no longer heard—
Their blessings extend to future generations,
And their lineage’s fortune is prolonged.

Next, for parents, brothers, sisters,
Husbands, wives, sons, and daughters—
All sins and blemishes are cleansed,
And all receive blessings and protection.

The **Purple Register** records their virtues,
Increasing their fortune and rank before the **Jade Emperor’s ledger**;
The **Yellow Ledger** marks their deeds,
Inscribing their names in the **Great Imperial Hall above**.

All within the household receive their grace,
And a hundred generations share in their blessings.

May the **Nine Sovereigns’ calamities** be removed—
Though punishments strike, they cause no harm;
May the **Two Celestial Cycles’ misfortunes** be averted,
And their years instead grow longer through cosmic void.

The young and old live in peace,
And the clan remains harmonious.

Next, I pray for the **sword to rest and punishments to cease**,
And the **Dao to spread pure and refined**.
May great celebrations fill the land,
Without the calamity of **overturned caps**;
May divine blessings descend upon the people,
And songs of praise return to the heavens.

Let the **mixed teachings of chariot and scripture** be unified,
And the heavens and earth be steadied in peace.
The **Nine Suns** are tempered to six,
Controlling the **Eon’s cycle** without worry;
The **Four Celestial Assistants** govern a thousand officials,
Honoring loyalty and repaying the state.

Let boundless grace extend to all things,
And duties be bestowed upon all ministers.
All who dwell beneath the **covering canopy**,
Share in the harmonizing transformation of like-minded hearts.

Now, the **heavenly fragrance lingers in the air**,
And the **celestial guards are returning**—
The **Immortal Children** bear the scepter in advance,
And the **Cloud Chariot** ascends with the wind’s swiftness.

The disciples of the **True Class** have retired,
And the **fasting rites are complete**—
We have already received the **Heaven’s favor**,
And forever share in the **harmonized sacred period**.

Your disciple and the disciples who conducted the **rites of expiation**,
With deepest longing and gratitude,
Humbly present this petition.

**Twelve Wishes fulfilled.**
**The furnace is restored.**

With reverence, I command the **Fragrance Officials and Envoys**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords**,
And the **Attendant Spirit Officials**—
That in the place where I have formerly practiced in quiet nights,
**Golden Elixir and Azure Jade** will naturally arise,
Along with **Immortal Mushrooms and Hundred Spirits**,
And the **multitude of True Ones** will gather here before the incense furnace.

May I pray that the **Ten-Directional Immortal Children and Jade Maidens**
Attend the **Lantern Smoke**,
And swiftly convey my sincere petition
To the **Most High, Supreme, and Limitless Dao of the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign** before the **Heavenly Court**.

**Recite the Praise at the Hall’s Exit.**
**Depart the Door.**

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Standards, Volume 62 concluded.**
**The Complete Daoist Ritual Standards, Volume 63**
*For the Three Caverns Scripture and Ritual Disciples, Composed by Zhong Li*
**The Grand Ritual of True Martial’s Responsive Virtue (真武灵应大醮仪)**
**The Auspicious Sovereign Ritual (佑圣醮仪)**, in three editions:
1. *Qianyao Chao’s* hidden and radiant version,
2. *Master Shi’s* great edition,
3. A recently compiled edition.

All are single-day rituals, lacking the full observances of night and day. Now, these three editions are merged, incorporating the *Du Tianxiang’s* Northern Emperor’s Ritual from *Guangting*, with the two *San Shang Xiang* (Three Upper Incense) sessions interwoven, expanded into *Qǐsàn* (ritual invocation and dismissal), and structured into three periods of practice, forming five volumes for ritual use.

**Ascending the Platform’s Ritual Procedures** follow the prescribed order.

**Courtly Attendance (Tíngcān):**
With humility, we, the positioned disciples, burn the **Dao-Qi (Way-Qi) incense**, **Virtue incense**, and **Non-Action-Natural incense**, and with sincere devotion, bow twice to petition:
The **Law-Lord, North Pole Pacifying Heaven True Martial Responsive Auspicious True Lord (北极镇天真武灵应佑圣真君)**,
The **Dark Heaven Primordial Holy Benevolent and Mighty Sovereign Emperor (玄天元圣仁威上帝)**,
The **Holy Father, Pure Joy King (圣父净乐国王)**,
The **Holy Mother, Virtuous Victory Empress (圣母善胜皇后)**,
The **North Pole Tianpeng Marshal of the Celestial Hosts, Azure Heaven Sovereign Emperor (北极天蓬都元帅苍天上帝)**,
The **North Pole Tianyou Vice-Marshal, Vermilion Heaven Sovereign Emperor (北极天猷副元帅丹天上帝)**,
The **North Pole Yìshèng Preserving Virtue True Lord, Azure Heaven Sovereign Emperor (北极翊圣保德真君昊天上帝)**,
The **North Pole Officials Ranked Beneath the Celestial Gate (北极阙下列班真宰)**,
The **Three Great Marshals of Thunder and Lightning—Deng, Xin, and Zhang (雷霆邓、辛、张三大元帅)**,
The **Two Marshals of the Thunder Gate—Gou and Bi (雷门苟、毕二元帅)**,
The **Two Host Deities of Xuwei (虚危二宿神君)**,
The **Black Tiger Great God Liu Tianjun (黑虎大神刘天君)**,
The **Fufu Deities and the Four Heavenly Lords—Cui, Lu, Deng, and Dou (阜纛神君、崔、庐、邓、窦四天君)**,
The **Four Great Marshals—Ma, Zhao, Guan, and Wen (马、赵、关、温四大元帅)**,
The **City Deities and Temple Spirits (城隍祀典，庙社神祇)**,
The **Three Realms’ Functionaries (三界功曹)**,
The **Oath-Keeping True Officials (证盟真宰)**—
All are summoned by the **True Incense**, universally honored with offerings.

We, the disciples, humbly reflect:
The **Round Canopy’s pure brilliance**—
A refined qi, untainted by smoke;
The **Northern Spirit’s manifest response**—
A harmonious time for celestial descent.

We purify our hearts, uphold the fast’s precepts,
And with reverence, perform the **Courtly Attendance rites**,
Aspiring to invite the **Imperial Dao’s sojourn**,
Exhausting our sincerity, renewing our earnest petitions.
With utmost devotion, we prostrate and take refuge.

**Issue the Edict.**
**Recite the Spell and Sprinkle Purification.**

The **Dao of Heaven** is lofty and distant,
Without sound or scent that can be heard;
The **Divine Response** is profound and unfathomable,
Yet only the **Yin and Yang** remain unmeasured.

Where sincerity is directed, the response is boundless.
Thus, the **Spiritual Officials** are capable of conveying petitions.
We dare to offer the **fragrance of a single incense burner**,
And humbly invite the **Four Celestial Rectifiers’** sacred might.

We hope to be granted **spiritual communion**,
And that **inspection and approval** may soon descend.
Now with this incense, we solemnly summon
The **Year-Rectifier Functionaries**,
The **Month-Rectifier Functionaries**,
The **Day-Rectifier Functionaries**,
And the **Hour-Rectifier Functionaries**,
Only wishing for their descent to receive our humble entreaties.

We, the disciples, reverently acknowledge:
The **Four Celestial Rectifiers** are the most **exalted and supreme** among all directions;
They traverse **ten thousand li** without pause,
Nor do they linger for an instant.

By **jade gates and golden courts**, their commands are transmitted,
And they oversee the **knocking at the threshold**;
With **cloud chariots and wind steeds**, they pass through the capital,
As dense as **journeying through the celestial realms**.

We rely on the **Holy Power’s** swift conveyance,
To reach the **Divine Hearing’s** fourfold expanse.
If our prayers are **precise and clear**,
They shall never face obstruction or delay.

Now, this **Dao Ritual Official** of humble virtue,
From birth endowed with **auspicious connections**,
Has encountered the **True Dao**,
And with **morning and evening incense**, dares not forget the **True Sage’s** boundless grace;
With **seasonal offerings and reverent devotion**, seeks to align with the **Spiritual Officials’** swift descent.

We humbly pray that the **Divine Presence** may descend to inspect,
And that all who dwell in this age may witness
**Auspicious mists ascending to the heavens**,
**Blessed winds and rains upon the earth**,
**Jade scripts unfolding on emerald tablets**,
**Sacred sincerity emanating from crimson hearts**,
To rely on the **preceding entreaties**,
And achieve **harmonious ascent**,
That our prayers and petitions may be **granted and heard**.

**Issue the Edict.**
**The previous edict has been properly sealed and submitted.**
Now, we **unfold the rituals** in the **mortal realm**,
And **dispatch our sincerity** to the **mystic domain**,
Though our deepest contemplations may not reach above,
We **invite the descent** on this **auspicious day**,
Daring to disturb the **Highest Spirit’s** hearing.

We humbly pray that the **Rectifiers** may **convey our words**,
That our **endeavors may succeed**,
Our **petitions be fulfilled**,
Our **exorcisms repel evil**,
Our **actions bear fruit**,
And that this **modest sincerity** may not be in vain.

**Recite the Precepts.**

We reverently acknowledge:
The **True Martial Spirit of the North**—**Lord of Sacred Response**—
Is the **manifest form of the Highest Venerable Lord**,
Associated with the **Sixth Star of the Northern Dipper**, **Mars**,
Who governs **Military Conquest**.

In the North, the **constellations of Xu (虚)** and **Wei (危)** are likened to **serpents**,
And the **stars of Yingshi (营室)** and **Dongbi (东壁)** to **tortoises**.
The **tortoise** bears a shell to **defend itself**,
The **serpent** forms an array with **head and tail both present**,
Thus embodying the **symbol of martial prowess**.
When the **tortoise and serpent unite**, they become the **True Martial Spirit**,
With **Divine Sovereignty**—this is the **True Lord in Heaven**.

He wears the **Azure Jade Crown**,
And robes of **dark hues**,
Together with **Tiānpéng (天蓬)**, **Tiānyòu (天猷)**, and **Yìshèng (翊圣)**,
Known as the **Four Celestial Saints of the Northern Pole**.

Descending to the **human realm**,
He **loosens his hair and goes barefoot**,
Wields a **sword to sever heresy**,
And commands the **Six Ding (六丁)** and **Twelve Jade Maidens (玉女)**,
The **Eight Killing Generals (八杀将军)**,
The **Six Celestial Guardians (六甲直符)**,
The **Twelve Divine Generals (十二神将)**,
Each with **twelve attendants**,
And **clerks bearing talismans**, numbering **one hundred and twenty**,
With **divine soldiers**, **five hundred million strong**,
And the **deities of thunder, lightning, wind, and rain**,
Who always accompany him.

The **True Lord** often descends in **Sichuan**,
As **Sichuan** has the **County of Mysterious Tortoise** (玄武县).
Now, to avoid the **Sacred Ancestor’s** name,
It is renamed **Zhōngwāng (中汪)**.
From the **Han** to the **Sui**, it was under **Chéngdū (成都)**.
In the **third year of Emperor Wǔdé’s reign (武德三年)** of the **Tang**,
It was divided and placed under **Zǐzhōu (梓州)**.
The county boasts the **most sacred traces of the True Lord**,
Leaning against **high mountains**.
The **mountains above and below** all have **temples**,
Facing the **great river**.
The **river’s stones** naturally form the **shape of tortoises and serpents**.

In recent times, there were **no Daoists maintaining the temples**,
So it became the **Golden Immortal Daoist Hall (金仙道场)**,
And the **sacred might** still frequently **manifests**,
Even descending with **divine messages** to **Chéngdū**.
At the **beginning of the Song dynasty’s rise**,
There was a **Li surnamed Jiāohuī (燂灰李)** in **Chéngdū**,
Who established a **single incense burner** to worship the **True Lord’s** sacred fire.
The **True Lord descended** to his household,
And bestowed upon him **five measures of sacred scriptures**,
Which were **passed down through generations**.

There was also **Dù Míng (杜明)**,
Who was **diligent in his reverence**,
And the **True Lord often descended** to speak with **Míng**.

During the **Xiánpíng era (咸平中)**,
**Wáng Jūn rebelled**,
And the **bandit leader sent soldiers** to summon **Míng**.
**Míng went** to see the **rebel commander**,
Yet **unbeknownst to him**, his mouth **uttered the True Lord’s sacred words**.
The **rebel commander ordered him sent back home**.
After some time, **Míng’s family realized he was still at home**,
And the whole household was **overjoyed**.
After the **rebels were pacified**,
**Míng** **exhausted all his wealth** in offerings to the **Three Treasures of Tiānqìngguān (天庆观)**,
Selected a **site to build the foundations**,
Constructed **halls and pavilions**,
And **sculpted the True Lord’s image**,
As well as **portraying the Spiritual Officials and their attendants**,
To **repay the debt** for escaping the **rebel’s calamity**.

On the **Festival of the Upper Element (上元节)**,
When the **halls and pavilions were newly adorned**,
**Crowds of visitors gathered**.
**Dù Míng** had passed away,
And his **brother struck the ritual gong**,
**Arranging the incense and lamps** with utmost reverence.
By night, **scholars and commoners filled the hall**.
His **brother**, at the **silk screen window**,
**Watched the calamitous women**...

The True Lord, in his wrath, caused [his own] eyes to nearly burst.

In the year **Xiángfú (祥符)** the fifth,
He again descended with words:
*"If Tiānpénggē (天蓬哥) arrives, he will be the guest,
And I shall be the host to welcome him."*
Numerous times, the **Highest True Ones (上真)** descended thereafter.

One day, while **Míng** was paying homage with incense and fire,
The True Lord descended with words, commanding him to summon **Daozhèng Míng**,
the **Master Jìng of Chán (寒道冲)**, saying:
*"I have descended here for several years.
Later, I shall descend in the **Eastern Capital (东都)** to safeguard the **imperial lineage (帝祚)**,
And you must not abandon your earlier resolve."*
From that time onward, he no longer heard the True Lord’s voice,
Until ten years later, when the **tortoise and serpent (龟蛇)** appeared at the **Holy Water Temple (圣水观)** in the capital,
As if confirming the prophecy.

In the late **Chóngníng (崇宁)** period,
**Jìtáng (纪堂)** of **Chéngdū (成都)** excelled in both **martial prowess (力学)** and **literary skill (能文)**.
The **Língshòu Temple (圣寿寺)**’s **Liú family (刘氏)** ordered their descendants to follow him in study.
The True Lord descended with words:
*"Jìtáng is unfilial to his stepmother,
And the **Celestial Register (天曹)** no longer accepts his name.
Later, he will achieve nothing—
He will die in exile at the **medicine stall (药水铺)**."*

At the beginning of **Jìngkāng (靖康)**,
When the capital fell,
The True Lord again descended in **Chéngdū**.

**Yáng Guǎng (扬广)**, a **Cháoqǐng Láng (朝请郎)**,
Due to **malicious influence (祟害)** harming his daughter,
Came to the **Yùjú Observatory (玉局观)**,
And established a **Four Saints Ritual (四圣醮)**.
The True Lord descended upon the seat,
And the entire observatory was struck with awe—
The True Lord dispelled the **malicious influence** for him.

Then, when he inquired about the **ancestral deeds (祖先以来事)** of the **ritual officers (斋官)** and others,
The True Lord **witnessed them with his own eyes (目击)**.

He also requested the **Jiāngshān Spirit King (江读神王)**,
Who arrived in response at once.

The **Earthly Officials (地司主者)** tremble in fear below the steps and obey your command.

In the **Jiànníng (建炎)** era,
At the **Cháo Dū (广都)** nest observatory,
He dreamed that the **True Lord (真君)** sent someone to summon him,
His heart filled with great dread.

Upon arrival, the **True Lord descended the steps (降阶)** to greet him,
With a **divine countenance (圣颜)** warm and gentle,
And a **refined voice (玉音)** clear and bright,
Treating him as an honored guest.

Awakening, he thus devoted himself to **establishing the ritual (修醮仪)**,
And his entire household **observed the precepts (奉戒)** with ever greater sincerity and reverence.

The reason for these offerings is that one must not **treat them lightly (轻媟)** from the very beginning of the **ritual foundation (建斋)**.
You should know these precepts—there are seven in total.
All must listen carefully.

The **First Precept (第一戒)** is this:
One must not **place faith in false Dao (邪道)**,
Or **invoke demonic rites (祷祭魔法)** and **beg for extra blessings (谄求余福)**,
Letting oneself fall into **confusion and delusion (昏迷沉乱)**.
One must always **aspire to purity of body and mind (清净身心)**,
And **take refuge in the Great Dao (归依大道)**.

The **Second Precept (第二戒)** is this:
One must not **be disloyal or unfilial (不忠不孝)**,
Or **act unjustly or without compassion (不义不仁)**.
One must always **serve one’s superiors with reverence and diligence (恭勤事上)**,
And **treat others with kindness (慈爱接物)**,
Never forgetting the **Dao’s teachings (道训)**.

The **Third Precept (第三戒)** is this:
One must always **remember one’s ancestors and parents (累世父母)**,
And the **departed relatives (过去亲萝)**,
Who were **wrongfully killed by the Six Heavenly Demons (六天魔鬼)**,
Or **died before their time (未尽天年)**,
Or **were slain by violence (横被伤杀)**.
One must **return to orthodox teaching (归投正教)**,
And **rescue their tormented spirits (拔济幽魂)**,
So that **both the living and the dead (幽明存亡)**,
And **all beings (均)**,
May **share in the blessings (沾利泽)**.

The **Fourth Precept (第四戒)** is this:
On days when the **True Lord descends (真君降日)**,
One must not **include taboo characters (犯讳字)** within **memorial petitions (章奏)**.
Nor must one **offer early prayers for begging (烧奏早钱)**,
Or **burn incense with oil lamps and paper (油灯油纸)**,
For **all offerings must be made with proper reverence (焚热所奏)**.

The **Fifth Precept (第五戒)** is this:
On days when the **True Lord descends (真君降日)**,
One must not **consume pungent meats or flesh (食荤辛杂肉)**,
Nor **black carp (黑鲤鱼)**, **cloud-platform greens (云台菜)**, **barbarian’s wild horse (胡婪马)**, **toothed amaranth (齿苋)**, **garlic (大蒜)**, or **seven-star fish (七星鱼)**.
Nor must one **allow their breath and qi to come near these things (气息相近)**.

The **Sixth Precept (第六戒)** is this:
Women who have not yet reached **fifty years of age (五旬)**,
Must not **be allowed near the divine seat (近神座)**.
Nor must **servants or attendants (童仆)** whose **bodies emit foul qi (气息臭秽)**,
Be permitted to **approach the altar (诣前)**.
One must always **purify oneself (务蠲洁)**,
To **honor the True Lord above (以奉上真)**.

The **Seventh Precept (第七戒)** is this:
When **offering petitions to the True Lord’s spirit (奏对真灵)**,
One must not **face north while spitting or weeping (北向涕唾)**,
Nor **urinate or defile oneself uncleanly (旋溺不洁)**.

The above **seven precepts (七戒)**—can you uphold them?
In unison: *"We can uphold them!"*

The **True Lord (真君)** once **received the Heavenly Sovereign’s Dao (奉天尊教)** to save all.
During the years of **Jia (甲子)** and **Gēngshēn (庚申)**,
And on the **seventh, twenty-first, and twenty-seventh days of each month (每月三七日)**,
He **descends into the mortal realm (下降人间)**,
Accepting **human ritual offerings (醮祭)**,
And **observing their virtues and vices (察人之善恶)**,
As well as **their cultivation and transgressions (修学功过)**,
Determining the **length of their lives (年命长短)**.

All who follow the **ritual procedures (依科行道)**,
Must **obey these seven precepts (奉此七戒)**,
To **discipline body and mind (检饬身心)**,
And **avoid inviting retribution (无招罪戾)**.
Thus may the **True Lord’s spirit descend graciously (真灵降格)**,
And **accept our sincere devotion (歆纳勤诚)**,
While **demonic forces are subdued (魔精消伏)**,
And **all inauspiciousness is extinguished (断灭不祥)**.
May the **departed be liberated (过去超生)****,
And the **living attain blessings (见存获庆)**,
So that **all beings may dwell in peace (生人安泰)**,
And the **land remain tranquil (国土清平)**.

All must **clearly understand (明知)** these precepts,
And **never forget them (无忘于心)**,
Obeying them **as prescribed (奉戒如法)**.

Now **recite the ritual ranks (称法位)**.

The **officiating ministers (具位臣某等)**,
With utmost sincerity and reverence,
Prostrate ourselves and **invoke the Supreme Dao of the Boundless (太上无极大道)**,
And the **Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures (三十六部尊经)**,
The **Great Master of the Mystic Center (玄中大法师)**,
The **Spiritual Treasure Chief Preceptor (灵宝主教)**,
The **Five Masters, True Lords (五师真君)**,
The **Three Heavenly Venerable Teachers (三天圣师)**,
The **Supreme Sage of Great Mystery (泰玄上相真君)**,
And the **Celestial Attendants of the Jade Hall (玉堂演教侍宸仙众)**,
As well as **all True Lords of the Three Realms and Ten Directions (三界十方一切真宰)**,
All **rely on the true incense (悉仗真香)**,
And **offer universal reverence and support (普同供养)**.

The **intent is declared (宣意)** and the **matter is sincere (事悃)**—already declared.
The **divine ears are clear and listen (圣聪昭听)**.

We further **reflect on our own inadequacies (谬以凡庸)**,
And **dare to oversee the Dao’s teachings (辄司科教)**,
Fearful that our **bodies may not be pure enough (检身之弗类)**,
And **dread incurring the True Lord’s wrath (获戾于上真)**.
Thus we **request the full assembly (会请备员)**,
And **do not dare to decline our duties (不容逊职)**,
To **purge accumulated impurities (蠲洗埃氛之累)**,
And **strictly promulgate the Dao’s ordinances (宣行教典之严)**.

We **humbly pray (伏望)** that the **Celestial Master of the Jade Capital (玉京山应供玄中大法师)**,
The **Three Teachers of the Spiritual Treasure (灵宝三师)**,
And the **Supervising Master of the Ritual (监斋大法师)**,
May **descend to the altar (降临坛所)**,
And **graciously bestow their blessings (俯垂佑助)**,
Flowing **true qi (真炁)** into our **bodies (臣等身中)**,
So that we may **successfully complete the ritual (斋事克成)**,
And **all True Lords may come in response (众真来格)**.

We are **overwhelmed by the depth of our supplication (不胜延伫恳祷之至)**,
And **respectfully report this (谨启以闻)**.

**Meritorious Dedication (回向)**.

「The Complete Daoist Rituals and Regulations, Volume Sixty-Three concluded. Volume Sixty-Four: *The Ritual of the True Martial Spirit’s [Zhenwu] Auspicious Response*, edited by Master Du Guangting of the *Broad Nurturance* [Guangcheng] School.

**Ritual Procedure for Ascending the Altar and Invoking the Dao**

The ritual officials ascend the altar in proper order.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.
The sacred incantations of the *Spiritual Guards* [Weiling] are proclaimed.

**Eastern Quarter:**
The Nine *Qi* [九炁] of Azure Heaven, the Illustrious Stars and Great Deity [明星大神].
Shining forth upon the Eastern Lands, illuminating the Nine Gates [九门].
Turning the torch of Yang Light, sweeping away filth and dispersing impure *qi* [氛].
Awakening the child of clarity, named *Xuanqing* [玄卿].
Guarding our hall, facing the Celestial Sovereign [帝君].
Subduing the Eastern demons, capturing the wicked host.
Offering the true Dao, with crimson script and jade texts.
The Nine-Heaven Talismans of Destiny [九天符命], seizing the Dragon Couriers [摄龙驿传].
Peace throughout the heavens, I attain the flying immortals—harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence [和与道合真].

**Southern Quarter:**
The Three *Qi* [三炁] of Vermilion Heaven, radiant brilliance and flowing light [焕景流光].
The luminous stars revolve like torches, piercingly illuminating the Great Sun [荧星转烛].
Above, the *Chijing* [赤精] aligns with the *Xuhuang* [虚皇].
Awakening the child of spirit, named *Huafang* [华房].
Commanding the Fire Soldiers [火兵], guarding the Jade Hall [玉堂].
Severing the wicked, binding the demons, decapitating the demon kings [斩邪束妖].
The Northern Sovereign’s decree [北帝所承], neither wind nor fire may resist.
The chimes resound in harmony, aiding and protecting the altar grounds.
The true Dao flows forth—who dares to act like a madman [巴狂]?
I enjoy the highest merit, seated upon the *Kuaixing* [魁罡].
A billion *kalpas* [亿劫] endure, preserving the heavens without bound—harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence [和与道合真].

**Western Quarter:**
The Seven *Qi* [七炁] of the White Heaven, the Great White flowing essence [太白流精].
Light radiates the Golden Gate [金门], illuminating the Great Darkness [太冥].
Within, the White Sovereign [素皇], named *Diling* [帝灵].
Guarding the spirit, ensuring peace, protecting my form.
Severing the sources of evil, the Way’s path now clear.
The palaces stand in solemn order, the three lights united.
The Dao merges with nature, ascending to the Purple Court [紫庭].
The *Lingbao* [灵宝] Talismans of Destiny, universally blessing all beings.
The Original Sovereign’s true *qi* [元皇正炁], coming to merge with my body.
Merit accrues to all—heaven and earth both at ease—harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence [和与道合真].

**Northern Quarter:**
The Five *Qi* [五炁] of Mysterious Heaven, the Primordial Wanderer [元始徘徊].
The stars of the hour shine brightly, illuminating the Great Enclosure [太微].
The Dark Spirit, revered deity, named *Cenwei* [层威].
Crowned with flying heavens, clad in celestial robes and feathered garments.
Guarding the Five Gates [五门], inspecting and capturing the wandering.
Who dares to interfere? They shall be struck down and annihilated.
By the Jade Talismans’ decree [玉符所告], the spirit’s might is manifest.
The gates of evil sealed, the true Dao clearly open.
Reflecting upon my form, the three lights shine together.
Riding the void, ascending the floating—my body soars as an immortal [举形仙飞]—harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence [和与道合真].

**Central Altar:**
The One *Qi* [一炁] of Yellow Heaven, harmonizing the *Qiankun* [乾坤].
Nurturing the *Yin-Yang* [阴阳], commanding the Mysterious True [玄真].
The stars of the constellations emit radiance, illuminating the Nine Heavens [九天].
Awakening the child of clarity, named *Tianlin* [天璘].
The Primordial *Qi* [元炁] and Yang Essence [阳精], blazing with crimson flames.
Piercingly illuminating the world, even reaching my humble body.
Ten thousand evils crushed, countless ghosts slain.
The *Zhongshan* [中山] Sacred Incantations, making all under heaven respond.
The Five Spirits [五灵] ensure peace—my body ascends as an immortal [身飞上仙]—harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence [和与道合真].

**Striking the Ritual Drum Twenty-Four Times**

The Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial *Qi* [无上三天玄元始三炁],
The Supreme Dao Sovereign [太上道君],
The Supreme Great Dao Sovereign [太上大道君],
The Supreme Old Sovereign [太上老君],
The Supreme Jade Sovereign of the Celestial Vault [太上昊天玉皇上帝],
The Nine Sovereigns [九皇上尊],
The Ten Directions’ Boundless Supreme [十方无极],
The Supreme *Lingbao* Heavenly Sovereign [太上灵宝天尊],
The *Daode* [道德] Great Saints who have attained the Dao,
The True Lords of all ranks [众至真],
The revered masters [诸君丈人],
The Thirty-Six Departments of Sacred Scriptures and the *Xuanzhong* [玄中] Grand Master,
The *Zhenwu* [真武] Auspicious True Lord of the Northern Pole [北极佑圣真武灵应真君],
The Three Realms’ responsive spirits [三界应感],
All true spirits [一切真灵].

I humbly hear that the *Jinguo* [金阙] transformed body,
Emerges from the Jade Palace [玉宫] with courage and might;
The *Qianyuan* [乾元] has its general,
Who surveys the Five Sacred Peaks [五岳] with equal renown.
The myriad True Ones [万真] reverently look to your mighty spirit,
The Six Directions [六合] have no escape from your vigilant inspection.
Thus, we now raise the *Hongting* [彤庭] Great Ritual,
Humbly praying for your arrival beneath the *Zaozhan* [皂纛] banner.

「允升地宝，毖涌神泉。」
May the treasures of the earth ascend,
And the divine springs gush forth in abundance.

「掬清润之云浆，徧愈都人之疾；建琳琅之宝宇，遂成圣水之名。」
Gathering the pure, life-nourishing elixir of the clouds,
To universally cure the maladies of all people;
Constructing a hall adorned with precious treasures,
Thus establishing the fame of the Sacred Spring.

「加以徽称，昭其懿实，普及寰瀛之内，咸知变化之神。」
With honors bestowed and its virtues illuminated,
Its divine transformations are known throughout the world.

「矧惟靖邦，素彰殊应。」
Especially in this land of peace,
Where its extraordinary responses have long been renowned.

「岂钦承之敢怠，冀孚佑以潜臻。」
How could we dare to neglect its revered blessings,
And hope for its hidden grace to reach us?

「臣职在宣扬，理难缄默，况奉词旨，敢不上闻。」
Our duty lies in proclaiming its glory,
And silence is impossible;
Moreover, having received this divine command,
We dare not fail to report it.

「宣词。」
We now proclaim:

「按如词言，丹诚恳切。」
As the words have been spoken with sincere devotion,
Our hearts are deeply earnest.

「臣等谨为沐浴五体，澄炼六情，依崇真谢圣之科，祈注禄延祥之泽，施坛列纂，法地象天，所赍镇信供养之具，证质丹诚。」
We humbly purify our five senses with ritual ablutions,
And clarify our six emotions through solemn discipline;
Following the established rites of the *Zhenxie* [真谢] Saints,
We pray for the blessings of longevity and auspiciousness to descend;
Setting up the ritual platform in proper order,
The sacred ground mirroring the heavens,
We offer the *Zhenxin* [镇信] supplies of devotion,
To attest our sincere and earnest hearts.

「以今日今时启坛，依仪行道，至某日某时，关奏上真，请福延生，祈恩谢过，辄依斋法，宿、先以启闻。」
On this very day and hour, we commence the ritual platform,
Conducting the rites in strict accordance;
Until a certain day and time,
We shall present our offerings to the *Shangzhen* [上真],
Praying for blessings and extended life,
Seeking grace and expressing gratitude,
Then proceed according to the fast regulations,
And notify the *Su* [宿] and *Xian* [先] in advance.

「恩惟太上三清，十方大圣，垂神鉴映，省览所陈。」
We beseech the *Taishang* [太上] Three *Qing* [清],
And the Great Saints of the Ten Directions,
To descend and witness our divine offerings,
And graciously review our humble petitions.

「乞敕勒灵宝官属，土地真官，一合同心，并力营卫，扫荡内外，清净坛场，降伏妖魔，馘灭邪祟。」
We pray that the *Lingbao* [灵宝] officials and the *Zhen* [真] officers of the lands,
With united hearts and combined efforts,
Guard and protect this sacred space,
Cleansing and purifying the ritual grounds within and without;
Subduing and vanquishing malevolent spirits and demons,
And utterly annihilating all evil influences.

「使臣等心安神定，思念立感，启奏御达，善功成就，无有窒滞，所愿随心。」
May this enable us to remain at peace in mind and spirit,
Our thoughts and prayers instantly answered;
May our petitions reach the divine ear,
Our righteous deeds accomplished without hindrance,
And all our wishes fulfilled as we desire.

「臣等虽佩正真，参修大法，处身五浊，染迹六尘，三关未调，六情放诞，先凭禁戒，然后登坛，格降上真，导迎灵贬。」
Though we bear the *Zhengzhen* [正真] badge,
And practice the *Dafa* [大法] of the Great Dao,
Our bodies dwell amidst the Five Turbidities [五浊],
And our traces are stained by the Six Dusts [六尘];
The Three Passes [三关] remain unrefined,
And our Six Emotions [六情] are undisciplined—
We first rely on prohibitions and precepts,
Then ascend the ritual platform,
To invite the *Shangzhen* [上真] to descend,
And guide the sacred spirits to our presence.

「上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等归向之诚，谨启以闻。」
Above, we illuminate the *Tianzun* [天尊]'s boundless compassion,
Below, we align with our own sincere devotion—
We humbly report this to the heavens.

「十二愿。」
The Twelve Wishes:

「复炉。」
Reigniting the Incense:

「谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来静夜行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。」
We solemnly gather the *Xiangguan* [香官] messengers,
The *Longhu* [龙虎] Lords of left and right,
And the *Shixiang* [侍香] spirits of incense attendance;
On the nights of our ritual practice,
May golden elixirs and emerald nectars spontaneously arise,
Along with herbs and sacred plants of myriad virtues,
And all the True Ones convene before this incense burner.

「当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。」
We wish that the celestial youths and maidens of the Ten Directions,
Attending to the fragrant incense,
May swiftly convey our sincere petitions
Directly to the *Zhen* [至真] *Wujing* [无极] Great Dao,
And to the *Hao Tian* [昊天] *Yuhuang* [玉皇] Emperor of Heaven.

「出堂颂。」
Departing the Hall, we chant:

「出户。」
Exiting the Door.

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Precepts, Volume 64 completed, Volume 65 begins: The Three Caverns Scripture and Ritual for the Disciple Zhong Li’s Cultivation of the *Zhenwu* [真武] *Lingying* [灵应] Great Expiation Rite**

**Morning of the Pure Day: Ritual Practice**
The ritual proceedings ascend the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master, focusing their spirit as taught.
The sacred incantations of protection are proclaimed:
The *Qingyang* [青阳] *Xuming* [虚映] shines forth, illuminating the sun’s return to life.
The *Shentian* [神虎] *Pixie* [辟邪] dispels malevolence, while the *Feitian* [飞天] *Liuqing* [流铃] soars, scattering celestial bells.
The *Cuijian* [摧奸] *Miexiong* [灭凶] crushes deceit and extinguishes ferocity—ten thousand demons bound in form.
The *Jiuwei* [九微] *Huidao* [回道] and *Baxia* [八威] *Shejing* [摄精] restore the Dao’s subtle currents and gather the vital essences.
A thousand True Ones oversee the records, while the Three *Yuan* [元] dispel impurities.
The left *Zhao* [啸] resounds through the *Zhonghuang* [中黄], and the right *Ce* [策] invokes the Six *Ding* [丁].
Seven circuits, eight harmonies—revolving through the *Tianjing* [天经] of the Dao.
The sacred transformation stands majestic, and the Great Dao takes form.
The *Qingyun* [庆云] flows in abundance, merging with the *Hueting* [黄庭] radiance—united in Dao and True essence.
The *Fagu* [法鼓] is struck twenty-four times.

The *Wushang* [无上] Three Heavens’ *Xuan Yuan* [玄元] *Shi* [始] *Sanqi* [三炁],
The *Taishang* [太上] Dao *Jun* [君],
The *Taishang* [太上] Lao *Jun* [君],
And the *Hao Tian* [昊天] *Yuhuang* [玉皇] Emperor of Heaven,
Summon forth from my body the Three *Wu* [五] *Gongcao* [功曹],
The left and right officials and messengers,
The left and right incense-bearers,
The *Yilong* [驿龙] couriers and mounted officers,
The golden youths and jade maidens of incense attendance,
The maidens who transmit words and scatter flowers,
The Five *Di* [帝]’s straight seals,
The *Zhiri* [直日] incense officials,
And the thirty-six in total, arrayed in procession.

**Procession Departure**
Those who depart must wear solemn attire and fine robes,
Their caps and sashes adorned with trailing ribbons,
Opening the *Xuan Tan* [玄坛] to the land spirits and domain deities.
I now, on this morning of the Pure Day, conduct the ritual,
And solemnly present this as my proclamation of intent.
My heartfelt petitions have been recorded and heard—
I wish to receive the *Taishang* [太上] Ten Directions’ *Zhidao* [至真] Dao *Qi* [炁],
The *Lingbao* [灵宝] radiance and auspicious light descending,
Flowing into my own body,
So that my words may swiftly reach and directly govern
The *Taishang* [太上] *Wujing* [无极] Great Dao,
And the *Hao Tian* [昊天] *Yuhuang* [玉皇] Emperor of Heaven.

**Invocation of the Sacred Assembly**
I, [Disciple’s Name], along with the assembled officials of the platform,
Solemnly present our united sincerity:
To the *Taishang* [太上] *Wujing* [无极] Great Dao,
The *Yuan Shi* [元始] Heavenly Venerable,
The *Taishang* [太上] Great Dao *Jun* [君],
The *Taishang* [太上] Lao *Jun* [君],
The *Taishang* [太上] *Hao Tian* [昊天] *Yuhuang* [玉皇] Emperor of Heaven,
The Nine *Huang* [皇] Venerables,
The Ten Directions’ *Wujing* [无极],
The *Taishang* [太上] *Lingbao* [灵宝] Heavenly Venerable,
The *Yidao* [已道] Great Saints,
The myriad *Zhidao* [至真] and all Noble Ones,
The thirty-six divisions of sacred scriptures and profound *Zhong* [中] *Dafa* [大法],
The *Beiji* [北极] *Yousheng* [佑圣] *Zhenwu* [真武] *Lingying* [灵应] True *Jun* [君],
The responsive deities of the Three Realms,
And all True spirits.

I have heard that yin and yang alternate in succession,
And that the north alone bears the *Taiyin* [太阴] Dao *Qi* [炁];
That water and fire wax and wane in their own vigor,
Yet only the True *Jun* [君] embodies the essence of water’s position.
He governs the *Kan* [坎] officials of administration,
Assists the *Chenji* [宸极] in cosmic functions,
And completes the beginning and end of all things—
Overseeing the unfolding and contraction of transformative forces.
He aids the Emperor of Heaven in his *Taojin* [陶钧] crafting,
And encompasses the vital mechanisms of all spirits.

Sometimes he soars within the vast heavens,
Sometimes he lingers in the Five *Qi* [炁] realms,
His banner raised as the seas and mountains tremble,
His sword *Qi* [炁] surging as clouds and thunder resound.
The *Qin* [祆] mists are swept away by lightning,
His commands carried forth by the wind’s swift flight.
All who turn to him in reverence
Shall receive his manifest blessings.

I have purified the *Dantan* [坛度] platform,
And await the wind’s final descent.
With earnest devotion, I humbly receive his grace,
And stand in awe of the spirit’s transformative power.

Having received the sacred words,
How dare I not present them above?
**Proclamation of Words**
The words are carefully examined,
Their sincerity clearly seen.
Without relying on his luminous might,
How could I attain the *Jian* [戬] *Gu* [谷]?
I pray to be offered the *Pingfan* [苹蘩]’s sacred guidance,
So that I may follow Heaven and Earth’s benevolent will.

From the layered heavens, his auspicious *Qi* [炁] descends,
A shower of *De* [德] *Zi* [泽];
Through all the realms, his spirit winds fan forth,
Broadly spreading waves of mercy.
No spirit shall dare to offend,
Nor shall any ghost accuse!

At this pure dawn of the Dao’s practice, I respectfully invite the assembly of the Law to take these first three strands of incense and offer them upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the Palace of Supreme Clarity, nourishing the manifested body of the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage, the Golden Gate Lord Lao, and the Three Pure Ones, the Jade Emperor of the Highest Sovereignty.

I humbly pray that the Great Dao may descend its benevolence in splendor, crowning the ranks of the Perfected with its auspicious grace, so that frontier beacons may shine brightly, blades may fall silent, and in court there be no ministers who deceive the sovereign or betray the state, while throughout the lands officials may govern with love for the people and loyalty to the realm. May there be no more bandits or rebellions, and may all enjoy the peace of *Shengping*.

Now, having offered this incense, I take refuge in the Virtue of the Great Sage, the Perfected Assembly of the Most True. After attaining the Dao, I shall ascend to the Formless and harmonize with the True and the Way.

At this pure dawn of the Dao’s practice, I respectfully invite the assembly of the Law to take these next two strands of incense and offer them upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the Northern Pole Bureau of Eternal Rites, nourishing the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage’s subordinate, the Star Lord of the Martial Chord, and the assembly of the Northern Pole Saints.

I humbly pray that you manifest your wondrous responses to spread far and wide, shining your sacred radiance afar, so that the officiant, this humble one’s ninth-generation ancestor seven generations back, may not be delayed at the nether gates. May my living father, now departed, be freed from all guilt. May the burdens of past-life enmity be severed, and the cries of ancestral lawsuits in the underworld be silenced. May the spirits of malevolent demons be bound, and the ghosts of the Six Peaks be beheaded. May the vast *Hongfan* qi be restored, and this people be eternally protected.

Now, having offered this incense, I take refuge in the Virtue of the Great Sage, the Perfected Assembly of the Most True. After attaining the Dao, I shall ascend to the Formless and harmonize with the True and the Way.

At this pure dawn of the Dao’s practice, I respectfully invite the assembly of the Law to take these final three strands of incense and offer them upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the Divine Seat, nourishing the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage.

I humbly pray that you embody the Golden Gate’s resplendent might, serving as the primordial minister of the Jade Capital, patrolling with decisive authority, cutting off all inauspicious omens, so that the officiant, this humble one of the *Kan* mansion, may be freed from perilous calamities and endowed with the enlightened nature of Water’s virtue. May he, who has long studied the Cloud Research Scriptures with profound mastery and unmatched eloquence, swiftly ascend to the honors of officialdom, then stride upon the lofty path of prosperity. May he who lacks such study possess a firm Daoist root and a keen, luminous nature, so that in all his comings and goings, no external evils may cling to him, and in his rest and nourishment, no temporal illnesses may afflict him. May disasters melt away like ice, and blessings grow ever longer as the sun. May he who holds office flourish in his career, distinguished by his lofty virtue, swiftly receiving the honor of promotion to perilous posts, ascending to the favor of the exalted, so that the seas may look to his statesmanship and all officials may revere his weighty bearing.

Now, having offered this incense, I take refuge in the Virtue of the Teacher-Sage, the Perfected Assembly of the Most True. After attaining the Dao, I shall ascend to the Formless and harmonize with the True and the Way.

With renewed reverence, the humble official, this one, along with the assembled officiants, sincerely presents this petition to the Supreme Without Extremes, the Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Supreme Dao Lord, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Supreme Jade Emperor of the Highest Sovereignty, the Nine Sovereigns, the Ten Directions Without Extremes, the Supreme Spirit-Treasury Heavenly Venerable, the Perfected Saints who have attained the Dao, the Assembly of the Most True, all Revered Lords and Masters, the Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scriptures and the Mystic Great Master of the Central Dao, the Northern Pole Auxiliary Saint, the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage, the Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits, and all True Essences.

I have heard that the mist of the Immortals drifts through the layered stages, granting those of worthy virtue the chariot of timely ascent; that the sacred grounds are opened with pure offerings, where the solemn rites are arranged in strict order. I have exhausted my humble devotion, relying on the divine presence to scrutinize me.

Yet, reflecting deeply, this humble officiant’s grasp of the Dao is shallow, his birth fraught with hardship, and he has recklessly burdened the workings of Transformation without benefiting the enlightened age. Navigating the world’s paths, he has endured countless perils, his name obscured by dust. He has always feared becoming one who toils diligently at the start but grows slack at the end, or who walks the world with many faults and few merits, or whose lifespan is not long, or whose foundation is not deep.

On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when the Supreme One expounds the Scriptures, and on the third day of the third month, when the Venerable Sage descends, my rites of offering have been deficient, and I have truly fallen into dread. In the years *Jiazi* and *Gengshen*, my prayers were sparse; to the Seven Elements and Four Saints, my reverence was delayed. I have dwelled in filth as my norm, partaken of meat and spice without restraint, approached the dying and the dead, and followed worldly customs, observing evil winds. Some have sought fleeting honors, indulging recklessly and bringing ruin upon their ancestors; others, relying on a single family’s wealth, have grown arrogant and licentious, incurring guilt before the underworld officials. There have been those who, without law, coveted wealth, or who, violating the Dao, sought advancement through improper means.

All these transgressions I now abandon, hoping to restore the divine favor. I humbly pray that you condescend to examine my sincerity, broadly extending the shelter of the Dao, so that this officiant’s household may flourish, with blessings and longevity ever increasing, his descendants multiplying and thriving, his spouse and he aging together in harmony, his granaries ever full and his gold and silk ever abundant. May he forever dispel unforeseen disasters and eternally preserve boundless life.

This disciple, this humble official, reflects once more: righteousness and heresy cannot coexist, and good and evil cannot walk together. Because the teachings of virtue have declined in the age, the ghosts of night have grown rampant. Those who revere the Dao are few, while those who believe in heresy are many. Due to the greed of the common folk, desiring sudden wealth for their households, they fawn upon wasteful spirits, plundering their neighbors, gorging on blood in their starving bellies, and displaying monstrous transformations in the night. Some hurl tiles and stones from emptiness, while others, taking advantage of the dark, steal wealth. Some mock the spirits of the dead, and often the deceitful nature of ghosts is exposed.

This disciple, this humble official, further reflects: some harm the young and innocent, while at times they manifest as terrifying seizures and convulsions. Others blow upon the mouth to create sounds and call out people’s names, or knock upon doors and pound on gates to disturb their dwellings. Some scatter filth in chaotic disorder, while others linger around food trays, feasting without restraint. Some send false dreams in sleep to deceive, or summon the departed to wreak havok. Others display wealth to win favor, or set fires to cause alarm.

Indeed, these most vile **Xie Dao** (邪道) heresies thrive in the mortal world. Without fail, I shall uncover all secrets, and I pray to ride upon the **Liuhuo Bell** (流火之铃) to strike. No crime shall go unpunished, and I shall spare no retribution, even if it be as vast as the **Great Heaven’s** (巨天) execution.

I shall carry out the **Taishang’s** (太上) command and uphold the **Zhenjun’s** (真君) authority. Let no land dare to withhold its offerings—first, I shall dispatch the **Yin soldiers** (阴兵) to slay and behead.

I shall cut off the hundred heresies’ (百邪) rampant harm and deliver all beings to safety and peace. With the **Magu** (魔精) spirits extinguished and the **Huosi** (火死) flames reduced to ash, disasters shall vanish like clouds dispersing and mists scattering.

May all hearts reverently pray, and may this humble offering be their refuge. Above, I honor the **Heavenly Sovereign’s** (天尊) boundless compassionate grace; below, I align with my officials’ sincere devotion. I respectfully submit this petition.

**The Twelve Vows** (十二願).
**Reverently Rekindle the Furnace** (复炉).
Respectfully, I command the **Fragrant Officials and Messengers** (香官使者), the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals** (左右龍虎君), and the **Attendant Spirits of Incense** (侍香諸靈官): they shall cause this humble official’s offerings, made at the dawn of each clear day, to spontaneously produce **Golden Elixir and Azure Jade** (金液丹碧), **Herbs and Spirits of a Hundred Kinds** (芝英百靈), and gather all the **Perfected Ones** (衆真) at this furnace of incense.

May the **Ten Directions’ Celestial Youths and Jade Maidens** (十方仙童玉女) attend to the fragrant vapors and swiftly convey this humble official’s petition to the **Supreme Ultimate Great Dao’s** (無極大道) and the **Celestial Jade Emperor’s** (昊天玉皇上帝) presence.

**Exit the Hall and Proclaim** (出堂頌).
**Exit the Door** (出戸).

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Canon, Volume Sixty-Six**
*Three Caverns Scripture and Talisman: Disciple’s Vows of Aspiration*
**The Grand Ritual of True Martial’s Responsive Virtue (真武灵应大醮仪)**

**At the Hour of Wu (临午行道):**
The ritual ascends the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.
The **Sacred Guards’ Incantations** (卫灵咒) are proclaimed:

**To the Northern Void, the Dark and Mysterious Lord (玄天杳杳神君):**
With myriad transformations, the **Mysterious Tortoise’s Perfected Spirit** (玄武灵真) unfurls—
Ascending the heavens, overturning the earth, driving thunder and dispersing clouds.
With legions numbering ten thousand, sweeping away the miasma of demons.
**Thunder Lords** attend, **Jade Maidens** command—
Ghosts and spirits cower, dragons and tigers flee in haste.
The Five Peaks tremble, all spirits obey.
The **Celestial Bell and War Drum** resound, traversing heaven and earth.
Hunting rogue ghosts, shattering demonic souls,
Expelling evil and aiding the righteous—
The **Dao-qi** ever ascends, harmonizing with the True.
**The Law-Drum is struck twenty-four times.**

**The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin-qi (三炁),**
The **Most High Dao Lord (太上道君),**
The **Most High Laozi (太上老君),**
Summon forth from within this humble servant:
The **Three Five Functionaries (三五功曹),**
The **Left and Right Officials and Messengers (左右官使者),**
The **Left and Right Incense-Bearers (左右捧香),**
The **Relay Dragon Cavalry Clerks (驿龙骑吏),**
The **Attendant Golden Boys (侍香金童),**
The **Speech-Bearing, Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens (传言散花玉女),**
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans (五帝直符),**
The **Direct-Day Incense Officials (直日香官)—**
A total of **Thirty-Six** emerge.

Those who depart are adorned in solemn, radiant attire,
Their headgear and sashes trailing ribbons.
They open the **Void Altar’s Land and Domain Spirits (玄坛土地),**
The **Territorial Deities and Perfected Ones (方域神真).**

At this hour of Wu, as the ritual commences,
This humble servant respectfully petitions to declare intent:
With sincerity unshaken, already recorded and reported,
May the **Most High’s Ten Directions’ Perfected Dao-qi (十方至真道炁),**
The **Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Light (灵宝瑞光),**
Descend and flow into this humble servant’s body,
That what is petitioned may swiftly reach the presence of
The **Most High’s Supreme Ultimate Dao (無極大道)**
And the **Celestial Jade Emperor (昊天玉皇上帝).**

**The Law-Position is invoked.**
This humble servant of such-and-such rank, together with the assembled officials,
Solemnly and sincerely petition above:
To the **Most High’s Supreme Ultimate Dao (無極大道),**
The **Primordial Heavenly Venerable (元始天尊),**
The **Most High Dao Lord (太上大道君),**
The **Most High Laozi (太上老君),**
The **Most High Celestial Jade Emperor (太上昊天玉皇上帝),**
The **Nine Sovereigns Most Exalted (九皇上尊),**
The **Ten Directions’ Supreme Ultimate (十方無極),**
The **Most High Sacred Treasure Heavenly Venerable (太上灵宝天尊),**
The **Already Dao-Realized Great Saints (已得道大圣),**
The **All-Perfected Spirits (衆至真),**
The **All Noble Lords (諸君丈人),**
The **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Scripture Masters of the Mysterious Middle (三十六部尊经玄中大法师),**
The **North Pole’s Auxiliary Saint, True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord (北极佑圣真武灵应真君),**
The **Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits (三界应感),**
And **All True Spirits (一切真灵).**

This humble servant has heard:
That which sustains life and origins,
All things derive from the **Two Principles (二仪).**
With **righteousness and wisdom (有义有知),**
Humans are the most enlightened of all creatures.
The **Nine Heavens unite in virtue (九天合德),**
The **Three Caverns manifest form (三洞化形).**
The **Three Myriad Six Thousand spirits** all come to guard and assist,
The **Three Hundred Sixty bones and joints** are all harmoniously connected.

Yet, through **obstinate delusion and false paths**, the True is obscured;
Through **deep-rooted malevolence**, goodness is blotted out.
When the **cycles of yin and yang are exhausted,**
And the **eons of great and small calamities conclude,**
Demons proliferate, cutting short humanity’s allotted span;
Seeking false blessings, all fall into **perverted, foolish ignorance.**
They do not reflect upon their **original nature**—
Following **evil paths**, they suffer **confusion and chaos,**
Lacking **loyalty, filial piety, benevolence, and righteousness.**
Though not yet their destined time of death,
They are struck down by the **Six Heavens’ injuries and killings;**
Sudden loss of life brings forth **the grievances of the multitudes.**
The young and old do not fulfill their natural years,
Their souls drift, bereft in the mortal realm.
Thus, the **impure qi** swirls in tangled knots,
While the **True One’s form** finds no refuge.

To alleviate the **lower realm’s suffering and distress,**
We rely upon the **True Martial’s Divine Lord (真武神君).**
Severing demonic essences, rescuing lost souls,
We wield the **Compassionate Sovereign’s might,**
Commanding **ten thousand armies,**
To slay demons and exterminate evil—
Thus the **Four Quarters are purified,**
The **Three Lights shine pristine,**
The **True Law flourishes,**
The **Evil qi dissipates,**
Restoring **peace to the world,**
Dissolving the **people’s doubts,**
Bringing **eternal tranquility to all nations,**
Silencing the **Nine Abysses’ accusations.**
The **Divine Function’s grace** extends,
Reliance upon it spans **ten thousand eons.**

The **Ritual Disciple**, though unworthy, has long partaken of the **True Shade (真荫),**
Yet dwells in the dusty world.
Ever contemplating **auspicious deeds of virtue,**
Dedicated to the **rites of the True.**
As a humble grass-and-thatch mortal,
Only harboring **loyal devotion;**
As a fleeting ant’s life,
Ever grateful for **the river’s flow of grace.**
Drowned in the years of neglect,
Unable to repay this light—
Thus, at this **auspicious hour of the Holy Dew’s birth (诞圣涓吉辰),**
A **Ritual of Welcoming Auspiciousness (迎祥之醮)** is specially established.
With **Daoist companions**, we humbly thank the **Northern Spirit (北灵),**
Revering the **Supreme Symbol’s Exalted One (上象之尊),**
Daring not to neglect the **Square Enclosure’s petition (方函之奏).**
Though the **sincere words may follow ancient forms,**
The **divine principles defy full comprehension—**
Our **devout supplications** arise from **precise intent.**
May the **whirlwind’s swift passage** pause,
And the **Heavenly Sovereign** look down upon this **crimson sincerity.**
This disciple’s **green petition** shall be duly presented.

**The Petition is Proclaimed:**
As the words declare, the sincerity is profound and devoted.
Gazing back upon the **Five Clouds’ Seat,**
Where **Hundred Harmonies’ smoke ascends,**
The **Heavenly Emperor and Perfected Ones** gather,
As at the **Upper Primordial Hall (上元之殿);**
The **Northern Capital’s Sovereign** leads,
Advancing toward the **Eight Scenic Palaces (八景之宫).**
The **Lofty Pavilion stands solemn in the void,**
The **Celestial Music drifts ethereal in the Azure Void (碧落),**
The **Perfected Ones attend in ranks,**
The **Demons bind their forms in submission—**
How dare we not **exert utmost sincerity,**
**Reverently prostrate in devotion,**
Hoping to receive the **Heavenly Sovereign’s favor,**
That **the family and nation may prosper.**

At this hour of Wu, as the ritual commences,
We request the **Law-Assembled** to kindle the **first incense-twist,**
That this **incense-smoke may ascend directly to the Pure Clarity Palace (太清宫),**
Offering to the **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord’s manifested form (真武灵应真君所化之身),**
To the **Golden Threshold’s Laozi (金阙老君),**
To the **Three Pure Ones Most Holy (三清上圣),**
And the **Jade Emperor (玉皇上帝).**

This humble servant **surrenders body, spirit, and fate,**
And with this **incense-twist’s merit,**
We pray for the **Current Emperor’s blessings:**
May his **virtue spread across the Eight Seas,**
His **lifespan equal the Two Principles (二仪).**
Like the **glory of sun and moon,**
Illuminating without end;
May his **boundless virtue encompass heaven and earth,**
Covering all beneath the vault of heaven.

The hundred affairs are in order, the three borders at peace,
A thousand spears laid aside, all bearing children return home.
The year’s bows and hooks are hung away,
Mountain paths open of their own accord.
Ice-silk divine beasts cross the seas to our gates.
All living things move with vitality, all ascend to benevolent longevity.

Now, we burn incense to return and take refuge in the **Dao-Honored Great Saints’ Most Authentic Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao, we ascend into the Formless,
Harmonizing with the True and merging with the Way.

With today’s midday ritual, we request the **Law-Assembled** to kindle the **second incense-twist**,
That this incense-smoke may ascend directly to the **Northern Pole’s Eternal Office (北极太常府)**,
To offer to the **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord’s subordinate, the Martial Chord Star Lord (武曲星君)**,
And the **Northern Pole’s Sacred Assembly**.
We surrender body, spirit, and fate,
And with this incense-twist’s merit,
We dedicate to the **certain household of the Dao’s transmission**—
Nine generations of divine rites,
A hundred million ancestral spirits,
Freed from endless night, ascending to behold the radiant light.
Shining in the **Court of the Vermilion Dan**,
Ascending to the **Palace of Piercing Brightness**,
With celestial robes gleaming in splendor,
Our names inscribed in the **Immortal Registers**,
Bestowing blessings upon descendants,
Partaking in the **True Celestial Realm**.

Now, we burn incense to return and take refuge in the **Sutra-Honored Great Saints’ Most Authentic Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao, we ascend into the Formless,
Harmonizing with the True and merging with the Way.

With today’s midday ritual, we request the **Law-Assembled** to kindle the **third incense-twist**,
That this incense-smoke may ascend directly to the **Divine Seat**,
To offer to the **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord**.
We surrender body, spirit, and fate,
And with this incense-twist’s merit,
We dedicate to the **certain household of the Dao’s transmission**—
Six kinships and nine clans,
All relations bound by fate,
All attaining auspicious connections,
Ever under the Dao’s protection,
Secretly dispelling guilt and calamity,
Silently resolving disasters and entanglements,
Debts and lawsuits settled in harmony,
Grudges and enmities reconciled.
Wicked men and malevolent ghosts lack schemes to harm;
Dark omens and black talismans avoid their doomed influence.

The **Divine Seat’s True Martial** bestows protection and auspiciousness in all actions.
With today’s incense-burning, we humbly dedicate ourselves to the **Law-Assembled**’s **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord**—
The **Virtue/Power of the Supreme True**,
Which, after attaining the **Dao/Way**, ascends to the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao/Way’s True Essence**.

We repeat the **Law’s sacred rank** in earnest.
**Official Certain** and the **Assembled Officials of the Ritual Platform**, with sincere devotion, jointly petition:
The **Supreme Way of the Limitless**, the **Heavenly Sovereign of Primordial Beginnings**,
The **Supreme Lord of the Great Dao**, the **Supreme Sage of the Lao**,
The **Supreme Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heavenly Sovereign**,
The **Nine Sovereigns Above**,
The **Ten Directions of the Limitless**,
The **Supreme Sovereign of the Numinous Treasure**,
The **Perfected Saints of the Dao** who have already attained the **Dao/Way**,
The **Assembled True Martial of the Supreme Law**,
All **Responsive Perfected Lords**,
And the **True Spirits of the Three Realms**.

We, the **Officials**, have heard of the **Responsive Perfected Lord’s** miraculous birth and deeds,
And we beseech guidance from the **Wondrous Practices**;
We, the **Officials**, have heard of the **Wicked Qis** stirring up calamities,
And we pray to sever and remove the **Malevolent Spirits** that once relied on the **Responsive Perfected Lord’s** **威神** (awe-inspiring spirit).

In the **endless age**, we fear the **proliferation of disasters**,
As the **host of demons** grows ever more rampant.
They dare to raise **noxious qi**,
Disturbing the **virtuous folk**;
They seek to **purge and cleanse**,
Yet only deepen the **suppressed grief** of the people.

The **Officials** humbly reflect:
Beneath the **urban settlements and suburbs**, the **malevolent spirits** take refuge;
Between the **mountains, rivers, forests, and valleys**, the **precise souls** dwell.
Some cling to **thin groves and sparse clusters**,
Others roam freely in the **sandy shallows**.
With **wind howling and rain shrieking**, they raise **grievous cries** across the **four wilds**;
When **clouds gather and moonlight wanes**, they emit **phosphorescent flames** in the **midnight hours**.
If one encounters these **wicked ones**, one’s **true life** will surely be harmed.
Some fall into **ravines and gullies**,
Others meet **blades and axes** at the **sharp edge**.
Some **leap into fire or wade through rivers**, acting in **madness or epilepsy**;
Others **endure bitterness and swallow acidity**, forever haunted by **fear and dread**.

The **Officials** deeply dread that all **living beings of the world** may suffer such torments,
And we earnestly hope the **Perfected Lords** will not betray their **vows**,
But **unfurl their numinous might**,
Driving these **malevolent demons** back to **emptiness and stillness**,
So that **heaven is clear and earth is tranquil**,
And they **forever cease to prey upon the innocent**—
Together with all **living beings**, we rejoice in this **great aspiration**.

The **Officials** further reflect:
In the **realm of ghosts**, the **crafty and domineering** tread upon **palaces and courts** in empty wanderings;
The **malevolent and cunning spirits**, unrestrained, **spread delusion and deceive the living**.
Some **nest in lofty towers and pavilions**,
Others **dwell in mountain forests**.
When **night grows dark**, their **lanterns flicker and flames blaze**;
In **desolate wilderness**, their **reeds and pipes** play in **chaotic return**.
They **spread their foul qi**, secretly **stealing treasures and hoarding wealth**.
They **bring calamity to the people**, demanding **sacrifices of wine and blood**;
They **boast false strength**, able to **snatch the souls of the young and vigorous**.

If one encounters these **wicked ones**, one’s **true life** will surely be harmed.
Some **suddenly shift from poverty to wealth**, only to **lose it all again**;
Others **gain fortune, then swiftly perish**.
They **roam without rest**, exploiting the **prayers of the greedy**;
They **assault without cease**, leading to **ruin and decline of the body**.

The **Officials** deeply dread that all **living beings of the world** may suffer such torments,
And we earnestly hope the **Perfected Lords** will not betray their **vows**,
But **unfurl their numinous might**,
Driving these **malevolent demons** back to **emptiness and stillness**,
So that **heaven is clear and earth is tranquil**,
And they **forever cease to prey upon the innocent**—
Together with all **living beings**, we rejoice in this **great aspiration**.

The **Officials** further reflect:
In the **lakes, rivers, and seas**, there are **cryptic dragons, hidden crocodiles, aged turtles, and giant tortoises**,
Whose **spirits** lurk in the depths.
In the **woods, groves, and mountains**, there are **wild boars, long serpents, venomous insects, and fierce beasts**,
Whose **kinds** dwell in the wilds.
They **ride the waves’ dangers**, swiftly **swallowing ships whole**.
They **await the sound of footsteps**, then **harbor poisonous intent**.
Sudden **disasters arise**, and **death comes in an instant**.
If one encounters these **wicked ones**, one’s **true life** will surely be harmed.
Some **are crushed beneath the **pine forests and ravines**,
Or **buried in the depths of the fish’s belly**,
Or **consumed by foul qi**, their **bodies swelling with thunderous pain**;
Others **are devoured by ferocious beasts**, their **bodies drained and bones exposed**.

The **Officials** deeply dread that all **living beings of the world** may suffer such torments,
And we earnestly hope the **Perfected Lords** will not betray their **vows**,
But **unfurl their numinous might**,
Driving these **malevolent demons** back to **emptiness and stillness**,
So that **heaven is clear and earth is tranquil**,
And they **forever cease to prey upon the innocent**—
Together with all **living beings**, we rejoice in this **great aspiration**.

The **Officials** further reflect:
In **Sichuan**, they say the **world’s ghostly pits** are here,
In the **southeast**, the **lands of Jing and Min-Yue** teem with **venomous insects and malevolent spirits**.
The **wilds of mountains and forests**, the **fields and villages**,
Are plagued by **malevolent shamans** who **work their tricks**.
They **hurl flying talismans and sprinkle cursed water**,
**Cutting mouths and burning bodies**,
**Pointing at the void with curses**—
And indeed, one **hears of unjust deaths**,
While the **spirit lingers within itself**, only to **be seized and imprisoned**.
They **desire to taste the sacrificial broth**, yet **midday brings harm from blood-sucking demons**;
They **raise their iron rods**, and one **suddenly falls stiff and lifeless**.

If one encounters these **wicked ones**, one’s **true life** will surely be harmed.
Some **whistle all day long**,
Others **remain in a stupor for years**.
Some **fall into madness without cause**, mistaking **empty flowers** for companions;
Others **groan silently in darkness**, struck by **sudden violent illness** and **dying in haste**.

The **Officials** deeply dread that all **living beings of the world** may suffer such torments,
And we earnestly hope the **Perfected Lords** will not betray their **vows**,
But **unfurl their numinous might**,
Driving these **malevolent demons** back to **emptiness and stillness**,
So that **heaven is clear and earth is tranquil**,
And they **forever cease to prey upon the innocent**—
Together with all **living beings**, we rejoice in this **great aspiration**.

The **Officials** further reflect:
From the **graves and mounds**, the **rotting bones** transform into **corpse spirits**,

They **spread like currents**, or **seep and permeate** through **gradual influence**.

Before the breath has fully parted, signs of rebirth already arise;
When the **spirit** and **qi** grow weary, **illness** of **midlife stagnation** ensues.

Should one encounter these **malevolent forces**, their **true vitality** will surely be harmed.

The **Officials** deeply dread that all **living beings of the world** may suffer such torments,
And we earnestly hope the **Perfected Lords** will not betray their **vows**,
But **unfurl their numinous might**,
Driving these **malevolent demons** back to **emptiness and stillness**,
So that **heaven is clear and earth is tranquil**,
And they **forever cease to prey upon the innocent**—
Together with all **living beings**, we rejoice in this **great aspiration**.

The **Officials** further reflect:

Their **karmic curses** bind tightly, their vengeance deep and relentless.
Those who find opportunity will dwell among mortals, appearing as **living kin**;

Should one encounter these **malevolent forces**, their **true vitality** will surely be harmed.
Some suffer lingering **illness**, others face battles with ten thousand armies.

The **Officials** deeply dread that all **living beings of the world** may suffer such torments,

The **names are inscribed on jade tablets** (名刊玉简),
The **characters recorded in the Celestial Palace** (字录帝房).
They **ride the tempestuous winds** and scatter their brilliance (乘飙散景),
Soaring through the **vast expanse** (飞腾太空),
Entering and exiting the **mysterious void** (出入冥无),
**Roaming and feasting** across the **Ten Directions** (游宴十方).

The **Five Clouds** float as a canopy (五云浮盖),
Summoning the **divine spirits** and restraining the **winds** (招神摄风).
They **command the myriad spirits** (役使万灵),
Ascending to **guard the Dao** (上卫仙翕),
In harmony with the **Dao’s True Essence** (和与道合真).

**Striking the Sacred Drum** twenty-four times (鸣法鼓二十四通).

The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Dao Essence** (无上三天玄元始三炁),
The **Most High Dao Sovereign** (太上道君),
The **Most High Lao Sovereign** (太上老君),
**Summon forth** from within my body the **Three Five Officials** (三五功曹),
The **Left and Right Official Attendants** (左右官使者),
The **Left and Right Incense Bearers** (左右捧香),
The **Postal Dragon and Mounted Officials** (驿龙骑吏),
The **Golden Boys Attending Incense** (侍香金童),
The **Jade Maidens Scattering Flowers and Conveying Messages** (传言散花玉女),
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** (五帝直符),
The **Direct Talismans of the Day Star** (直日香官),
And the **Thirty-Six** (合三十六人) **assembled**.

Those who **emerge** are clad in **solemn attire and resplendent garments** (严装显服),
Their **headdresses and sashes** adorned with trailing ribbons (冠带垂缨),
Opening the **gateways of the Mysterious Dao’s Earthly Deities** (关启玄坛土地),
And the **spirits of the realm and domain** (方域神真).

I now **practice the Dao in solemn night** (静夜行道),
**Respectfully present this as my sincere intention** (谨奏为入意).
All my **devoted sincerity** (诸忱悃) has been **recorded and reported** (已录告闻).
I pray that the **Most High Dao’s Essence of the Ten Directions** (太上十方至真道炁),
The **Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Light** (灵宝瑞光),
May **descend and flow** into my body (下降，流入臣身中),
So that my **petitions** may **swiftly reach** the **Most High Boundless Dao** (令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道),
And the **Divine Presence of the Most High Heavenly Sovereign** (昊天玉皇上帝御前).

**Requesting the invocation of the Dao’s rank** (请称法位).
**I, [Name], of the Conjuration Officials** (醮官某), along with the **assembled spirits of the platform** (合坛众等),
**Solemnly present my sincere vows** (谨同诚上启):

To the **Most High Boundless Dao** (太上无极大道),
The **Primordial Sovereign of Heaven** (元始天尊),
The **Most High Dao Sovereign** (太上大道君),
The **Most High Lao Sovereign** (太上老君),
The **Most High Heavenly Sovereign of the Jade Palace** (太上昊天玉皇上帝),
The **Nine Sovereigns Above** (九皇上尊),
The **Ten Directions’ Boundless Dao** (十方无极),
The **Most High Celestial Sovereign of the Sacred Treasure** (太上灵宝天尊),
The **Already Dao-Attained Great Saints** (已得道大圣),
The **Multitude of True Essences** (众至真),
The **Honorable Lords** (诸君丈人),
The **Thirty-Six Departments of Supreme Scriptures** (三十六部尊经玄中大法师),
The **True Martial Spirit of the Northern Pole’s Auspicious Response** (北极佑圣真武灵应真君),
The **Responsive Spirits of the Three Realms** (三界应感),
And the **All-Encompassing True Spirits** (一切真灵).

I have heard that at the **beginning of the Han Dynasty’s celestial era** (龙汉纪号之初),
On the **day when the Primordial Dao was manifested** (元始演法之日),
The **Five Clouds** spread beneath the **wondrous seat** (敷五云之妙座),
And the **multitude of True Spirits from the Ten Directions** gathered (会十方之众真).
At the **Upper Primordial Dao’s Celestial Palace** (上元仙宫),
The **heavenly music resounded** on its own (天乐自响),
When suddenly at the **Gan Position** (艮位),
A **great tremor of seven sounds** shook the heavens (大震七声),
And the **Celestial Gate was swiftly opened** (奄辟天门),
To **descend and observe the world** (下观世界).

The **Essence of Dark Poison and Blood Light** surged upward from below (黑毒血光之炁，自下而冲);
Within the **Dao’s realm of the Great Sun** (太阳道境之中),
**All was visible** when gazing downward (俯目皆见).

Then arose the **wondrous deeds** (妙行),
The **strange causes** for inquiry (发问异因),
To **request the Sovereign’s might and splendor** (欲请威光),
To **descend and eliminate demons and spirits** (下除魔鬼),
**Acknowledging the Heavenly Sovereign’s compassionate teachings** (感天尊之慈训),
And **recounting the True Martial Spirit’s sacred traces** (述真武之灵踪).

The **King of Pure Joy** (净乐国王) and the **Queen of Good Victory** (善胜皇后),
**Swallowed the Sun’s Light in their dreams** (吞日光於梦寐),
And **gave birth to the Holy Child in the palace halls** (诞圣子於宫闱).
They **inherited the natural divine spirits** (禀自然之神灵),
And **bore the courage of humanity** (负过人之勇猛),
**Assisting the propagation of the orthodox teaching** (辅行正教),
**Undaunted by obstacles**, their **sincerity was unyielding** (难遏勤诚),
**Vowing to exterminate the world’s demonic spirits** (誓断天下之妖魔),
And to **universally save all beings** (普救世间之群品).

At **Mount Wudang**, their **Dao cultivation was perfected** in **forty-two years** (武当修道，功成於四十二年);
On **the White Day**, they **ascended to Heaven** (白日登天),
Their **virtue and power** aligned with the **Northern Pole’s Water Position** (德正於北方水位).
Thus they **laid aside the attendance of the Golden Boys** (辍金童之侍),
And **held the talismans to summon the True Spirits** (俾持招真之符).
They **journeyed to the distant Northern Capital** (遥往朔都),
**Summoning their divine generals** (召其神将).
The **celestial rites ceased**, and **swiftly they arrived here** (仙仪萃止，欻驾来斯).
They **received the mandate from the True Sovereign** (奉眷命於真皇),
**Determined to clear the lower realms of impurities** (期肃清於下境).
Their **hair blackened by dark clouds**, their **feet bare upon the empty void** (披发而乌云拂踵，跣足而白玉莹空).
They **rode upon the Eight Trigrams’ divine tortoise** (蹑八卦之神龟),
And the **mythical serpent followed** (螣蛇亦附);
They **wielded the Seven Stars’宝剑** (仗七星之宝剑),
And the **sacred waters accompanied them** (神水相随).
**Thunder and lightning displayed their might** (雷电扬威),
**Winds and clouds bore them aloft** (风云捧步).

The **Thirty-Six Heavenly Soldiers** (六丁玉女) and the **Thirty-Six Earthly Soldiers** (六甲直符),
**Dispatched the swarming poisonous dragons and ferocious beasts** (毒龙猛兽之纷纭),
**Scattered the encircling giant tortoises and lions** (巨虬狮子之围绕),
And **commanded over thirty million divine troops** (统吏兵之三十余万).
They **judged between humans and spirits** within **seven days** (判人鬼於七日之中),
And the **demonic essences of the heavens were dispersed** (弥天之妖炁荡除),
The **suffering souls of transgressors were liberated** (作孽之冤魂解散),
So that **living beings were at peace** (生人安泰),
And the **land was free from calamities** (国土清平).
They **returned to pay homage before the Heavenly Sovereign** (复朝见於天尊),
And **forever dwelled in the Northern Pole’s domain** (永临镇於北极).

Now, **I, the Conjuration Official**, having **reviewed the extraordinary merits** (阅殊勋於宝恢),
**Cannot fully express my gratitude** (难尽偷扬);
I **received the True Martial Spirit’s command** at the **auspicious hour** (奉真驭於灵辰),
And **desire to seek their assistance** (欲资佑助).

Now, **selecting a site of auspicious reserve** (爰择储祥之地),
To **extend the sacred rites** (用伸延圣之仪).

**Laying out** the **sacred wine and rice wine** (陳醪醴以惟馨),
**Offering** the **pure grains and pure vessels** (荐粢盛而有洁).
**Arranging** the **Nine Veil’s candles** (列以九微之烛),
**Scattering** the **hundred-blended incense** (散以百和之香).
**Devoutly exhausting** the **sincere heart** (悉罄精衷),
**Supplicating** the **Heavenly Sovereign’s discernment** (上祈冲鉴).

May we **receive boundless blessings** (庶被无疆之福祉),
And **forever rely upon the august and mighty** (永依有赫之威灵).

**I, the Conjuration Official**, together with the **assembled ritualists and officials** (臣与醮官合坛众等),
**Humbly await**, **with utmost reverence and longing**, to **petition above** (无任伫望仰请之至),
**With profound awe and fear**, **prostrate twice** (诚惶诚恐，稽首再拜),
**To solemnly welcome the True Martial Spirit** (奉迎真驭).

**Descend, True Martial Spirit!** (降真)
**Offer tea.** (献茶)
**First offering—scatter flowers.** (初献，散花)

**I, the humble servant** (具位臣某),
**With utmost sincerity**, **now humbly petition**:
To the **Emperor of the Golden Peak of the Void-Nothingness** (虚无自然金阙至尊),
The **Ten-Direction Limitless** (十方无极),
The **Supreme Lord of the Numinous Treasure Dao** (太上灵宝天尊),
The **Great Sage Who Has Obtained the Dao** (已得道大圣),
The **Many True Ones** (众至真),
The **Honorable Masters and Lords** (诸君丈人),
The **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Masters of the Mystic Middle Scripture** (三十六部尊经玄中大法师),
The **North Pole’s Auspicious and Holy True Martial Spirit Who Responds to Prayers** (北极佑圣真武灵应真君),
