The sacred peaks’ spirits descend their grace—may their souls soar free in the boundless void. The **Kōngdòng** [空洞] gives birth to spirits, merging their **Zhuī** [炁] essence with the **Fànfǔ** [梵辅] realm. Ever freed from the depths of suffering, swiftly granted the mercy of **Liàndù** [炼度].

Now we burn this incense, **taking refuge in the Dao’s Great Saints’ supreme virtue**. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend to the formless, harmonizing with the True and the Way.

**Chànyuán** [忏方], three invocations, three obeisances.

Your humble servants of the **Jùwèi** [具位] ranks, with utmost sincerity, now prostrate ourselves before the **Xūwú Zìrán Jīnquè Qībǎo Shàngdì** [虚无自然金阙七宝上帝], the **Dōnggōng Jiàozhǔ Tàiyǎ Jiùkǔ Tiānzūn** [东宫教主太乙救苦天尊], the **Chuánjīng Yǎnjiào Lìdài Shīzhēn** [传经演教历代师真], the **Dōngyuè Tàishān Tiānqí Rénshèng Dì** [东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝], the **Shúmíng Huánghòu** [淑明皇后], the **Tàizǐ Guìfēi** [太子贵妃], the **Diànshàng Bǐnglíng Gōng** [殿上炳灵公], the **Xīqí Língwáng** [西齐灵王], the **Yuèxià Wénwǔ Kǎoxiào** [岳下文武考校], all **Yīqiè Cáoliáo** [一切曹僚], the **Sānjiè Yìnggǎn** [三界应感], and all **Yīqiè Zhēnlíng** [一切真灵].

May they all behold the vast mercy and descend to illuminate our humble supplications.

We have heard: when the **Wèitóng** [会同] gathers the Five Elders, the **Tiānzūn** [天尊] always listens to the Law; when the **Guāngzhào Jiǔyōu** [光照九幽] shines upon the Nine Depths, the **Fǎjiě** [法解] arises through prayerful invocation.

Deeply moved by the suffering of the **Sāntú** [三涂], we are especially grieved by the hardships of the **Wǔkǔ** [五苦]. To examine and punish the guilty spirits, there are the **Jùtiān Lìshì** [巨天力士]; to enforce the strict laws of the **Yīnyù** [阴狱], there are the **Zhífǎ Shénbīng** [执法神兵].

The **Jiànshù Dāoshān** [剑树刀山] sever sinews and shatter bones; the **Liàngtāng Lúitàn** [镬汤炉炭] reduce flesh to ash. The **Niǎozhuó Shéyīn** [鸟啄蛇吞] and the **Lígēng Jùjiě** [犁耕锯解] bring torment beyond measure. Such suffering is truly lamentable.

Fortunately, the **Shàngshèng** [上圣]’s boundless compassion teaches the causes of their plight; the **Zhēnrén** [真人]’s pity allows them to know the path of virtuous conduct.

Though bound by the **Sānyè** [三业] and stained by the **Liùchén** [六尘], they follow their desires, unaware that the **Shíhuǒ** [石火] moment cannot be halted. In receiving retribution and calamity, they only prolong the **Yèfēi** [夜扉]’s endless closure.

Yet even now, they may reform their hearts and turn toward the Dao, all granted deliverance from judgment and purification from sin.

To cultivate vast fields of merit, they must rely on the **Lánghán** [琅函] scriptures; to exalt the **Shènghào** [圣号], none surpass the **Dōngjí** [东极] **Tiānzūn** [天尊].

Truly, this clears the roots of doubt and allows them to grasp the **Xīyí** [希夷] mysteries.

Your humble servant, **Dìngguān** [醮官], in deep reflection, fears that the **Àifāng** [哀方] suffer more in death than in life, their sins accumulating even in their brief existence. The **Yèwǎng** [业网] remains unbroken, and the **Fǎqiáo** [法桥] is yet unreached. They must now depend on the **Miàoshàn** [妙善] to purge their past transgressions.

Thus, we solemnly prepare the **Zhāi tán** [斋坛], and with utmost reverence, perform the **Rùlǐ** [褥礼] rites.

Named **Xiānshēng** [先嵩], we ever raise our heads to gaze afar; our faces turn toward the **Yúntíng** [云亭], our hearts yearning for divine compassion.

The **Dānyú** [丹舆] and **Lǜbèi** [绿辈] await the swift arrival of the **Biāoxū** [飙忽]; the **Yǔgài** [羽盖] and **Níqíng** [霓旌] hope for the descending **Wēirúi** [葳蕤].

May they discern our sincere devotion and open wide the gates of deliverance. May the **Jiùkǔ Shàngzhēn** [救苦上真] respond in kind; may the **Zhìchuí** [坠魄] souls, once submerged, now submit and take form.

Swiftly may they meet the **Nánjí** [南极]’s **Zhùshēng** [注生], and also gain the **Běidū** [北都]’s **Bùwèi** [部卫]. Gradually ascending the **Xiānlù** [仙路], they shall not stray from the path, and all shall be granted equal harmony in life and death.

Above, we honor the **Tiānzūn** [天尊]’s vast mercy; below, we fulfill our servants’ **Guīmìng** [皈命] sincerity. Thus we humbly report.

**Shíèr yuàn** [十二愿]. **Fùlú** [复炉].

We now solemnly command the **Xiāngguān Shǐzhě** [香官使者], the **Zuǒyòu Lónghǔ Jūn** [左右龙虎君], and the **Shìxiāng Zhūlǐngguān** [侍香诸灵官], to bring us to the place where we once performed the Dao/Way’s rites at noon. There, **Jīnyè Dānbì** [金液丹碧] and **Zhīyīng Bǎilíng** [芝英百灵] shall naturally arise, and all **Zhōngzhēn** [众真] shall gather at this incense altar.

May the **Shífāng Xiānróng Yùnǚ** [十方仙童玉女] attend to the **Lántián** [兰烟], swiftly conveying our servants’ sincere supplications to the **Zhìxīng Wújí Dàdào** [至真无极大道] and the **Hàotiān Yùhuáng Shàngdì** [昊天玉皇上帝] before the **Yuè** [御].

**Chūtáng sòng** [出堂颂]. **Chūhù** [出户].

**Dao/Way Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Eighty-Two Complete**
**Dao/Way Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Eighty-Three**
**Eastern Peak Rescue and Salvation Petitionary Great Ritual Ceremony**
**Evening Dao/Way Practice**

The ritual proceedings ascend the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Dao/Way.

**Proclaim the Sacred Protective Incantations.**
The Five Stars shine resplendent, auspicious *qi* ascends in flight.
The Primordial Sovereign gathers the spirits; Heaven and Earth complete their cycles.
Jade talismans and sacred seals resound with imperious command to the hidden realms.
Flames are cast forth in display of might—evil and malevolent forces shall not linger.
Ten thousand demons submit in trembling; chaotic passions dissolve.
Monstrous evils are crushed, malevolence extinguished—Dao/Way *qi* circulates universally.
Divine radiance illuminates the night; all obscurity is dispelled.
Ten thousand spirits descend in order, their banners borne on the wind.
All living beings prosper; divine blessings pervade the land, harmonizing with the True Dao/Way.

**Strike the ritual drum twenty-four times.**
**Ignite the incense.**

To the **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Sovereign of the Three *Qi*** [三炁], **Supreme Dao/Way Lord**, **Supreme Venerable Lord Laozi**—
We now summon from within our bodies the **Three Five Officials of Merit**, the **Left and Right Official Envoys**, the **Left and Right Incense-Bearers**, the **Relay Dragon Cavalry Clerks**, the **Incense-Serving Golden Boys**, the **Speech-Conveying Scattered-Flower Jade Girls**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**, and the **Direct-Sun Incense Officials**—**thirty-six in total**—to emerge.

Those who emerge shall don resplendent attire and ceremonial insignia, their headgear adorned with trailing ribbons.
The **Mysterious Platform’s Earth and Domain Spirits** are hereby opened.

Now, in this quiet night of Dao/Way practice, we humbly present our intentions.
All sincere supplications have been recorded and reported.
May the **Supreme Dao/Way’s Ten Directions’ True *Qi*** and **Sacred Treasure Auspicious Light** descend upon us, flowing into our bodies,
So that our petitions may swiftly reach the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Boundless**, the **Jade Gate Celestial Sovereign of the High Heaven**.

**Request the proclamation of the ritual rank.**

We, the officials of rank **[具位臣某等]**, with utmost sincerity, now humbly present our supplications to:
The **Void-Natural Golden Gate Seven-Treasures Celestial Sovereign**,
The **Eastern Palace Preceptor, Great Unity Savior of Suffering, Heavenly Venerable of the Jade Tripod**,
The **Transmitting Scriptures and Teaching Ancestral Masters of All Generations**,
The **Eastern Peak Tai Mountain, Heavenly Equal and Benevolent Holy Emperor**,
The **Virtuous and Illuminating Empress**,
The **Crown Prince and Noble Consort**,
The **Splendid-Spirit Official of the Hall**,
The **Western Qi Spirit King**,
The **Literary and Martial Examiners Beneath the Peak**,
All officials and attendants,
The **Three Realms of Responsive Spirits**,
All **True Spirits and Sacred Beings**.

May they all behold the vast mercy and deign to reveal the crimson sincerity.

We have heard:
*"Sealing the golden mud"*—this duty remains with the sovereign;
*"The jade scroll’s transmission"*—this decree governs the order of humanity.
Above, it connects with the empty void of Heaven, thus called the **Celestial Realm of the Immortals**;
Below, it governs life and death, serving as the **Yin Officials’ registry**.

Yet we reflect upon the recently departed souls—
Their **black ledgers** of sins may yet remain unexpunged.
Though crimes are not yet recorded, their severity must be weighed in lightness and depth;
Though intentions seek severe punishment, they must be allowed room for **repentance in sorrow**.

All may thus tread the path of renewal, knowing the period of transformation.

Moreover, the **Heavenly Venerable of Rescue and Life**—
All originate from the **Eastern Residence** to enlighten;
Even the **Chanting Officials of Reverence and Compliance**—
Follow the **Eastern Direction** in reciting their hymns.

We know the **Peak Emperor’s benevolence** does not reject the pleas of mortals.

The ritual officials, grieving the swift passage of life like a galloping steed—
Already separated from the living by the veil of death;
Fearful of the **unwholesome *qi* of the horse**, ever drawn to perilous paths—
In life, they violated the **Awakened Ones’ intentions**;
In death, they suffer boundless torment.
Falling into Hell, they must harbor pain and regret;
In the human world, they should strive for **posthumous rectification**.

Thus may they move the **Emperor’s heart**, or even turn his **wrathful *qi**—
The roots of karma and the nets of sin shall dissolve like mist and ice;
The fruits of virtue and fields of blessing shall unfold like clouds and rain.

The **Three Primordials** nurture their essence—
Now they hear the **Great Unity’s talisman-bearer**;
The **Eight Auspicious Scenes** manifest their spirits—
Again, they receive the **Emperor’s decree of rank**.

Now, with the **midnight watch** just struck and the **first hour’s tally** announced,
The **bright moon** hangs high, framing the boundless sky—
It is fitting to **present our grievances**,
To offer our **sincere fasting words**,
And solemnly **proclaim our petitions**.

**Proclamation of Words:**
As the words declare, with profound pity and sorrow—
We have heard:
*"Without the Primordial Sovereign’s talismans and decrees, one cannot ascend the stages of transcendence and elevation;
Without the Jade Emperor’s proclamation of names, one cannot attain the realm of immortality."*

We must rely on the **Supreme Dao/Way** to rescue the lost souls,
Transforming the **artificial into the natural**, the **formed into the formless**,
Following the **Direct Path’s regulations** to present our petitions,
Hoping the **Celestial Chariot** may swiftly arrive,
Further revealing our **grief and sorrow**, and beseeching **compassionate mercy**.

Now, as the evening’s light fades and the Dao/Way practice begins,
We request the assembled ritualists to take this **first incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer worship to the **Pure Celestial Sacred Realm’s Primordial Sovereign** and the **Ten Directions’ Dao/Way Treasures**.

We, the servants, **take refuge in body, spirit, and life**,
And dedicate these merits to the **ritual official’s household**, all kin and dependents—
May those who have passed receive early elevation to the **Path of the Immortals**;
May the living enjoy longevity and blessings, reaching **venerable old age**.
With **snow-white hair and furrowed brows**, they shall stand as pillars, never faltering like the **distant crane**;
With **hunched backs and protruding teeth**, they shall lean on their staffs, as sturdy as the **sacred tortoise**.
The **Yellow Register** shall erase the records of death;
The **Green Flower** shall inscribe the ledgers of extended years.
The **Heavenly Bestowal** shall grant the **rare blessing of non-aging**,
And the **Great Sovereign’s lament** shall be silenced.

Now, we burn this incense in **sincere devotion to the Dao/Way’s Great Saints and True Virtues**.

After attaining the Dao/Way, one ascends to the **Formless**,
And harmonizes with the **True Dao/Way**.

We have heard:
*"The Jade Boy Attending the Immortals"*—
His divine origin first unfolded in the **embroidered brocade**;
*"The Great Saint of Longevity"*—
First rescued mortals from the **Eastern Quarter**.

Now, as the evening’s light fades and the Dao/Way practice begins,
We request the assembled ritualists to take this **second incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer worship to the **Most High Pure Realm’s Sacred Treasure Sovereign** and the **Supreme Scriptural Treasures**.

We, the servants, **take refuge in body, spirit, and life**,
And dedicate these merits to the **ritual official’s two ancestral gates and seven generations of forefathers**.

May they swiftly ascend the **Golden Tablet’s path** to the **Jade Capital**,
Transcending the **Three Realms**, and be **commended by the Demon King**.

Ascend in name to the **Nine Palaces**,
And proceed to pay homage at the **Great Sovereign**.

Hasten to the **Dragon Gate** to receive the assembly,
And gain the **Bird Mother’s** guidance as a **Sacred Treasure Sovereign**,
No longer entangled in **grave disputes**,
Nor subject to the calamities of descendants.

Now, through this incense offering,
We **take refuge** in the **Supreme Teacher’s** **Great Saintly Assembly’s** **Most True Virtue/Power**.
Obtaining the Dao/Way thereafter,
We enter the **Formless Realm** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

I have heard that the **Nine Refining Transformations** truly **revive the dead**,
And that **Ten Directions without limit** hold no greater merit than **saving beings**.

Through tonight’s **auspicious Dao/Way practice**,
We request the ritual assembly to present this **third incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
And worship the **Supreme Pure Sacred Treasure Sovereign of the Celestial Realm** and the **Ten-Directional Teacher Treasures**.

We, the servants, **take refuge in body, spirit, and life**,
And dedicate these merits to the **five surnames of the departed**,
Male and female lonely spirits, and the **four types of sentient beings**.
Withered corpses and decayed bones,
Yet to leave the **land of darkness and stagnation**;
Wearing horns and bearing fur,
Not spared from the **whips and lashes of suffering**.

In the **dim underworld**, where **demons and spirits** lurk,
Squirming and writhing like **serpents and maggots**,
They lose their **vital essence** and remain utterly confused,
Clinging to **blood and qi** yet lacking awareness.
Some starve in **hunger and thirst**,
Falling into **ravines and ditches**;
Others perish in **warfare and conflict**,
Their bodies **rotting in grass and marshes**.

Cliffs and valleys, drowning in water or burning in flames,
Imprisoned in **jails and cages**,
Or dying by the **roadside**—
All suffer **harsh wrongs**,
Yet none encounter the **merit of commendation and guidance**,
Wandering the **Three Paths**, cycling through the **Six Realms of Rebirth**.

Humbly, we pray to **ride upon the Dao’s power**,
And **rely entirely on the True Compassion**.
To **abandon past ignorance** and avoid **falling into error**,
And to **meet tonight’s guidance**,
That all may swiftly **transcend and ascend**.

Freeing ourselves from **demonic spirits’** clutches,
Shedding our **traces in dust and sand**,
We all return to birth as **human beings**,
And hear the **lawful sounds** of the **Dharma**.

Now, through this incense offering,
We **take refuge** in the **Supreme Teacher’s** **Great Saintly Assembly’s** **Most True Virtue/Power**.
Obtaining the Dao/Way thereafter,
We enter the **Formless Realm** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

**Repentance of the Ten Directions**,
Three invocations, three obeisances.
The humble servants, **[names omitted]**, sincerely and earnestly present this plea:

To the **Natural Void Supreme Golden Gate Seven-Treasured Sovereign**,
The **Eastern Palace Master, the Great Sovereign of the Celestial Way**,
The **Sutra-Transmitting and Teaching Sovereigns of Past Ages**,
The **Eastern Peak, Grand Imperial Sovereign of the Jade Equilibrium**,
The **Virtuous and Benevolent Empress**,
The **Crown Prince and Noble Consort**,
The **Illuminating Spirit Official of the Hall**,
The **Spirit King of the Western Equilibrium**,
And all **clerks and officials** beneath the **Eastern Peak**,
The **Three Realms’** responsive beings,
And all **True Immortals**.

May they **hear our earnest prayers** and **reveal their compassion**.
I have heard that even those **who govern the year**,
Granting **ascension to the mountain** to **subdue demons**,
And those **who enjoy abundant food and salary**,
Yet still **record the dead’s names** as **officials of life**—
For the **thirty-six Formless Void Sovereigns**,
The **True Spirits** must surely gather;
And how much more so for the **seventy-two Sovereigns of the Seal Offerings**,
Whose rites are **especially esteemed**!

They **oversee the underworld**,
And **specialize in managing calamities and blessings**.
Though their names are **registered in the living ledgers**,
They must first **judge the departed spirits**.
Examining deeds and calculating merits,
There is **distinction between righteousness and wrongdoing**;
Ascending names or **falling into the tablets**,
How could there be no **differences in fate’s speed**?

If not for **purifying the mind** to **cleanse the heart**,
How could **expiation of sins** and **repairing past faults** be possible?

The **ritual official’s household**,
Now **awakening grief and sorrow**,
**Shedding tears** and **aching in the heart**,
With **painted images** yet **unseen**,
No **gentle admonition** heard;
Though **offerings are made**,
The **emotion is still deeply sorrowful**.

Joy is **suddenly cut off** at the **gates of the home**,
And **arrest and return** are **only now** sent to the **Eastern Peak’s office**.

Without **rites**, none can be **guided**—
May we **fulfill the merit of guidance**;
Without **rites**, none can **ascend**—
May we **earn the fruit of rebirth**.

To request **entrustment** from **the departed**,
It is **difficult to match past examples**;
To **seek guidance** in **youthful years**,
How could we **again** be **fellow students**?

Only in reciting the **wondrous methods of the Incense Forest**,
And passing on the **Void Songs of the Verdant Abyss**,
Shall we **establish a Pure Altar**,
With **lamps blazing** to **dispel darkness**;
And **devote ourselves to the Sacred Treasure Sovereign**,
With **fragrant incense** ascending to the heavens.

May our **sincere sincerity** be **fully exhausted**,
And our prayers **directly reach the lofty peaks**.

Humbly, we pray that the **frost and ice of the night office may melt**,
And that **rain and dew** may **pour upon the dark gates**.

Through **five refining transformations**,
May they be **molded anew** in **rebirth**;
With **all sins cleansed and released**,
May they **once more** behold **the light of clarity**.

The departed, if they **have awareness**,
Shall **harmonize with sudden enlightenment**;
The living, filled with **gratitude**,
Shall **ever more deeply take refuge**.

Extending **universal compassion**,
All shall **be saved and guided**.

Above, we **fulfill** the **Supreme Sovereign’s** **Great Compassion**,
Below, we **align** with our servants’ **sincere refuge in life**,
And humbly submit this plea.

**Twelve Vows** completed.
**Return to the altar**.

The humble **incense officials and messengers**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Sovereigns**,
And all **attendant spirit officials**,
Shall now **command** that in the **servant’s** past **quiet nights of Dao/Way practice**,
**Golden Elixir and Azure Jade** shall naturally **generate**,
Along with **mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits**,
And the **gathering of all True Ones**,
At this **incense fire altar**.

May the **Ten-Directional Immortal Children and Jade Maidens**,
**Attend and escort the fragrant incense**,
And **transmit** the **servant’s** past **sincere pleas**,
Swiftly **reaching** the **Supreme, Limitless Great Dao/Way**,
Before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor**.

**Praise outside the hall**.
**Praise outside the door**.

**The Complete Ritual Codes of the Dao Gate, Volume 83 Complete**
**The Complete Ritual Codes of the Dao Gate, Volume 84**
*Compiled by Master Guangting Du, with revisions by the Eastern Peak [Mount Tai] Master of Rescue and Salvation*
**Great Ritual of the Eastern Peak [Mount Tai] – Scattered Altar Dao Practice**

**Ritual Ascension to the Altar as Usual**
Each pays respect to the Master in accordance with the law.
**Proclaim the Spirit-Guarding Incantations.**

The Five Stars shine forth, illuminating the Five Directions.
Mercury repels calamity, Wood virtue brings prosperity.
Mars dissipates misfortune, Jupiter wards off war.
The Star of Stability holds firm—blessing the family and state with harmony.
Names inscribed upon the Jade Tablets, words recorded in the Imperial Archives.
Riding the gale, scattering brilliance, soaring through the boundless void,
Entering and exiting the unseen, feasting across the Ten Directions.
Five clouds float as canopies, summoning spirits and harnessing winds.
Commanding ten thousand spirits, guarding above with Dao harmony—
**Striking the Dao Drum twenty-four times.**

**Ignite the Altar.**

The Most High Three Celestial Primordials—**Heavenly Primordial Beginning of the Three Qi,**
**Supreme Dao Lord, Supreme Laozi**—
Summon forth from within the servant’s body:
The **Three Five Officials of Merit,**
Left and Right Official Messengers,
Left and Right Incense-Bearers,
Postal Dragon Cavalry Officers,
Attendant Golden Boys,
Incense-Transmitting Jade Maidens,
The Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols,
Direct-Sun Incense Officials—
A total of **thirty-six** emerging.

Those who emerge are clad in solemn, resplendent robes,
With headgear and trailing ribbons,
Opening the **Mysterious Altar’s Land and Domain Spirits.**

The servant, now in quiet night Dao practice,
Humbly presents this proclamation of intent.
All sincere pleas have been recorded and reported—
May the **Supreme Dao Qi of the Ten Directions** descend,
The **Sacred Treasure Radiance** flow into the servant’s body,
So that what is presented may swiftly reach
The **Supreme Limitless Great Dao,**
Before the **Heavenly Golden Threshold Jade Emperor of the Highest Void.**

**Request the proclamation of rank.**
The servant of such-and-such rank, with utmost sincerity,
Humbly presents to:
The **Void-Natural Golden Threshold Seven-Treasured Supreme Emperor,**
The **Eastern Palace Patriarch, Great Unity Savior of Suffering, Heavenly Lord,**
The **Transmitting Scriptures and Teaching Ancestral True Ones of Past Ages,**
The **Eastern Peak Mount Tai, Heavenly Equal and Benevolent Holy Emperor,**
The **Virtuous and Illuminating Empress,**
The **Crown Prince and Noble Consort,**
The **Illuminous Spirit Duke of the Hall,**
The **Western Qi Spirit King,**
The **File and Martial Officials beneath the Peak,**
All **clerks and officials,**
The **Three Realms’ responsive spirits,**
All **True Spirits.**

The servant hears:
At the **Great Peak, the sacrificial rites were first established,**
And the hunt was revered by the **Yu Emperor;**
At the **sacrificial field, the mandate was sought,**
And the **Rites of Ru were held in utmost respect.**

**Translation:**

---
**Responding to the Wood Virtue’s reign and upholding benevolence,**
Well able to lead as the first of spring’s seasons,
Where life’s origin begins.
**Indeed, the Mountain Emperor’s benevolence**
Stems from his love of life and hatred of slaughter as his purpose;
**He governs the celestial populace’s register,**
And records births and deaths as his merit.
**All these myriad beings, vast and orderly,**
Are all nurtured by the transformative *qi* of life.
**How could he bear to oppress those crying out in slaughter’s fields,**
Or wish to confine them in the dark prisons of the netherworld?
Yet because of the multitude’s ignorance and folly,
Their crimes are self-inflicted;
**Each follows base desires of love and hatred,**
And their greed knows no end.
**Indulging in licentiousness and deceit in myriad forms,**
**Giving free rein to cunning and guile in countless guises,**
If their crimes are not rectified, they must face judgment;
If the law is applied, they cannot escape punishment.
**Still, they hope for mercy’s tears to absolve their guilt,**
And pray for the prison’s records to be reconsidered.
**If they can reform, why not cease like the tillers of the field?**
**If they die in wrong, they will wail as ghosts in the thorny groves.**
**Thus, they seek pity and plead for life,**
Wishing to amend their faults and atone for their errors,
**Following the Dao’s Way as a bridge to law,**
**Conforming to the Dao’s teachings as a lamp of wisdom,**
**Seeking the Dao’s shelter as a protective cloud,**
**Relying on the Dao’s compassion as saving rain,**
**Hoping to bathe in the dew of mercy,**
**And swiftly rescue souls from the dark night.**
**With utmost reverence and sincerity, day after day,**
**Focusing on the Pure Clarity’s realm,**
**Praying for the descent of the Feathered Canopy’s grace;**
**Reciting the *Step-on-the-Void* hymns,**
**Aspiring to the paired clouds’ arrival.**
**Temporarily departing the Golden Gate,**
**First, the Nine Phoenixes harmonize in song;**
**Descending to the mortal feast,**
**Then, the Eight Cranes dance in flight.**
**The Holy Will communicates in an instant,**
**The True Ones come and go in a flash,**
**Surely granting human desires as Heaven approves,**
**Responding to the lower’s petitions and transmitting them above.**
**The servants, with utmost devotion,**
**Humbly welcome the Sacred Procession.**
**Descend, O Holy One!**
**First Offering, Scatter Flowers.**

**The servants, with utmost devotion,**
**Humbly address:**
**The Formless, Natural Golden Gate Seven-Treasured Emperor of Heaven,**
**The Eastern Palace Patriarch, Great Unity Savior of Suffering, Heavenly Lord,**
**The Transmitting Scriptures and Teaching Ancestral True Ones of Past Ages,**
**The Eastern Peak Mount Tai, Heavenly Equal and Benevolent Holy Emperor,**
**The Virtuous and Illuminating Empress,**
**The File and Martial Officials beneath the Peak,**
**All clerks and officials,**
**The Three Realms’ responsive spirits,**
**All True Spirits.**

**The servants hear:**
**The Five Peaks are established across the world,**
**Yet only Mount Tai stands as the foremost.**
**A hundred spirits converge at the Mountain’s Hall,**
**For it governs the fate of the people.**
**Not only does it reveal omens through divination,**
**But also manifests auspices through signs.**
**The Sample Stone stood upright,**
**And the grandson truly succeeded the Tang Dynasty;**
**The violent wind scattered it,**
**And the First Ancestor of Qin was ultimately overthrown by the Qin.**
**For kings, it foretells success or failure,**
**Yet for the common folk, it determines life and death.**
**Thus, in memory of the departed,**
**We do not exceed the common practice.**
**When moved by emotion, some act out of greed, jealousy, or delusion in anger;**
**When following desires, others indulge in depravity and extravagance.**
**The Three Karmas wield the axe of self-destruction,**
**And myriad sins brew the poison of ruin.**
**In their past lives, they fell into nets, traps, and pits without knowing;**
**Now in the underworld, they suffer chains, shackles, and torture.**
**Though their names and crimes are recorded,**
**And though they face punishment,**
**Yet the boundless virtue still hopes for pardon.**
**The Dao originates from benevolent forgiveness,**
**And the humble heart dares to seek renewal.**
**Thus, we rely on the Yellow Hat,**
**And solemnly present the Pure Rites.**
**Baring our hearts and pouring forth our sincerity,**
**We lay bare our words of repentance;**
**Stretching our necks and focusing our minds,**
**We earnestly hope for their arrival.**
**At the Jade Seal’s Enfeoffment Ground,**
**We envision the Sacred Procession ascending in the Cloud Chariot;**
**At the Stone Gate’s Descending Meditation Site,**
**We await the Void’s slow arrival in the Celestial Procession.**
**With reverence and devotion, we merge our spirits,**
**And hope for their arrival and blessings, abundant and vast.**
**Not offering humble baskets of bronze and pottery,**
**But presenting pure offerings of lotus and orchids.**
**The rites proceed with the First Offering,**
**And sincerity is fully expressed in its purity.**
**Though we are unworthy of the Holy Virtue’s fragrance,**
**We still present our heartfelt prayers.**
**May you perceive our sorrow today,**
**And swiftly free us from the suffering of the underworld’s gate.**
**The Pure Rites’ words are sincere,**
**And we solemnly declare them.**
**Declare the Words.**
**Carefully examining the language,**
**Clearly seeing the depths of our grief.**
**Why must we journey to Qufu’s capital**
**Before we turn toward you?**
**Why must we ascend to the Great Treasury’s hall**
**Before we fully rely on you?**
**Remembering the departed souls have a home,**
**It is the Mountain’s Spirit who governs them all.**
**Nourish their withered flesh and bones,**
**And grant them the tenfold merit of rebirth;**
**Endow them with life’s origin,**
**And open for them the mysteries of the Nine Heavens.**
**Provide them with the calculations of the Eastern Dipper,**
**And let them receive refinement in the Southern Palace.**
**Lamenting the dead and mourning the departed,**
**Though it is said that humans return to the earth;**
**Yet seeking rebirth and transformation,**
**We pray that Heaven grants them form once more.**
**The servants, with utmost sincerity,**
**Bow twice, heads touching the ground,**
**And humbly present the Second Offering.**
**Scatter Flowers.**

**The servants, with utmost devotion,**
**Together address:**
**The Formless, Natural Golden Gate Seven-Treasured Emperor of Heaven,**
**The Eastern Palace Patriarch, Great Unity Savior of Suffering, Heavenly Lord,**
**The Transmitting Scriptures and Teaching Ancestral True Ones of Past Ages,**
**The Eastern Peak Mount Tai, Heavenly Equal and Benevolent Holy Emperor,**
**The Virtuous and Illuminating Empress,**
**The File and Martial Officials beneath the Peak,**
**All clerks and officials,**
**The Three Realms’ responsive spirits,**
**All True Spirits.**

**The servants hear:**
**Heaven does not cut short the lives of the people,**
**For their original fate stems from self-destruction;**
**If humans fall into crime,**
**Even the Sage on High does not hesitate to enforce punishment.**
**If evil is not punished,**
**Then virtuous deeds remain unseen.**
**Since the path is blocked by the Three Pure Ones’ distance,**
**They must sink into the Nine Underworlds’ depths.**
**Once fallen into darkness, some endure countless kalpas.**
**The South’s prison is called Fire Obscurity,**
**And those who fall there suffer burning brows and heads;**
**The West’s prison is Iron, the Diamond Fort,**
**And those who enter are crushed with hammers and pierced with spears.**
**The Cold of the Northern Abyss is extreme,**
**Where they suffer the hundred poisons’ frost;**
**The Central Prison of Universal Sweeping**
**Is where they fall from the Eight Reaching Trees.**
**The tortures of the Copper Pillars and the slaughtering fields,**
**The agonies of the Iron Chariots and boiling cauldrons,**
**All stem from their past indulgence in desires,**
**And thus they now endure these sufferings.**
**Moreover, this Eastern prison**
**Is also called the Wind-Thunder Realm;**

**Moreover, the spirit of the Lord Guan must surely exert its divine authority.**
**Fortunate is the radiant light of the Celestial Sage, pervasive and illuminating,**
**That it does not allow all to be utterly lost in darkness;**
**Though the Yin Officials enforce strict punishments,**
**Surely there are also opportunities for leniency.**

**With utmost sincerity and devotion, we earnestly pray**
**To receive the saving grace and blessings of deliverance.**

**The fragrant incense has already ascended to the Three Heavens,**
**And the sweet wine is now offered in the second presentation,**
**Mimicking the arrival of the sacred banners,**
**And faintly resembling the imperial procession’s presence.**

**We humbly wish to feel the divine response through mutual resonance (交孚),**
**And that our lamentations may not fall upon deaf ears (无告).**

**Under the radiant gaze of the Vaulted Sky (穹窿),**
**May we soon emerge from the realms of darkness and light (幽明);**
**Near the Hidden Mystic Gate of the Celestial Realm (奥天门),**
**May we immediately depart from suffering and distress (苦恼).**

**May we be permitted to repent our wrongs and turn to goodness,**
**So that we may attain the Dao and ascend to True Reality (登真).**

**Your humble servants, with reverent devotion, prostrate ourselves twice,**
**And respectfully present our final offering.**
**Scatter flowers.**

**Your servants of the lowest ranks, [names redacted],**
**With profound sincerity and earnestness, humbly address the following:**

**To the Peerless Golden Palace Supreme Deity of the Natural Void (虚无自然金阙七宝上帝),**
**To the Eastern Palace Great Unity Saving Suffering Celestial Sage (太乙救苦天尊),**
**To the lineage of scripture-transmitting and doctrine-performing sages across generations (历代师真),**
**To the Heavenly Lord of Equality and Virtue, the Eastern Peak Tai Mountain (东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝),**
**To the Virtuous and Illustrious Empress,**
**To the Crown Prince and the Noble Consort,**
**To the Radiant Spirit Marquis of the Hall,**
**To the Mystic King of Western Qi,**
**To the Heavenly Marshal and the Celestial Officials of the Five Directions,**
**To all the bureaucratic spirits (一切曹僚),**
**To the Three Realms that respond to our devotion,**
**And to all True Spirits (一切真灵).**

**We have heard that since the Dragon Han era produced scriptures,**
**The path of the Dao has finally been broadly revealed.**
**From the beginning of the Red Brightness Kalpa (赤明开劫),**
**The sole purpose has been to guide beings toward liberation.**

**Divine spirits universally flourish,**
**And the Dao transforms mortals into immortals.**
**The Holy Mother guards the room while the Marshal oversees the court,**
**The Record-Keeper registers the deeds while the Life Official determines their fates.**
**Would they desire to torment the people and cause their suffering?**
**Rather, they wish to multiply the myriad beings and grant them life.**

**Yet, humans may sometimes incur the offense of defying Heaven,**
**And thus, the Yin Prisons inevitably fall upon them.**

**When grievances accumulate and the spirits of darkness exact retribution,**
**Those who sow unvirtuous causes reap great suffering in return.**

**Thanks to the Original Beginning’s sacred decree (符命),**
**We may hope for timely elevation and advancement.**
**Also, through the Black King’s esoteric chapters (洞章),**
**We may be recorded for our meritorious efforts and recommended.**

**Thus, the departed souls may undergo refinement,**
**And obtain vital *qi* to solidify their essence.**

**In the Northern Capital of Luo and Tang,**
**To be freed from calamity is to depart from the Spirit Bureau (泉府).**
**In the Southern Capital’s palace and gates,**
**The living souls’ fate further depends upon Your divine benevolence.**

**With the sacred talismans in hand and the registers held,**
**We present ourselves before the Heavenly Lord.**
**Having received the decree and been granted form,**
**We circulate through the cosmos,**
**All owing to the boundless compassion of the Original Primordial (元梵),**
**And each attaining the lower cultivation at the Mud Mound (泥丸).**

**This ritual master, [name redacted], deeply mourns the departed souls,**
**Who have yet to ascend to the realm of the living.**
**In the land of Lu where they were once honored,**
**They still linger in the Spirit Bureau.**
**Reflecting on the withered songs of Confucius,**
**They have long departed from the mortal world.**

**Moreover, their misfortunes remain unwashed,**
**And they are truly overwhelmed by the Black Poison’s torments.**

**Thus, we beseech the Daoist Realm of Immortal Wandering (仙游),**
**And fully confess our repentance.**
**We also purify the sacred space and solemnly arrange the offerings,**
**Carrying incense and devotion to pledge our hearts,**
**And bow before the True Spirits to atone for our sins.**

**Now, with the three presentations of wine complete,**
**And at the fifth watch of the night,**
**We strive ever harder to be reverent and devout,**
**Hoping thereby to receive Your gracious favor.**

**We humbly wish to cleanse our transgressions and crimes,**
**And that Your divine insight may accept our sincerity.**
**May You deign to acknowledge the merit of the Three Treasures (三宝),**
**And erase our names from the Black Register (黑簿).**
**May we soon receive the command of the Nine Dragons (九龙),**
**And be inscribed in the Green Palace of blessings (青宫).**

**Riding the morning light and ascending toward the luminous (阳翘),**
**We open the Great Existence and pass through the Mystic Gate (玄户).**
**Having received our form and undergone refinement,**
**We attain the Hall of Flowing Fire (流火之庭).**
**Following our wishes to be reborn,**
**We ascend to the Realm of Equality and Longevity (仁寿之域).**

**Your servant and this ritual master, [names redacted],**
**Cannot adequately express our deepest reverence and prayers.**

**Twelve Vows.**
**Return to the Furnace.**

**Respectfully summoning the incense officials and messengers,**
**The Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords (龙虎君),**
**And the attendant spirits of the incense (侍香诸灵官),**
**To command them to guide Your servant to the place of past nightly Daoist practice,**
**Where naturally arise golden nectar and emerald elixir,**
**Mushrooms, herbs, and myriad sacred essences,**
**And where all True Ones gather—**
**Right here before this incense furnace.**

**May the Ten Directions’ immortal youths and celestial maidens**
**Attend to the fragrant vapors,**
**And swiftly convey the sincerity of our past petitions**
**Directly to the Primordial Supreme Dao of the Jade Sovereign (无极大道) and the Heavenly Lord (昊天玉皇上帝).**

**Exit the Hall, recite the praises.**
**Exit the Door.**
**Escort the Sacred.**
**Turn back the merit.**

**The Complete Collection of Daoist Rituals and Precepts, Volume 84 ends.**
**The Complete Collection of Daoist Rituals and Precepts, Volume 85 begins.**

**The Ritual Compendium of the Daoist Gate, Volume 85 (East Peak Salvation Ritual for Three Times of Repentance)**

**Dawn of Pure Clarity**
The humble servants, with utmost sincerity, prostrate and entrust themselves to the **Ten Directions’ Primordial Supreme Daoist Lord of the Soul’s Treasure (无极太上灵宝天尊)**, the **Five Sacred Peaks’ Imperial Saints (五岳圣帝)**, the **Four Great Waters’ Source Kings (四渎源王)**, the **Three Realms and Ten Directions (三界十方)**, all **Divine Beings and Immortals (神仙)**, and the **Assemblies of Spirits (诸灵官)**, devoutly repenting our transgressions.

We humbly hear that the **Divine Officials’ Celestial Abodes (仙官洞府)**
can dissolve calamity and dispel disaster;
that the **East Peak Water Sovereign (东岳水司)**
holds life over death by the **Heavenly Lord’s decree (皇主生而制死)**.

All under heaven revere and gaze upon them,
for they govern the fate of mortal lives.
A single thought of devotion and reliance
shall surely earn the **Heavenly Lord’s compassionate regard (帝心之回眷)**.

We pray for Your gracious pity,
to look down upon our mortal plight,
and grant us repentance for our sins,
cleansing our stains and purging our defilements.
May we be absolved of our offenses.

Today’s ritual master, **so-and-so**, deeply regrets the transgressions of the departed, **so-and-so**.
From birth, humans are bound by the **Four Great Elements (四大)**,
and our senses are formed by the **Six Roots (六根)**.
From the roots arises dust,
and dust accumulates into defilements,
which grow worse and cannot be concealed,
leading to grave sins that are hard to escape.

To rescue the **Nine Nights’ soul (九夜之魂)**,
we must repent the **Six Roots’ sins (六根之罪)**.

For we see the cause of suffering—
the **illusion of form (色)**—yet fail to recognize its emptiness (**空**),
and thus let external things disturb us.
*"Do not gaze upon what is improper"*—
yet we still bear guilt before **Yan Yuan (颜渊)**;
*"Blind yet seeing"*—
we are deeply shamed before **Zhuangzi’s teachings (庄叟)**.

Delighted by the allure of beauty,
we indulge in the sight of **splendor and finery (青黄黼黻)**.
Even more, when gold blinds us to true humanity,
how can we scrutinize the **footprints of virtue (视履)**?

Such sins stem from the **eye-root (眼根)**.
Today, at this time, we vow to repent.

Again, if we take pleasure in **lewd speech (亵语)** and incline our ears,
or revel in **heretical teachings (邪说)** and find joy in hearing,
when we encounter the **whispering voices of clouds and dust (遏云绕尘之声)**,
we cannot help but be ensnared;
when we hear the **urgent strings and hasty drums (急弦促柱之响)**,
we cannot resist lingering.

Believing in **erroneous doctrines and wild schemes (谬论狂谋)**,
we crave **licentious words and filthy speech (淫言秽语)**,
yet fail to heed *"Do not listen to what is improper"*—
how can we claim to uphold **virtue and wisdom (尚德而为聪)**?

Such sins stem from the **ear-root (耳根)**.
Today, at this time, we vow to repent.

Again, if we are intoxicated by **the hundred scents (五臭所熏, 百物交感)**,
like guests who steal fragrance in the dark,
or husbands who abandon all for the **coastal allure (海畔之夫)**,
chasing only the **pleasing odors (逐臭)**,
we demand **rich flavors (厚味)** and compete for the **savor of meat and wine (饮膳之膻香)**;
we covet **fine garments and rare fabrics (美衣奇, 绮罗)**,
and delight in the **scent of orchids and musk (兰麝)**.

Yet we do not know that **the nose’s penetration leads to trembling (鼻彻为颤)**,
and only bring weariness to our brow.
Such sins stem from the **nose-root (鼻根)**.
Today, at this time, we vow to repent.

Again, if we indulge in **the five tastes (五味)** and cling to **the eight delicacies (八珍)**,
we scorn **Yan Hui’s simple fare (颜回之箪瓢)**,
and prefer **Yi Ya’s elaborate cuisine (易牙之刍豢)**,
seeking only to satisfy our **mouth’s desires (口腹之足欲)**,
yet unaware that **the cauldron’s heat breeds resentment (鼎镬之生冤)**.

Moreover, **sweet-tongued treachery (利口覆邦)** and **crafty words that disrupt virtue (巧言乱德)**—
these wound like **spears and javelins (矛戟)**,
and we lack **the modesty of the Duke of Zhou (雅之莫扪)**;
we **dishonor the sacred pivot (枢机)**,
and follow **Zhang Yi’s deceit (张仪之尚在)**.

Thus, **words bring calamity (召祸)**,
yet we fail to see that **taste is also emptiness (味即是空)**.
Such sins stem from the **tongue-root (舌根)**.
Today, at this time, we vow to repent.

Again, if we seek **the body’s ease (安佚)** and neglect others’ toil,
or push our **four limbs to their limits (优游)** in self-indulgence,
we **boast of our lofty halls and vast mansions (高堂广厦)**,
and **lust after fine food and silks (美食鲜衣)**,
making ourselves proud while harming others,
and failing to **relieve the suffering of the world (博济)**.
When told *"Do not harm others for your own gain (害人而利己)"*,
we **glance with scheming eyes (睢盱)**;
when we **destroy others to fulfill our own desires (坏人以自成)**,
we do not consider **bestowing kindness (施恩)**.

Such sins stem from the **body-root (身根)**.
Today, at this time, we vow to repent.

Again, if the **heart’s nature (心妄性本)** is unrestrained,
and **intentions wander into the field of emotions (意入情田)**,
we are **disturbed by greed, jealousy, and rivalry (贪嫉妬)**,
and **driven by joy, anger, sorrow, and delight (喜怒哀乐)**,
yet we do not **follow Confucius’ Four Absolutes (四绝)**,
and only **err in Xun Kuang’s Five Constraints (五綦)**.

We cannot **subdue the Heavenly Lord (天君)**,
for the **mind-monkey (心猿)** keeps escaping;
we cannot **restrain the breath-horse (气马)**,
for its **wild spirit (志帅)** cannot be tamed.
We **abandon what is right for what is wrong (舍是为非)**,
and **follow what is crooked (径行)**,
nurturing our nature without **reducing desire (寡欲)**.

Such sins stem from the **mind-root (意根)**.
Today, at this time, we vow to repent.

As above, we repent the **sins of the Six Roots (六根之罪)**.
We humbly pray that the **Noble Worthies (高真)** may forgive our offenses,
that the **Assemblies of Saints (众圣)** may shower mercy upon us,
and grant us **awakening after others’ awakening (觉后而觉先)**,
as well as **rebirth and death in accordance with the Dao (更生而更死)**.
May our **black ledgers of karmic debts (黑簿)** be dissolved by accumulated merit,
and our **red sins of departed souls (朱陵)** be transcended through this ritual.
May Your blessings extend to future generations,
and may we forever dwell under the **Dao’s shade (道荫)**.

After attaining the **Dao/Way (道)**,
we ascend to the **formless (无形)**,
harmonizing with the **True Dao (道合真)**.

**Midday Repentance for the Ten Directions**
The humble servants, with utmost sincerity, prostrate and entrust themselves to the **East Peak Jade Treasure Supreme Heavenly Lord (东方玉宝皇上天尊)**, the **Nine Breaths’ Heavenly Sovereign (九炁天君)**, all **Divine Beings and Immortals (神仙)**, and the **Assemblies of Spirits (诸灵官)**, devoutly repenting and offering thanks.

We humbly hear that **wood binds us in the world (束为木)**,
and **virtue governs by benevolence (德主仁)**.
When humans **lose the heart of benevolence (昧仁心)**,
they **depart from virtuous conduct (乖仁德)**.
If we cannot **repent and purify (忏洗)**,
how much longer shall we **accumulate guilt (愆尤)**?

The ritual master, **so-and-so**, offers this repentance on behalf of the departed, **so-and-so**.
From countless past lives to this present one,
we have **forgotten compassion (恻隐之心)**,
and **lacked the resolve of kindness (宽慈之志)**.

At home, we **failed to love our parents (爱亲之念)**,
and **our filial piety was utterly neglected (孝养全亏)**;
in office, we **did not sincerely care for our lord (忧主之诚)**,
and **our loyalty and diligence were lost (忠勤顿阙)**.
We **ignored the widow, the orphan, and the lonely (鳏寡孤独)**,
and **did not relieve the suffering of the sick and poor (疾苦困穷)**.
We **pushed away those in need (推内沟)**,
and **deeply regret not offering aid (不被泽)**,
like **Yi Sheng’s sorrow (伊生)**;
we **laughed at those in peril (有刀)**,
yet **killed them secretly (潜杀人)**,
like **Yi Fu’s hypocrisy (义甫)**.

We **abandoned our kin (宗族)**,
causing **one-sided resentment (相怨於一方)**;
we **neglected our brothers (弟兄)**,
yet **preferred to dwell together in shared deceit (同居而共被)**.
We **refused to guide those seeking the Dao (问津莫答)**,
and **only schemed to harm (挤壑是图)**.
Since we **failed to practice the Six Virtues (六行)**,
we **cannot escape the fate of a single wrongdoer (一夫之不获)**.

Such crimes **harm benevolence and compassion (宽仁)**.
We deeply fear that the departed, **so-and-so**, after death,
may fall into the **prison of East Peak’s winds and thunders (东方风雷之狱)**,
or be **judged under the East Peak Sacred Emperor’s authority (东岳圣帝考官之司)**,
suffering in **dark dungeons (幽关)**,
with no way to **escape their torments (解脱)**.

Today, with sincere devotion, I **repent and submit** to the **Eastern World’s Jade Treasure Sovereign of Heaven, the Nine-Qi Heavenly Lord**.

I humbly pray that **You command** from **Mount Tai**,
and **grant me salvation** to **the departed, so-and-so**,
**washing away all unvirtuous crimes**,
and **receiving the blessings of the Dao’s virtue**.

After attaining the **Dao/Way**,
I shall **ascend to the Formless**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s true essence**.

We, the **officiants**, with sincere devotion, **repent and submit** to the **Southern World’s Mysterious True Ten-Thousand Blessings Heavenly Lord, the Three-Qi Heavenly Lord**, and all **divine immortals, spirit officials**.

We **humbly hear** that in the **Southern Fire Bureau**,
**virtue is expressed as propriety**.

If **humans offend the Fire Virtue**,
they **fail to understand the precepts of propriety**.
With **accumulated transgressions and sins**,
they **must seek purification and absolution**.

The **officiant** now **entrusts the departed, so-and-so**,
and **repents for the crimes of improper conduct**.
From **countless past lives**,
until **this present life**,
I **lacked the mind of modesty and humility**,
and **did not cultivate the spirit of diligence and reverence**.

My **conduct violated the precepts of humility**,
my **actions failed to uphold harmony**,
I **demeaned the exalted while in lowly stations**,
and **offended superiors while in weakness**.
I **neglected the humble seat at feasts**,
and **pursued precedence on the path of the Dao**.
I **oppressed my neighbors with arrogance**,
and **scorned my elders and betters**.

I **sat insolently and sprawled**,
yet **aspired to equal the Sage**;
I **walked naked and exposed**,
yet **never lagged behind the wise**.

How could I know that **Master Yan** (颜子) **grieved over the faults of sight and hearing**,
and **remembered the virtues of the ancient kings**—
their **behavior, their words, their demeanor**?
I **fell into pride and sloth**, which **mutually reinforced**,
and **arrogance and haughtiness**, which **grew together**.
Thus, **my licentiousness was complete**,
and **all propriety lost**.

Now I deeply fear that after **the departed, so-and-so’s** death,
they may **succumb to the Southern Fire’s dark prison**,
or **be judged under the Southern Sacred Emperor’s authority**,
**wandering through shadowed dungeons**,
with **no path to liberation**.

Today, with sincere devotion, I **repent and submit** to the **Southern World’s Mysterious True Ten-Thousand Blessings Heavenly Lord, the Three-Qi Heavenly Lord**.

I humbly pray that **You command** from the **Southern World**,
and **grant salvation** to **the departed, so-and-so**,
**washing away all crimes of improper conduct**,
and **elevating them to the realm of joy**.

After attaining the **Dao/Way**,
they shall **ascend to the Formless**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s true essence**.

We, the **officiants**, with sincere devotion, **repent and submit** to the **Western World’s Supreme Marvelous Ultimate Heavenly Lord, the Seven-Qi Heavenly Lord**, and all **divine immortals, spirit officials**.

We **humbly hear** that in the **Western Metal Bureau**,
**virtue is expressed as righteousness**.

If **humans offend the Metal Virtue**,
they **fail to grasp the way of righteousness**.
With **accumulated transgressions and sins**,
they **must seek purification and absolution**.

The **officiant** now **entrusts the departed, so-and-so**,
and **repents for the crimes of unrighteousness**.
From **countless past lives**,
until **this present life**,
I **lacked the mind of shame and revulsion**,
and **willingly endured the insults of others**.
I **indulged in favors and flattery**,
and **even betrayed my lord**.
I **pledged loyalty with severed necks**,
yet **still sought to sell my friends**.

My **actions were driven by petty disputes**,
and **self-interest prevailed over harmony**.
I **did not ponder Master Meng’s response to the Duke of Liang**,
but **only mimicked Song Jiao’s flattery of Chu**.
If **I could not resist desire**,
then **my nature aligned with Xia You and Ge Ren** (夏癸, 商辛);
if **I was deemed cruel**,
then **my wickedness matched Shang Xin and Jiang Zhi** (商辛, 江志).

I **could not cease from trespassing and harming others**,
yet **failed to recognize that gradual cultivation leads to the right path**.
I **took what was not mine**, nearing **theft**;
how much more so when **I seized gold in the marketplace**?
I **executed the innocent**, exceeding **just severity**;
yet **I manipulated laws to frame prisoners**.

Such **crimes are beyond redemption**,
and **no path can absolve them**.

I deeply fear that after **the departed, so-and-so’s** death,
they may **fall into the Western Metal’s prison of retribution**,
or **be judged under the Western Sacred Emperor’s authority**,
**wandering through shadowed dungeons**,
with **no way to escape**.

Today, with sincere devotion, I **repent and submit** to the **Western World’s Supreme Marvelous Ultimate Heavenly Lord, the Seven-Qi Heavenly Lord**.

I humbly pray that **You command** from the **Western World**,
and **grant salvation** to **the departed, so-and-so**,
**washing away all crimes of unrighteousness**,
and **receiving the blessings of the Dao’s ultimate function**.

After attaining the **Dao/Way**,
they shall **ascend to the Formless**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s true essence**.

We, the **officiants**, with sincere devotion, **repent and submit** to the **Northern World’s Mysterious Supreme Jade Chariot Heavenly Lord, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**, and all **divine immortals, spirit officials**.

We **humbly hear** that in the **Northern Water Bureau** (居坎),
**virtue is expressed as wisdom**.

If **humans offend the Water Virtue**,
they **lack the mind of wisdom**.
With **accumulated transgressions and sins**,
they **must seek purification and absolution**.

The **officiant** now **entrusts the departed, so-and-so**,
and **repents for the crimes of folly**.
From **countless past lives**,
until **this present life**,
I **did not discern the rites of right and wrong**,
but **only harbored ignorance and stupidity**.

I **knew not myself nor others**,
yet **claimed to uphold rectitude**—
how could I **straighten others while bent myself**?
My **eyelashes obscured my vision**,
and **my heart grew darker with seclusion**.
I **fixed my gaze on the four cardinal points**,
yet **my mind was in chaos**;
the **Heavenly Lord must know of my two errors**,
for **I was lost in deeper darkness**.

I **trampled propriety and violated righteousness**,
yet **did not recognize reverence and love for elders and betters**.
I **abandoned trust and betrayed loyalty**,
yet **failed to understand harmony with friends**.

**Light could not return** when **reflected back**,
and **deceit now merged with my present folly**.
The **Dao/Way is easy to know yet hard to practice**,
but **I sought to defy it**.
**People may know late and awaken late**,
yet **I still fall short of the common folk’s shame**.

I **toiled in vain, seeking only punishment**,
and **did not realize truth nor know restraint**.
**Crimes are hard to avoid**,
and **wisdom is fully obscured**.

I deeply fear that after **the departed, so-and-so’s** death,
they may **succumb to the Northern Boundless Cold’s prison**,
or **be judged under the Northern Sacred Emperor’s authority**,
**wandering through shadowed dungeons**,
with **no path to liberation**.

Today, with sincere devotion, I **repent and submit** to the **Northern World’s Mysterious Supreme Jade Chariot Heavenly Lord, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**.

I humbly pray that **You command** from the **Northern World**,
and **grant salvation** to **the departed, so-and-so**,
**washing away all crimes of folly**,
and **elevating them to the realm of joy in this very life**.

After attaining the **Dao/Way**,
they shall **ascend to the Formless**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s true essence**.

We, the **officiants**, with sincere devotion, **repent and submit** to the **Northeast World’s Immortal-Saving Supreme Heavenly Lord, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**, and all **divine immortals, spirit officials**.

We **humbly hear** that in the **Northern Water Bureau**,
**the virtue of benefiting others is supreme**.
If **humans fail to benefit others**,
they **hoard greedily and covet resources**.
With **accumulated transgressions and sins**,
they **must seek purification and absolution**.

The **officiant** now **entrusts the departed, so-and-so**,
and **repents for the crimes of greed**.
From **countless past lives**,
until **this present life**,
I **could not sacrifice myself to benefit others**,
but **only sought to harm others for my own gain**.

But only knowing **worry over insufficiency**,
how could one know **one’s share requires no excess**?
Counting **fields by the thousand** to become a **landlord**,
hoarding **millions in coins** to become a **money-tyrant**.

Not knowing **life’s swift passage**—like a **fleeting moment**—
one **plucks not even a hair** to avoid misfortune.
Some **cheat orphans and widows**, seizing their **household wealth** and refusing to return it;
if **trading as a merchant or peddler**, they **double prices** and take pride in it.
They **slander monks and defame Daoists**, utterly lacking **generosity in giving**;
seeing **starvation or cold**, they **never show pity or compassion**.

They **lend at double interest**, yet still **covet more**;
they **spend hundreds on guests**, already **showing displeasure**.
How much more those who **kill for gain**—
**never sharing wealth** with others.
Such **transgressions**, piled high, **bring calamity and ruin**.

In deepest fear, **the departed so-and-so**, after death,
will **fall into the Northeast’s Boiling Cauldron Prison**,
to be **tried by the Officials of Mount Tai’s Judgment Bureau**,
endlessly trapped in **dark dungeons**, with **no way to escape**.

Now, with **sincere devotion**, we **repent to the Northeast World’s Immortal-Saving Supreme Heavenly Lord, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**.
We **humbly pray** that the **saints show mercy**,
that the **departed soul be guided**,
and that **all greed’s sins be cleansed**,
so they may **be reborn in the Heaven of Joy**.
After attaining the **Dao**, they will **ascend to the Formless**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s true essence**.

---

We, the **officiants**, with **sincere devotion**, **repent to the Southeast’s Life-Nurturing Soul-Saving Heavenly Lord, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**, and all **divine immortals, spirit officials**.

We **humbly hear** that in the **Eastern Wood Bureau**,
**the virtue of nurturing life is supreme**.
If **humans fail to nurture life**,
**slaughter becomes rampant**.
Without **purification**, how could **transgressions be absolved**?

The **officiant** now **entrusts the departed, so-and-so**,
and **repents for the crime of slaughter**.
From **countless past lives**,
until **this present life**,
I **only craved the taste of fat meats**,
never **pausing to fear life’s fragility**.

I **drew bows and held arrows**, shooting **birds mid-flight in the clouds**;
I **cast nets and sank hooks**, dragging **scaled creatures from the depths**.
Before **feathers were plucked**, their **manes were already severed**;
while **winds were still being hunted**, their **wings were already broken**.
Dogs, pigs, oxen, and sheep—
all were **slaughtered to excess** with **blade and spear**;
chickens, ducks, geese, and wildfowl—
were **cooked at will** before my **table**.

Their **cries echoed before the knives**,
their **blood dripped upon the cooking pots**.
Though **flayed and butchered**, I **never considered their flesh as my own**;
though **boiled, roasted, or fried**, I **only thought of filling my mouth**.
I **tamed pheasants like Lu Gong’s**, with **no different intent**;
I **hunted deer like Xi Ba’s**, with **no divergent heart**.
Not that I **could not bear to see them die**—
but **many more perished** because of me.
Such **transgressions**, piled high, **must lead to ruin**.

In deepest fear, **the departed so-and-so**, after death,
will **fall into the Copper Pillar Prison**,
to be **tried by the Officials of Mount Tai’s Judgment Bureau**,
endlessly trapped in **dark dungeons**, with **no way to escape**.

Now, with **sincere devotion**, we **repent to the Southeast’s Life-Nurturing Soul-Saving Heavenly Lord, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**.
We **humbly pray** that the **saints show mercy**,
that the **departed soul be guided**,
and that **all slaughter’s sins be cleansed**,
so they may **be reborn in the Heaven of Joy**.
After attaining the **Dao**, they will **ascend to the Formless**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s true essence**.

---

We, the **officiants**, with **sincere devotion**, **repent to the Southwest’s Most Sacred Void Emperor, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**, and all **divine immortals, spirit officials**.

We **humbly hear** that in the **Southern Fire Bureau**,
**the virtue of propriety is strict**.
If **humans fail in propriety**,
they **fall to depraved acts**.
Without **purification**, how could **transgressions be absolved**?

The **officiant** now **entrusts the departed, so-and-so**,
and **repents for the crime of depravity**.
From **countless past lives**,
until **this present life**,
I **harbored lustful desires**,
and **lost my guard over chastity**.

I **schemed for trysts by the Han River**,
and **planned meetings in the mulberry groves**,
admiring the **lush lotus of Bi Pond**,
and **offering peonies from the Lacquered Brook**.
A **maiden in spring’s bloom** was **lured by a scholar**,
not coming to **trade silk**, but **seeking my schemes**.

In **fine attire**, I **forced her to yield** like a **captive bird**;
over **walls**, I **embraced her** like a **maiden’s lover**.
My **ambitions sought high rank**—
though my **teeth were broken**, I **felt no shame**;
my **desires craved union**—
though my **heart was pierced**, I **felt only joy**.

I **only knew of painted faces and dyed eyebrows**,
of **beautiful features**—
but **never considered** that **eyes and gestures betrayed** deep **violation of rites**.
My **deeds were clear as stealing a brother’s wife**,
my **tracks led to abducting a husband’s spouse**.
Such **sins**, piled high, **must bring calamity and ruin**.

In deepest fear, **the departed so-and-so**, after death,
will **fall into the Southwest’s Butchery Prison**,
to be **tried by the Officials of Mount Tai’s Judgment Bureau**,
endlessly trapped in **dark dungeons**, with **no way to escape**.

Now, with **sincere devotion**, we **repent to the Southwest’s Most Sacred Void Emperor, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**.
We **humbly pray** that the **saints show mercy**,
that the **departed soul be guided**,
and that **all depraved sins be cleansed**,
so they may **be reborn in the Heaven of Joy**.
After attaining the **Dao**, they will **ascend to the Formless**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s true essence**.

---

We, the **officiants**, with **sincere devotion**, **repent to the Northwest’s Boundless Taihua Heavenly Lord, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**, and all **divine immortals, spirit officials**.

We **humbly hear** that in the **Western Metal Bureau**,
**the virtue of forbidding wrong is strict**.
If **humans fail to forbid wrong**,
**theft becomes rampant**.
Without **purification**, how could **transgressions be absolved**?

The **officiant** now **entrusts the departed, so-and-so**,
and **repents for the crime of theft**.
From **countless past lives**,
until **this present life**,
I **did not value the height of Western Mountains**,
but **coveted the cunning of Eastern Tombs**.
With **eyes watching and hands probing**,
I **stole by day and lurked by night**.

**For the crime of theft, we now confess:**

Alas, our greed was boundless—
like the Xiang of Song, who fell to avarice,
yet knew not the Dao—
shameful as Guisheng of Qi, who lacked its way.

Not wealth earned through toil was our aim,
but only the art of burglary and bribery.
Shouldering sacks, we rejoiced in sealed cords;
forcing gates, we scorned locks and bars.
A dropped hat won us hidden treasure—
like Zu Ban’s cunning plunder.
A shared room demanded false gold—
yet who could match Zhizi’s honesty?

Marked by rusted hem, we fell to Zhang En’s snare;
eyebrows betrayed us—no escape from Yonghe’s gaze.
Bold in theft, yet cowardly in virtue—
how like Wang Cang’s deceitful reliance on guile.
Such wickedness accumulated,
now we reap our calamity and blame.

We fear that after death, the departed, so-and-so,
shall fall into the fiery prison of the Northwest,
entangled in the Taihua and Taishan officials’ scrutiny,
trapped in dark dungeons with no path to liberation.

Now, with sincere devotion, we entrust ourselves to the **Boundless Taihua Heavenly Lord of the Northwest, the Five-Qi Heavenly Lord**.
We humbly pray that the holy ones take pity,
that the wandering soul be guided,
that all sins of theft be cleansed,
and that rebirth in the blissful realm be attained.
After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the formless,
harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence.

---

**For the crime of broken faith, we now confess:**

The Heavenly Dao values rectitude and sincerity—
one must preserve truth to align with Heaven.
Without rectitude, how can one avoid transgression?

We, the officiants, now entrust the departed, so-and-so,
and repent for the sin of dishonesty.
From countless past lives to this present one,
we spoke in vain, betrayed oaths and covenants.
Armor could not save the fallen soldier,
yet we still claimed safety;
a broken cart’s wheels did not stop our false claims of travel.
Gold, unlike Ji Bu’s word, brought no honor—
blame fell on friends who trusted us.
Our sashes differed from Zi Zhang’s honest letters—
resentment festered in the neighborhood.
We did not ponder the unyielding virtue of gold and stone,
yet still dared to deceive the spirits.
Our words, once spoken, were soon abandoned—
like the ruined speech of Lu’s people.
Our virtue was divided—
shameful as the *Odes* of Zhou.

Deceitful and hollow, we deceived both others and ourselves;
crafty and false, we failed to move even mortals—
how could we hope to sway Heaven?
We sought only to blind the world’s blind,
unafraid of the sun and moon’s judgment.
With sincerity lost, how could we escape transgression?

We fear that after death, the departed, so-and-so,
shall sink into the dark paths of the underworld,
entangled in the Three Officials’ scrutiny,
with no means of escape.

Now, with sincere devotion, we entrust ourselves to the **Celestial Sovereign of Jade Emptiness, the One-Qi Heavenly Lord**.
We humbly pray that the Three Officials intervene,
that the departed ascend,
that all sins of dishonesty be erased,
and that the fruit of effortless wandering be attained.
After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the formless,
harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence.

---

**For the crime of crookedness, we now confess:**

The Earthly Dao values sincerity and straightness—
one must walk upright to align with the land.
Without straightness, how can one avoid transgression?

We, the officiants, now entrust the departed, so-and-so,
and repent for the sin of perversity.
From countless past lives to this present one,
our bodies bent like crooked hooks,
our deeds strayed from the straight path—
we abandoned the righteous road and trod only the wicked.
Deceitful and harmful to the good,
crafty and jealous of the virtuous.
The upright had no place for us—
like Yiwu’s stacked arrows in vain.
Though the land had order, none shared the loyalty of Yu’s arrow.

Praise and blame found no truth in our actions,
while our cunning earned infamy among the shameless.
A child of five could outwit us in the market’s deceits;
though the *Three Hundred Poems* were revered,
we knew no shame in hiding our deceit.
Our efforts were spent in twisting and turning,
yet we never considered the virtue of returning to rectitude.
Such transgressions accumulated,
bringing only guilt and calamity upon ourselves.

We fear that after death, the departed, so-and-so,
shall fall into the Nine Abysses’ prison,
entangled in the Tangdu and Quancu officials’ scrutiny,
trapped in the cold realms with no path to liberation.

Now, with sincere devotion, we entrust ourselves to the **True Sovereign of the Cavern Spirit, the Nine-Piled Earthly Lord**.
We humbly pray that Tangdu’s interrogations cease,
that Quancu spare the soul,
that all sins of perversity be cleansed,
and that the fruit of effortless wandering be eternally attained.
After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the formless,
harmonizing with the Dao’s true essence.

---

**The All-Encompassing Night of Repentance**

We, the officiants, with wholehearted devotion, entrust ourselves to the **Ten Directions’ Great Yi Savior of Suffering, the Heavenly Sovereign of Tianqi’s Ren and Saintly Virtue, the Auspicious and Illustrious Empress of Pure and Gentle Earthly Virtue, the True Lord of Fate, the Brilliant and Trustworthy Auxiliary King, the Protector of the Realm and Manifested Marquis, the Great King of Western Qi, the True Lords of the Ten Palaces, the Eighty-Four Officials of the Six Divisions, all divine immortals, and all spirit officials**, and humbly repent.

We hear that even the ancient mirror, though bright,
may dim with filth;
the luminous toad, though radiant,
is still obscured by clouds.

The mirror’s flaw is none—defilement comes from without;
the moon’s blemish is false—clouds arise from beside it.
When filth is ground away, the mirror’s light shines clear;
when clouds are rolled back, the moon’s radiance knows no end.

How much more so for humankind, equally endowed,
whose nature is round and bright as dawn.
Yet nature drifts with passion, desire lured by things;
the mind neglects nurturing virtue, indulging instead in lust,
forging sins and evils without knowing,
forgetting origin, forgetting first principles, and failing to return.

Should one day awaken to this truth,
all ten thousand offenses shall be swept away.
Thus the Celestial Sovereign opens the great gate of **Yòu** [pardon],
and the saints widely bestow the transformation of renewal.
The benevolent wind stirs, sweeping clean the dust of the **color realm**;
the **Dharma-rain** flows, washing away the barriers of countless lives.

With sincere hearts, all find refuge in repentance—
today’s devotion is exhausted in **returning to the Dao**.

The officiant **[Name Redacted]**, reflecting on the sins of **[Name Redacted]**, deeply fears that in life,
he habitually overcame the true with the false,
abandoned enlightenment for the mundane,
disrespected sovereign and kin,
oppressed and scorned teachers and elders,
lacked benevolence toward all while hoarding selfishness,
and condemned others while justifying himself.

Though he piled up rotting grains like ancient dust,
did he ever feel pity for the widowed and orphaned?
Though he feasted on fresh meats and wore fine silks,
did he ever truly care for the hungry and cold?

The net ensnares aquatic and terrestrial **beasts and fish**,
yet heedless of losing life or body;
The whip lashes his household slaves and servants,
yet does he ever pity their wounds to the bone or flesh?

He delights in arrogance and pride, boasting of his own virtue,
and enjoys mockery and ridicule, debasing others to lose their **virtue/power**.

In weighing and measuring, there is deceit in light and heavy, large and small;
In contracts and pawns, there are falsehoods of smearing and erasing.

He slanders monks and **Daoists**,
inflicts suffering through cowardice and deceives the simple.
He often practices **spells and incantations**, profaning **spirits and gods**,
relying on his own might to defy **Heaven and Earth**.
He acts brutally in his village and neighborhood,
and envies the virtuous and the good.

Seeing gold and treasures, he is filled with greed,
secretly plotting to seize them;
Dividing fields and property, he enriches himself,
yet would he ever willingly share equally?

He privately instructs officials to frame the innocent,
and conspires with ruffians to assault the virtuous.
He seduces noble sons,
and fraternizes with **Bhikṣuṇī**;
He lends without intent to repay and breaks his promises,
and sells false goods for profit while flaunting deceit.

Such crimes and sins,
all stem from **perversity and evil**.
Today, he returns to the **high and true Daoist masters** with sincere repentance,
and earnestly seeks profound punishment for his misdeeds.

May the abundant grace of **Daoist blessings** flow,
cleansing stains and purifying filth,
breaking the dark prison of endless night,
and pointing out the path to enlightenment for those lost in delusion.

May his sins be absolved in the **Eastern Palace of Pure Radiance**,
and swift relief be granted from judgment and retribution;
May he be reborn in the **Southern Pure Land**,
and thereby attain transcendence.

May he escape the **River of Suffering**,
and reach the **Shore of Ease**,
extending even to the **Nine Mystic Realms and Seven Ancestral Abodes**,
and the **Six Paths and Three Routes**—
all freed from **Yin曹**, born into **Heavenly Dao**,
where disputes cease for the departed,
and his sins do not bind those yet to come.
May his blessings extend to both the living and the dead,
and his merit touch all beings.

After attaining the Dao,
he ascends to the **Formless**,
harmonizing with the **Dao’s true essence**.

*End of Volume Eighty-Five of the Daoist Canon of Great Rules and Regulations*
*Beginning of Volume Eighty-Six of the Daoist Canon of Great Rules and Regulations*

**The *Lingbao Chongshen Great Ritual* of Master Guangcheng Du Guangting**
*Natural Dao Practice Ceremony*

The ritual master ascends the platform in proper form.
Each reverently invokes the Dao as prescribed.
The Sacred Protective Incantations are proclaimed.
The Five Stars shine resplendent, auspicious *qi* ascends in flight.
The Primordial Gathering of Spirits—Heaven and Earth in harmonious cycle—
The Jade Talismans and Sacred Nodes command the unseen with their breath.
Fire is cast, might is displayed—wickedness and malevolence are banished without trace.
Ten thousand demons are subdued, their chaotic blooms dispersed.
Monstrous evils are crushed, Daoist *qi* flows unobstructed.
Divine radiance illuminates the night, all shadowy obstructions are withdrawn.
Ten thousand spirits descend in order, their banners borne upon the wind.
All living beings prosper, blessings pervade the land—
in harmony with the Dao’s true essence.

The Supreme Law Drum is struck twenty-four times.
The furnace is ignited.

The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin’s Three *Qi* of the Most High Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao,**
summon forth from within my body the **Three Five Functionary Officials, the Left and Right Attendants, the Left and Right Incense-Bearers, the Relay Dragon Cavalry, the Attendant Golden Boys, the Speech-Bearing Flower-Sprinkling Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans, and the Direct-Day Incense Officials—**
a total of **thirty-six**—
who emerge in solemn ceremonial attire, their caps and sashes adorned with trailing ribbons.
They open the **Mysterious Dao’s Land and Domain Spirits**.

Now, in this quiet night of Dao practice, I humbly petition to declare my intent.
All sincere hearts have been recorded and heard.
May the **Supreme Ten-Directional True Dao’s *qi* of the Most High, the Lingbao Auspicious Light**, descend upon my body,
so that my invocation may swiftly reach the **Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Jade Gate of the Celestial Sovereign, before the Jade Emperor of Heaven’s Supreme Court**.

I request the proclamation of my ritual rank.
**The humble servant [name],** in deepest reverence, now addresses:
The **Three Pure Ones, the Supreme Emperors, the Solar and Lunar Deities, the Southern Celestial and Northern Dipper, the Three Officials and Five Emperors, the Four Sacred True Immortals,**
the **transmitting teachers and sacred assemblies of all ages,**
the **Yingdu officials, the Mountain and Marsh Spirits, the Constitutional Bureau’s Caverns, the Water Realm’s Thunder Lords, the City Gods and Warming Departments, the local temples and ancestral shrines,**
and **all responsive spirits**.

May they all gaze upon the boundless mercy, pierce through the crimson sincerity.

I have heard:
*"Great and transforming—this is called sagehood;*
*sagehood fills the space between Heaven and Earth.*
*Sensitive and responsive—this is called divinity;*
*divinity adapts across the four seas.*

*From the stars of the vault above,*
*emanates the awe-inspiring spirit below,*
*governing mountains and rivers in Heaven’s stead,*
*observing the people’s excesses and blessings.*

*At the utmost of goodness, one attains blessings;*
*at the depth of vice, one invites calamity.*
*Impartial without favor—*
*only the upright may be rectified.*

*Heaven, through divine decree, punishes transgressions;*
*man, through divine decree, bestows prosperity and omens.*
*Divine and human rely upon each other,*
*Heaven’s Way must oversee and illuminate.*

*Virtue earns divine favor,*
*mercy is never withheld.*

The ritual master **[name]**, though placed among mortals, relies utterly upon divine protection.
Though I offer the sacrificial rites, my reverence may yet be insufficient;
though I present my pure intentions, I hope to merit a clear response.
I recite the hidden verses of the **Jade Chapters**, sing the profound hymns of the **Azure Void**.

With deepest awe, I honor the Primordial Mercy,
and thus extend my blessings.

My duty is to propagate the Dao,
my resolve to aid the age—
to cultivate merit through deeds,
to rescue the people and benefit all things.

All matters revealed, how could I fail to report?
All words sincere, I now declare them in full.

**Proclamation of the Petition:**
The words are examined with care, the sincerity is evident.
Without proper ritual procedures, how could the Dao’s spirits be moved to their utmost?
Without the Dao’s established forms, how could divine power be augmented?

Thus, I rely upon my Daoist companions
to reverently perform the **Heavenly Sciences**,
hoping to restore the abundant mercy of Heaven,
and amplify the boundless power of the spirits.

I have heard:
*"If the ruler does not govern himself,*
*he entrusts the officials to rule the people;*
*Heaven, though silent,*
*delegates the spirits to aid transformation.*

*All who share responsibility in sacred shrines and blessed lands*
*propagate the Dao’s flow in mighty counties and renowned domains.*
*They curb excess, reward humility,*
*recompense the virtuous and punish the wicked.*

*All signs of fortune or calamity*
*are reflected in their influence."*

With today’s reverent worship of the gods and practice of the Dao,
I beseech the multitude of teachings to kindle this **first incense offering**,
wishing that this incense smoke
may nourish the **Supreme Three Sovereigns** and all the **Celestial Worthies and Supreme Deities**.

With these **meritorious deeds**,
I offer prayers to the divine ranks.
**Humbly I pray** that my **true understanding** may swiftly awaken,
that my **Daoist attainments** may be ever greater,
to partake in the **spirits’ boundless blessings**,
and ascend to the **highest grades of Immortality**.

Then may **blessings flow upon the imperial lineage**,
and **protection extend to the sacred realm**,
so that the **four seas may be at peace**,
and the **eight directions may be tranquil**.

Now, as I burn this incense,
I myself **take refuge in the Dao’s Most Honored, Great Saints, and Perfectly True Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao,
I shall rise into the **Formless Realm**,
and **harmonize with the Dao’s True Essence**.

I have heard:
*"Secret speech transmitted to the world*
*is the gateway to all wonders;
*The Dao’s formlessness*
*ever resides in the **profound designs** of the scriptures.*

*The teachings and laws are fundamentally one principle,*
*yet the wise and foolish diverge in their paths.
*If one can **quietly reflect** to **fathom its meaning**,
*then one may **direct the heart** to **grasp the Dao**."*

With today’s reverent worship of the gods and practice of the Dao,
I beseech the multitude of teachings to kindle this **second incense offering**,
wishing that this incense smoke
